前言

PREFACE

十年前我开始着手写这本书时，脑海中浮现出两个不同的选题。首先，我想解释为什么冷战后美国的对外政策如此容易失败，有时甚至是灾难性的失败。我尤其想解释美国在中东地区不断累积的失败，以及美俄关系的持续恶化，最终在2014年因乌克兰问题而彻底破裂。这个主题之所以如此引人入胜，是因为上世纪90年代初人们对美国在世界上的角色抱有极大的乐观态度。我想弄清楚究竟哪里出了问题。

WHEN I BEGAN WORKING ON THIS BOOK ten years ago, I had two different ideas about what the topic might be. First, I was interested in explaining why post–Cold War U.S. foreign policy was so prone to failure, sometimes disastrous failure. I was especially interested in explaining America’s fiascoes in the greater Middle East, which continued to accumulate, and the steady deterioration of U.S.-Russian relations, which culminated in a major rupture over Ukraine in 2014. This subject was all the more interesting because there was so much optimism in the early 1990s about America’s role in the world. I wanted to figure out what went wrong.

其次，我一直想写一本书，探讨自由主义、民族主义和现实主义如何相互作用，进而影响国家间的关系。我一直认为民族主义是国际政治中一股极其强大的力量，但我从未对此进行过深入研究。不过，我曾就现实主义撰写过大量文章，并在之前的几部作品中探讨过它与自由主义的区别。我认为，如果能写一本比较和对比这三种“主义”的书，将会非常有趣，尤其是我还没见过任何相关的文章或书籍。

Second, I aspired to write a book about how liberalism, nationalism, and realism interact to affect relations among states. I have long considered nationalism a remarkably powerful force in international politics, but I had never examined that topic in detail. I had written a good deal about realism, however, and explored its differences with liberalism in several earlier works. I thought that it would be interesting to write a book comparing and contrasting these three “isms,” especially since I knew of no article or book that did this.

当我思考自由主义、民族主义和现实主义之间的关系时，我意识到这三者之间的对立为解释1989年以来，特别是2001年以来美国外交政策的失败提供了一个理想的模板。至此，我写这本书的两个原因就完美地契合了。

As I thought about the relationship between liberalism, nationalism, and realism, I came to realize that this trichotomy provided an ideal template for explaining the failures of U.S. foreign policy since 1989, and especially since 2001. At that point, my two reasons for writing this book fit together rather neatly.

我的基本论点是，冷战结束后，美国实力强大，足以推行一种极端自由主义的外交政策，通常被称为“自由霸权”。这项雄心勃勃的战略旨在将尽可能多的国家转变为自由民主国家，同时促进开放的国际经济并建立强大的国际机构。本质上，美国试图按照自己的意愿重塑世界。这项政策在美国外交政策界广受欢迎，其支持者认为，这将使世界更加和平，并缓解核扩散和恐怖主义的双重难题。它将减少侵犯人权的行为，并使自由民主国家更能抵御内部威胁。

My basic argument is that the United States was so powerful in the aftermath of the Cold War that it could adopt a profoundly liberal foreign policy, commonly referred to as “liberal hegemony.” The aim of this ambitious strategy is to turn as many countries as possible into liberal democracies while also fostering an open international economy and building formidable international institutions. In essence, the United States has sought to remake the world in its own image. Proponents of this policy, which is widely embraced in the American foreign policy establishment, believe it will make the world more peaceful and ameliorate the dual problems of nuclear proliferation and terrorism. It will reduce human rights violations and make liberal democracies more secure against internal threats.

然而，自由主义霸权从一开始就注定失败，事实也的确如此。这种策略必然导致一些政策使一个国家与民族主义和现实主义背道而驰，而民族主义和现实主义最终对国际政治的影响力远超自由主义。大多数美国人难以接受这一基本事实。美国是一个根深蒂固的自由主义国家，其外交政策精英几乎本能地敌视民族主义和现实主义。但这种思维方式只会给外交政策带来麻烦。明智的美国决策者应该放弃自由主义霸权，转而奉行更加克制的外交政策，这种政策应基于现实主义，并充分理解民族主义如何制约大国。

From the beginning, however, liberal hegemony was destined to fail, and it did. This strategy invariably leads to policies that put a country at odds with nationalism and realism, which ultimately have far more influence on international politics than liberalism does. This basic fact of life is difficult for most Americans to accept. The United States is a deeply liberal country whose foreign policy elite have an almost knee-jerk hostility toward both nationalism and realism. But this kind of thinking can only lead to trouble on the foreign policy front. American policymakers would be wise to abandon liberal hegemony and pursue a more restrained foreign policy based on realism and a proper understanding of how nationalism constrains great powers.

这本书的根源可以追溯到我在康奈尔大学读研究生的时期。1976年秋季，我选修了艾萨克·克拉姆尼克教授开设的政治理论研讨课。这门课向学生们介绍了柏拉图、马基雅维利、霍布斯、洛克、卢梭和马克思等重要思想家的著作，对我的影响远胜于我以往修读的任何其他课程。事实上，我至今还保留着那门课的笔记，这些年来，我至少翻阅过五十次。

The deeper roots of this book go back to my days as a graduate student at Cornell University. In the fall of 1976, I took the Field Seminar in Political Theory taught by Professor Isaac Kramnick. The class, which introduced students to the writings of seminal thinkers like Plato, Machiavelli, Hobbes, Locke, Rousseau, and Marx, had a greater impact on me than any other course I have ever taken. Indeed, I still have my notebook from that class, and over the years I have consulted it at least fifty times.

那次研讨会的三个方面对我的思想发展至关重要。首先，我了解了各种各样的主义，包括自由主义、民族主义和现实主义，而且这门课程本身就便于我将它们相互对比。其次，它让我明白理论对于理解世界的运行方式至关重要。我之所以多次翻阅那门课的笔记，是因为我记得其中的一些论点。这些理论家的理论对当代政治问题有着深远的影响。第三，我了解到，人们可以用简洁明了、非专业人士也能理解的语言来谈论和撰写重要的理论问题。虽然我们阅读清单上的那些著名理论家的论述往往晦涩难懂，但克拉姆尼克教授用直白的语言阐述他们的理论，不仅使之易于理解，也清晰地展现了这些理论的重要性。

Three aspects of that seminar made it central to my intellectual development. First, I learned much about all sorts of isms, including liberalism, nationalism, and realism, and the course lent itself to contrasting them against each other. Second, it taught me that theory is indispensable for understanding how the world works. The reason I have referred back to the course notebook so many times is that I remembered particular arguments those theorists made that had significant implications for contemporary political issues. Third, I learned that one may talk and write about important theoretical issues in simple, clear language that is accessible to nonexperts. Although it was often hard to figure out exactly what the famous theorists on our reading list were saying, Professor Kramnick’s ability to spell out their theories in straightforward language not only made them easy to understand but also made it clear why they are important.

《大错觉》的核心在于理论探讨。本书的基本前提是：理论对于理解政策问题至关重要。但秉承艾萨克·克拉姆尼克的精神，我竭尽所能地清晰阐述我的论点，以便任何受过良好教育且对此感兴趣的读者都能理解。坦白地说，我的目标是成为一名优秀的沟通者，而不是一名故弄玄虚的专家。当然，最终只有读者才能评判我是否成功。

The Great Delusion is intended to be theoretical at its core. The premise underlying the book is that theory is essential for understanding policy issues. But in the spirit of Isaac Kramnick, I have gone to great lengths to spell out my arguments as clearly as possible so that any well-educated and interested reader can grasp them. To put it bluntly, my aim is to be a great communicator, not a great obfuscator. Only the reader, of course, can determine whether I have succeeded.

如果没有众多才华横溢之人的帮助，我不可能完成这本书。我最感激的是四位对本书贡献良多的人士：伊丽莎·格奥尔基、玛丽亚·格林伯格、塞巴斯蒂安·罗萨托和斯蒂芬·沃尔特。他们不仅提出了至关重要的概念性见解，促使我修改了某些论点，还发现了我的疏忽之处，并就如何重新组织章节以及全书结构提供了宝贵的建议。

I could not have written this book without the help of many very smart people. My greatest debt is to four individuals whose fingerprints are all over it: Eliza Gheorghe, Mariya Grinberg, Sebastian Rosato, and Stephen Walt. They not only made critically important conceptual points that caused me to alter particular arguments, but also spotted contradictions that I had missed and gave sage advice on how to reorganize chapters as well as the book’s overall structure.

在将书稿交给耶鲁大学出版社之前，我一共修改了五稿。2016年11月，在完成第二稿之后，我举办了一场图书研习会，邀请了六位来自芝加哥大学以外的学者——丹尼尔·杜德尼、马修·科赫尔、约翰·欧文、塞巴斯蒂安·罗萨托、斯蒂芬·沃尔特和亚历山大·温特——他们非常友善地阅读了整部书稿，并花了八个小时进行详细的点评。他们在研习会上以及之后通过电子邮件和电话提出的反馈意见，促使我做出了许多修改，其中一些是根本性的。

The manuscript went through five major drafts before I turned it over to Yale University Press. In November 2016, after the second major draft, I had a book workshop featuring six scholars from outside the University of Chicago—Daniel Deudney, Matthew Kocher, John Owen, Sebastian Rosato, Stephen Walt, and Alexander Wendt—who were kind enough to read the entire manuscript and spend eight hours critiquing it in detail. Their feedback, both at the workshop and in subsequent email and phone exchanges, led me to make numerous changes, some of them fundamental.

那次读书会的其他参与者，包括我的好友托马斯·杜尔金，都给了我很多宝贵的建议，告诉我追求自由主义霸权如何威胁国内公民自由，并助长国家安全机构的扩张。我也很幸运地遇到了我在芝加哥大学的所有国际关系同事——奥斯汀·卡森、罗伯特·Gulotty、Charles Lipson、Robert Pape、Paul Poast、Michael J. Reese 和 Paul Staniland 也参与了讨论。他们也提出了许多精彩的意见，帮助我完善了一些论点，并促使我修改了另一些论点。

Other participants at that book workshop, including my good friend Thomas Durkin, gave me sage advice on how the pursuit of liberal hegemony threatens civil liberties at home and facilitates the growth of a national security state. I also had the good fortune of having all my international relations colleagues at the University of Chicago—Austin Carson, Robert Gulotty, Charles Lipson, Robert Pape, Paul Poast, Michael J. Reese, and Paul Staniland—participate in the discussion. They too offered excellent comments that helped me tighten some arguments and forced me to alter others.

我特别感谢肖恩·林恩-琼斯，他通读了整篇稿件，并提出了详尽的意见，帮助我完善了最终版本。我尤其要感谢耶鲁大学出版社的编辑威廉·弗鲁赫特，他出色地完成了最终版本的编辑工作。他督促我精简某些论点，同时对几乎所有论点进行了精简，使本书更易于读者理解。莉兹·舒勒在约翰·多诺霍的协助下，出色地完成了校对工作，凯伦·奥尔森则高效且热情地处理了后勤事宜。

I owe a special debt of gratitude to Sean Lynn-Jones, who read the entire manuscript and gave me a detailed set of comments that helped me refine the final version of the manuscript. I am especially grateful to my editor at Yale University Press, William Frucht, who did a superb job of editing that final version. He pushed me hard to tighten particular arguments while he streamlined virtually all of them in ways that helped make the book more reader friendly. Liz Schueler, with some help from John Donohue, did a fine job of copyediting, and Karen Olson handled the logistics efficiently and cheerfully.

许多其他人也帮助我完成了这本书——有的贡献不大，有的贡献微不足道。他们包括 Sener Akturk、Zeynep Bulutgil、Jon Caverley、Michael Desch、Alexander Downes、Charles Glaser、Burak Kadercan、Brian Leiter、Jennifer A. Lind、Gabriel Mares、Max Mearsheimer、Nicholas Mearsheimer、Rajan Menon、Nuno Monteiro、Francesca Morgan、Valerie Morkevičius、John Mueller、Sankar Muthu、David Nirenberg、Lindsey O'Rourke、Joseph Parent、Don Reneau、Marie-Eve Reny、Michael Rosol、John Schuessler、James Scott、Yubing Sheng、Tom Switzer，以及耶鲁大学出版社的两位匿名审稿人。

Many other individuals helped me—some in small ways, some in big ways—produce this book. They include Sener Akturk, Zeynep Bulutgil, Jon Caverley, Michael Desch, Alexander Downes, Charles Glaser, Burak Kadercan, Brian Leiter, Jennifer A. Lind, Gabriel Mares, Max Mearsheimer, Nicholas Mearsheimer, Rajan Menon, Nuno Monteiro, Francesca Morgan, Valerie Morkevičius, John Mueller, Sankar Muthu, David Nirenberg, Lindsey O’Rourke, Joseph Parent, Don Reneau, Marie-Eve Reny, Michael Rosol, John Schuessler, James Scott, Yubing Sheng, Tom Switzer, and the two anonymous reviewers for Yale University Press.

我要感谢耶鲁大学麦克米伦国际与区域研究中心亨利·卢斯主任伊恩·夏皮罗先生，是他邀请我做了2017年的亨利·L·史汀生讲座。我在耶鲁大学的三场讲座实际上是本书的核心内容。我还要感谢芝加哥大学，三十五年来，这里一直是我的学术家园，它慷慨地支持了我的研究，不仅包括本书的创作，也包括自1982年我担任助理教授以来我几乎所有的著作。此外，我还要感谢查尔斯·科赫基金会资助我的研究和书籍研讨会。我尤其感谢该基金会负责研究的副主席威廉·鲁格先生的支持。

I would like to thank Ian Shapiro, the Henry R. Luce Director of the MacMillan Center for International and Area Studies at Yale, who invited me to give the Henry L. Stimson Lectures for 2017. The three lectures that I gave at Yale are, in effect, the central ingredients of this book. I would also like to express my appreciation to the University of Chicago, which has been my intellectual home for more than thirty-five years and has generously supported the research that went into producing not only this book but virtually everything I have written since I started there as an assistant professor in 1982. In addition, I want to thank the Charles Koch Foundation for helping to fund my research and the book workshop. I especially appreciate the support of William Ruger, its vice president for research.

多年来，我非常幸运地拥有优秀的行政助理团队，他们不仅帮助我处理作为教授和学者日常的后勤工作，而且还做了很多其他重要的事情。本书的研究工作由梅根·贝兰斯基、艾玛·奇尔顿、苏维克·德、伊丽莎白·詹金斯和迈克尔·罗利等人协助完成，他们都为本书的创作做出了重要贡献。我也非常感谢家人给予我的支持，尤其是我的妻子帕梅拉，她从未抱怨过我没完没了地修改书稿。

I have been fortunate over the years to have top-notch administrative assistants who not only have helped me deal with the everyday logistical demands of being a professor and scholar but also have done significant amounts of research for me. Megan Belansky, Emma Chilton, Souvik De, Elizabeth Jenkins, and Michael Rowley have all served me well and have contributed in important ways to the making of this book. I am also grateful for all the support I received on the home front from my family, especially from my wife, Pamela, who never complained about the endless hours I spent writing and rewriting the book manuscript.

最后，我要将这本书献给我多年来教过的所有学生，最早可以追溯到1974年我在纽约州北部莫霍克谷社区学院开设的第一门课程。我在这里使用“学生”一词的含义非常广泛，也包括那些没有正式上过我的课，但告诉我我的教学对他们的思维方式产生了影响的人。我热爱教学，因为我能从向学生传授知识以及帮助他们形成自己对世界运行规律的理解中获得极大的满足感。

Finally, I would like to dedicate this book to all the students I have taught over the years, going back to when I taught my first course at Mohawk Valley Community College in upstate New York in 1974. I am using the term student here in its broadest sense, to include people who have not formally taken a course with me but have told me that my work has helped shape their thinking. I love teaching because I get great satisfaction from imparting knowledge to students and from helping them come up with their own theories about how the world works.

与此同时，多年来与学生的互动也让我受益匪浅。尤其是在研讨课上，我常常带着对课程大纲中某篇文章或书籍的某种理解走进课堂，却因为学生的发言而改变了想法。教授大型讲座课程也是一次重要的学习经历，它迫使我整理自己对重大议题的思考，并思考如何以清晰易懂的方式呈现出来。

At the same time, I have learned an enormous amount over the years from interacting with students. This is especially true of seminars, where I have often gone into class thinking one way about an article or book on the syllabus and left thinking about it differently because of something a student said. Teaching large lecture courses has also been an important learning experience, as it has forced me to organize my thoughts on big topics and figure out how to present them in a clear and accessible way.

总而言之，多年来的教学和与学生的相处，帮助我形成了对国际政治的思考，而这些思考都体现在本书的每一页。对此，我永远心怀感激。

All of this is to say that teaching and working with students over the years has helped shape my thinking about international politics in ways that are reflected in every page of this book. For that I am forever grateful.

大错特错

THE GREAT DELUSION

1

1

不可能的梦想

The Impossible Dream

自由霸权是一种雄心勃勃的战略，其目标是将尽可能多的国家转变为像自身一样的自由民主国家，同时促进开放的国际经济并构建国际机构。本质上，自由主义国家力图将其自身的价值观广泛传播。本书旨在阐述当一个强大的国家为了推行这一战略而牺牲权力平衡政治格局时，将会发生什么。

LIBERAL HEGEMONY IS AN AMBITIOUS STRATEGY in which a state aims to turn as many countries as possible into liberal democracies like itself while also promoting an open international economy and building international institutions. In essence, the liberal state seeks to spread its own values far and wide. My goal in this book is to describe what happens when a powerful state pursues this strategy at the expense of balance-of-power politics.

西方许多人，尤其是外交政策精英，认为自由霸权是一项明智的政策，各国理应奉行。他们认为，从道德和战略角度来看，在全球范围内传播自由民主都意义非凡。首先，这被认为是保护人权的绝佳途径，因为人权有时会遭到专制国家的严重侵犯。其次，由于该政策认为自由民主国家之间不愿开战，因此它最终提供了一种超越现实主义、促进国际和平的方案。最后，支持者声称，自由霸权有助于保护国内的自由主义，因为它可以消除那些可能助长自由主义国家内部存在的非自由主义势力的专制国家。

Many in the West, especially among foreign policy elites, consider liberal hegemony a wise policy that states should axiomatically adopt. Spreading liberal democracy around the world is said to make eminently good sense from both a moral and a strategic perspective. For starters, it is thought to be an excellent way to protect human rights, which are sometimes seriously violated by authoritarian states. And because the policy holds that liberal democracies do not want to go to war with each other, it ultimately provides a formula for transcending realism and fostering international peace. Finally, proponents claim it helps protect liberalism at home by eliminating authoritarian states that otherwise might aid the illiberal forces that are constantly present inside the liberal state.

这种传统观点是错误的。大国很少有能力全面推行自由主义外交政策。只要地球上存在两个或两个以上的大国，它们就别无选择，只能密切关注自身在全球力量平衡中的地位，并按照现实主义的准则行事。所有大国，无论其政治倾向如何，都非常重视自身的生存。在两极或多极体系中，始终存在被其他大国攻击的风险。在这种情况下，自由主义大国常常用自由主义的辞藻来掩盖其强硬的行径。他们口口声声说着自由主义，做着现实主义。如果他们采取的自由主义政策与现实主义逻辑相悖，最终必然会后悔莫及。

This conventional wisdom is wrong. Great powers are rarely in a position to pursue a full-scale liberal foreign policy. As long as two or more of them exist on the planet, they have little choice but to pay close attention to their position in the global balance of power and act according to the dictates of realism. Great powers of all persuasions care deeply about their survival, and there is always the danger in a bipolar or multipolar system that they will be attacked by another great power. In these circumstances, liberal great powers regularly dress up their hard-nosed behavior with liberal rhetoric. They talk like liberals and act like realists. Should they adopt liberal policies that are at odds with realist logic, they invariably come to regret it.

但有时，自由民主国家会遇到极其有利的权力平衡，以至于能够拥抱自由主义霸权。这种情况最有可能出现在单极世界中，因为在单极世界中，唯一的超级大国无需担心受到其他超级大国的攻击。在这种情况下，唯一的自由主义极点几乎总是会放弃现实主义，转而采取自由主义外交政策。自由主义国家天生具有一种难以抑制的十字军精神。

But occasionally a liberal democracy encounters such a favorable balance of power that it is able to embrace liberal hegemony. That situation is most likely to arise in a unipolar world, where the single great power does not have to worry about being attacked by another great power since there is none. Then the liberal sole pole will almost always abandon realism and adopt a liberal foreign policy. Liberal states have a crusader mentality hardwired into them that is hard to restrain.

由于自由主义珍视不可剥夺或自然权利的概念，坚定的自由主义者深切关注地球上几乎每个人的权利。这种普世主义逻辑为自由主义国家介入严重侵犯其公民权利的国家事务提供了强大的动力。进一步而言，确保外国人权利不受践踏的最佳途径是让他们生活在自由民主国家。这种逻辑直接导致积极的政权更迭政策，其目标是推翻独裁政权，代之以自由民主政体。自由主义者并不回避这项任务，主要是因为他们通常对本国在国内和国际上进行社会改造的能力充满信心。创建一个由自由民主政体组成的世界也被认为是实现国际和平的良方，这不仅可以消除战争，而且即使不能彻底消除，也能大大减少核扩散和恐怖主义这两大祸害。最后，这也是在国内维护自由主义的理想途径。

Because liberalism prizes the concept of inalienable or natural rights, committed liberals are deeply concerned about the rights of virtually every individual on the planet. This universalist logic creates a powerful incentive for liberal states to get involved in the affairs of countries that seriously violate their citizens’ rights. To take this a step further, the best way to ensure that the rights of foreigners are not trampled is for them to live in a liberal democracy. This logic leads straight to an active policy of regime change, where the goal is to topple autocrats and put liberal democracies in their place. Liberals do not shy from this task, mainly because they often have great faith in their state’s ability to do social engineering both at home and abroad. Creating a world populated by liberal democracies is also thought to be a formula for international peace, which would not just eliminate war but greatly reduce, if not eliminate, the twin scourges of nuclear proliferation and terrorism. And lastly, it is an ideal way of protecting liberalism at home.

尽管抱有这种热情，自由主义霸权终将无法实现其目标，其失败也必然会带来巨大的代价。自由主义国家很可能最终陷入无休止的战争，这非但不会减少国际政治冲突，反而会加剧核扩散和恐怖主义问题。此外，国家的军事行为几乎肯定会威胁到其自身的自由主义价值观。对外推行自由主义会导致国内的非自由主义。最后，即便自由主义国家实现了其目标——将民主传播到世界各地，促进……经济交往和建立国际机构——它们并不能带来和平。

This enthusiasm notwithstanding, liberal hegemony will not achieve its goals, and its failure will inevitably come with huge costs. The liberal state is likely to end up fighting endless wars, which will increase rather than reduce the level of conflict in international politics and thus aggravate the problems of proliferation and terrorism. Moreover, the state’s militaristic behavior is almost certain to end up threatening its own liberal values. Liberalism abroad leads to illiberalism at home. Finally, even if the liberal state were to achieve its aims—spreading democracy near and far, fostering economic intercourse, and creating international institutions—they would not produce peace.

理解自由主义局限性的关键在于认识到它与民族主义和现实主义之间的关系。本书最终探讨的正是这三种主义及其相互作用如何影响国际政治。

The key to understanding liberalism’s limits is to recognize its relationship with nationalism and realism. This book is ultimately all about these three isms and how they interact to affect international politics.

民族主义是一种极其强大的政治意识形态。它的核心在于将世界划分为众多民族，这些民族都是强大的社会单元，各自拥有独特的文化。几乎每个民族都希望拥有自己的国家，尽管并非所有民族都能如愿。然而，我们生活在一个几乎完全由民族国家构成的世界，这意味着自由主义必须与民族主义共存。自由主义国家本身也是民族国家。毫无疑问，自由主义和民族主义可以共存，但当二者发生冲突时，民族主义几乎总是占据上风。

Nationalism is an enormously powerful political ideology. It revolves around the division of the world into a wide variety of nations, which are formidable social units, each with a distinct culture. Virtually every nation would prefer to have its own state, although not all can. Still, we live in a world populated almost exclusively by nation-states, which means that liberalism must coexist with nationalism. Liberal states are also nation-states. There is no question that liberalism and nationalism can coexist, but when they clash, nationalism almost always wins.

民族主义的影响往往会削弱自由主义外交政策。例如，民族主义高度重视自决权，这意味着大多数国家会抵制自由主义大国干涉其内政的企图——而这恰恰是自由主义霸权的核心所在。这两种主义在个人权利问题上也存在冲突。自由主义者认为，无论居住在哪个国家，每个人都享有同等的权利。民族主义则是一种从上到下都带有特殊主义色彩的意识形态，这意味着它并不认为权利是不可剥夺的。实际上，世界上绝大多数人并不太关心其他国家公民的权利。他们更关心本国公民的权利，但即便如此，这种关心也是有限度的。自由主义过分强调了个人权利的重要性。

The influence of nationalism often undercuts a liberal foreign policy. For example, nationalism places great emphasis on self-determination, which means that most countries will resist a liberal great power’s efforts to interfere in their domestic politics—which, of course, is what liberal hegemony is all about. These two isms also clash over individual rights. Liberals believe everyone has the same rights, regardless of which country they call home. Nationalism is a particularist ideology from top to bottom, which means it does not treat rights as inalienable. In practice, the vast majority of people around the globe do not care greatly about the rights of individuals in other countries. They are much more concerned about their fellow citizens’ rights, and even that commitment has limits. Liberalism oversells the importance of individual rights.

自由主义也无法与现实主义匹敌。自由主义的核心假设是，构成任何社会的个体有时会对美好生活的构成存在深刻分歧，而这些分歧可能导致他们互相残杀。因此，需要一个国家来维护和平。但是，并不存在一个世界国家能够在各国之间存在深刻分歧时将它们置于对立面。国际体系的结构是无政府状态而非等级制，这意味着将自由主义应用于国际政治行不通。因此，如果各国希望生存下去，它们几乎别无选择，只能按照权力平衡的逻辑行事。然而，也存在一些特殊情况，例如一个国家非常安全，以至于可以暂时摆脱现实政治的束缚。并推行真正的自由主义政策。结果几乎总是糟糕的，这主要是因为民族主义阻碍了自由主义的推进。

Liberalism is also no match for realism. At its core, liberalism assumes that the individuals who make up any society sometimes have profound differences about what constitutes the good life, and these differences might lead them to try to kill each other. Thus a state is needed to keep the peace. But there is no world state to keep countries at bay when they have profound disagreements. The structure of the international system is anarchic, not hierarchic, which means that liberalism applied to international politics cannot work. Countries thus have little choice but to act according to balance-of-power logic if they hope to survive. There are special cases, however, where a country is so secure that it can take a break from realpolitik and pursue truly liberal policies. The results are almost always bad, largely because nationalism thwarts the liberal crusader.

简而言之，我的论点是：民族主义和现实主义几乎总是胜过自由主义。我们的世界在很大程度上是由这两种强大的主义塑造的，而非自由主义。想想五百年前，政治格局极其多元化，包括城邦、公国、帝国、侯国以及其他各种政治形式。而如今，世界已几乎完全由民族国家构成。尽管促成这一巨大转变的因素众多，但现代国家体系背后的两大主要驱动力是民族主义和权力平衡政治。

My argument, stated briefly, is that nationalism and realism almost always trump liberalism. Our world has been shaped in good part by those two powerful isms, not by liberalism. Consider that five hundred years ago the political universe was remarkably heterogeneous; it included city-states, duchies, empires, principalities, and assorted other political forms. That world has given way to a globe populated almost exclusively by nation-states. Although many factors caused this great transformation, two of the main driving forces behind the modern state system were nationalism and balance-of-power politics.

美国拥抱自由主义霸权

The American Embrace of Liberal Hegemony

本书的写作动机之一，是希望了解美国近期的外交政策。美国是一个奉行深度自由主义的国家，冷战结束后，它一跃成为国际体系中最强大的国家。1 1991年苏联解体，使美国处于追求自由主义霸权的理想地位。2美国外交政策机构几乎毫不犹豫地接受了这一雄心勃勃的政策，并对美国和世界的未来充满乐观。至少在初期，广大公众也认同这种热情。

This book is also motivated by a desire to understand recent American foreign policy. The United States is a deeply liberal country that emerged from the Cold War as by far the most powerful state in the international system.1 The collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991 left it in an ideal position to pursue liberal hegemony.2 The American foreign policy establishment embraced that ambitious policy with little hesitation, and with abundant optimism about the future of the United States and the world. At least at first, the broader public shared this enthusiasm.

弗朗西斯·福山在其著名的文章《历史的终结？》中捕捉到了时代精神，这篇文章发表于冷战即将结束之际。福山认为，自由主义在20世纪上半叶战胜了法西斯主义，在下半叶战胜了共产主义，如今已无其他可行的替代方案。世界最终将完全由自由民主国家组成。福山认为，这些国家几乎不会再有实质性的争端，大国之间的战争也将停止。他指出，在这个新世界里，人们面临的最大问题或许是无聊。

The zeitgeist was captured in Francis Fukuyama’s famous article, “The End of History?,” published just as the Cold War was coming to a close.3 Liberalism, he argued, defeated fascism in the first half of the twentieth century and communism in the second half, and now there was no viable alternative left standing. The world would eventually be entirely populated by liberal democracies. According to Fukuyama, these nations would have virtually no meaningful disputes, and wars between great powers would cease. The biggest problem confronting people in this new world, he suggested, might be boredom.

当时人们普遍认为，自由主义的传播最终将终结权力平衡政治。长期以来构成大国关系特征的激烈安全竞争将会消失，而长期以来占据主导地位的现实主义理论范式也将不复存在。国际关系终将被历史淘汰。“在一个自由而非暴政正在崛起的世界里，”比尔·克林顿在1992年竞选总统时宣称，“纯粹的权力政治的犬儒算计根本行不通。它不适应这个新时代，在这个时代，思想和信息在各国大使来得及阅读电报之前就已经传遍全球。” ⁴

It was also widely believed at the time that the spread of liberalism would ultimately bring an end to balance-of-power politics. The harsh security competition that has long characterized great-power relations would disappear, and realism, long the dominant intellectual paradigm in international relations, would land on the scrap heap of history. “In a world where freedom, not tyranny, is on the march,” Bill Clinton proclaimed while campaigning for the White House in 1992, “the cynical calculus of pure power politics simply does not compute. It is ill-suited to a new era in which ideas and information are broadcast around the globe before ambassadors can read their cables.”4

或许近期没有哪位总统比乔治·W·布什更热衷于传播自由主义。他在2003年3月的一次演讲中说道，当时距离入侵伊拉克仅两周：“伊拉克现政权已经展现了暴政在中东散播纷争和暴力的力量。一个获得解放的伊拉克能够展现自由的力量，通过给数百万人的生活带来希望和进步，来改变这个至关重要的地区。美国在安全方面的利益，以及美国对自由的信仰，都指向同一个方向：一个自由和平的伊拉克。” 5同年晚些时候，9月6日，他宣称：“推进自由是我们时代的召唤，也是我们国家的召唤。从十四点原则到四大自由，再到威斯敏斯特演讲，美国始终将我们的力量奉献于原则。我们相信，自由是自然的设计；我们相信，自由是历史的方向。我们相信，人类的圆满和卓越源于对自由的负责任的运用。我们相信，自由——我们所珍视的自由——并非我们独有，而是全人类的权利和能力。” 6

Probably no recent president embraced the mission of spreading liberalism more enthusiastically than George W. Bush, who said in a speech in March 2003, two weeks before the invasion of Iraq: “The current Iraqi regime has shown the power of tyranny to spread discord and violence in the Middle East. A liberated Iraq can show the power of freedom to transform that vital region, by bringing hope and progress into the lives of millions. America’s interests in security, and America’s belief in liberty, both lead in the same direction: to a free and peaceful Iraq.”5 Later that year, on September 6, he proclaimed: “The advance of freedom is the calling of our time; it is the calling of our country. From the Fourteen Points to the Four Freedoms, to the Speech at Westminster, America has put our power at the service of principle. We believe that liberty is the design of nature; we believe that liberty is the direction of history. We believe that human fulfillment and excellence come in the responsible exercise of liberty. And we believe that freedom—the freedom we prize—is not for us alone, it is the right and the capacity of all mankind.”6

事情出了大问题。如今，在2018年，大多数人对美国外交政策的看法与2003年截然不同，更不用说与上世纪90年代初相比了。悲观而非乐观，主导了对美国在逃避现实主义期间所取得成就的大多数评价。在布什和奥巴马总统的领导下，华盛顿在中东地区散播死亡和破坏方面扮演了关键角色，而且几乎没有迹象表明这种混乱局面会在短期内结束。美国对乌克兰的政策，其背后的自由主义逻辑，是造成俄罗斯与西方之间持续危机的主要原因。自1989年以来，美国平均每三年就有两年处于战争状态，参与了七场不同的战争。对此我们不应感到惊讶。与西方普遍的看法相反，自由主义外交政策并非合作与和平的良方，而是动荡与冲突的根源。

Something went badly wrong. Most people’s view of U.S. foreign policy today, in 2018, is starkly different from what it was in 2003, much less the early 1990s. Pessimism, not optimism, dominates most assessments of America’s accomplishments during its holiday from realism. Under Presidents Bush and Barack Obama, Washington has played a key role in sowing death and destruction across the greater Middle East, and there is little evidence the mayhem will end anytime soon. American policy toward Ukraine, motivated by liberal logic, is principally responsible for the ongoing crisis between Russia and the West. The United States has been at war for two out of every three years since 1989, fighting seven different wars. We should not be surprised by this. Contrary to the prevailing wisdom in the West, a liberal foreign policy is not a formula for cooperation and peace but for instability and conflict.

本书重点关注1993年至2017年这段时期，克林顿、布什和奥巴马三届政府执政八年，均致力于推行自由霸权。尽管奥巴马总统对这一政策有所保留，但这些保留对其政府的实际外交行动影响甚微。我没有将特朗普政府纳入考量，原因有二。首先，在本书撰写之时，我难以预测特朗普总统的外交政策走向，尽管从他2016年竞选期间的言论来看，他显然已经意识到自由霸权的彻底失败，并希望放弃该战略的关键要素。其次，有充分理由认为，随着中国的崛起和俄罗斯实力的复苏，大国政治再次成为焦点，特朗普最终将别无选择，只能转向基于现实主义的大战略，即便这样做在国内会遭遇相当大的阻力。

In this book I focus on the period between 1993 and 2017, when the Clinton, Bush, and Obama administrations, each in control of American foreign policy for eight years, were fully committed to pursuing liberal hegemony. Although President Obama had some reservations about that policy, they mattered little for how his administration actually acted abroad. I do not consider the Trump administration for two reasons. First, as I was finishing this book it was difficult to determine what President Trump’s foreign policy would look like, although it is clear from his rhetoric during the 2016 campaign that he recognizes that liberal hegemony has been an abject failure and would like to abandon key elements of that strategy. Second, there is good reason to think that with the rise of China and the resurrection of Russian power having put great power politics back on the table, Trump eventually will have no choice but to move toward a grand strategy based on realism, even if doing so meets with considerable resistance at home.

人性的核心地位

The Centrality of Human Nature

学者在评估自由主义对国际政治的影响时，通常首先分析一系列被广泛视为现实主义的自由主义替代方案的理论。民主和平理论认为，自由民主国家之间不会发生战争，但并不认为它们比非民主国家更爱好和平。根据经济相互依存理论，经济联系密切的国家很少发生战争，因为战争的代价对双方来说都难以承受。自由制度主义则认为，加入国际机构的国家更有可能相互合作，因为它们会受到机构规则的约束，而遵守这些规则几乎总是符合它们的长远利益。

When scholars assess liberalism’s effect on international politics, they usually begin by analyzing a cluster of theories widely seen as the liberal alternatives to realism. Democratic peace theory maintains that liberal democracies do not go to war with each other, but not that they are more peaceful than non-democracies. According to economic interdependence theory, countries with significant economic relations rarely fight with each other, because the costs of war are prohibitive for both sides. Liberal institutionalism claims that states that join international institutions are more likely to cooperate with each other, because they will be constrained by the organization’s rules, which is almost always in their long-term interest to obey.

我将仔细评估每一种理论。但在此之前，必须先搁置国际关系问题，转而探讨一些更根本的问题：自由主义的本质是什么？它的理论基础是什么？换句话说，我的目标是从自由主义的核心假设和逻辑入手，并判断它们是否合理。在评估理论时，考察它们的理论基础至关重要。关于人性的基本假设。自由主义的奠基人之一约翰·洛克对此阐述得非常精辟：“要正确理解政治权力……我们必须考虑所有人天生处于何种状态。” 7

I will carefully assess each of these theories. But before I do, it is essential to put aside matters of international relations and address more basic questions: what liberalism is and what its intellectual foundations are. My aim, in other words, is to begin with the assumptions and logics that sit at the core of liberalism itself—and determine whether they make sense. It is enormously important when evaluating theories to examine their foundational assumptions about human nature. John Locke, one of liberalism’s founding fathers, put the point well: “To understand political power right . . . we must consider what state all men are naturally in.”7

什么是“所有人自然所处的状态”？所有人类有哪些共同的特征？回答这个问题不仅对理解自由主义至关重要，对理解民族主义和现实主义也同样重要。任何一种主义越符合人性，它在现实世界中就越具有现实意义。因此，我必须阐述自己对人性的看法，并解释这些共同特征如何共同作用，影响政治生活。这最终意味着要构建一个简明的政治理论，用于评估和比较自由主义、民族主义和现实主义。

What is the “state all men are naturally in”? What distinguishing characteristics do all humans have in common? Answering this question is important not only for understanding liberalism but also for understanding nationalism and realism. The more closely any ism accords with human nature, the more relevance it will have in the real world. So I have to spell out my own views about human nature and explain how the common characteristics operate together to affect political life. This ultimately means coming up with a sparse theory of politics that can be used to evaluate and compare liberalism, nationalism, and realism.

我们需要回答关于人性的两个主要问题。首先，男人和女人首先是社会性动物吗？还是更应该强调他们的个性？换句话说，人类本质上是努力争取个性空间的社会动物，还是缔结社会契约的个体？其次，我们的批判能力是否发展到足以让我们就美好生活的定义达成某种粗略的道德共识？我们能否就基本原则达成一致？

We need to answer two principal questions about human nature. First, are men and women social beings above all else, or does it make more sense to emphasize their individuality? In other words, are humans fundamentally social animals who strive hard to carve out room for their individuality, or are they individuals who form social contracts? Second, have our critical faculties developed to the point where we can reach some rough moral consensus on what defines the good life? Can we agree on first principles?

我认为，从生命之初到终结，我们都是深刻的社会性动物，个人主义的重要性次之，但这并非意味着个人主义不重要。其次，即便不同群体内部可能存在广泛的共识，我们也不可能就基本原则达成一致。正因为对于何为美好生活并无普世真理，个人和群体之间的分歧才会如此深刻。

My view is that we are profoundly social beings from the start to the finish of our lives and that individualism is of secondary importance, which is not to say that it is unimportant. Second, it is impossible to reach a common understanding about first principles, even though there can be widespread agreement within different groups. But because there are no universal truths regarding what constitutes the good life, the disagreements among individuals and groups can be profound.

自由主义淡化了人类的社会属性，几乎将其忽略不计，而是将人视为孤立的个体。但自由主义者明智地强调，对于何为美好生活等问题，不可能达成普遍共识。因此，在回答有关人性的关键问题上，自由主义只能算是勉强及格。与此同时，民族主义和现实主义都与人性相符，这不仅解释了为什么它们在与自由主义相悖时能够胜过自由主义，也解释了为什么它们是国际政治背后的主要驱动力。民族主义和现实主义很少关注个体。他们不再关注人权，而是以不同的民族国家来看待世界，这反映了人类本质上是社会性动物，对美好生活的构成有着根本不同的理解。8

Liberalism downplays the social nature of human beings to the point of almost ignoring it, instead treating people largely as atomistic actors. But liberals wisely emphasize that it is not possible to approach any universal agreement on questions relating to what constitutes the good life. Thus liberalism is one for two in answering the key questions about human nature. Both nationalism and realism, meanwhile, are in sync with human nature, which explains not only why they trump liberalism when they are at odds with it but also why they are the main driving forces behind international politics. Nationalism and realism pay little attention to individuals and rights and instead see the world in terms of distinct nation-states, reflecting the fact that humans are principally social beings who have fundamentally different views of what constitutes the good life.8

尽管存在这些差异，这三种主义都具有一个重要的共同特征：对生存的深刻关注。我认为，各国之所以如此致力于建立自己的国家，是因为这是确保自身生存的最佳途径，而生存绝非理所当然。国际体系中的国家也深受生存考量的影响，因此它们会密切关注权力平衡，并最终寻求霸权。最后，生存是自由主义的一个决定性特征。毕竟，自由主义理论的基础在于这样一种信念：人们有时会因为对基本原则的强烈分歧而互相残杀。国家的一个关键职责就是扮演维护秩序的角色，最大限度地保障每个人的生存机会。

These differences notwithstanding, all three isms have one important feature in common: a profound concern about survival. Nations, I argue, are deeply committed to having their own state because it is the best way to ensure their survival, which can never be taken for granted. States in the international system are also intensely influenced by concerns about survival, which is why they carefully monitor the balance of power and ultimately seek hegemony. Finally, survival is a defining aspect of liberalism. After all, that theory is predicated on the belief that individuals sometimes disagree so strongly about first principles that they try to kill each other. A crucial purpose of the state is to act as a constable and maximize each person’s prospects of survival.

政治自由主义

Political Liberalism

我尚未对“自由主义”一词进行详细定义。现在必须这样做，因为它对不同的人来说可能意味着不同的东西。民族主义和现实主义也是如此。明确所有这些术语的定义至关重要，因为只有这样才能就它们之间的关系以及它们如何相互作用并影响国际政治提出连贯的论证。精确的定义能够帮助学者梳理纷繁复杂的事实。它们还能帮助读者判断作者的论点是否令人信​​服，如果令人信服，则能指出其不足之处和原因。

I have yet to define the term liberalism in any detail. It is important that I do so now, because it can mean different things to different people. The same is true of nationalism and realism. It is essential to settle on clear definitions of all these terms, because that is the only way to make coherent arguments about how they relate to each other and how they interact to influence international politics. Precise definitions allow scholars to impose order on a messy and complicated body of facts. They also help readers decide whether an author’s arguments are compelling, and if not, where and why not.

定义本身并无对错之分，并非非真即假。我们可以自由地根据自身理解来定义核心概念。但这并不意味着我们无法对不同的定义进行区分。评估任何定义价值的首要标准在于它对理解所研究现象的实用性。我选择的定义正是我希望能够达到这一目的的。

Definitions are neither right nor wrong in the sense of being true or false. We are free to define our core concepts as we see fit. This is not to say, however, that there is no way to discriminate among definitions. The primary criterion for assessing any definition’s worth is how useful it is for understanding the phenomenon under study. I have chosen definitions that I hope serve that purpose.

在我看来，政治自由主义是一种以个人主义为核心，并高度重视不可剥夺权利概念的意识形态。9这种对权利的关注是其普世主义的基础——每个人……地球上的每个人都拥有相同的固有权利——这正是自由主义国家推行雄心勃勃的外交政策的动力所在。自二战以来，关于自由主义的公共和学术讨论都极其重视通常所说的人权。这种情况遍及世界各地，而不仅仅是西方。“人权，”塞缪尔·莫恩指出，“已经成为社会运动和政治实体——无论是国家层面还是跨国层面——最高理想的核心。它们激发希望，并促使人们采取行动。” 10

Political liberalism, in my lexicon, is an ideology that is individualistic at its core and assigns great importance to the concept of inalienable rights.9 This concern for rights is the basis of its universalism—everyone on the planet has the same inherent set of rights—and this is what motivates liberal states to pursue ambitious foreign policies. The public and scholarly discourse about liberalism since World War II has placed enormous emphasis on what are commonly called human rights. This is true all around the world, not just in the West. “Human rights,” Samuel Moyn notes, “have come to define the most elevated aspirations of both social movements and political entities—state and interstate. They evoke hope and provoke action.”10

政治自由主义也建立在这样的假设之上：人们有时会在一些根本性的政治和社会问题上存在激烈的分歧，这就需要一个国家来维护秩序，以防这些争端演变成暴力冲突。与此相关的是，自由主义者非常重视宽容，这种准则鼓励人们即使存在根本分歧也要互相尊重。然而，尽管他们在所有这些问题上都达成了共识，但自由主义者之间仍然存在一些根本性的分歧。

Political liberalism is also built on the assumption that individuals sometimes differ intensely about bedrock political and social issues, which necessitates a state that can maintain order if those disputes threaten to turn violent. Relatedly, liberals place great emphasis on tolerance, a norm that encourages people to respect each other despite their fundamental disagreements. But while they agree on all of these matters, liberals are divided by some fundamental differences.

事实上，政治自由主义有两种类型：一种是所谓的“权宜之计式自由主义”，另一种是“进步自由主义”（本书通篇采用此术语）。 11二者之间主要存在两个重要的区别，首先在于它们对个人权利的理解。权宜之计式自由主义者几乎完全从个人自由的角度来理解权利，他们所说的个人自由是指在不受政府干预的情况下行动的自由。言论自由、新闻自由和财产权都是这些权利的典型例子。政府的存在是为了保护这些自由免受来自社会内部或外部的威胁。进步自由主义者同样珍视这些个人自由（有时被称为消极权利），但他们也坚定地致力于一系列由政府积极推动的权利。例如，他们认为每个人都享有平等的机会，而这只有通过政府的积极参与才能实现。权宜之计式自由主义者强烈反对这种积极权利的理念。

Political liberalism, in fact, comes in two varieties: what some call modus vivendi liberalism and progressive liberalism, a terminology I use throughout this book.11 There are basically two important differences between them, the first of which concerns how they think about individual rights. Modus vivendi liberals conceive of rights almost exclusively in terms of individual freedoms, by which they mean the freedom to act without fear of government intrusion. Freedom of speech, freedom of the press, and the right to hold property are representative examples of these rights. The government exists to protect these freedoms from threats that might emanate either from within the broader society or from outside it. Progressive liberals prize the same individual freedoms, which are sometimes called negative rights, but they are also deeply committed to a set of rights that are actively promoted by the government. They believe, for example, that everyone has a right to equal opportunity, which can be achieved only with active government involvement. Modus vivendi liberals are intensely opposed to this notion of positive rights.

对个人权利的讨论引出了“共存模式”与进步自由主义的第二个重要区别。二者在国家应扮演的角色上存在着显著分歧，而国家的作用远不止于维护国内和平。“共存模式”的自由主义者强调保护个人权利，这与他们所倡导的自由主义理念相符。自由主义者及其对积极权利的怀疑态度，认为国家应尽可能少地干预社会。不出所料，他们往往对政府进行社会改造的能力不屑一顾。进步自由主义者则持相反观点。他们倾向于积极主动的国家，以促进个人权利，并且对政府进行社会改造的能力更有信心。

This discussion of individual rights leads to the second important difference between modus vivendi and progressive liberalism. They differ sharply on the role the state should assume, beyond keeping the peace at home. Modus vivendi liberals, in line with their emphasis on protecting individual freedoms and their skepticism about positive rights, maintain that the state should involve itself in society as little as possible. Unsurprisingly, they tend to be dismissive about governments’ ability to do social engineering. Progressive liberals take the opposite view. They prefer an activist state that can promote individual rights, and they have much more faith in the capacity of governments to do social engineering.

毋庸置疑，政治自由主义和政治自由主义在思想界都备受关注，但在实践中，进步自由主义已经战胜了权宜之计式的自由主义。现代生活的复杂性和各种需求迫使各国不得不深入参与社会工程，包括促进积极权利。这并非否认某些国家比其他国家更积极地参与其中，也并非否认一个国家参与的程度会随时间而变化。然而，我们生活在一个国家干预主义盛行的时代，而且没有理由认为这种情况会在短期内改变。因此，就本书而言，政治自由主义实际上等同于进步自由主义。

While there is little doubt that both kinds of political liberalism receive great attention in the world of ideas, in practice, progressive liberalism has triumphed over modus vivendi liberalism. The complexities and demands of life in the modern world leave states with no choice but to be deeply engaged in social engineering, including promoting positive rights. This is not to deny that some states are more involved in this enterprise than others, or that a state’s depth of involvement can vary over time. Still, we live in the age of the interventionist state, and there is no reason to think this will change anytime soon. Thus, for all intents and purposes, political liberalism in this book is synonymous with progressive liberalism.

关于我对自由主义的定义，还有三点需要补充。首先，有时人们会将另外两种主义归类为自由主义政治意识形态：功利主义和自由理想主义。当然，人们可以自由地将它们视为政治自由主义的变体，但我并不这样认为，因为它们的运作逻辑与权宜之计和进步自由主义截然不同。尤其值得注意的是，功利主义和自由理想主义都不太关注个人权利，而个人权利恰恰是自由主义的核心。功利主义的理论之父杰里米·边沁甚至称自然权利是“修辞上的胡言乱语，是建立在高跷上的胡言乱语”。 12

Three further points about my definition of liberalism are in order. First, two other isms are sometimes categorized as liberal political ideologies: utilitarianism and liberal idealism. One is free to treat them as variants of political liberalism, of course, but I do not, because they operate according to different logics from modus vivendi and progressive liberalism. In particular, neither utilitarianism nor liberal idealism pays much attention to individual rights, which are at the heart of liberalism. Jeremy Bentham, the intellectual father of utilitarianism, called natural rights “rhetorical nonsense, nonsense upon stilts.”12

E·H·卡尔的著名著作《二十年危机》写于20世纪30年代末，被广泛认为是批判自由主义在国际政治领域应用的经典之作。 13事实上，他的批判对象并非我在此讨论的那种基于权利的自由主义。卡尔对当时并不受推崇的“权宜之计”或“进步自由主义”都漠不关心。相反，他直指自由主义的理想主义和功利主义，这两种思潮在20世纪30年代的英国更具影响力。 14 因此，卡尔和我谈论自由主义时所指的含义并不相同，我们的批判也鲜有重叠之处。

E. H. Carr’s famous book The Twenty Years’ Crisis, written in the late 1930s, is widely considered a classic critique of liberalism as it applies to international politics.13 In fact, his target is not rights-based liberalism of the sort I discuss here. Carr cares little about either modus vivendi or progressive liberalism, which at the time were not highly regarded isms. Instead he takes dead aim at liberal idealism and utilitarianism, which were much more influential in 1930s Britain.14 Carr and I thus mean different things when we talk about liberalism, and there is not much overlap in our critiques.

这并非意味着自由主义理想主义和功利主义不重要，或者它们对于理解国际生活毫无用处。系统。但它们与政治自由主义是不同的理论，评估它们与国家行为的相关性需要单独研究。

None of this is to say that liberal idealism and utilitarianism are unimportant or that they are useless for understanding life in the international system. But they are different theories from political liberalism, and assessing their relevance to state behavior would require a separate study.

其次，自由主义和民主这两个术语经常被混用，或者在“自由民主”一词中联系在一起。但这两个概念并不相同，区分它们并解释它们之间的关系至关重要。我将民主定义为一种拥有广泛选举权的政府形式，公民可以通过定期选举选出自己的领导人。这些领导人随后制定并实施治理国家的规则。另一方面，自由主义的核心在于个人权利。一个自由主义国家重视公民的权利，并通过法律保护这些权利。

Second, the terms liberalism and democracy are often used interchangeably, or linked together in the phrase “liberal democracy.” But the two concepts are not the same, and it is important to distinguish between them and explain how they relate to each other. I define democracy as a form of government with a broad franchise in which citizens get to choose their leaders in periodic elections. Those leaders then write and implement the rules that govern the polity. Liberalism, on the other hand, is all about individual rights. A liberal state privileges the rights of its citizens and protects them through its laws.

有可能出现一种非自由民主政体，在这种政体中，当选的多数派践踏少数派的权利。这种情况有时被称为多数人的暴政，而且我们确实可以指出现实世界中的例子。然而，奉行自由主义的国家几乎也都是民主国家，因为不可剥夺权利的概念明确地包含了通过选举参与自身治理的权利。马库斯·费舍尔对此阐述得非常精辟：“自由主义与民主之间的关系是不对称的：自由主义在很大程度上意味着民主制度，而民主只在极小的程度上包含自由权利。” 15

It is possible to have an illiberal democracy in which the elected majority tramples on the rights of the minority. This is sometimes referred to as a tyranny of the majority, and one can certainly point to real-world examples. States that are liberal, however, are almost always democratic as well, because the concept of inalienable rights clearly implies the right to have a voice in one’s own governance through elections. Markus Fischer puts the point well: “The relation between liberalism and democracy is asymmetrical: liberalism implies democratic institutions to a large degree, whereas democracy entails liberal rights only to a minimal extent.”15

然而，有人可能会认为，当少数群体基于权利提出论点，阻碍多数群体的决定时，自由主义国家就是反民主的。虽然这种情况确实时有发生，但我并不认为这种行为是反民主的，因为在这种情况下，最终结果取决于公民民主通过的法律或规则。因此，本书中使用的“自由主义国家”一词指的是自由民主国家。 16

One might argue, however, that liberal states are anti-democratic when minorities make rights-based arguments that obstruct the majority’s decisions. While there is no question this sometimes happens, I do not consider this behavior anti-democratic, because the outcome in such cases is based on laws or rules the citizenry democratically adopted. Thus the term liberal state, as used in this book, means a liberal democracy.16

第三，一些读者可能会将本书视为对自由主义的全面批判，并由此得出结论，认为我对这种政治意识形态抱有敌意。这种看法是错误的。必须区分自由主义在国家内部的运作方式和其在国际体系中的运作方式。我对自由主义在这两个领域的看法截然不同。

Third, some readers might see this book as a sweeping attack on liberalism and conclude I am hostile to that political ideology. That would be wrong. It is essential to distinguish the way liberalism operates inside a country from the way it functions in the international system. My views about liberalism are different for each of these realms.

在国家层面，我相信自由主义是一种真正的向善力量，生活在一个重视并保护个人权利的国家是非常理想的。我尤其庆幸自己出生并生活在自由的美国。然而，在国际层面，自由主义……情况则有所不同。像美国近年来那样奉行雄心勃勃的自由主义外交政策的国家，最终只会让世界变得更加不和平。此外，它们还可能在国内损害自由主义，这种后果应该让每一位自由主义者都感到担忧。

Within countries, I believe liberalism is a genuine force for good, and it is highly desirable to live in a country that privileges and protects individual rights. I consider myself especially fortunate to have been born and lived all my life in liberal America. Liberalism at the international level, however, is a different matter. States that pursue ambitious liberal foreign policies, as the United States has done in recent years, end up making the world less peaceful. Moreover, they risk undermining liberalism at home, an outcome that should strike fear into the heart of every liberal.

路线图

A Road Map

我在第二章详细阐述了我对人性与政治的看法。在这一章中，我提出了我的基本政治理论，我将在后续章节中运用该理论来分析自由主义、民族主义和现实主义。在第三章中，我描述了政治自由主义，仔细考察了权宜之计与进步自由主义之间的异同，并解释了为什么当今的政治自由主义在很大程度上是进步自由主义。我还简要地探讨了功利主义和自由主义理想，并解释了为什么我不认为它们是自由主义理论。

My views on human nature and politics are developed at length in chapter 2. There I lay out my basic theory of politics, which I will use in subsequent chapters to analyze liberalism, nationalism, and realism. In chapter 3, I describe political liberalism, paying careful attention to the similarities and differences between modus vivendi and progressive liberalism, and explain why political liberalism today is largely progressive liberalism. I also briefly consider utilitarianism and liberal idealism and explain why I do not consider them liberal theories.

在第四章中，我将探讨政治自由主义的关键问题。我会考察自由主义与民族主义之间的关系，以及自由主义关于普世权利主张的局限性。至此，我几乎没有涉及自由主义与国际政治的关系。本书前半部分的目的仅仅在于理解自由主义的本质。

In chapter 4, I take up the key problems with political liberalism. I examine the relationship between liberalism and nationalism, as well as the limits of liberal claims about universal rights. By this point I will have paid hardly any attention to how liberalism relates to international politics. My aim in the first half of the book is simply to understand what liberalism is about.

在第五章中，我开始着重探讨自由主义如何影响国际体系，并详细考察了自由主义与现实主义之间的关系。我的核心论点是，即使在极少数情况下，当国家有能力采取自由主义霸权时，通常也会导致外交失败和战争失败。我还解释了民族主义和现实主义——而非自由主义——才是造成现代国际体系几乎完全由民族国家构成的根本原因。最后，我评估了世界国家出现的可能性，如果世界国家出现，将会深刻改变自由主义在国际政治中的意义。

I begin zeroing in on how liberalism affects the international system in chapter 5, where I consider in detail the relationship between liberalism and realism. My central argument is that on the rare occasions when states are in a position to adopt liberal hegemony, it usually leads to failed diplomacy and failed wars. I also explain how nationalism and realism—not liberalism—are largely responsible for creating a modern international system that is almost wholly populated with nation-states. Finally, I assess the likelihood of a world state, which, if it materialized, would profoundly change the relevance of liberalism for international politics.

第六章的核心论点是，一个追求自由霸权的国家不仅注定失败，而且还会为此付出巨大的代价。这类国家最终往往陷入无休止的战争，而这些战争非但没有减少国际冲突，反而加剧了冲突。我还阐述了这种自由主义军国主义通常如何给目标国造成巨大损失，同时又如何危及国内的自由主义。

The core argument in chapter 6 is that a state pursuing liberal hegemony does not simply court failure, it suffers significant costs in doing so. Such states invariably end up fighting endless wars, which serve to increase rather than reduce international conflict. I also describe how this liberal militarism usually ends up inflicting huge costs on the target state while endangering liberalism at home.

我在第七章中论证，即便自由主义外交政策实现了其主要目标——广泛传播自由民主、建立开放的世界经济以及构建众多卓有成效的国际机构——也并不会因此带来一个更加和平的世界。安全竞争依然存在，并伴有严重的战争隐患。原因在于，支撑自由主义霸权将彻底改变国际政治格局的三大理论——民主和平理论、经济相互依存理论和自由制度主义——均存在根本缺陷。我在第八章中总结了对美国外交政策未来走向的一些看法。我评估了美国放弃自由主义霸权、转而采取基于现实主义的更为克制的外交政策的可能性，同时也认识到民族主义极大地限制了大国直接干预他国政治的能力。此外，我还谨慎地分析了特朗普总统在其白宫任期内可能对美国外交政策产生的影响。

I make the case in chapter 7 that even if a liberal foreign policy were to achieve its principal goals—spreading liberal democracy widely, creating an open world economy, and building lots of impressive international institutions—that would not lead to a more peaceful world. There would still be security competition with serious potential for war. The reason is that each of the three theories underpinning the expectation that liberal hegemony will radically transform international politics—democratic peace theory, economic interdependence theory, and liberal institutionalism—has fundamental flaws. I conclude in chapter 8 with some observations about the future trajectory of American foreign policy. I assess the prospects that the United States will abandon liberal hegemony and adopt a more restrained foreign policy based on realism, coupled with recognition of the fact that nationalism sharply limits the ability of great powers to directly intervene in the politics of other states. I also offer some cautious observations on President Trump’s likely effect on American foreign policy during his tenure in the White House.

总而言之，第二章对人性的探讨侧重于个体的特征；第三章和第四章对政治自由主义的分析集中于它与一国国内政治的关系；第五章至第八章则探讨了这种主义与国际政治的关系。当然，这一基本框架反映了国际关系研究者最终都关注的三个分析层面——个体、单元和系统。 17

To sum up, the discussion about human nature in chapter 2 focuses on the traits of individuals, the analysis of political liberalism in chapters 3 and 4 concentrates on how it relates to a country’s domestic politics, and the discussion in chapters 5–8 concerns how that ism relates to international politics. This basic template, of course, reflects the three levels of analysis—individual, unit, and system—that ultimately concern all students of international relations.17

2

2

人性与政治

Human Nature and Politics

关于人性的信念是政治理论论证的基石，自由主义也不例外。其核心主张基于一系列关于人性的假设，即所有人共有的特质，而非个体差异。因此，要评估自由主义，我们首先必须描述它对人性的论述，并判断这些论述是否与我们对人类状况的认知相符。

BELIEFS ABOUT HUMAN NATURE ARE the building blocks of theoretical arguments in politics, and liberalism is no exception. Its core claims are based on a set of assumptions about human nature, meaning those attributes that are common to all people, as opposed to those that vary among individuals. Thus, to assess liberalism, we must first describe what it says about human nature and determine whether those claims square with what we know about the human condition.

法国保守派思想家约瑟夫·德·迈斯特认为：“世上根本没有‘人’这种东西。我一生中见过法国人、意大利人、俄罗斯人等等；多亏了孟德斯鸠，我甚至知道有人是波斯人。但至于‘人’，我断言我一生从未见过；如果他存在，我也不认识他。” ¹当然，民族之间以及人与人之间存在着重要的差异，这些差异正是本书论证的核心。然而，几乎每个人都具有某些永恒且独特的特征，这些特征可以为一个简单的政治理论提供微观基础，进而可以用来评估自由主义及其与民族主义和现实主义的关系。本章的主要目的是阐述我对人性与政治的思考。

The conservative French thinker Joseph de Maistre maintained that “there is no such thing as man in the world. In my lifetime I have seen Frenchmen, Italians, Russians, etc.; thanks to Montesquieu, I even know that one can be Persian. But as for man, I declare that I have never in my life met him; if he exists, he is unknown to me.”1 Of course, there are important differences among peoples as well as people, and those differences are central to the arguments in this book. Yet certain features are permanent and distinctive in almost every person, and these can provide the microfoundations for a simple theory of politics that can then be employed to evaluate liberalism and its relationship to nationalism and realism. My main aim in this chapter is to present my own thinking about human nature and politics.

我首先提出两个简单的假设，第一个假设与我们的批判性思维能力有关。毫无疑问，人类拥有令人印象深刻的推理能力。然而，这种能力也存在显著的局限性，尤其是在回答关于美好生活本质等关键问题时。

I begin with two simple assumptions, the first of which concerns our critical faculties. There is no question humans have an impressive capacity to reason. Still, this capacity has significant limits, especially when it comes to answering essential questions about what constitutes the good life.

几乎所有人都认同生存是个人最重要的目标，因为没有生存，就无法追求其他任何目标。但除此之外，对于所有社会都面临的、对日常生活有着深远影响的重要伦理、道德和政治问题的答案，往往存在着难以调和的分歧。这些基于基本原则的分歧有时会变得异常激烈，甚至可能引发致命的冲突。这种潜藏的暴力可能性，导致人们彼此恐惧，担忧自身生存，这种可能性不仅存在于个体之间，也存在于社会之间。

Almost everyone agrees that survival is the most important individual goal, because without it you cannot pursue any other goal. But beyond that, there is often intractable disagreement about the answers to the important ethical, moral, and political questions that all societies confront, and which have profound implications for daily life. Those differences over first principles sometimes become so passionate that they create the potential for deadly conflict. That lurking possibility of violence, which leads individuals to fear each other and worry about their survival, applies to relations among societies as well as among individuals.

我的第二个假设是，人类是高度社会化的动物。他们并非孤狼，而是生于社会群体或社会之中，这些群体或社会在他们能够展现个人主义之前就塑造了他们的身份认同。此外，个体通常会对自己的群体产生强烈的依恋，有时甚至愿意为群体成员做出巨大的牺牲。人们常说，人类的本质是部落性的。我们具有社会性的主要原因在于，对个人而言，生存的最佳方式是融入社会，与群体成员合作，而不是单打独斗。这并非否认个体有时出于自私的目的而利用其他群体成员。然而，总的来说，合作胜于自私的行为。社会群体是生存的保障。

My second assumption is that humans are profoundly social beings. They do not operate as lone wolves but are born into social groups or societies that shape their identities well before they can assert their individualism. Moreover, individuals usually develop strong attachments to their group and are sometimes willing to make great sacrifices for their fellow members. Humans are often said to be tribal at their core. The main reason for our social nature is that the best way for a person to survive is to be embedded in a society and to cooperate with fellow members rather than act alone. This is not to deny that individuals sometimes have good reasons to act selfishly and take advantage of other group members. On balance, however, cooperation trumps selfish behavior. Social groups are survival vehicles.2

人们或许会疑惑，既然人们在基本信仰上都难以达成共识，社会又如何能够正常运转？我的两个核心假设之间无疑存在着张力，这既解释了为什么社会群体有时会分崩离析，也解释了为什么过去从未有过、将来也可能永远不会有统一的全球社会。然而，人类显然有能力在社会群体中长期共同生活，因为自人类出现以来，地球上就一直存在着这样的群体。

One might wonder how it is possible to have a functioning society when it is so difficult for individuals to agree about fundamental beliefs. There is unquestionably a tension between my two core assumptions, which is why social groups sometimes break apart and also why there never has been and probably never will be a unified global society. Nevertheless, people are obviously capable of living together in social groups for sustained periods, as the planet has been populated with them since human beings first appeared.

一个社会要想维系下去，其成员对美好生活的理解必须有相当大的共识，而且当不可避免地出现严重分歧时，他们必须互相尊重。尽管存在这些差异，但一个社会群体内部仍有可能就基本原则达成相当程度的共识，这主要是因为成员们共享一种共同的文化，这种文化包含了对终极价值的各种信仰。大多数人自出生起就被社会化，被教导要崇敬自己的文化，这这意味着从小接受社会化教育，尊重某些核心原则。文化就像粘合剂，将社会中的个体凝聚在一起。

For a society to hold together, there must be substantial overlap in how its members think about the good life, and they must respect each other when, inevitably, serious disagreements arise. These differences notwithstanding, it is possible within a social group to have considerable agreement about first principles, mainly because the members share a common culture, which includes a variety of beliefs about ultimate values. Most people have been socialized since birth to venerate their culture, which means being socialized to respect certain core principles. Culture is a kind of glue that helps hold individuals together inside a society.

但仅靠文化是不够的。为了维持社会的完整，一个社会还必须拥有规范群体内部行为的政治制度。它需要制定规则来明确群体成员应如何共同生活，以及执行这些规则的手段。这通常表现为基于所谓“法治”的司法体系。社会群体也需要政治制度来帮助它们在面对其他群体的威胁时生存下来。这些制度必须控制暴力手段，既要维护社会内部的规则，又要保护社会免受外部威胁。

But culture alone is not enough. To stay intact, a society also must have political institutions that govern behavior within the group. It needs rules that stipulate how the group’s members are expected to live together, as well as the means to enforce those rules. This commonly takes the form of a juridical system based on what has become known as “the rule of law.” Social groups also need political institutions to help them survive in the face of threats from other groups. These institutions must control the means of violence both to enforce the rules within the society and to protect it from external threats.

政治制度的出现催生了政治，而政治对于任何社会的日常生活都至关重要。政治的本质在于谁有权制定管理群体的规则。这项责任至关重要，因为任何社会的成员都必然存在利益冲突，他们永远无法在基本原则上达成完全一致。鉴于这一基本事实，任何一方制定和解释规则，都可以根据自身利益而非竞争对手的利益，或者反映自身而非竞争对手的社会愿景。当然，权力在决定哪一方最终胜出方面起着至关重要的作用。个人或派系拥有的资源越多，就越有可能掌控治理机构。简而言之，在一个理性作用有限的世界里，权力平衡通常决定着谁有权制定和执行规则。

With political institutions comes politics, which is crucial to daily life in any society. Politics is essentially about who gets to write the rules that govern the group. This responsibility matters greatly because the members of any society are certain to have some conflicting interests, as they will never completely agree about first principles. Given that basic fact of life, whichever faction writes and interprets the rules can do so in ways that serve its interests rather than its rivals’, or reflect its vision of society rather than its rivals’. Of course, power matters greatly in determining which faction wins this competition. The more resources an individual or faction possesses, the more likely it is to control the governing institutions. In short, in a world where reason takes you only so far, the balance of power usually decides who gets to write and enforce the rules.

鉴于政治对于社会群体运作的绝对必要性，当我说人类天生是社会性动物时，实际上也是在说他们同时也是政治性动物。这显然包括狩猎采集者，他们有时被错误地描绘成在霍布斯式的世界中孤立生存。事实上，他们生活在小群体中，在这些群体中，权力、规则和派系——也就是政治——是不可避免的。人类生存状态的政治和社会维度密不可分。关于何为美好生活的问题，从根本上来说，既关乎政治，也关乎社会。虽然我在本书中频繁使用“社会群体”一词，但它实际上是社会政治群体的简称。

Given the absolute necessity of politics for the functioning of social groups, when I say that humans are naturally social beings, I am in effect saying they are also political beings. This obviously includes hunter-gatherers, who are sometimes wrongly portrayed as operating alone in a Hobbesian world. In fact, they lived together in small groups in which power, rules, and factions—that is, politics—were unavoidable. The political and social dimensions of the human condition go hand in hand. Questions about what constitutes the good life are axiomatically about political as well as social matters. Although I frequently use the term social group in this book, it is shorthand for what is effectively a sociopolitical group.

政治在自治社会群体之间的关系中至关重要。然而，并没有任何更高层级的政治机构能够撰写……并能可靠地执行规范彼此行为的规则。因此，在社会内部至关重要的规则制定权，在群体间层面则显得不那么重要。然而，权力本身在群体间的交往中仍然至关重要，因为拥有优势权力能让一个群体在与其他群体发生冲突时占据上风。更重要的是，它能让一个群体抵御来自其他群体的生存威胁。因此，独立的社会群体之间会为了权力而相互竞争。群体间的政治本质上就是争夺相对权力。

Politics is vitally important in the relations between self-governing social groups. There are no higher political institutions, however, that can write and reliably enforce rules that might govern their behavior toward each other. The power to write rules, which matters so much inside a society, thus matters much less at the intergroup level. Still, power itself matters greatly in dealings among groups, because possessing superior power allows a group to get its way when it is at odds with another group. Above all else, it allows a group to fend off threats to its survival from other groups. Independent social groups thus compete with each other for power. Politics among groups is all about gaining relative power.

社会群体具有扩张的倾向，因为规模越大，通常相对于竞争对手的力量就越强，从而提高生存几率。群体扩张也可能出于其他原因。例如，他们可能认为自己找到了真正的宗教或政治理念，于是发起一场运动，将他们珍视的蓝图传播到其他社会。群体扩张的主要方式是征服其他群体，尽管有时拥有共同利益的群体也会自愿联合。征服者通常会试图控制战败群体，剥夺其自主权，或者将其纳入自己的社会。有时，他们甚至会试图消灭战败群体。任何群体的扩张都存在极限，因为潜在的受害者几乎总是有强大的动机进行抵抗，以确保自身生存。

Social groups have a propensity to expand, because greater size usually augments their power relative to rival groups and thus enhances their prospects for survival. Groups can also be bent on expansion for other reasons. They might believe, for example, that they have found the true religion or political ideology, and go on a crusade to export their prized blueprint to other societies. Groups mainly expand by conquering other groups, although occasionally groups with common interests join together voluntarily. Conquerors usually try either to dominate the vanquished group and rob it of its autonomy or else absorb it into its own society. Sometimes they try to wipe out the defeated group. There are limits as to how far any group can expand because the potential victims almost always have powerful incentives to resist and ensure their own survival.

总之，我首先提出两个关于人性的简单假设：我们推理基本原理的能力存在显著局限性，而且我们本质上是社会性动物。这两个假设共同揭示了关于世界的三个重要事实。首先，世界由众多社会群体组成，每个群体都有其独特的文化。没有理由认为这种情况在不久的将来或遥远的未来会发生改变。实际上，人类的关键普遍特征使我们身处一个以其特殊性而著称的世界。

In sum, I begin with two simple assumptions about human nature: there are significant limits on our ability to reason about first principles, and we are social animals at our core. Taken together, these assumptions tell us three important facts about the world. First, it is populated with a great number of social groups, each with its own distinctive culture. There is no reason to think that situation will change in the near or distant future. In effect, the crucial universal traits of humankind lead us to a world distinguished by its particularism.

第二，社会群体别无选择，只能建立政治制度，这意味着政治和权力是社会内部以及社会群体之间生活的核心。第三，生存对个人和社会群体都至关重要，它贯穿人类历史，如同一条红色的主线。

Second, social groups have no choice but to build political institutions, which means politics and power are at the center of life within societies as well as among them. Third, survival is of overriding importance for individuals as well as social groups. It runs like a red skein through human history.

在详细考察我的论点的主要组成部分之前，我需要定义一些重要的概念。

Before examining the main components of my argument in detail, I need to define some important concepts.

关键定义

Key Definitions

接下来的讨论大多围绕五个基本概念展开：文化、群体、身份认同、政治制度和社会。其中至少有两个概念——文化和身份认同——难以界定，主要是因为它们涵盖范围太广。不出所料，这些术语在学术文献和公共话语中都有不同的用法。因此，尽可能精确地解释我如何使用它们至关重要。

Much of the subsequent discussion revolves around five basic concepts: culture, groups, identity, political institutions, and society. At least two of them—culture and identity—are difficult to define, mainly because they are so sweeping. Not surprisingly, those terms are employed in various ways in both the scholarly literature and public discourse. Thus it is essential to explain as precisely as possible how I am using them.

需要指出的是，这些概念紧密相连，难以区分。例如，有人可能会认为文化、身份和社会构成了一个密不可分的整体。它们之间确实存在重叠。尽管如此，我还是力求对每个概念进行细致的定义，并阐明它们之间的相互关系，希望这能使我的核心论点更容易被理解。

I should note that these concepts are closely linked and hard to disentangle. For example, one might argue that culture, identity, and society are all part of a seamless web. They certainly overlap. Still, I have tried to define each one carefully and show how they relate to each other, in the hope that this will make my core arguments easier to understand.

社会是指一群人以有组织、有规律的方式持续互动的群体。社会成员相互依存，因此有些人会将“社会”和“社群”这两个词互换使用。所有社会都有其独特的文化，并且通常占据特定的地域。许多社会是主权政治实体，这意味着它们在很大程度上掌控着自身的命运。然而，有些社会并非主权实体，而是更大政治秩序的一部分。

A society is a large group of people who interact with each other on a continual basis in organized and routine ways. The members of a society are interdependent, leading some people to use the words society and community interchangeably. All societies have their own discrete culture, and they usually occupy a particular piece of territory. Many are sovereign political entities, which means they largely control their own destiny. Some societies, however, are not sovereign but are part of a larger political order.

文化赋予构成任何社会本质的关系模式以意义。文化唯有存在于社会语境中才能存在。在我看来，文化是构成社会核心的一系列共享实践和信仰。这些实践包括习俗和仪式、服饰、饮食、音乐、日常作息、符号以及人们所使用的语言。它们还包括人们互动和应对日常生活的微妙姿态、举止和交流方式。法国社会学家皮埃尔·布迪厄将这些称为“习性”。另一方面，一个社会的信仰——包括其政治和社会价值观、道德和宗教观念以及历史叙事——则明确地关乎基本原则。它们指导着一个特定社会如何界定美好生活。文化还包括反映这些实践和信仰的公民机构，例如教堂和足球场。

Culture gives meaning to the patterns of relationships that are the essence of any society. Cultures exist only in the context of societies. In my vocabulary, culture is the set of shared practices and beliefs that are at a society’s heart. Those practices include customs and rituals, dress, food, music, routines, symbols, and the language people speak. They also include the subtle gestures, mannerisms, and communications by which people interact and make their way through daily life. The French sociologist Pierre Bourdieu called these a “habitus.”3 A society’s beliefs, on the other hand—consisting of its political and social values, views about morality and religion, and stories about its history—deal explicitly with first principles. They guide how a particular society decides what constitutes the good life. Culture also includes the civil institutions, like churches and soccer stadiums, that reflect those practices and beliefs.

文化赋予每个社会独特的特征，使其与其他社会区分开来。然而，有时某些特征在不同社会之间是共通的。文化之间存在差异，尽管它们之间永远不会完全重合。文化之所以独特，是因为世界各地的人们拥有极其不同的生活经历和历史。换句话说，环境对人类行为有着深远的影响。然而，人们也拥有自主性；他们具备批判性思维能力，可以决定如何最好地生活。但是，不同社会的人们对基本原则往往会得出不同的结论，这也是文化差异的另一个原因。当然，这并非否认文化会发展和变化，有时甚至是剧烈的变化。历史不断向前推进，带来新的环境和新的思想，而不同的文化对此会做出不同的反应。

Culture gives every society distinct characteristics that separate it from other societies. Sometimes, however, particular features are shared across cultures, although there is never a complete overlap. The reason cultures are distinct is that peoples around the world have remarkably diverse life experiences and histories. The environment, in other words, heavily shapes human behavior. Yet people also have agency; they possess critical faculties with which to determine how best to lead their lives. But people in different societies often come to different conclusions about first principles, which is another reason for variation among cultures. None of this is to deny that cultures evolve and change, sometimes drastically. History marches on, constantly bringing new circumstances and new ideas, to which different cultures respond in different ways.

当西方精英谈论“全球社会”或“人类社会”时，其隐含的意思是全球文化差异已经显著缩小。诚然，工业革命、全球化以及英美两国的全球影响力在过去两个世纪确实产生了一定的文化趋同效应，但这并未催生出全球社会所必需的普世文化。麦当劳和星巴克的普及以及众多世界精英能够说英语，远不足以代表文化的同质化。世界上存在着丰富多彩的文化，它们支撑着形形色色的社会。异质性而非同质性，才是全球文化的主流特征。因此，“全球社会”和“人类社会”这两个术语并不恰当。

When Western elites talk about “global society” or “human society,” the implication is that there has been a profound leveling of cultural differences across the planet. While there is no question that the Industrial Revolution, globalization, and the worldwide influence of Britain and the United States have had something of a leveling effect over the past two centuries, they have not led to anything like the universal culture that is a prerequisite for a global society. The proliferation of McDonald’s and Starbucks and the ability of so many of the world’s elites to speak English hardly amount to cultural sameness. There is an abundance of distinct cultures in the world, and they underpin a wide variety of societies. Heterogeneity, not homogeneity, is the prevailing state of global culture. Thus, global society and human society are not useful terms.

群体是指一群经常互动、具有同志情谊、拥有许多共同理念并怀有共同目标的个体。虽然社会显然符合群体的定义，但这个概念具有足够的弹性，可以涵盖各种类型的群体。然而，本书的重点在于拥有自身政治机构的大型社会群体。在本书中，“群体”与“社会”是同义词。

A group is a collection of individuals who regularly interact with each other, have a sense of comradeship, share many of the same ideas, and have a common purpose. Although a society obviously qualifies as a group, the concept is elastic enough to include all sorts of clusters of people. My focus, however, is on large social groups that have their own political institutions. As it is used in this book, group is synonymous with society.

身份认同是一个深刻的社会概念，它涉及个人或群体的自我意识。我是谁？我们是谁？身份认同很大程度上是与“他者”相关的。在个体层面，它涉及一个人如何看待自己与其他个体或群体之间的关系。当然，这可能涉及多种身份认同，因为一个人可以属于多个群体。我在这里关注的是社会中的个体如何相互联系。可以肯定的是，个体的身份认同深受其所在社会的影响。文化之所以重要，是因为它提供了一套所有成员都必须每日遵循的实践和信仰，并鼓励成员将彼此视为相似。然而，每个成员的身份认同都必然会受到与他人重要差异的影响。任何社会中的个体都拥有不同的能力和偏好，并且可以加入各种不同的群体，这些都会影响他们如何看待自身与他人的关系。一个人的身份认同并非如此简单。

Identity is a profoundly social concept that involves a person’s or group’s sense of self. Who am I? Or who are we?4 Identity is largely defined in relation to the “other.” At the individual level, it involves how a person thinks about himself in relation to other individuals or groups. This can involve multiple identities, of course, because people can belong to multiple groups. My focus here is on how individuals within a society relate to each other. For sure, an individual’s identity is deeply influenced by his society’s culture, because it provides a set of practices and beliefs that all members must relate to daily, and encourages members to think of themselves as similar. Nevertheless, each member’s identity will invariably be shaped by important differences with others. Individuals in any society have different abilities and preferences and can affiliate with a host of different groups, and these things influence how they think about themselves in relation to others. A person’s identity is not defined simply.

那么社会本身呢？任何大型群体对自身的认知都取决于其实践和信仰如何使其与其他社会区分开来。换言之，一个社会的文化与其身份认同密不可分。本书将重点关注国家——地球上占主导地位的社会群体——以及民族认同的概念。在现代社会，个人的身份认同深受其国家文化的影响，但并非完全由其塑造。

What about societies themselves? Any large group’s sense of itself depends on how its practices and beliefs distinguish it from other societies. In other words, a society’s culture and its identity are inextricably bound up with each other. In this book I pay particular attention to nations, the dominant social group on the planet, and to the concept of national identity. An individual’s identity in the modern world is heavily influenced, but not completely shaped, by her nation’s culture.

最后，政治机构是制定规则以规范日常生活和维护秩序的治理机构。尽管它们在不同层面运作，但任何社会都必须存在一个凌驾于一切之上的政治权威。任何社会都无法在没有有效政治机构的情况下长期生存。当然，在文字出现之前的社会，习俗和规范取代了成文规则和正式的治理机构。然而，本书的重点在于更现代的社会。

Finally, political institutions are the governing bodies that create rules to regulate daily life and maintain order. Though they operate at different levels, within any society there must be an overarching political authority. No society could survive for long without effective political institutions. Of course, in preliterate societies, customary practices and norms take the place of written rules and formal governing institutions.5 My focus in this book, however, is on more modern societies.

现在让我谈谈我对人性的主要假设。

Let me now turn to my key assumptions about human nature.

理性的局限与美好生活

The Limits of Reason and the Good Life

人类拥有推理或批判性思考的能力，这种能力使人类区别于其他所有动物，并使他们得以主宰地球。它也使人类能够建立起一套令人叹为观止的理论体系，解释世界的运行规律。然而，我们的推理能力也存在着显著的局限性，这对社会和政治生活有着重要的影响。其中一个局限性在于，我们无法就何为美好生活达成共识，这有时会导致个人和社会群体彼此仇恨，甚至试图伤害他人，而这反过来又会使其他人担忧自身的生存。

Humans have the capability to reason or think critically, a faculty that distinguishes them from all other animals and has allowed them to dominate the planet. It has also allowed them to establish an impressive body of theories about how the world works. Yet there are significant limits on our ability to reason, which have important consequences for social and political life. One such limitation, our inability to agree about what constitutes the good life, sometimes leads individuals as well as social groups to hate and try to hurt others, which in turn causes the others to worry about their survival.

区分我们的偏好和实现这些偏好的最佳策略至关重要。这种区别体现在以下两点中。问题。首先，我们的偏好是否理性？这些目标是为了促进我们的生存，还是另有其他意义？其次，我们是否采取了策略来实现这些目标？这两种理性有时分别被称为实质理性和工具理性。我主要关注实质理性，因为它对理解政治更为重要。然而，工具理性在我的论述中也同样重要，因为它与政府有效实施社会工程的能力直接相关。当然，在这个问题上，目前还没有共识。

It is important to distinguish between our preferences and the best strategies for achieving them. This difference is reflected in the following two questions. First, are our preferences rational, and do those goals promote our survival or make some other kind of sense? Second, are we acting strategically to achieve our goals? These two kinds of rationality are sometimes referred to as substantive and instrumental rationality, respectively. My main concern is with substantive rationality, which is more important for understanding politics. Yet instrumental rationality also matters in my story, because it is directly tied to the ability of governments to effectively perform social engineering. There is certainly no consensus on that issue.

就我们的偏好而言，关键问题是：理性能告诉我们关于美好生活的一切？它对我们应该如何行事、如何安排生活、社会应该如何组织以及社会成员的行为准则有何指导？我们的批判能力能告诉我们关于所有个人和社会都面临的根本性伦理、道德和政治问题有何启示？我们如何区分对错？所有这些问题都关乎基本原则：指导我们思考和行动的根本准则。

In terms of our preferences, the key questions are: What can reason tell us about the good life? What does it say about how we should behave and arrange our lives, how a society should be organized, and what rules should govern its members’ conduct? What can our critical faculties tell us about the bedrock ethical, moral, and political questions that confront all individuals and societies? How do we distinguish between right and wrong? All of these questions deal with first principles: the essential guidance for how we think and act.

更具体地说，理性告诉我们，究竟哪种宗教（如果有的话）才是指导我们日常生活的真正指南？我们能否通过理性找到理想的政治制度？我们的批判能力能否解决关于堕胎、平权行动或死刑的争论？它能否化解个人权利之间的冲突，例如言论自由与隐私权之间的冲突？理性告诉我们，是否应该区别对待外来者和本社会成员，以及何时可以对其他国家发动战争？这些只是众多与社会组织方式及其成员行为相关的问题中的几个例子。

To put the questions in more concrete terms: What does reason tell us about which religion, if any, provides the true guide to how we should lead our daily lives? Can we reason our way to the ideal political system? Can our critical faculties resolve debates about abortion, affirmative action, or capital punishment? Can they settle conflicts between individual rights, such as when one person’s freedom of speech clashes with another’s right to privacy? What does reason say about whether we should treat outsiders differently from members of our own society, or when it is permissible to make war on other countries? These are just a few of the many questions related to how societies should be organized and how their members should behave.

因为我们是高度社会化的物种，所以我们无法回避这类问题。我们别无选择，只能努力探寻如何彼此共处，并发展出对共同利益的认同感，即便这一过程最终可能无法达成持久的共识。列奥·施特劳斯曾写道：“一切政治行动本身都指向对善的认识：对美好生活的认识，或对美好社会的认识。” 这句话虽略有夸张，但也并非全然夸张。有时，人们几乎没有机会就关键问题表达自己的观点；有时，他们甚至试图回避这些问题。但每个社会都必须以某种方式面对这些问题。

Because we are an intensely social species, we cannot avoid wrestling with such questions. We have little choice but to try to figure out how to live with each other and develop a shared sense of the common good, even if that process never leads to a lasting consensus. Leo Strauss exaggerated only slightly when he wrote, “All political action has then in itself a directedness towards knowledge of the good: of the good life, or of the good society.”6 Sometimes people have little opportunity to express their views on pivotal questions, and sometimes they try to avoid dealing with them. But every society must address them in some fashion.

以制定一套指导个人行为的道德原则为例。任何社会群体若缺乏对何为道德行为的广泛共识，都无法有效运作。任何社会中促进合作的规则都根植于其道德准则。即使是世界顶尖法学家之一、并不赞成以道德原则作为法律判决依据的理查德·波斯纳法官，也承认道德“是社会生活中普遍存在的特征，也是许多法律原则的基石”。 7

Take, for example, the matter of devising a body of moral principles to guide individual behavior. No social group can function effectively without widespread agreement on what constitutes moral behavior. The rules that facilitate cooperation in any society are rooted in its moral code. Even Judge Richard Posner, one of the world’s leading legal theorists and no fan of basing legal decisions on moral principles, acknowledges that morality “is a pervasive feature of social life and is in the background of many legal principles.”7

“理性统治世界”

“Reason Rules the World”

许多人相信存在一套客观的基本原则，几乎每个人都能理解。8换句话说，理性赋予人类能力，使其能够大致理解美好生活的构成要素。如果我们中的一些人难以独自理解这一点，我们可以与他人交流，以澄清我们的想法。这种假设认为，理性重视事实和逻辑，并且很少受到可能干扰系统性思维的文化或社会因素的影响，因此几乎每个人都能得出相同的真理。9

Many people believe there is an objective set of first principles that almost every individual can ascertain.8 In other words, reason gives humans the capacity to figure out, in broad outline, what constitutes the good life. If some of us have difficulty figuring this out on our own, we can engage with others to clarify our thinking. The assumption is that reason, because it privileges facts and logic and is little influenced by cultural or social forces that might interfere with systematic thinking, leads nearly everyone toward the same truths.9

在启蒙运动时期，理性信仰尤为盛行。启蒙运动是欧洲历史上从大约1650年到1800年的一段时期，有时也被称为理性时代。当时许多欧洲知识分子对新教改革后旷日持久的宗教战争感到震惊，他们希望相信宗教的力量正在衰落，而科学和教育的发展将为人们提供认识美好生活真谛的工具。理性的力量终将战胜信仰，并解决当时许多宗教无法解答的重大问题。人们认为，关于美好生活的客观真理是可能的。

Faith in reason was especially pronounced during the Enlightenment, the era in European history from roughly 1650 to 1800 that is sometimes called the Age of Reason.10 Many European intellectuals at the time, horrified by the long religious wars that ensued from the Protestant Reformation, wanted to believe that religion was a fading force and that the growth of science and education would provide people with the tools to recognize the essential truths about the good life. The power of reason would triumph over faith and settle many of the great questions of the day that religion had been unable to answer. Objective truth about the good life was thought to be possible.

法国哲学家尼古拉·德·孔多塞在其1794年出版的《人类心灵历史图景草图》一书中，捕捉到了这种乐观的观点。他写道，他的目标“是通过推理和事实表明，人类能力的提升没有界限；人类的完善性是绝对无限的；这种完善性的进步……除了自然赋予我们的地球的寿命之外，没有任何其他限制。” 11英国哲学家威廉·戈德温甚至在1793年提出“人是可以完善的”，并认为我们对正义的理解最终会发展到如此高度，以至于不再需要政府。 12大多数启蒙思想家的观点都较为谦逊，但几乎所有人都相信人类理性有能力显著改善人类的境况。
