但宽容也有其限度。有些人对美好生活的某些方面抱有如此强烈的执念，以至于无法容忍异议。他们无法相信其他世界观也能被真诚地持有——在他们看来，持有这些观点的人一定是故意背离真理，甚至可能是邪恶的。这种不宽容的心态不仅对他们的反对者构成威胁，也对自由社会本身构成威胁。并非所有人都会认同价值多元主义，这一事实引出了自由主义战略的第三个支柱：一个凌驾于社会之上、维护秩序的强大国家。国家非常适合承担这项任务，因为正如马克斯·韦伯的名言所说，它拥有“在特定领土内合法使用武力的垄断权” 。

But tolerance has its limits. Some people feel so passionately about particular aspects of the good life that they cannot abide disagreement. They find it impossible to believe that other worldviews can be held in good faith—the people who hold those views, they imagine, must be deliberately turning away from the truth and are perhaps evil. This intolerant mind-set makes them a threat not just to their antagonists but to liberal society itself. The fact that not everyone will be committed to value pluralism brings us to the third prong in the liberal strategy: a strong state that sits above society and maintains order. The state is well suited for this task because, as Max Weber famously said, it holds a “monopoly of the legitimate use of physical force within a given territory.”8

为了维护秩序，国家承担着三大主要角色。最重要的是，它扮演着守夜人的角色，保护个人权利，防止意见相左的人或派系之间发生致命冲突。借用托马斯·卡莱尔的话来说，自由主义就是“无政府状态加上一个治安官”。9国家还制定规则，界定可接受和不可接受的行为，同时竭力避免侵犯个人权利。这些规则使得个人或群体能够以文明的方式互动，各自追求自己对美好生活的理解。最后，当出现严重争端时，国家扮演着仲裁者的角色，确保冲突不会演变成暴力。10换句话说，国家集规则制定者、仲裁者和守夜人于一身。

The state, to maintain order, assumes three principal roles. Most importantly, it acts as a night watchman that protects individual rights and prevents mortal combat between people or factions with conflicting views. Liberalism, to borrow Thomas Carlyle’s phrase, is “anarchy plus a constable.”9 The state also writes the rules that define acceptable and unacceptable conduct while going to great lengths not to trample on individual rights. These rules allow individuals or groups to interact in civil ways as each pursues its own version of the good life. Finally, the state acts as an arbiter when serious disputes arise, to ensure that conflicts do not lead to violence.10 The state, in other words, functions as rule maker, umpire, and night watchman.

自由主义国家显然承担着比维护国内秩序更多的职能。进步自由主义者希望国家能够促进……为公民提供平等机会，并开展其他形式的社会工程。奉行“权宜之计”的自由主义者肯定会反对，但即便他们大多也认同，国家必须管理经济和制定外交政策。教育、社会保障、住房和劳资关系等诸多其他事务，即使是奉行自由放任主义的政府，如果想要避免经济萧条、混乱和动乱，也需要予以关注。简而言之，现代自由主义离不开强大的国家。

The liberal state obviously performs more functions than those aimed at keeping domestic order. Progressive liberals want the state to promote equal opportunity for its citizens and engage in other forms of social engineering as well. Modus vivendi liberals would surely object, but even they mostly agree that the state has to manage its economy and conduct foreign policy. A host of other matters, such as education, social security, housing, and labor relations, also require the attention of even a laissez-faire government, if it hopes to avoid economic depression, chaos, and unrest. In short, modern liberalism cannot work without a strong state.

然而，各种政治倾向的自由主义者对国家的角色持有不同的看法。尽管他们知道国家对于维护秩序和促进公民社会繁荣至关重要，但他们也认识到国家拥有践踏个人权利的巨大潜力。正如政治理论家朱迪思·什克拉在一篇关于自由主义的重要文章中所说：“一直以来阻碍自由的恐惧和偏袒，绝大多数都是由政府——无论是正式的还是非正式的——所制造的。虽然社会压迫的根源确实很多，但没有哪个因素比那些作为现代国家代理人的人更具致命性，因为他们拥有独特的武力和说服力。” 11然而，正如典型的自由主义者托马斯·潘恩所写，政府归根结底是一种“必要的恶”。 12

Still, political liberals of all persuasions have mixed views about the state’s role. Although they know the state is essential for preserving order and allowing civil society to flourish, they also recognize its powerful potential to trample on individual rights. As the political theorist Judith Shklar put it in an important essay on liberalism: “The fear and favor that have always inhibited freedom are overwhelmingly generated by governments, both formal and informal. And while the sources of social oppression are indeed numerous, none has the deadly effect of those who, as agents of the modern state, have unique resources of physical might and persuasion at their disposal.”11 Nevertheless, as the quintessential liberal Thomas Paine wrote, government is in the final analysis a “necessary evil.”12

因此，自由主义者寻求限制国家权力的方法。例如，自由主义国家可以建立以权力制衡为基础的政治秩序；或者可以采取联邦制，即中央政府将相当大的权力下放给地方政府。由于自由主义国家通常都是民主国家，因此始终存在多数人压迫少数人的风险。最大限度降低这种风险的一种方法是将明确规定的权利法案写入宪法。

Liberals thus look for ways to limit the state’s power. For example, liberal states can set up a political order built around checks and balances; or they can adopt federalism, where the central government delegates substantial power to regional authorities. Because liberal countries are invariably democracies, there is always the risk that the majority will tyrannize the minority. One way to minimize this danger is to write a clearly articulated bill of rights into the constitution.

必须强调的是，除了作为守夜人之外，自由主义国家力求不去干涉人们的行为在道德上的对错。它鼓励（有时甚至要求）宽容，并致力于保障公民的繁荣与安全。然而，其核心目标是尽可能地允许人们按照自己的原则生活。自由主义与共和主义截然不同，后者强调个人的责任和义务，并倾向于建立一个积极倡导公民美德的国家。自由主义也与亚里士多德的观点存在根本冲突，即“政治的目的”在于培养“某种类型的公民——也就是善良且有作为的人”。高尚的行为。” 13一个纯粹的自由主义国家是没有灵魂的：它很少在公民和政府之间建立情感联系，这就是为什么人们有时会说，让人们为自由主义国家而战甚至牺牲尤其困难。14

It is important to emphasize that, outside of its night-watchman function, a liberal state seeks to stay out of the business of telling people what kind of behavior is morally correct or incorrect. It encourages (and sometimes requires) toleration and works to ensure the prosperity and security of its citizens. The central aim, however, is to allow people, as much as possible, to live according to their own principles. Liberalism is distinct from republicanism, which emphasizes an individual’s duties and obligations and favors a state that actively promotes civic virtue. It is also fundamentally at odds with Aristotle’s view that “the end of politics” is to produce “citizens of a certain sort—that is, good people and doers of noble actions.”13 A purely liberal state is soulless: it creates few emotional bonds between citizens and their government, which is why it is sometimes said that getting people to fight and die for a liberal state is especially difficult.14

现在应该很清楚，自由主义叙事设想在国家与公民社会之间划出一条清晰的界限。 15国家是众多个人共同缔结的社会契约的产物，这些个人竭尽全力确保他们所创建的政府不会过度干预他们的生活。其目标是限制赫伯特·斯宾塞所说的“部长级监督”，从而最大限度地保障人们自由地追求他们自己理想中的美好生活。 16奉行“共存模式” （Modus vivendi）的自由主义者和进步自由主义者在何为适当的部长级监督问题上存在分歧。

It should be apparent by now that the liberal story envisions a distinct boundary between the state and civil society.15 The state is the product of a social contract drawn up by a large body of individuals who go to considerable lengths to make sure the government they create does not interfere too much in their lives. The goal is to limit the amount of what Herbert Spencer called “ministerial overseeing,” so as to maximize people’s freedom to lead their own version of the good life.16 Modus vivendi liberals and progressive liberals disagree on what is the appropriate amount of ministerial oversight.

自由主义也力求尽可能地降低政治的重要性。正如我之前提到的，政治从根本上讲是关于美好生活的基本问题的冲突。这正是政治具有对抗性的原因。自由主义试图通过赋予个人充分的自由来缓解政治冲突，让他们可以按照自己的意愿生活，从而至少部分地消除了人们为基本原则而争斗的原因。正如马库斯·费舍尔所指出的，“自由主义通过掏空政治生活的大部分意义，使其趋于平静。” 17或者正如斯蒂芬·霍姆斯所说，自由主义力求“将那些既无法通过辩论也无法通过妥协解决的问题从公共议程中移除。” 18

Liberalism also seeks to minimize the importance of politics as much as possible. As I noted earlier, politics at its most basic level is about conflicts over fundamental questions regarding the good life. This is what makes it an adversarial enterprise. Liberalism tries to ameliorate political conflict by giving individuals abundant freedom to live their lives as they see fit, thus removing at least part of the reason for fighting over first principles. As Markus Fischer notes, “Liberalism has pacified political life by emptying it of much of its meaning.”17 Or as Stephen Holmes puts it, liberalism seeks “to remove from the public agenda issues that are impossible to resolve by either argument or compromise.”18

然而，即便自由主义者试图淡化政治，他们也承认允许个人自由参与经济活动的重要性。他们的最终目标是创造一个经济凌驾于政治之上的世界。 19这种思路在约翰·洛克的著作中得到了清晰的体现，并由亚当·斯密发展得最为完善。他认为，应该尽可能避免政府干预经济，以便个人能够追求自身利益，而这最终将有利于整个社会。他坚持认为，“看不见的手”会引导市场创造日益丰裕的财富，而国家如果试图引导经济，只会弊大于利。毫不夸张地说，资本主义和自由主义是相辅相成的。

Yet even as they try to attenuate politics, liberals acknowledge the importance of allowing individuals to freely engage in economic activity. Their ultimate aim is to create a world where economics overshadows politics.19 This line of thinking, clearly reflected in the writings of John Locke, was pushed forward in its most comprehensive form by Adam Smith. He argues for doing as much as possible to keep the government from interfering in the economy so that individuals can pursue their own self-interest, which he claims will ultimately work to the benefit of the entire society. The “invisible hand,” he maintains, will guide the market to create increasing abundance, whereas the state, if it tried to guide the economy, would be more of a hindrance than a help. It is no exaggeration to say that capitalism and liberalism go hand in hand.

自由主义者明白，个人之间以及派系之间总会存在严重的政治争端。然而，这些争端最终由国家解决，因为国家制定并执行规则。国家是围绕和平解决冲突而建立的进程中的最终仲裁者。不出所料，政治自由主义非常重视法院和法治，因为它旨在通过法律体系而非政治舞台来解决政治问题。约翰·格雷在评价约翰·罗尔斯的思想时抓住了这一点：“罗尔斯‘政治自由主义’的核心机构并非议会之类的审议机构，而是法院。所有根本性问题都被排除在政治审议之外，交由最高法院裁决。罗尔斯学说自称为政治自由主义，这本身就极具讽刺意味。事实上，罗尔斯的学说是一种反政治的法律主义。” 20

Liberals understand that there will always be serious political disputes between individuals and between factions. Those quarrels, however, are settled by the state, which writes the rules and enforces them. The state is the ultimate arbiter in a process built around peaceful conflict resolution. Predictably, political liberalism places much emphasis on courts and the rule of law, since it aims to deal with political problems in the legal system, not the political arena. John Gray captures this point in his assessment of John Rawls’s thinking: “The central institution of Rawls’s ‘political liberalism’ is not a deliberative assembly such as a parliament. It is a court of law. All fundamental questions are removed from political deliberation in order to be adjudicated by a Supreme Court. The self-description of Rawlsian doctrine as political liberalism is supremely ironic. In fact, Rawls’s doctrine is a species of anti-political legalism.”20

然而，自由主义国家在最小化政治干预方面的能力是有限的。最重要的限制在于，国家无法保持中立，这主要是因为国家制定了支配日常生活诸多方面的规则，而这些规则大多涉及基本原则。鉴于人们对美好生活的构成必然存在尖锐分歧，社会中哪个派别有权制定规则至关重要。这意味着高层职位的竞争将异常激烈。这种竞争在自由主义国家可能尤为激烈，因为它们同时也是民主国家，至少在理论上存在通过选举实现权力交接的可能性。相比之下，威权国家的政治空间则更小，因为来自上层的铁腕控制要么扼杀要么限制了公众对公职的竞争。简而言之，政治注定会成为自由主义国家日常生活的一部分，因为根本无法彻底消除对基本原则的深刻分歧。

There are limits, however, on the ability of liberal states to minimize politics. The most important limit is that the state is unable to be neutral, mainly because it writes the rules that govern much of daily life, and many of those rules deal with first principles. Given the inevitable sharp differences over what constitutes the good life, it matters enormously which faction in a society gets to write the rules. This means there will be marked competition to win high office. This competition is likely to be especially intense in liberal states because they are also democracies, which carries at least the theoretical possibility of a transfer of power through an election. Authoritarian states actually have less room for politics because iron control from the top either stamps out or limits public competition for office. In short, politics is guaranteed to be part of daily life in liberal states, simply because there is no way of completely eliminating deep disagreements over first principles.

自由主义将国家与公民社会分离并试图削弱政治影响的方案，标志着与以往关于最佳政治秩序的思考的根本决裂。在亚里士多德和柏拉图等古代哲学家的著作中，政治制度与公民社会紧密交织；积极参与政治是美好生活的必要组成部分。投身公共领域被视为一项崇高的事业，因此，成为杰出的公众人物是一种荣誉的象征。即使是强调严酷残酷的马基雅维利，也未能免俗。在《君主论》中，政治的一面将国家与公民社会视为一个无缝衔接的整体。他强调，巧妙的政治策略可以服务于崇高的政治目标，尤其是共和主义。21自由主义则提供了一种截然不同的政治和美好生活思考方式。

The liberal formula for separating the state from civil society and trying to reduce the influence of politics marks a fundamental break with previous thinking about the optimum political order. In the writings of ancient philosophers such as Aristotle and Plato, political institutions and civil society were woven closely together; actively participating in politics was a necessary element of a good life. Engaging in the public sphere was considered a noble enterprise, and thus it was a mark of distinction to be a prominent public figure. Even Machiavelli, who emphasized the harsh and cruel side of politics in The Prince, saw the state and civil society as a seamless web. He stressed that clever political strategies could serve the pursuit of noble political goals, especially republicanism.21 Liberalism offers a much different way of thinking about politics and the good life.

自由主义的悖论

Liberalism’s Paradoxes

在探讨共存模式与进步自由主义之间的差异之前，我们有必要先讨论自由主义中蕴含的两个悖论。第一个悖论与宽容有关。在任何自由社会中，总会有人反对自由主义，并在有机会时推翻现有的政治秩序。如果相当一部分人持有这种观点，他们无疑会对自由主义构成致命威胁。在这种情况下，自由主义者对敌人采取宽容的态度毫无意义，因为“互不干涉”的做法可能会摧毁政权。

Two paradoxes embedded in liberalism merit discussion before we examine the differences between modus vivendi and progressive liberalism. The first paradox concerns tolerance. In any liberal society, some people will reject liberalism and would overturn the political order if given the opportunity. If a substantial number of people held this view, they would surely present a mortal threat to liberalism. It would make little sense in these circumstances for liberals to practice toleration toward their enemies, since a live-and-let-live approach could destroy the regime.

当然，自由主义者也意识到了这种危险，这意味着自由主义的核心存在一种脆弱性，这种脆弱性自然而然地会引发自由主义者中某种不宽容的倾向。这种逻辑在很大程度上解释了为什么洛克——他曾撰写过一篇关于宽容美德的著名文章——在其著作中对无神论者和天主教徒持不宽容的态度。他认为天主教徒不可信赖，因为他们效忠于教皇，而且自身也存在不宽容；无神论者也不可信赖，因为他们的承诺缺乏神圣的认可。因此，在他看来，这两个群体都对自由主义构成了威胁。 22实际上，这种威胁的程度有所不同，而且这种不宽容通常会被抑制住。

Liberals, of course, are aware of this danger, which means liberalism has a sense of vulnerability at its core that naturally provokes a tendency toward intolerance among liberals. This logic explains in good part why Locke, who wrote a famous essay on the virtues of toleration, was intolerant in his writings toward atheists and Catholics. He believed Catholics could not be trusted because of their allegiance to the pope and their own intolerance, and that atheists could not be trusted because their pledges were not backed up by divine sanction. Both groups were thus, in his mind, a threat to liberalism.22 In practice, the level of threat varies, and this intolerance is usually kept at bay.

自由主义倾向于不宽容还有另一个原因。大多数自由主义者认为自由主义优于其他政治秩序，并相信如果世界完全由自由主义政权统治，世界将会变得更美好。自由主义中既包含一种脆弱感，又包含一种优越感，这种双重属性助长了不宽容，尽管该理论强调要宣扬宽容以维护国内和谐。

Liberalism tends toward intolerance for another reason as well. Most liberals consider liberalism superior to other kinds of political order and believe the world would be a better place if it were populated solely by liberal regimes. There is a sense of both vulnerability and superiority wired into liberalism that fosters intolerance despite the theory’s emphasis on purveying tolerance to maintain domestic harmony.

自由主义的核心还存在另一个看似矛盾之处。该理论既包含特殊主义的成分，也包含普遍主义的成分，二者截然相反。普遍主义成分源于自由主义对个人权利根深蒂固的承诺。人权没有界限或国界：它们适用于每个人。在这个星球上。需要明确的是，这里并非主张个人应该拥有这些权利，而是主张所有人理所当然地都拥有这些权利。在理解权利方面，我们的推理能力几乎没有任何限制。可以说，这就是自由主义的和平维度，因为尊重他人的权利应该能够促进宽容，并遏制暴力行为。

There is another seeming contradiction at liberalism’s core. The theory contains both a particularist and a universalist strand, which stand in marked contrast to each other. The universalist strand springs from liberalism’s deep-seated commitment to individual rights. There are no boundaries or borders when it comes to human rights: they apply to every person on the planet. To be clear, the claim is not that individuals should have those rights but that all people axiomatically do have them. There are no meaningful limits to our ability to reason when it comes to comprehending rights. One might say this is the pacific dimension of liberalism, because respect for the rights of others should promote tolerance and discourage violent behavior.

另一方面，特殊主义倾向源于自由主义的信念，即不可能就何为美好生活达成一致意见。这里我们看到了理性的局限性。有些人会在某些时候达成共识，但并非所有人都会在所有时候都达成共识——而且他们的分歧有时会非常激烈，以至于会引发互相伤害的动机。我们可以将此称为自由主义的冲突维度，正是这种维度凸显了国家需要扮演“守夜人”角色的必要性。

The particularist strand, on the other hand, stems from the liberal belief that it is impossible to get unanimous agreement on what constitutes the good life. Here we see the limits of reason at play. Some people will agree some of the time, but not all of them all of the time—and their disagreements will sometimes be so passionate that they are motivated to harm each other. One might call this liberalism’s conflictual dimension, which underpins the need for the state to function as night watchman.

因此，政治自由主义既包含强调理性力量、不可剥夺的权利和非暴力的普世主义倾向，也包含强调理性局限性、对基本原则的分歧以及政治纷争本质的特殊主义倾向。自由主义的这些对立组成部分之间有何关联？哪一部分占据主导地位？

Political liberalism thus has a universalist strand that emphasizes the power of reason, inalienable rights, and nonviolence as well as a particularist strand that stresses the limits of reason, disagreements about first principles, and the fractious nature of politics. How do these opposing components of liberalism relate to each other? And which one is dominant?

总体而言，自由主义理论似乎更侧重于特殊主义，但这并不意味着普遍主义就无关紧要。原因很简单。如果自由主义关于权利的论述真的令人信服，那么就不需要一个强大的国家来维护秩序。对个人权利的普遍尊重就能保障宽容，并在很大程度上消除对更高权威机构防止谋杀和混乱的必要性。但几乎所有自由主义理论家都认识到宽容的局限性，因此也认识到国家维护和平的必要性。关于何为美好生活的激烈争论，以及可能造成人员伤亡的冲突，将永远存在。仅靠宽容是不够的，换句话说，在自由主义的论述中，特殊主义最终比普遍主义更具解释力。

The overall theory seems to privilege the particularist strand, but this does not mean the universalist strand is of little consequence. The reason is straightforward. If liberalism’s story about rights were truly compelling, there would be no need for a strong state to maintain order. A pervasive respect for individual rights would guarantee toleration and largely eliminate the need for a higher authority to prevent murder and mayhem. But virtually every liberal theorist recognizes the limits of tolerance and thus the need for a state to keep the peace. Passionate and potentially deadly disputes over what defines the good life will always be with us. Tolerance by itself is not enough, which is another way of saying the particularist strand ultimately has more explanatory power in the liberal story than the universalist one.

自由主义共存模式

Modus Vivendi Liberalism

和解派和进步自由主义者提出的主要论点与上述政治描述完全一致。自由主义。本节及下一节旨在探讨每种变体的细微差别，并阐明它们之间的差异。

The main arguments put forth by both modus vivendi and progressive liberals are fully consistent with the above description of political liberalism. The aim in this section and the next one is to examine the fine points of each variant and show how they differ.

一些符合“权宜之计”自由主义定义的政治理论家未必会完全认同下文概述的总体图景。约翰·洛克是典型的“权宜之计”自由主义者，亚当·斯密和弗里德里希·哈耶克亦是如此。约翰·格雷和斯蒂芬·霍姆斯是两位符合这一范畴的当代政治理论家。许多其他自由主义理论家的论点虽然与“权宜之计”自由主义完全吻合，但他们所倡导的其他理念却与之相悖。这些人——约翰·斯图亚特·密尔便是其中之一——很难被归入“权宜之计”阵营。在适当的情况下，我将引用这些“权宜之计”自由主义者的著作来阐明我的主要观点。

A number of political theorists who qualify as modus vivendi liberals would not necessarily agree with every detail of the composite picture sketched below. John Locke is a quintessential modus vivendi liberal, as are Adam Smith and Friedrich Hayek. Two contemporary political theorists who fit in this category are John Gray and Stephen Holmes. Many other liberal theorists make arguments that fit squarely with modus vivendi liberalism but promote other ideas that are at odds with it. These people—John Stuart Mill is one—are hard to put in the modus vivendi camp. Where appropriate, I will draw on the writings of these modus vivendi liberals to illustrate my main points.

奉行“权宜之计”的自由主义者对我们能否就核心原则达成共识深感悲观。格雷写道：“理性探究表明，美好生活多种多样……理性可以启发我们认识自身的伦理冲突。但通常情况下，它会揭示这些冲突比我们想象的更为深刻，让我们不知如何解决。” 23这种悲观情绪因个人常常在缺乏理性的情况下做出决定而加剧。正如霍姆斯所指出的：“所有古典自由主义者都非常清楚，大多数人类行为都是非理性的、习惯性的、情绪化的，而且大多数人类目标都是非物质的。” 24 看来，理性并不能为我们指明关于何种政治秩序最佳的任何客观真理。

Modus vivendi liberals are deeply pessimistic about our ability to reach agreement on core principles. “Rational inquiry,” Gray writes, “shows that the good life comes in many varieties. . . . Reason can enlighten us as to our ethical conflicts. Often, it shows them to be deeper than we thought, and leaves us in the lurch as to how to resolve them.”23 This pessimism is magnified by the fact that individuals often make decisions without the aid of reason. As Holmes notes: “All classical liberals were perfectly aware that most human behavior is noncalculating, habitual, and emotional and that most human goals are nonmaterial.”24 Reason, it seems, does not point us to any objective truth about what political order is best.

自由主义生活方式论者认为，权利的本质功能在于赋予个人最大限度的自由，使其能够追求自身利益。他们几乎完全强调消极权利——即保护个人免受他人（包括政府）约束的权利。他们尤其关注拥有和交换财产的权利，这种重视有助于解释自由主义为何与资本主义紧密相连。最后，尽管自由主义生活方式论者相信人人平等，但他们并不认为这种平等要求政府为所有公民创造公平的竞争环境。

Modus vivendi liberals believe the essential function of rights is to give individuals maximum personal freedom to pursue their own interests. Their emphasis is almost exclusively on negative rights—those that protect individuals from being constrained by others, including the government. They pay great attention to the right to own and exchange property, an emphasis that helps explain why liberalism is closely tied to capitalism. Finally, although modus vivendi liberals believe that all individuals are equal, they do not believe that this equality requires the government to level the playing field for its citizens.

宽容显然是“共存模式”自由主义者的核心价值观。尽管他们提倡在日常生活中采取互不干涉的态度，但共存也有其局限性。他们相信一个能够维护秩序的强大国家的重要性，但除此之外，他们会尽可能地阻止国家干预公民社会。

Tolerance is obviously central for modus vivendi liberals. Although they advocate a live-and-let-live approach to daily life, coexistence has its limits. They believe in the importance of a strong state that can maintain order, but beyond that they would, as much as possible, prevent the state from interfering in civil society.

这种观点并不令人意外，因为“权宜之计”自由主义者反对国家为促进机会平等而采取的行动，因为这需要政府进行大量的干预。创造机会平等意味着重新分配资源，这无疑会对私有财产造成不利影响，也会侵犯个人自由。更普遍地说，“权宜之计”自由主义者不赞成国家干预社会以促进任何形式的个人权利。相反，他们认为首要目标应该是保护可能受到威胁的权利。他们也不认为国家应该干预经济，除非绝对必要。他们更倾向于建立一个基于开放市场中不受限制竞争的经济体系。

This perspective is hardly surprising, since modus vivendi liberals oppose state efforts to foster equality of opportunity, which would entail significant government action. Creating equal opportunity would involve redistributing resources, which would surely have adverse consequences for private property and also impinge on personal freedom. More generally, modus vivendi liberals do not like the idea of the state interfering in society to promote any kind of individual rights. Instead, the paramount goal should be simply to protect rights that might be threatened. Nor do they believe the state should try to manage the economy unless absolutely necessary. The preference instead is to build an economy based on unrestricted competition in open markets.

权宜之计自由主义者对我们批判能力的悲观态度，远不止于认为我们无法就基本原则达成一致。他们还倾向于认为国家无法采取明智的行动来实现远大的目标。他们认为，政府非但不能带来有意义的进步，反而会阻碍进步。本质上，权宜之计自由主义者质疑国家是否具有工具理性，这使他们倾向于认为几乎所有形式的政府主导的社会工程都可能失败。在权宜之计自由主义中，没有建立庞大福利国家的容身之地。

The pessimism of modus vivendi liberals about our critical faculties goes beyond simply saying we cannot agree on first principles. They also tend to think the state cannot act intelligently to achieve ambitious goals. Governments, they argue, do not make meaningful progress; they hinder it. In essence, modus vivendi liberals question whether states are instrumentally rational, which predisposes them to believe that almost all forms of government-directed social engineering are likely to fail. There is no place for an expansive welfare state in modus vivendi liberalism.

归根结底，权宜之计式的自由主义并非一种乐观或进步的政治理论。25国家应当采取自由放任的治理方式：其目标应仅仅是防止分歧演变成致命冲突，并尽可能地给予人民自由，让他们按照自己认为合适的方式生活。

Ultimately, modus vivendi liberalism is not an optimistic or progressive theory of politics.25 The state is supposed to take a laissez-faire approach to governing: its goal should be simply to keep disagreements from turning deadly and to allow people as much freedom as possible to live as they see fit.

进步自由主义

Progressive Liberalism

进步自由主义者对政治生活描绘了一幅更为乐观的图景。从他们的一些作品中，人们或许会认为这是因为他们对人类理性解答有关美好生活的关键问题的能力更为乐观。有些人甚至似乎认为我们可以发现绝对真理。另一些人则认为，理性能够促进自由社会公民之间的深度宽容，从而在很大程度上消除暴力威胁。但仔细审视这些论断，就会发现它们站不住脚，而提出这些论断的进步自由主义者最终也总是会收回成命，承认……就像生活方式自由主义者一样，我们不能运用批判能力来就美好生活的构成达成普遍共识。

Progressive liberals tell a more hopeful story about political life. One might think from reading some of their works that this is because they are more sanguine about the capacity of human reason to answer critical questions regarding the good life. Some even appear to say that we can discover absolute truths. Others suggest that reason promotes deep tolerance among citizens in a liberal society, thus largely removing the threat of violence. But on close inspection, these claims do not hold up, and the progressive liberals who make them invariably backtrack and end up admitting, like modus vivendi liberals, that we cannot use our critical faculties to reach a universal consensus on what constitutes the good life.

真正让进步自由主义者比权宜自由主义者拥有更乐观前景的，是他们对个人权利以及国家为维护这些权利而进行社会工程的能力的思考方式。他们对权利的理解更为宽泛，尤其坚信人人享有平等机会。他们也认为，政府有责任也有能力推行确保这一目标实现的政策。他们对政府以工具理性方式行事的能力充满信心，这使他们与权宜自由主义者截然不同，后者缺乏这种信心。进步自由主义者也认识到国家需要扮演守夜人的角色，因为他们明白，就基本原则达成共识是不可能的。

What really gives progressive liberals a more hopeful outlook than modus vivendi liberals is how they think about individual rights and the state’s ability to do social engineering in the service of those rights. They have a more expansive view of rights, especially regarding their belief that everyone has a right to equal opportunity. They also believe that governments have both a responsibility and the ability to pursue policies that ensure that outcome. Their faith in governments’ capacity to act in instrumentally rational ways sets them apart from modus vivendi liberals, who have no such faith. Progressive liberals also recognize the need for the state to act as a night watchman, since they understand that it is not possible to achieve consensus on first principles.

进步自由主义的根源在于启蒙运动。正如艾萨克·克拉姆尼克所指出的，启蒙运动“推崇个人主义和利己主义的道德合法性”，但也强调“独立于信仰或传统的理性”的重要性。 26正如杰里米·沃尔德伦所言，“自由主义思想与启蒙运动遗产之间的联系怎么强调都不为过。启蒙运动的特点是对人类理解世界、把握世界规律和基本原则、预测世界未来以及运用世界力量造福人类的能力日益增强的信心。” 27

Progressive liberalism has its roots in the Enlightenment, which, as Isaac Kramnick notes, “valorized the individual and the moral legitimacy of self-interest,” but also trumpeted the importance of “unassisted human reason, not faith or tradition.”26 As Jeremy Waldron put it, “The relationship between liberal thought and the legacy of the Enlightenment cannot be stressed too strongly. The Enlightenment was characterized by a burgeoning confidence in the human ability to make sense of the world, to grasp its regularities and fundamental principles, to predict its future, and to manipulate its powers for the benefit of mankind.”27

过去五十年中最杰出的进步自由主义者包括罗纳德·德沃金、弗朗西斯·福山、史蒂芬·平克和约翰·罗尔斯。福山著名的1989年文章《历史的终结？》堪称此类思想的杰出代表。该文认为，随着共产主义的垮台，关于理想政府形式的问题已基本得到解答，自由民主制占据了主导地位。罗尔斯无疑是现代最具影响力的政治哲学家之一，而德沃金则是法哲学界的泰斗。平克可能是最著名的倡导者，他认为理性与自由价值观的胜利在减少全球暴力方面发挥了关键作用。追溯更久远的历史，法国哲学家尼古拉·德·孔多塞也属于这一范畴，伊曼努尔·康德亦是如此。康德曾写道：“要有勇气运用你自己的理性——这就是启蒙运动的格言。” 28

The most prominent progressive liberals over the past fifty years include Ronald Dworkin, Francis Fukuyama, Steven Pinker, and John Rawls. Fukuyama’s famous 1989 article “The End of History?,” which argued that with the fall of communism the question of the ideal form of government had largely been answered in favor of liberal democracy, is an outstanding example of this genre. Rawls, of course, was one of the most influential political philosophers of modern times, while Dworkin was a giant among legal philosophers. Pinker is probably the most famous proponent of the claim that the triumph of reason and liberal values has played a key role in reducing violence around the world. Going back further in time, the French philosopher Nicolas de Condorcet fits in this category, as does Immanuel Kant, who wrote: “Have courage to use your own reason—that is the motto of Enlightenment.”28

理性的力量

The Power of Reason

许多进步自由主义者认为，理性加上某些可发现的原则，是让世界变得更美好的关键。德沃金曾说过“自由主义不能建立在怀疑主义之上”，这体现了这种信念。 29实际上，进步自由主义有两种变体，它们对批判能力能告诉我们什么有着不同的理解。我们不妨称它们为有界进步主义者和无界进步主义者。

Many progressive liberals believe reason, coupled with certain discoverable principles, is the key to making the world a better place, a conviction reflected in Dworkin’s comment that “liberalism cannot be based on skepticism.”29 There are actually two variants of progressive liberalism, each with a different take on what our critical faculties can tell us. Let us call them bounded and unbounded progressives.

无界限进步主义者最相信理性。他们认为，当我们共同发现基本原则，并将其与对个人权利的普遍尊重相结合时，就能有效地消除暴力冲突。有界限进步主义者虽然比奉行“共存之道”的自由主义者更相信理性，但他们并不认为世界各地的人们能够就美好生活的问题达成共识。不过，他们相信自由社会中的人们足够聪明，能够接受这些差异，而不是为此争斗。在自由主义盛行的地方，宽容、和平解决冲突和尊重法律是日常生活的准则。

The unbounded progressives have the most faith in reason. They claim that when we collectively discover first principles and couple them with universal respect for individual rights, it effectively takes violent conflict off the table. Bounded progressives, while they have more faith in reason than modus vivendi liberals, do not think people around the world can reach a consensus on questions about the good life. But they do believe people in liberal societies are smart enough to accept those differences and not fight over them. Abundant tolerance, accompanied by peaceful conflict resolution and respect for the law, governs daily life wherever liberalism reigns.

这两种进步主义都对批判能力的作用抱有不切实际的理解。我们无法（至少无法成功地）论证存在几乎人人都接受的基本原则真理。同样，也没有任何理由相信仅凭理性就能在自由社会中产生深刻的宽容，但这并不意味着自由主义制度不能使人们变得高度宽容、尊重法律并以和平方式解决冲突。此外，仔细考察他们的著作就会发现，进步自由主义者自身也认识到理性的局限性，这实际上削弱了他们自身乐观的主张。

Both kinds of progressivism have an unrealistic understanding of what our critical faculties can do for us. It is not possible to argue (at least not successfully) that there are truths about first principles that virtually everyone accepts. Nor is there any basis for believing that reason alone can produce profound tolerance in liberal societies, which is not to say that liberal institutions cannot socialize people to be highly tolerant, respect the law, and settle their conflicts peacefully. Moreover, a careful examination of their writings shows that progressive liberals themselves recognize the limits of reason, in effect undermining their own optimistic claims.

无限制的进步主义

Unbounded Progressivism

德沃金、福山和品克的著作中包含一些与无限制进步主义相契合的论点。正如我之前提到的，德沃金非常关注最高法院大法官是否有可能对那些总是摆在他们面前的“疑难案件”给出“正确答案”的问题。具体来说，他关注的是是否存在普遍的道德原则，能够为这些案件提供客观正确的答案，而不是取决于特定大法官价值观的答案。偏好。他认为，存在一套自由主义的“构成性原则”，法官可以运用这些原则来寻求正确的答案。他写道：“在我们自己的法律体系中，法律问题没有正确答案的情况可能比人们通常认为的要少得多。”他接着说：“在一个复杂而全面的法律体系中，两种理论不太可能存在足够大的差异，以至于在某些情况下需要不同的答案，同时又能与相关的法律材料完美契合。”值得注意的是，德沃金在指出自由主义不能建立在怀疑主义之上之后，又论证了自由主义的“构成性道德”规定，政府必须平等对待所有人，这并非因为政治道德中没有对错之分，而是因为这样做才是正确的。 30 人们还可以指出德沃金论证普遍真理的其他例子。

The writings of Dworkin, Fukuyama, and Pinker contain arguments that fit with unbounded progressivism. As I noted earlier, Dworkin pays much attention to the question of whether it is possible for Supreme Court justices to come up with “right answers” for the “hard cases” that invariably make their way to them. Specifically, he is concerned with whether there are universal moral principles that can provide objectively correct answers in these cases, rather than answers that depend on particular justices’ value preferences. He believes that there is a set of liberal “constitutive principles” that justices can employ to help get the right answers. “The occasions when a legal question has no right answer in our own legal system,” he writes, “may be much rarer than is generally supposed.” He goes on to say that “in a complex and comprehensive legal system it is antecedently unlikely that two theories will differ sufficiently to demand different answers in some case and yet provide equally good fit with the relevant legal materials.” It is also worth noting that after saying liberalism cannot be grounded on skepticism, Dworkin argues that liberalism’s “constitutive morality provides that human beings must be treated as equals by their government, not because there is no right and wrong in political morality, but because that is what is right.”30 One could point to other examples of Dworkin making the case for universal truths.

在福山关于历史终结的著名论述中，他似乎提出了更为大胆的论断。他认为，历史终结意味着“基本原则和制度的发展将不再有任何进步，因为所有真正重大的问题都已得到解决。” 31福山写道，随着西方自由民主战胜所有其他政治形式，我们已经到达了“人类意识形态演化的终点”。在“普世同质国家”中，“所有先前的矛盾都得到了解决，所有人类需求都得到了满足。不再有关于‘重大’问题的斗争或冲突，因此也不再需要将军或政治家；剩下的主要是经济活动。” 在一个人们对基本原则没有实质性分歧的世界里，他们最大的问题很可能是“无聊”。毋庸赘言，无聊尚未降临到我们身上。

In his famous writings about the end of history, Fukuyama appears to make even bolder claims. History’s end, goes the argument, means “there would be no further progress in the development of underlying principles and institutions, because all of the really big questions had been settled.”31 With the triumph of Western liberal democracy over all other political forms, Fukuyama writes, we have reached the “endpoint of mankind’s ideological evolution.” In the “universal homogeneous state, all prior contradictions are resolved and all human needs are satisfied. There is no struggle or conflict over ‘large’ issues and consequently no need for generals or statesmen; what remains is primarily economic activity.” Given a world where people have no meaningful disagreements over first principles, their biggest problem is likely to be “boredom.” It hardly needs mentioning that boredom has not yet descended upon us.

最后，平克强调他所谓的“理性阶梯”，这体现了他作为一位无界限进步主义者的特征。“信不信由你，”他告诉我们，“我们正在变得越来越聪明。”而且“更聪明的人也更开明。”“我们心理上的共通性意味着，无论人们之间存在多少差异，原则上，思想是可以达成一致的。”原因很简单：“当世界主义思潮将不同背景的人们聚集在一起进行讨论，当言论自由允许讨论自由发展，当历史上失败的尝试被置于聚光灯下审视时，种种迹象表明，价值体系正朝着自由人文主义的方向演进。” 32

Finally, Pinker, who emphasizes what he calls “the escalator of reason,” has the earmarks of an unbounded progressive. “Believe it or not,” he tells us, “we are getting smarter.” And “smarter people are more liberal.” One important implication of “our psychological commonality is that however much people differ, there can be, in principle, a meeting of the minds.” The reason is simple: “When cosmopolitan currents bring diverse people into discussion, when freedom of speech allows the discussion to go where it pleases, and when history’s failed experiments are held up to the light, the evidence suggests that value systems evolve in the direction of liberal humanism.”32

无限制进步主义的论点最终是站不住脚的。对于何为美好生活，从来没有人能达成普遍共识，也没有任何理由认为将来会达成。认为我们可以运用批判性思维来探寻关于基本原则的普遍真理的论点根本站不住脚。这并非否认个人可以提出他们认为的终极真理，但要让所有人都接受他们的观点则是另一回事。这也不是否认有可能让一大群人就他们关心的公共议题达成共识。但即便如此也十分困难，远未达到普遍共识的程度。沃尔德伦在批判德沃金关于法律领域真理的观点时，就强调了这一点：“所有关于客观性的讨论……都丝毫没有改变这样一个事实：不同的法官在提出和回答德沃金法理学所要求的客观价值问题时，会得出不同的答案。”换句话说，“答案因人而异，而非因法律而异。” 33

The case for unbounded progressivism is ultimately unpersuasive. There has never been anything approximating a universal consensus on what constitutes the good life, and no good reason to think there ever will be. The argument that we can use our critical faculties to divine universally accepted truths regarding first principles simply cannot be sustained. This is not to deny that individuals can come up with beliefs they deem ultimate truths, but getting everyone else to accept their views is another matter. Nor is it to deny that it is possible to get large groups of people to reach a consensus on public issues that matter to them. But even that is difficult, and it falls far short of universal agreement. Waldron drives this point home in his critique of Dworkin’s views on truth in the legal realm: “None of this talk about objectivity . . . makes the slightest dent on the fact that different judges asking and answering the objective questions of value that Dworkin’s jurisprudence requires will come up with different answers.” In other words, “the answers will differ depending on the person, not depending on the law.”33

鉴于理性的明显局限性，那些曾经雄心勃勃的进步主义者最终放弃他们大胆的断言，转而开始听起来像是墨守成规的自由主义者，这并不令人意外。不幸的是，他们在这一关键问题上的摇摆不定是站不住脚的。人们必须在截然相反的两种方法中做出选择：要么相信关于基本原理的普遍真理是可以达到的，要么不相信。

Given reason’s obvious limits, it is unsurprising that unbounded progressives themselves ultimately retreat from their bold assertions and begin to sound like modus vivendi liberals. Unfortunately, their bouncing back and forth on this critical matter is untenable. One has to choose between the opposite approaches. Either one believes universal truths about first principles are attainable or one does not.

福山关于历史终结论的论述或许是这一现象的最佳例证。正如前文所述，他在1989年那篇著名的文章中认为，所有重大问题都已尘埃落定，几乎没有什么值得争论的了。然而，尽管他在1992年的后续著作中重申了这些观点，但他的诸多论述却自相矛盾，很容易让人联想到一种自由主义的生存模式。例如，在书中，福山着重论述了“现代相对主义给我们造成的思想僵局”，他认为这种僵局“不允许我们捍卫传统意义上的自由权利”。他还写道：“我们当前关于权利本质的论述之所以缺乏连贯性，源于一个更深层次的哲学危机，即对理性理解人性的可能性……如今，人人都在谈论人的尊严，但对于人为何拥有尊严却没有共识。”人们无法谈论“……认为现代思想陷入了相对主义的困境”，但却又声称人们对基本原则存在广泛的共识。34

Fukuyama’s writings about the end of history provide what is probably the best example of this phenomenon. As noted, he argues in his well-known 1989 article that all of the big questions have been settled and that little remains to fight about. But while he repeats these claims in his 1992 follow-up book, he also contradicts himself with numerous statements that could easily come from a modus vivendi liberal. In his book, for example, Fukuyama makes much of “the intellectual impasse in which modern relativism has left us,” which he says “does not permit defense of liberal rights traditionally understood.” At another point, he writes: “The incoherence in our current discourse on the nature of rights springs from a deeper philosophical crisis concerning the possibility of a rational understanding of man. . . . Today, everybody talks about human dignity, but there is no consensus as to why people possess it.” One cannot talk about “the relativist impasse of modern thought” and yet argue there is broad agreement on first principles.34

在本书的其他章节中，福山也警告了未来的种种危险，但这些危险并不包括厌倦。例如，他写道：“回顾过去，我们这些生活在人类暮年的人或许会得出这样的结论：没有任何一种政权——没有任何一种‘社会经济制度’——能够让所有人在所有地方都感到满意。这其中也包括自由民主……相反，不满恰恰产生于民主最为无限制地取得胜利的地方：它源于对自由和平等的不满。因此，那些仍然不满的人总有可能重新开始历史。” 更尖锐地说，他指出：“现代思想并未对那些在自由民主的怀抱中成长起来的人未来发动的虚无主义战争设置任何障碍。” 同样，他认为“基于其他形式的不平等，对自由民主提出的新的、可能更为激进的挑战是否会停止，目前尚不明朗。”或许他最引人注目的论断是：“我们没有任何保证，也无法向后代保证未来不会出现希特勒或波尔布特这样的人。” 35

Elsewhere in his book, Fukuyama warns about the dangers ahead, but these do not include boredom. He writes, for example: “Looking backward, we who live in the old age of mankind might come to the following conclusion. No regime—no ‘socio-economic system’—is able to satisfy all men in all places. This includes liberal democracy. . . . Rather, the dissatisfaction arises precisely where democracy has triumphed most unboundedly: it is a dissatisfaction with liberty and equality. Thus those who remain dissatisfied will always have the potential to restart history.” More pointedly, he notes, “Modern thought raises no barriers to a future nihilistic war against liberal democracy on the part of those brought up in its bosom.” Along the same lines, he posits that “it is not clear that there will be any end to new and potentially more radical challenges to liberal democracy based on other forms of inequality.” And possibly his most striking claim is that “we have no guarantees and cannot assure future generations that there will be no future Hitlers or Pol Pots.”35

斯蒂芬·霍姆斯简洁地总结了采取这些自相矛盾立场所带来的后果：“福山似乎并不明白，所有这些先发制人的让步实际上都等同于承认失败。” 36

Stephen Holmes succinctly sums up the consequences of taking these contradictory positions: “Fukuyama does not seem to understand that all these pre-emptive concessions amount to an admission of defeat.”36

这种对理性力量持有相反观点的倾向也出现在康德的著作中，这解释了为什么一些学者将他归类为“权宜之计式自由主义者”（modus vivendi liberal），而另一些学者则认为他是进步主义者。例如，黛博拉·布科扬尼斯（Deborah Boucoyannis）和肯尼斯·沃尔兹（Kenneth Waltz）都认为康德是“权宜之计式自由主义者”，而迈克尔·德施（Michael Desch）和约翰·格雷（John Gray）则将他描绘成进步主义自由主义者。 37正如沃尔兹所指出的，造成这种混乱的原因在于，康德的著作为这两种观点都提供了佐证。 38

This tendency to employ opposing views about the power of reason also appears in Kant’s work, which explains why some scholars classify him as a modus vivendi liberal, while others see him as a progressive. Both Deborah Boucoyannis and Kenneth Waltz, for instance, say Kant is a modus vivendi liberal, while Michael Desch and John Gray portray him as a progressive liberal.37 The reason for this confusion, as Waltz points out, is that Kant’s writings give you ammunition to support both perspectives.38

总之，进步主义者们对我们理性能力的无限乐观，不仅被他们自己的著作所削弱，也因为他们未能对人类本性在短短几个世纪内发生如此深刻的变化给出令人信服的解释。

In sum, the unbounded progressives’ profound optimism about our ability to reason is undermined by their own writings and also by their failure to offer a compelling explanation for why human nature has changed so profoundly in just a few centuries.

有限进步主义

Bounded Progressivism

在第二种进步自由主义变体中，理性并不能就人生重大问题达成共识，但它确实能产生深厚的宽容。对立观点。罗尔斯是最重要的有限进步主义者。他明确表示，他认为自由社会中的公民并不具备“全面的善的概念”。他坚持认为，对于“在道德和政治生活的各个方面都有效的普遍原则”并没有达成共识。 39事实上，他预期自由社会中的公民会“因合理的宗教、哲学和道德教义而产生深刻分歧”。 40此外，他并不认为自由社会中所有“合理的全面教义”都是“自由主义的全面教义”。

With the second variant of progressive liberalism, reason does not yield consensus about life’s big questions, but it does produce deep tolerance of opposing views. Rawls is the most important bounded progressive. He makes it clear that he believes citizens in liberal societies do not have “a comprehensive conception of the good.” There is no agreement, he maintains, about “universal principles having validity in all parts of moral and political life.”39 Indeed, he expects citizens in a liberal society to be “profoundly divided by reasonable religious, philosophical, and moral doctrines.”40 Moreover, he does not expect all of the “reasonable comprehensive doctrines” found in a liberal society to be “liberal comprehensive doctrines.”

然而，罗尔斯坚信，自由国家的公民不仅具有“一定的道德品质”，而且极其理性，这意味着他们不会为了“不可调和的全面理论”而争斗，而是会“受理性意识的约束”。最终，“公共理性”将引导他们达成妥协方案，并尊重彼此的观点。“作为理性的公民”，他们会“在公平的条件下与其他公民合作”。他写道，这种根深蒂固于自由社会的宽容规范，将导向“合理的多元主义”，即便无法成就“现实的乌托邦”。 41

Nevertheless, Rawls firmly believes not only that citizens in a liberal state have “a certain moral character” but that they are eminently sensible, which means they will not fight over their “irreconcilable comprehensive doctrines” but will instead be “constrained by their sense of what is reasonable.” In the end, “public reason” will lead them to reach compromise solutions and respect each other’s views. “As reasonable citizens” they will “offer to cooperate on fair terms with other citizens.” This deeply embedded norm of toleration in liberal societies, he writes, will lead to “reasonable pluralism,” if not a “realistic utopia.”41

进步自由主义的两种变体在对宽容的重视程度上存在显著差异。对于有界限的进步主义者而言，宽容如同灵丹妙药，显然至关重要。而对于无界限的进步主义者来说，宽容则不那么重要，他们至少在大多数情况下认为，只要在基本原则上达成广泛共识，宽容就显得多余。在一个没有实质性差异的世界里，宽容也就无从谈起。任何社会都难免会存在一些不认清真相的怪人，但无界限的进步主义者不会容忍他们的错误观点。相反，他们会想方设法劝说或强迫这些人幡然醒悟。

The two variants of progressive liberalism differ markedly in their emphasis on tolerance. For bounded progressives, tolerance acts as a magic elixir and is obviously of central importance. It is less important for unbounded progressives, who assume, at least much of the time, that broad agreement on first principles may make it unnecessary. There is little need to worry about tolerating difference in a world with no meaningful differences. Any society will surely harbor a few oddballs who do not recognize the truth, but unbounded progressives will not be inclined to tolerate their misguided views. Instead they will want to coax or coerce them into seeing the light.

有限进步主义在直觉上更具吸引力，原因很简单，它承认在根本性问题上达成普遍共识的难度。然而，它期望自由社会中的宽容能够战胜因基本原则分歧而产生的激烈争论，这种期望本身就存在问题。

Bounded progressivism is intuitively more attractive, simply because it acknowledges the difficulty of reaching universal agreement on foundational questions. Still, there are problems with its expectation that tolerance in liberal societies will trump the intense passions generated by fundamental disagreements over first principles.

首先，几乎没有证据表明自由社会中的公民像罗尔斯和其他有限进步主义者所声称的那样宽容，而且……有证据表明事实并非如此。政治哲学家乔治·克洛斯科直接回应了罗尔斯关于宽容的论断，他认为“证据表明，许多自由派公民实际上非常不宽容”——他用大量证据支持这一论点。克洛斯科指出，这一点“对于任何熟悉美国民意调查研究的人来说都不应该感到惊讶”。 42我将在下一章讨论个人权利被过度宣传时对此进行更详细的阐述。但在此只需指出，有限进步主义关于深度宽容的论断没有任何经验基础。

For starters, there is little evidence that citizens in liberal societies are as tolerant as Rawls and other bounded progressives claim, and much evidence that they are not. The political philosopher George Klosko, who directly engages Rawls’s claims about tolerance, argues that “the evidence shows many liberal citizens are remarkably intolerant”—an argument he supports with abundant evidence. Klosko notes that this point “should not be surprising to anyone familiar with research in American public opinion.”42 I will say more about this in the next chapter, when I discuss the overselling of individual rights. But suffice it to say here that there is no empirical basis for bounded progressivism’s claims about deep tolerance.

罗尔斯并非认为人们天生具有理性或宽容的倾向。他显然认为，世界上既有自由社会，也有非自由社会，而且生活在非自由社会中的人们按照自由社会的标准来看并不理性。例如，他谈到“体面的社会”，也谈到“侵略性和危险性的”“法外国家”。关于生活在体面社会中的人们的信仰，他写道：“我并非说他们是理性的，而是说他们并非完全不理性。”人们会认为，生活在法外国家中的人们，至少其中的大多数人，大多是不理性的。世界上有大量的人按照罗尔斯自己的标准来看并不理性，这一事实只能说明他不相信人们天生具有理性。 43

Rawls does not argue that people have a natural inclination toward reasonableness or tolerance. He clearly believes the world is populated by non-liberal as well as liberal societies, and that people living in non-liberal societies are not reasonable by the standards of liberal societies. For example, he talks about “decent societies” as well as “outlaw states” that are “aggressive and dangerous.” Regarding the beliefs of those individuals who populate decent societies, he writes: “I do not say they are reasonable, but rather they are not fully unreasonable.” One would assume people living in outlaw states, at least most of them, are mostly unreasonable. The simple fact that huge numbers of people in the world are not reasonable by Rawls’s own standards can only mean he does not believe people are naturally reasonable.43

罗尔斯对宽容概念历史的观点进一步强化了这一点。具体而言，他承认，在洛克等人于十七世纪开始构建自由主义理论之前，普遍存在的是不宽容而非宽容；在此之前，“不宽容被视为社会秩序和稳定的必要条件”。罗尔斯写道，存在着“长达几个世纪的不宽容实践”。因此，自由社会中理性与宽容的盛行并非人性使然，必然有其他因素在起作用。 44

This point is reinforced by Rawls’s views on the history of the concept of tolerance. Specifically, he acknowledges that intolerance, not tolerance, was commonplace before Locke and others began formulating liberal theory in the seventeenth century; until then, “intolerance was accepted as a condition of social order and stability.” There was, Rawls writes, a “centuries-long practice of intolerance.” Thus the prevalence of reasonableness and tolerance in liberal societies cannot be a product of human nature. Something else must account for it.44

在自由社会中，理性与宽容从何而来？罗尔斯声称自由公民具有“某种道德品质”，其依据是什么？他并未就这些重要问题展开详述。他的主要论点似乎是，“理性多元主义”（其中深深植根着宽容）很大程度上是自由社会内部长期社会化的结果。它是“一个社会文化在……自由制度背景下的长期产物”。 45但这种论调……这种论证未能阐明宽容这一严肃承诺最初源自何处，也未能说明谁应负责推广这一规范。人们或许会认为国家是塑造公民行为的主要责任人，但罗尔斯并未提出这一论点，而且他倾向于淡化国家在其理论中的作用。此外，很难相信国家——或任何机构——能够如此有效地推广宽容这一规范，从而基本消除因对美好生活的不同理解而引发的暴力冲突。简而言之，罗尔斯并未就其理论中的主要驱动力之一——理性——如何在自由社会中蓬勃发展给出令人满意的答案。不出所料，他几乎没有为他关于宽容的大胆论断提供任何实证支持。

Where do reasonableness and tolerance come from in liberal societies? On what basis does Rawls claim that liberal citizens have a “certain moral character”? He does not say much about these important questions. His main claim seems to be that “reasonable pluralism,” which has tolerance deeply embedded in it, is largely the result of the socialization that takes place over time inside liberal societies. It is “the long-term outcome of a society’s culture in the context of . . . free institutions.”45 But this line of argument fails to say where the serious commitment to tolerance came from in the first place as well as who is responsible for purveying that norm. One might suppose the state is principally responsible for shaping its citizens’ behavior, but Rawls does not make that argument, and he tends to play down the role of the state in his theory. Moreover, it is hard to believe that the state—or any institution—could purvey a norm like tolerance so effectively that it would largely eliminate violent conflict over competing views of the good life. In short, Rawls provides no good answer for how reasonableness, one of the main driving forces in his theory, comes to flourish in liberal societies. Not surprisingly, he offers little empirical support for his bold claims about tolerance.

罗尔斯偶尔也会像那些不受约束的进步主义者一样，提出一些与他关于自由社会和平性的基本论断相矛盾的论点，这并不令人惊讶，这些论点甚至让他听起来像是一个奉行“权宜之计”的自由主义者。例如：“可以说，某些真理关乎极其重要的事情，以至于围绕这些真理的​​分歧必须通过斗争来解决，即使这意味着内战。” 46他还指出，由于大量民众拒绝自由主义，因此“和解存在着重要的局限性”，并补充说，“许多人……无法接受我所描述的那种社会世界。对他们而言，政治自由主义所设想的社会世界是社会分裂和谬论的噩梦，甚至可以说是邪恶的。” 47此外，罗尔斯完全承认，自由国家有时会面临一种极其紧急的局面，需要放弃自由主义，或者至少对其进行严格限制。 48

Nor is it surprising that Rawls, like the unbounded progressives, occasionally makes arguments that contradict his fundamental claims about the peacefulness of liberal societies and leave him sounding like a modus vivendi liberal. For example: “Certain truths, it may be said, concern things so important that differences about them have to be fought out, even should this mean civil war.”46 He also notes that because large numbers of people reject liberalism, there are “important limits to reconciliation,” adding that “many persons . . . could not be reconciled to a social world such as I have described. For them the social world envisaged by political liberalism is a nightmare of social fragmentation and false doctrines, if not positively evil.”47 Furthermore, Rawls fully accepts that liberal states sometimes face a supreme emergency that requires liberalism to be abandoned or at least seriously curtailed.48

这又将我们引向何方呢？诚然，进步自由主义者有时会对我们批判能力的强大力量做出大胆的断言，但这些断言经不起仔细推敲。尽管有限进步主义者的主张更为局限，但这两种观点都存在同样的缺陷。它们都未能令人信服地解释为何理性能够为美好生活的问题提供最终答案，或为何能够在自由社会中促进极大的宽容。相反，这一传统的理论家主要依靠断言来论证他们的观点。其次，有限进步主义者和无限进步主义者有时都会提出与他们关于理性如何缓解冲突的断言相矛盾的论点，使他们听起来像是奉行“权宜之计”的自由主义者。

Where does this leave us? While there is no question that progressive liberals sometimes make bold claims about the power of our critical faculties, those claims do not stand up to close inspection. Although the claims of bounded progressives are more limited, the two versions share the same flaws. Neither provides a persuasive explanation for why reason can offer final answers to questions about the good life or promote prodigious tolerance in liberal societies. Instead, theorists in this tradition make their cases mainly by assertion. Second, both bounded and unbounded progressives sometimes make arguments that contradict their assertions about how reason ameliorates conflict and leave them sounding like modus vivendi liberals.

归根结底，在理性所起的安抚作用上，权宜之计与进步自由主义并无本质区别。这两种政治自由主义的真正区别在于它们如何看待个人权利以及国家对社会的干预。

In the end, there is no meaningful difference between modus vivendi and progressive liberalism on the pacifying effects of reason. The real difference between these two variants of political liberalism involves how they think about individual rights and social engineering by the state.

权利与社会工程

Rights and Social Engineering

在个人权利的核心地位上，和平共处模式派和进步自由主义者几乎没有分歧。但他们对于这些权利的具体内容以及如何在这些权利发生冲突时寻求平衡存在分歧。和平共处模式派强调消极权利，这些权利主要涉及个人行为免受政府干预的自由。集会自由、新闻自由和言论自由就是很好的例子。正如洛克和斯密的著作所反映的那样，获取和交换私有财产的权利对和平共处模式派来说是一项尤为重要的权利。 49

Modus vivendi and progressive liberals hardly differ on the centrality of individual rights. But they disagree over what those rights are and how to strike a balance when they come into conflict. Modus vivendi liberals emphasize negative rights, which largely involve freedom from government interference in individual action. Freedom to assemble, freedom of the press, and freedom of speech are good examples. The right to acquire and exchange private property is an especially important right for modus vivendi liberals, as reflected in the writings of Locke and Smith.49

这种对个人自由的强调也体现在弗里德里希·哈耶克的著作中，他是自由主义生活方式的代表人物。例如，哈耶克在其著作《自由宪章》第一章的开头写道：“本书关注的是这样一种人类状态：在这种状态下，社会中某些人对其他人的强制力被尽可能地减少。我们将在全文中把这种状态描述为自由状态。” 50

This emphasis on individual freedom is also reflected in the writings of Friedrich Hayek, a canonical modus vivendi liberal. The first sentences of the first chapter of Hayek’s The Constitution of Liberty, for example, read: “We are concerned in this book with that condition of men in which coercion of some by others is reduced as much as possible in society. This state we shall describe throughout as a state of liberty or freedom.”50

不出所料，许多奉行“权宜之计”的自由主义者对积极权利深恶痛绝，因为积极权利要求国家付出切实努力来帮助公民。积极权利使个人受制于政府行为，政府行为旨在向公民提供他们有权享有的商品或服务。这些努力与免受政府干预的自由几乎无关，甚至可能适得其反。积极权利的一个典型例子，也是“权宜之计”自由主义者尤其厌恶的一项权利，就是机会平等权。这意味着政府采取行动，最大限度地确保每个人都拥有同等的资源去竞争成功。其目标并非保证结果平等，而是确保机会平等。

Unsurprisingly, many modus vivendi liberals have an intense dislike of positive rights, which require a serious effort by the state to help its citizens. Positive rights make individuals subject to government actions, which aim to provide them with a good or service to which they have a right. These efforts have little to do with freedom from government interference and may even entail the opposite. A good example of a positive right, and the one that modus vivendi liberals especially loathe, is the right to equal opportunity. This involves the government taking action to maximize the likelihood that every person has the same level of resources to compete for success. The aim is not to guarantee equal outcomes, just equal opportunity.

哈耶克在写道：“普遍的法律和行为准则的平等……是唯一有利于自由的平等，也是唯一一种我们能够在不破坏自由的前提下实现的平等。”时，揭示了这种权宜之计式自由主义对机会平等理念的敌视。不仅如此，他还指出，这种平等不仅能够促进自由，而且能够保障自由。自由与任何其他形式的平等都无关，而且在许多方面甚至必然会造成不平等。” 51奉行“生存模式”（Modus vivendi）的自由主义者不仅认为不存在不可剥夺的平等机会权，而且认为国家无力提供这种权利，正如哈耶克所指出的，这样做甚至可能导致不平等。他们坚持认为，政府不应该插手推广积极权利，因为他们觉得这些权利甚至都不是合法的权利。

Hayek reveals modus vivendi liberalism’s hostility toward the notion of equal opportunity when he writes: “Equality of the general rule of law and conduct . . . is the only kind of equality conducive to liberty and the only equality which we can secure without destroying liberty. Not only has liberty nothing to do with any other sort of equality, but it is even bound to produce inequality in many respects.”51 Modus vivendi liberals not only believe there is no such thing as an inalienable right to equal opportunity but also think the state is ill equipped to provide it, and as Hayek notes, efforts to do so may even cause inequality. Governments, they maintain, should not be in the business of promoting positive rights, which they feel are not even legitimate rights.

进步自由主义者秉持着与“权宜之计”自由主义核心相同的基本自由原则。但他们在此基础上又增添了其他权利。机会平等是德沃金和罗尔斯著作中的一个主导主题， 52在他们看来，机会平等等同于公平，而他们认为公平正是正义的本质。他们非常重视正义。罗尔斯最著名的著作名为《正义论》 ，德沃金则在《原则问题》一书中以“自由主义与正义”为题，探讨了“自由主义理论的现状”。 53 “权宜之计”自由主义者很少谈及正义。

Progressive liberals are committed to the same set of basic freedoms that are at the core of modus vivendi liberalism. But then they add other rights. Equal opportunity is a dominating theme in the writings of both Dworkin and Rawls,52 for whom it is synonymous with fairness, which they believe is what justice is all about. And they care greatly about justice. Rawls’s most famous book is titled A Theory of Justice, and Dworkin uses “Liberalism and Justice” as the title for the section in A Matter of Principle where he “explores the present state of liberal theory.”53 Modus vivendi liberals rarely talk about justice.

进步自由主义者也相信其他积极权利，例如健康权、受良好教育权和免于贫困的权利。在某种程度上，这些权利与机会平等息息相关，因为如果一个人在贫困中长大，或者缺乏良好的教育或健康，就很难取得成功。当然，也可以认为，这些权利本身就很重要，与它们对机会平等的意义无关。

Progressive liberals believe in other positive rights as well, such as the right to health care, the right to a decent education, and the right to live free of poverty. To some extent, these rights are linked with equality of opportunity, as it is hard to achieve success if you grow up impoverished or lack a good education or good health. One could also argue, of course, that these are important rights independent of what they mean for equal opportunity.

然而，倡导积极权利的一个问题是，它们有时会与消极权利相冲突。54平等机会尤其如此，它常常与私有财产权相冲突。任何旨在促进平等机会的有意义的努力都涉及社会资源的重大再分配。这意味着从富人手中夺取作为私有财产的金钱，并将其转移给穷人。进步自由主义者毫不犹豫地向富人征税以促进平等机会，但这并不意味着他们不承认财产权。他们承认财产权，但他们赋予这项权利的重要性不如“权宜之计”自由主义者。罗尔斯在他的著作中并不强调个人财产权，尤其与洛克和斯密相比，后两者视财产权为神圣不可侵犯的。

One problem with promoting positive rights, however, is that they sometimes conflict with negative rights.54 This is especially true of equal opportunity, which often conflicts with the right to private property. Any meaningful effort to foster equal opportunity involves a significant redistribution of a society’s resources. That means taking money, which is private property, from the rich and transferring it to the poor. Progressive liberals hardly hesitate to tax the rich to foster equal opportunity, which is not to say they do not recognize the right to property. They do, but they do not accord that right the same importance that modus vivendi liberals do. Rawls does not emphasize individual property rights in his writings, especially compared with Locke and Smith, for whom it is sacrosanct.

这两种自由主义在国家角色和社会工程方面也存在根本差异——这直接源于它们对权利的不同看法。“权宜之计”式的自由主义者希望国家在维护秩序的同时，尽一切可能最大限度地保障个人自由，他们不想要社会工程，当然也不想要一个围绕积极权利构建的福利国家。进步自由主义者则认识到国家需要扮演“守夜人”的角色，但他们也希望国家能够促进积极权利，以增进个人福祉。在他们看来，这是促进社会整体福祉的最佳途径。（这正是他们被称为进步自由主义者的原因。）他们的国家将高度依赖专家，其中许多是直接受雇于国家，另一些则在学术界或智库担任顾问。这些专家中有很多是社会科学家，因为毕竟国家也在进行社会工程。55

The two kinds of liberalism also have fundamental differences—directly related to their different views of rights—over the role of the state and social engineering. Modus vivendi liberals, who want the state to maintain order while doing everything possible to maximize individual freedom, do not want social engineering, and they certainly do not want a welfare state built around positive rights. Progressive liberals recognize the need for a state to act as a night watchman, but they also want it to promote positive rights for the purpose of enhancing individual welfare. This, in their view, is the best way to promote the overall well-being of society. (That is what makes them progressive liberals.) Their state will rely heavily on experts, many in its direct employ, and others who serve as consultants from their positions in academia or think tanks. Many of these experts will be social scientists, since after all the state is doing social engineering.55

虽然进步自由主义者确实对建立一个能够深刻影响公民社会的干预型国家感兴趣，但他们仍然对大政府保持警惕。他们不像黑格尔那样将国家奉为圭臬，主要是因为他们认识到国家有可能演变成庞然大物，威胁个人自由。 56简而言之，进步自由主义者对国家持有一种矛盾的看法：他们既畏惧国家，又将其视为一股重要的向善力量。

While progressive liberals are certainly interested in building an interventionist state that can affect civil society in profound ways, they remain wary of big government. They do not lionize the state the way a philosopher like Hegel does, mainly because they recognize that it has the potential to turn into a leviathan and threaten individual freedoms.56 In short, progressive liberals have a conflicted view of the state: they fear it even while treating it as a major force for good.

进步自由主义者对国家进行社会工程的能力深信不疑，这实际上表明他们高度重视工具理性。他们相信人们能够运用批判性思维，制定出实现远大社会目标的明智策略。而“权宜之计”自由主义者则对政府的社会工程能力缺乏信心，也就是说，他们对国家以工具理性方式行事的能力信心不足。尽管在工具理性的影响力方面存在如此明显的差异，“权宜之计”自由主义者和进步自由主义者在实质理性问题上达成了共识：理性无法帮助我们洞悉关于美好生活的集体真理。

Progressive liberals’ great faith in the ability of states to do social engineering says, in effect, that they place a high premium on instrumental rationality. They believe people can use their critical faculties to come up with smart strategies for achieving ambitious social goals. Modus vivendi liberals have little faith in government social engineering, which is to say they have less confidence in the state’s ability to act in instrumentally rational ways. This clear difference about the sway of instrumental rationality notwithstanding, modus vivendi and progressive liberals agree on substantive rationality: that reason cannot help us divine collective truths about the good life.

正如我之前提到的，政治在自由社会中始终扮演着重要角色。因为国家必须制定一些涉及基本原则的规则和法律，所以政府由谁执掌对公民来说至关重要。生活在一个由进步自由主义者主导的国家的民众会更加关心这个问题。之所以如此，是因为进步型国家会更多地介入公民社会。在进步型而非奉行权宜之计的自由主义者执政的国家，政治竞争的激烈程度可能会更高。在这种情况下，奉行权宜之计的自由主义者将有强烈的动机参与政治，以限制干预型国家的权力。

As I noted earlier, politics is always at play in a liberal society. Because the state must make at least some rules and laws that deal with first principles, it matters to the citizenry who among them runs the government. People living in a state dominated by progressive liberals will care more about this because the progressive state will insert itself more in civil society. The intensity of political competition is likely to be greater in states where progressive rather than modus vivendi liberals are in charge. In such circumstances, modus vivendi liberals will have a powerful incentive to engage in politics so as to limit the interventionist state.

归根结底，政治自由主义两种流派的关键区别在于它们对权利和国家角色的看法。过去两个世纪以来，二者之间的力量平衡已发生决定性转变，进步自由主义占据了主导地位。

The bottom line is that the key differences in political liberalism’s two variants are how they think about rights and the role of the state. Over the past two centuries the balance of power between them has shifted decisively in favor of progressive liberalism.

自由进步主义的胜利

The Triumph of Liberal Progressivism

政治自由主义最初等同于权宜之计式自由主义。但这种形式逐渐失宠，部分原因是自由放任的治理方式导致了极端的经济不平等和普遍的贫困。此外，正如我将要讨论的，它并不适合管理一个工业化的民族国家。功利主义和自由理想主义的出现，很大程度上是对权宜之计式自由主义缺陷的回应。进步自由主义也是权宜之计式自由主义的替代方案，到20世纪初，它已成为美国和英国政治中占主导地位的政治自由主义形式。其思想领袖是约翰·罗尔斯。

In its original form, political liberalism was synonymous with modus vivendi liberalism. But that variant gradually fell out of favor, partly because a laissez-faire approach to governing led to extreme economic inequality and widespread poverty. Moreover, for reasons I will discuss, it was an unsuitable blueprint for administering an industrialized nation-state. Utilitarianism and liberal idealism emerged in good part as responses to modus vivendi liberalism’s shortcomings. Progressive liberalism was also an alternative to modus vivendi liberalism, and by the early twentieth century it was the dominant form of political liberalism in American and British politics. Its king of thought is John Rawls.

自由进步主义胜利的关键标志在于，致力于促进经济机会和其他积极权利的自由主义干预型国家将继续存在。然而，进步自由主义并未取得足以使权宜之计式自由主义失效的决定性胜利。权宜之计式自由主义在每个自由主义社会都拥有相当数量的追随者，其倡导者有时对公共话语具有显著影响。但在实践中，其支持者所能做的最多也只是遏制干预型国家的过度行为。57几乎不可能用一个摒弃社会工程和积极权利的国家来取代它。

The key indicator of liberal progressivism’s triumph is that the interventionist state, committed in its liberal form to fostering economic opportunity as well as other positive rights, is here to stay. Yet progressive liberalism has not won such a decisive victory as to render modus vivendi liberalism irrelevant. Modus vivendi liberalism has a substantial following in every liberal society, and its advocates sometimes have a significant influence on public discourse. But in practice, the best its proponents can do is to curb the excesses of the interventionist state.57 There is virtually no hope of replacing it with a state that eschews social engineering and positive rights.

美国进步主义

Progressivism in America

美国的例子向我们展示了原因。自由进步主义在19世纪末，尤其是在20世纪初，是美国政坛的一股强大力量。几个世纪以来，共和党一直是美国的主要政党，直到1932年总统大选才失去执政权。共和党与进步主义紧密相连。这一时期的一些宪法修正案——授权征收联邦所得税、由普选产生参议员、赋予妇女选举权以及禁止销售酒精饮料——都源于进步主义倡议。甚至连赫伯特·胡佛，也与人们普遍的看法相反，在他1921年至1928年担任商务部长以及1929年至1933年担任总统期间，都积极致力于社会工程。然而，毫无疑问，自由进步主义也经历过起伏，其拥护者最初的乐观情绪也随着时间的推移而逐渐消退。但总体而言，美国政府始终积极参与社会工程。富兰克林·罗斯福的新政（1933-1938）和林登·约翰逊的伟大社会计划（1964-1965）都是雄心勃勃的社会工程尝试，旨在促进积极权利。

The American case shows us why. Liberal progressivism was a powerful force in U.S. politics in the late nineteenth and especially the early twentieth centuries.58 The Republican Party, which was the dominant party until the 1932 presidential election, was closely identified with progressivism. Several constitutional amendments in this era—to authorize the federal income tax, elect senators by popular vote, give women the vote, and prohibit the sale of alcohol—emerged from progressive initiatives. Even Herbert Hoover, contrary to the conventional wisdom, was deeply committed to social engineering when he was secretary of commerce from 1921 to 1928, and as president from 1929 to 1933.59 There is no question, however, that liberal progressivism has had its ups and downs and that its adherents’ initial optimism has waned over time. But overall the U.S. government has remained deeply engaged in social engineering.60 Franklin D. Roosevelt’s New Deal (1933–38) and Lyndon B. Johnson’s Great Society (1964–65) were extremely ambitious attempts at social engineering, aimed at promoting positive rights.

要了解进步主义取得的彻底胜利，不妨考察一下自由主义与当今美国主要政党之间的关系。民主党的执政意识形态显然是进步自由主义，而当它掌控华盛顿的关键权力杠杆时，其行为也与之相符。如果你听共和党人的言论，你可能会认为他们奉行的是权宜之计式的自由主义。这通常适用于他们的言辞，但并非他们的执政方式。在执政期间，共和党人的行事方式与民主党人并无二致。例如，自1982年以来，联邦支出的年增长率在共和党总统（里根、老布什和小布什）执政期间高于民主党总统（希拉里·克林顿和奥巴马）。1982年至1985年间，里根执政期间的联邦支出增长率为8.7%，而2010年至2013年间，奥巴马执政期间的联邦支出增长率仅为1.4%。 61

To understand how thoroughly progressivism has triumphed, consider how liberalism relates to the major political parties in the United States today. The Democratic Party’s ruling ideology is clearly progressive liberalism, and it acts accordingly when it controls the key levers of power in Washington. If you listen to Republicans, you might think they follow the dictates of modus vivendi liberalism. That is usually true of their rhetoric, but it is not how they govern. In office, Republicans act like Democrats. For example, the annualized growth of federal spending since 1982 grew more under Republican presidents (Reagan, Bush 41, and Bush 43) than Democrats (Clinton and Obama). It grew by 8.7 percent under Reagan between 1982 and 1985, but only 1.4 percent under Obama between 2010 and 2013.61

里根总统于1986年签署了《紧急医疗救治和积极分娩法案》，该法案禁止医院拒绝前来急诊室就诊的患者。无论患者是否为美国公民、其法律身份如何，或是否负担得起治疗费用，都不得拒绝为其提供救治。实际上，该法案表明医疗保健是一项人权。事实上，早在1961年，里根总统就曾表示，“在美国，任何需要医疗救助但无法自行获得医疗救助的人都应该得到救助。” 62共和党人承认这项权利的另一个证据是他们经常使用的口号“废除并取代”。他们明白，他们不能简单地废除平价医疗法案。《医疗保健法案》必须取而代之的是另一套旨在为美国民众提供体面医疗保健的体系。共和党总统主导了州际公路系统、环境保护署和国土安全部的建立。简而言之，共和党人坚定地拥护国家干预主义及其带来的广泛社会工程。

Reagan also signed into law in 1986 the Emergency Medical Treatment and Active Labor Act, which prohibits hospitals from turning away people who come to an emergency room for treatment. It does not matter whether those individuals are American citizens, what their legal status is, or whether they can afford the treatment. In effect, this law says that health care is a human right. In fact, Reagan said as early as 1961 that “any person in the United States who requires medical attention and cannot provide it for himself should have it provided for him.”62 Further evidence that Republicans recognize this right comes from the often-repeated slogan “repeal and replace.” They understand they cannot simply eliminate the Affordable Care Act but must substitute another system that aims to provide Americans with decent health care. Republican presidents oversaw the beginnings of the Interstate Highway System, the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Department of Homeland Security. Republicans, in short, are deeply committed to the interventionist state and the extensive social engineering that comes with it.

美国确实存在一个真正致力于“共存式自由主义”（modus vivendi freedomism）的政党，它恰如其分地被称为自由意志党（Libertarian Party）。该党致力于促进公民自由和自由放任资本主义，并废除福利国家。其党纲直指积极权利：“我们追求一个自由的世界；一个每个人都能自主掌控自己生活，任何人都不必为了他人利益而被迫牺牲自身价值观的世界。” 63自由意志党从未在国会赢得过任何席位，也从未接近过入主白宫。该党候选人在2016年总统选举中仅获得3.3%的选票。即便自由意志党真的掌权，他们也必将发现自己沦为干预主义国家及其雄心勃勃的社会计划的囚徒。

The United States does have a political party that is genuinely committed to modus vivendi liberalism, and it is appropriately called the Libertarian Party. It is dedicated to promoting civil liberties and laissez-faire capitalism and to abolishing the welfare state. Its party platform takes dead aim at positive rights: “We seek a world of liberty; a world in which all individuals are sovereign over their own lives and no one is forced to sacrifice his or her values for the benefit of others.”63 The Libertarian Party has never won a single seat in Congress and never come close to winning the White House. Its candidate in the 2016 presidential election received 3.3 percent of the vote. Even if the Libertarians ever did gain power, they would surely find themselves prisoners of the interventionist state and its ambitious social programs.

进步主义为何获胜

Why Progressivism Won

进步主义最终战胜了权宜之计式的自由主义，因为19世纪初席卷全球的深刻变革迫使各国建立致力于社会工程的大型机构。对于自由民主国家而言，这种工程包括干预公民社会以促进权利。国家日益增强的干预能力促进了这些新角色的发挥。例如，通信和交通的进步使得政府更容易渗透到公民社会中。沃尔特·李普曼在1914年写道，他捕捉到了时代的精神：“我们不能再把生活视为自然而然降临到我们身上的东西。我们必须有意识地去应对它，设计它的社会组织，改变它的工具，制定它的方法，教育它并控制它。” 64

Progressivism won out over modus vivendi liberalism because the profound changes that began sweeping across the world in the early nineteenth century forced states to build large-scale institutions dedicated to social engineering. For liberal democracies, this engineering included intervention in civil society to promote rights. These new roles were facilitated by the states’ increasing capacity to handle them. For example, improvements in communications and transportation made it increasingly easy for governments to penetrate civil society. Walter Lippmann, writing in 1914, captured the spirit of the times: “We can no longer treat life as something that has trickled down to us. We have to deal with it deliberately, devise its social organization, alter its tools, formulate its method, educate and control it.”64

推动进步自由主义兴起的三大主要力量是工业革命。首先是工业革命，它始于18世纪的英国，至今仍在持续产生巨大的经济和社会效益。变革。除其他因素外，它还促成了大型企业的崛起——例如制造企业、金融公司、行业协会、研究型大学和工会等等——这些企业深刻地影响了数百万人的生活。约翰·杜威对此做了精辟的阐述：“新技术应用于生产和商业，引发了一场社会革命。原本毫无预兆的地方社区，发现自己的事务被遥远而隐形的组织所左右。” 65

Three major forces drove progressive liberalism’s ascendancy. The first was the Industrial Revolution, which started in England in the eighteenth century and continues even today to generate enormous economic and social change. Among other things, it led to the rise of large-scale enterprises—manufacturing companies, financial firms, trade associations, research universities, and labor unions, to name a few—that profoundly affected the lives of millions of people. John Dewey put the point well: “The new technology applied in production and commerce resulted in a social revolution. The local communities without intent or forecast found their affairs conditioned by remote and invisible organizations.”65

工业化带来的另一个后果，即前文所述的通信和交通网络的增长，不仅体现在国家层面，也体现在国际层面。工业革命推动了全球化，这意味着任何一个国家的重大经济发展都不可避免地会影响到体系中的其他国家，使世界日益相互依存。工业化也导致了童工、工人剥削和环境破坏。鉴于这些以及其他影响深远的发展，国家别无选择，只能认真介入社会各方面的管理，包括经济。 66鉴于相关企业的规模庞大、技术变革日新月异以及工业资本主义的全球性，所需的规划和监管力度远远超出了地方政府的能力范围。

Another consequence of industrialization, the aforementioned growth in communication and transportation networks, occurred not just at the national level but at the international level as well. The Industrial Revolution helped fuel globalization, which meant that major economic developments in any one country inevitably affected other countries in the system and made the world increasingly interdependent. Industrialization also led to child labor, worker exploitation, and environmental damage. Given these and other hugely consequential developments, the state had no choice but to get seriously involved in managing various aspects of society, including the economy.66 Given the sheer size of the relevant enterprises, the speed at which technology changes, and the global nature of industrial capitalism, the necessary levels of planning and regulating were far beyond the capacities of local governments.

令奉行权宜之计的自由主义者们大为懊恼的是，指望“看不见的手”在经济中施展魔法并非可行之策。自由主义国家或许信奉资本主义和市场经济，但这并不妨碍干预主义国家对本国经济以及国际经济进行严格监管。67这些任务涉及制定和实施不可避免地会影响个人权利的政策。

Much to the chagrin of modus vivendi liberals, relying on the invisible hand to work its magic in the economy is not a feasible strategy. Liberal countries might be wedded to capitalism and a market economy, but that does not prevent the interventionist state from closely regulating not only its own economy but the international economy as well.67 These tasks involve making and implementing policies that unavoidably affect individual rights.

进步自由主义胜利背后的第二个关键力量是民族主义。与工业化一样，民族主义在十九世纪成为国际政治的主导力量。我将在下一章详细讨论民族主义，但这里只需指出，所有国家都有充分的理由（行政、经济和军事方面的理由）在其人民中培养强烈的民族认同感，而这需要广泛的社会工程。这项工作永无止境，不仅因为新生公民需要社会化，还因为一些国家允许大规模移民。此外，大多数国家都是多民族国家，这意味着它们必须努力在不同群体之间建立共同的身份认同。

The second key force behind the triumph of progressive liberalism is nationalism, which, like industrialization, became a dominating force in international politics during the nineteenth century. I will discuss nationalism at length in the next chapter, but suffice it to say here that all states have powerful reasons (administrative, economic, and military) to foster in their people a strong sense of nationhood, which requires extensive social engineering. This task never ends, not only because newly born citizens have to be socialized but also because some states allow large-scale immigration. Moreover, most states are multinational, which means they have to work assiduously to forge a common identity among their different groups.

与此同时，民族主义在公民与国家之间建立起牢固的联系，使人们期望政府通过提供福利来回报他们的忠诚。这种需求强化了民族国家干预的倾向，在自由民主国家，这种干预包括促进人权。民主制度进一步强化了这种干预主义。选民要求政治家提出促进他们福祉的政策，而那些做出大胆承诺并兑现承诺的政治家更有可能当选并连任。这种民意压力使得大多数政治家倾向于支持，或者至少不会强烈反对那些促进机会平等和其他积极权利的政策。

At the same time, nationalism creates powerful bonds between citizens and the state, leading people to expect their government to reward their loyalty by providing for their welfare. This demand reinforces the nation-state’s inclination toward intervention, which includes, in liberal democracies, the promotion of rights. Democracy further bolsters this interventionism. Voters demand that politicians put forward policies that promote their welfare, and politicians who make bold promises and deliver on them are likely to get elected and reelected. This popular pressure causes most politicians to favor, or at least not fervently oppose, policies that promote equal opportunity and other positive rights.

进步自由主义占据主导地位的第三个主要因素是战争性质的改变以及维持庞大的和平时期军事机构的必要性。现代军队通常包含大量身着制服的人员以及众多文职人员，并依赖于庞大且不断更新的精密武器库，如今，对一些国家而言，这其中就包括威力巨大的核武器。军队还依赖于私营企业的制造、后勤和服务，从而形成了德怀特·艾森豪威尔所说的“军工复合体”。国家别无选择，只能管理这个庞然大物，因为军队是国家不可分割的一部分。 68军队需要健康且受过良好教育的公民，这促使政府有强大的动力去保障公民的福利。而政府也必须保障那些最终穿上军装的公民的福利。 69

The third major force behind progressive liberalism’s dominance is the changing nature of warfare and the need to maintain a large peacetime military establishment. Modern militaries invariably contain large numbers of individuals in uniform as well as numerous civilian employees, and rely on a vast and constantly changing arsenal of sophisticated weaponry that today, for several states, includes massively destructive nuclear weapons. They depend as well on manufacturing, logistics, and services from private businesses, creating what Dwight Eisenhower called the military-industrial complex. The state has no choice but to manage this behemoth, because the military is an integral part of the state.68 The need to fill the ranks of the military with healthy and well-educated citizens gives the government a powerful incentive to provide for the welfare of its citizenry. And it must then provide for the welfare of those citizens who end up wearing a uniform.69

当现代军队进行大规模战争，尤其是像两次世界大战这样的“总体战”时，国家最终会干预日常生活的几乎方方面面。如果政府希望调动必要的资源赢得战争，就几乎别无选择。然而，其结果是，国家发现了自身大规模进行社会工程的能力。正如社会学家莫里斯·贾诺维茨在谈到第二次世界大战时所指出的那样：“一个能够动员起来进行总体战的社会，就被定义为一个能够动员起来进行社会福利的社会。因此，中央政府在战争期间的实际表现，对于推动福利国家的建立至关重要。本质上，政治精英们获得了管理福利国家的知识和信心。” 70

When these modern militaries fight major wars, especially “total wars” like the two World Wars, the state ends up interfering in almost every aspect of daily life. The government has little alternative if it hopes to mobilize the resources necessary to win. The result, however, is that the state discovers its ability to do social engineering on a grand scale. As the sociologist Morris Janowitz notes regarding World War II: “A society that could mobilize for total war was defined as one that could mobilize for social welfare. Thus it was the actual performance of the central government during the war that was crucial in the thrust toward a welfare state. In essence, the political elites gained the knowledge and the confidence that they could manage the welfare state.”70

即使国家卷入旷日持久的冲突，例如冷战和所谓的全球反恐战争，而这些冲突并不涉及大规模军队的交锋，它们仍然会对公民社会产生深远的影响。例如，在冷战期间，美国针对非裔美国人的公然种族主义使得美国决策者难以在国际上宣传美国政治制度优于共产主义。正如法律史学家玛丽·杜齐亚克所指出的，“在当时美国希望按照自己的意愿重塑战后世界之际，国际社会对种族隔离问题的关注令人不安且尴尬。”正如理查德·尼克松在艾森豪威尔总统任内担任副总统时明确承认的那样，纠正这一问题的必要性在推动民权运动中发挥了重要作用。 71换句话说，“民权改革在某种程度上是冷战的产物”，因为这一变革“与对抗世界共产主义这一更为核心的任务相一致，并且至关重要”。 72

Even when states become involved in protracted conflicts that do not involve the clashing of mass armies, like the Cold War and the so-called global war on terror, they still interfere profoundly in civil society. During the Cold War, for example, blatant racism against African Americans in the United States made it difficult for American policymakers to promote the U.S. political system internationally as superior to communism. As the legal historian Mary Dudziak notes, “At a time when the United States hoped to reshape the postwar world in its own image, the international attention given to racial segregation was troublesome and embarrassing.” The need to rectify this problem played an important role in propelling the civil rights movement, as Richard Nixon explicitly acknowledged when he was vice president under Eisenhower.71 In other words, “civil rights reform was in part a product of the Cold War,” because that change was “consistent with and important to the more central mission of fighting world communism.”72

战争结束后，归国的士兵往往会向国家提出诉求。例如，来自被剥夺投票权群体的退伍军人很可能会要求获得投票权。正如历史学家亚历山大·凯瑟所指出的：“美国历史上几乎所有重大的选举权扩张都发生在战争期间或战后。历史记录表明，这并非巧合：战争本身以及备战的需求都对扩大投票权产生了强大的压力。军队需要招募，而这些士兵往往来自所谓的社会底层，在剥夺民众选举权的同时强迫他们拿起武器，无论从道义上还是实践上都是困难的；同样，发动战争意味着动员民众支持，这赋予了任何被排除在政治体系之外的社会群体政治影响力。” 73

When wars end, the returning soldiers often make demands on the state. For example, veterans who come from groups that have been denied the right to vote are likely to demand it. As the historian Alexander Keyssar notes: “Nearly all of the major expansions of the franchise that have occurred in American history took place either during or in the wake of wars. The historical record indicates that this was not a coincidence: the demands of both war itself and preparedness for war created powerful pressures to enlarge the right to vote. Armies had to be recruited, often from the so-called lower orders of society, and it was rhetorically as well as practically difficult to compel men to bear arms while denying them the franchise; similarly, conducting a war meant mobilizing popular support, which gave political leverage to any social groups excluded from the polity.”73

退伍军人还会申请养老金、医疗保健和教育福利。例如，美国内战结束后，负责处理军人养老金的养老金管理局“成为联邦政府规模最大、最活跃的机构之一”。正如社会学家西达·斯科克波尔所指出的，“到20世纪初……许多美国选民和公民似乎都希望将这一政策先例延续到……”更广泛地提供老年养老金。” 74 1930年，养老金管理局并入新成立的退伍军人事务部，该部门如今拥有约35万名员工，预算超过1500亿美元。二战后，无数美国退伍军人利用《退伍军人权利法案》（GI Bill）进入大学深造，该法案也使参加过朝鲜战争、越南战争、阿富汗战争和伊拉克战争的退伍军人受益。 75

Returning soldiers also make claims for pensions, health care, and educational benefits. After the American Civil War, for example, the Bureau of Pensions, which handled military pensions, “became one of the largest and most active agencies of the federal government.” As the sociologist Theda Skocpol notes, “By the early twentieth century . . . many American voters and citizens appear to have wanted to extend this policy precedent into more widely available old-age pensions.”74 In 1930, the Bureau of Pensions became part of the new Veterans Administration, which today has roughly 350,000 employees and a budget of over $150 billion. Following World War II, countless American veterans went to college on the G.I. Bill, which also benefited veterans of the wars in Korea, Vietnam, Afghanistan, and Iraq.75

简而言之，出于国家安全考虑，自由主义国家不仅需要进行大规模的社会改造，还需要倡导个人权利。这两项努力都促进了进步自由主义的发展。在当今世界，权宜之计式的自由主义无法在与敌人接触后幸存下来。如今，政治自由主义实际上已等同于进步自由主义，权宜之计式的自由主义只能对进步主义进行塑造，而无法取而代之。

In short, national security considerations force liberal states not only to engage in large-scale social engineering but also to promote individual rights. Both efforts foster progressive liberalism. In the modern world, modus vivendi liberalism cannot survive contact with an enemy. Political liberalism today is effectively synonymous with progressive liberalism, and modus vivendi liberalism can only hope to shape progressivism, not replace it.

在批判政治自由主义之前，我想简要考察一下功利主义和自由主义理想主义，它们有时被描绘成自由主义理论，但至少根据我的定义，它们并不是。

Before turning to a critique of political liberalism, I want to briefly examine utilitarianism and liberal idealism, which are sometimes portrayed as liberal theories but, at least under my definition, are not.

功利主义

Utilitarianism

杰里米·边沁是功利主义的思想之父，但他绝非这一传统中唯一的杰出人物，詹姆斯·密尔、他的儿子约翰·斯图亚特·密尔、亨利·西奇威克以及其他许多人也都是这一传统的代表人物。功利主义的拥护者认为，政治的首要目标是找到提升社会整体幸福感的方法。幸福感是这一理论中的效用，而领导者的关键目标是推行有助于“最大多数人的最大幸福”的政策。 76

Jeremy Bentham is the intellectual father of utilitarianism, although he is hardly the only luminary in that tradition, which includes James Mill, his son John Stuart Mill, Henry Sidgwick, and many others. Advocates of this ism maintain that the primary goal of politics is to find ways of promoting the overall happiness of society.
