In the age of the dynastic state, desertion was a major problem for military commanders both before and during battles. Rulers built their armies with mercenaries and “the criminal, the vagabond, and the destitute” from their own societies, and these soldiers felt little loyalty to the country for which they were fighting.69 By far a greater motivation was to avoid getting killed. Desertion is much less of a problem when soldiers are drawn from a nationalistic population: they are primed to defend their country by putting themselves in harm’s way. Napoleon captured this shift when he proclaimed, “All men who value life more than the glory of the nation and the esteem of their comrades should not be members of the French army.”70

当一方利用民族主义建立起强大的军队，而另一方却没有时，民族主义会对战争的结局产生深远的影响。1789年法国大革命后，法国民族主义助力拿破仑打造了欧洲最强大的军队。曾作为普鲁士军官与这支军队作战的卡尔·冯·克劳塞维茨这样描述它的威力：“这辆建立在全民力量之上的战争巨轮，开始了它横扫欧洲的征程。它如此自信而坚定地前进，以至于无论何时遇到传统类型的军队，战局都毫无悬念。” 71其他国家要想生存下去，只有建立起像法国军队那样的军队，而实现这一目标的唯一途径就是培育民族国家。 72

Nationalism can have a profound effect on the outcome of a war when one side uses it to build a powerful military while its opponents do not. After French nationalism in the wake of the 1789 Revolution helped Napoleon create the mightiest army in Europe, Carl von Clausewitz, who fought against it as an officer in the Prussian military, described its prowess: “This juggernaut of war, based on the strength of the entire people, began its pulverizing course through Europe. It moved with such confidence and certainty that whenever it was opposed by armies of the traditional type there could never be a moment’s doubt as to the result.”71 Other countries could hope to survive only if they built an army like the French army, and the only way to do that was to cultivate a nation-state.72

最后，治理一个致力于促进民族主义的国家背后存在着双重逻辑。首先，各类领导人都渴望获得民众的拥护。他们希望民众尽可能团结一致，忠于国家，但这并非易事，因为任何社会都无法就何为美好生活达成彻底共识。通过培育共同文化，加强人民与国家之间的联系，民族主义可以成为维系原本纷争不断的人民的纽带。

Finally, there is a two-pronged logic behind governing a state that works to promote nationalism. First, leaders of all kinds desire popular allegiance. They want their people to be as united as possible and feel loyal to the state, which is not easy to achieve given that no society can ever reach a thoroughgoing consensus about what constitutes the good life. By fostering a common culture and tight bonds between the people and their state, nationalism can be the glue that holds otherwise disputatious people together.

以十六、十七世纪的英国和法国为例，当时国家作为一种政治形式刚刚兴起，两国都饱受天主教徒和新教徒之间的冲突之苦。安东尼·马克思在其著作《民族信仰》中阐述了伦敦和巴黎的统治者如何竭力结束这些冲突，并在各自的国家构建共同文化。他指出，他们的目标不仅在于增强民众的凝聚力，还在于建立民众对统治者的忠诚。 73尽管他们并未最终建立起国家（国家是后来才出现的），但他们在两国都取得了显著的成功。然而，他们的努力解释了为什么英国和法国是最早演变为民族国家的王朝国家之一。

Consider Britain and France in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries, when states were just emerging as a political form and both countries were riven with conflicts between Catholics and Protestants. In his book Faith in Nation, Anthony Marx explains how the ruling monarchs in London and Paris diligently worked to end those conflicts and construct a common culture in their respective countries. Their aim, he notes, was not simply to generate greater cohesion in the populace but also to build loyalty between the people and their rulers.73 They were largely successful in both cases, although they did not go so far as to create nations, which came later. Nevertheless, their efforts explain why Britain and France were among the earliest dynastic states to evolve into nation-states.

各国政府也有强大的动机去塑造社会，以简化日常治理。政治领导人和官僚都厌恶复杂性，因为它使他们难以理解周遭世界，也难以将其转化为有利于国家的利益。他们尤其不愿治理一个拥有众多地方文化、各自边界、教育体系、计量单位、产权制度、规则和语言的国家。为了解决这个问题，统治精英们会进行社会工程，旨在让人们更容易了解自己的国家，从而简化治理。成功的关键在于消除异质性，詹姆斯·斯科特认为，这涉及两个互补的过程：简化和清晰化。“一个完全清晰的社会，”斯科特写道，“通过统一的规范、身份、统计数据、法规和衡量标准，消除了地方对信息的垄断，并创造了一种全国性的透明度。”但所有“国家简化”措施中“最有效”的莫过于“强制推行单一官方语言”。74使社会更加同质化意味着超越地方文化，建立一个统一的国家，即使这不是目的。

States also have powerful incentives to shape their societies in ways that make day-to-day governance easier. Political leaders and bureaucrats alike abhor complexity, because it makes it difficult for them to make sense of the world around them and manage it to their state’s advantage. They especially dislike trying to run a country where a variety of local cultures have their own boundaries, educational systems, measures, property systems, rules, and languages. To remedy this problem, governing elites engage in social engineering aimed at making it easier to gain knowledge about their country, which, in turn, makes it easier to administer. The key to success is to eliminate heterogeneity, which, according to James Scott, involves complementary processes: simplification and legibility. “A thoroughly legible society,” Scott writes, “eliminates local monopolies of information and creates a kind of national transparency through the uniformity of codes, identities, statistics, regulations, and measures.” But the “most powerful” of all “state simplifications” is “the imposition of a single, official language.”74 Making a society more homogeneous means transcending local cultures and building a unified nation, even if that is not the intent.

总之，正如民族有充分的理由渴望建立自己的国家一样，国家也总是试图将其人口塑造成民族国家。民族主义根深蒂固的互补逻辑将民族和国家融合为民族国家，并使其成为世界主导的政治形式。这是自由主义必须面对的现实之一。

In sum, just as nations have powerful reasons to want their own states, states invariably try to mold their populations into nations. The complementary logics at the root of nationalism work to meld nations and states together into nation-states and have made them the dominant political form in the world. This is one of the realities that liberalism must deal with.

与支配者同居

Living with the Dominator

要理解自由主义和民族主义之间的关系，最好的切入点是列举它们的主要区别。主要有五点。首先，自由主义关注个人，较少关注社会群体。民族主义则恰恰相反：它以社会群体为中心，而这个群体当然就是国家。个人虽然并非无关紧要，但它从属于国家，这赋予了个人强烈的参与感，让他们觉得自己参与了一项拥有悠久而伟大传统的事业。

The best starting point for understanding the relationship between liberalism and nationalism is to list their main differences. There are five key ones. First, liberalism focuses on the individual and pays little attention to social groups. Nationalism does the opposite: it rivets on the social group, which of course is the nation. The individual, while not irrelevant, is subordinate to the nation, which provides him with a powerful sense of participation in an enterprise with a timeless and grand tradition.

其次，自然权利和宽容是自由主义理论的核心组成部分。民族主义很少关注它们，尽管一个民族国家当然可以拥有自己的一套权利并宣扬宽容。

Second, natural rights and toleration are central components of liberal theory. Nationalism pays them little attention, although a nation-state can certainly have its own set of rights and preach toleration.

第三，自由主义既包含特殊主义倾向（源于其认为美好生活没有最终真理），也包含普遍主义倾向（源于其强调不可剥夺的权利）。这两种倾向之间存在着某种张力。民族主义则不具备普遍主义倾向；尽管它具有普遍吸引力，但其本质却是特殊主义的。

Third, liberalism has a particularist strand, which stems from its assumption that there are no final truths about the good life, and a universal strand, derived from its emphasis on inalienable rights. A certain tension exists between these strands. Nationalism does not have a universalist strand; despite its universal appeal, it is particularist all the way down.

第四，尽管国家对这两种理论都至关重要，但它们与广大公众的关系却截然不同。在自由主义理论中，国家的主要职能是充当守夜人、仲裁争端，并进行重要的社会工程，以促进个人权利并应对现代社会日常生活中遇到的各种问题。而“权宜之计”式的自由主义者则反对社会工程，尤其是反对以促进积极权利为目的的社会工程，但他们在这场斗争中已经败下阵来。自由主义几乎无法在公民中培养任何对国家的情感依恋，即便公民对国家有着巨大的依赖。这种对国家的功能性看法解释了为什么很难激励人们为一个纯粹的自由主义国家而战，甚至牺牲生命。民族主义国家同样维护秩序并进行大量的社会工程，但它却能激发强烈的忠诚感。人们愿意为之战斗，甚至牺牲生命。

Fourth, although the state is of central importance for both theories, its relationship to the wider public is different in each. With liberalism, the state’s main functions are to act as a night watchman, arbitrate disputes, and do significant social engineering for the purposes of promoting individual rights and managing the various problems that attend daily life in a modern society. Modus vivendi liberals are opposed to social engineering, especially for the purpose of fostering positive rights, but that is a battle they have lost. Liberalism cultivates hardly any emotional attachment to the state among its citizens, even despite their enormous dependence on it. This functional view of the state explains why it is hard to motivate people to fight and die for a purely liberal state. The nationalist state also maintains order and does substantial social engineering, but it inspires powerful allegiance. People are willing to fight and die for it.

第五，自由主义和民族主义对领土的看法截然不同。民族主义者往往将他们居住或渴望居住的土地视为神圣之地。那是他们的祖国，因此值得他们付出巨大的牺牲去捍卫。土地的边界在哪里至关重要。自由主义则不认同神圣领土的概念；它很少关注各国如何划定边界，这与自由主义者强调普世权利的理念相符。在自由主义的叙事中，土地最重要的意义在于它是私有财产，个人拥有不可剥夺的拥有权，并可以按照自己的意愿出售。

Fifth, liberalism and nationalism view territory differently. Nationalists tend to think of the land they live on, or aspire to live on, as sacred. It is their fatherland or motherland, and so worth making great sacrifices to defend. Where the land’s borders are located matters greatly. Liberalism has no room for hallowed territory; it pays little attention to where countries draw their borders, which squares with the emphasis liberals place on universal rights. In the liberal story, land is most important as private property that individuals have an inalienable right to own and sell as they see fit.

共存的可能性

The Potential for Coexistence

尽管存在这些差异，但大量证据表明，这两种主义可以在一个国家内共存。然而，必须强调的是，自由主义始终在民族国家的背景下运作。没有民族主义的自由主义是不可能的。我们生活在一个由民族国家构成的世界——这是一个民族主义无处不在的世界。当然，自由主义并非无处不在。直到二战后，国际体系中才出现少数自由民主国家。 75尽管此后自由民主国家的数量大幅增长，但它们从未占到世界国家总数的一半。例如，自由之家报告称，1986年自由民主国家占世界国家总数的34%，2017年占45%，但这一比例呈下降趋势。 76然而，关键在于，所有这些国家并非仅仅是自由民主国家，而是自由主义民族国家。一个纯粹的自由主义国家是不可行的。自由主义需要“民族共同体中非自由主义的一面”。 77

Despite these differences, there is abundant evidence that these two isms can coexist inside a country. It is important to emphasize, however, that liberalism always operates within the context of a nation-state. Liberalism without nationalism is impossible. We live in a world of nation-states—a world of omnipresent nationalism. Liberalism, of course, is not omnipresent. The international system contained few liberal democracies until after World War II.75 Although their numbers have grown substantially since then, they have never accounted for even half the countries in the world. Freedom House, for example, reports that they represented 34 percent of the total in 1986 and 45 percent in 2017, but that the trend line is moving downward.76 The key point, however, is that all of them are not simply liberal democracies but liberal nation-states. A purely liberal state is not feasible. Liberalism requires “the non-liberal underbelly of national community.”77

斯蒂芬·霍姆斯一针见血地指出：“自由主义者之所以能够实现他们的一些理想……仅仅是因为他们对建立在自由主义之前的国家主权现实做出了妥协。自由主义权利只有在既有的、领土明确的国家框架内，并且只有在存在权利强制执行力量的地方才有意义。” 78引用另一位政治理论家威尔·金里卡的话来说：“自由主义者为个人要求的自由，主要不是超越自身语言和历史的自由，而是在自身社会文化中自由行动、与特定文化角色保持距离、选择哪些文化特征最值得发展、哪些毫无价值的自由。” 79

Stephen Holmes captures this point when he writes: “Liberals have succeeded in realizing some of their ideals . . . only because they have compromised with the realities of national sovereignty erected on a preliberal basis. Liberal rights are meaningful only within the confines of pre-existing, territorially-bounded states, and only where there exists a rights-enforcing power.”78 To quote another political theorist, Will Kymlicka: “The freedom which liberals demand for individuals is not primarily the freedom to go beyond one’s language and history, but rather the freedom to move around within one’s societal culture, to distance oneself from particular cultural roles, to choose which features of the culture are most worth developing, and which are without value.”79

我们可以从关于美国民族认同的文献中很好地了解自由主义与民族主义之间的关系。学者们曾经普遍认为美国是一个根深蒂固的自由主义国家，却很少关注美国的民族主义。路易斯·哈茨1955年的经典著作《美国的自由主义传统》就体现了这种观点。他认为，美国生来就是一个自由主义国家，不像欧洲国家那样有着封建传统。由于缺乏显著的政治右翼或左翼，美国反而走向了一种非自由主义的自由主义。但哈茨很少提及美国的民族主义。在这方面，他追随了亚历克西·德·托克维尔和贡纳尔·默达尔的脚步，这两位学者也撰写了关于美国认同的重要著作，但大多忽略了民族主义。

We can get a good sense of how liberalism relates to nationalism from the literature on American national identity. It was once commonplace for scholars to argue that the United States is a deeply liberal country while paying little attention to American nationalism. This perspective is reflected in Louis Hartz’s classic 1955 book The Liberal Tradition in America. He maintains that the United States was born a liberal country and never had a feudal tradition, unlike its European counterparts. Lacking a significant political right or left, it has instead veered toward an illiberal liberalism. But Hartz says little about American nationalism. In this he follows in the footsteps of Alexis de Tocqueville and Gunnar Myrdal, who also wrote important books on American identity that largely ignore nationalism.80

正如罗杰斯·史密斯在其重要著作《公民理想》中所指出的，这是一种“误导性的正统观念” 。81美国身份认同并非像哈茨似乎认为的那样仅仅围绕自由主义展开，而是与民族主义密不可分。史密斯认为，美国的政治精英们……“需要由一群自视为‘人民’的民众来领导”，这其实就是“民族”的另一种说法。 82他强调，本质上是特殊主义的“人民”概念与自由主义强调的“普遍平等的人权”相悖。 83此外，史密斯指出，不可能存在一个纯粹的自由主义国家。 84

This was a “misleading orthodoxy,” as Rogers Smith points out in his important book Civic Ideals.81 American identity does not revolve only around liberalism, as Hartz seemed to think, but is inextricably bound up with nationalism. Political elites in the United States, Smith argues, “require a population to lead that imagines itself to be a ‘people,’” which is another way of saying a nation.82 He emphasizes that conceptions of peoplehood, which are particularist at their core, are at odds with liberalism’s emphasis on “universal equal human rights.”83 Moreover, Smith notes that it is impossible to have a purely liberal state.84

在现代学者中，史密斯关于“民族性”重要性的观点似乎占据了上风。例如，阿纳托尔·利文的《美国民族主义》和塞缪尔·亨廷顿的遗作《我们是谁？》都清晰地反映了民族主义在美国政治生活中的重要性。亨廷顿最为担忧的是，美国的民族认同正在逐渐消亡，最终可能只剩下自由主义信条，而这本身不足以长期维系美国的存续。85

Among modern scholars, it appears that Smith’s view of the importance of “peoplehood” has won the day. For example, the importance of nationalism in American political life is clearly reflected in Anatol Lieven’s American Nationalism and Samuel Huntington’s last book, Who Are We? Huntington’s great concern was that America’s national identity is withering away and that eventually it will be left with only its liberal creed, which by itself cannot sustain the United States for long.85

最后，正如大卫·阿米蒂奇提醒我们的那样，《美国独立宣言》不仅强调了个人权利的普遍性，也十分重视“一个民族”建立主权的理念，而这当然正是当时殖民者正在做的事情。他称该宣言为“美利坚民族的出生证明”（我稍作修改，称之为“美利坚民族国家的出生证明”）。阿米蒂奇认为，在“这两个截然不同的要素”之间，建国者及其后继者更关注“通过行使人民主权来建立一个新国家”，而非“个人权利的理念”。他认为，《宣言》之所以具有如此广泛的普遍吸引力，更多地是基于其主权维度，而非权利维度。 86

Finally, as David Armitage reminds us, the American Declaration of Independence did not just emphasize the universality of individual rights. It also paid much attention to the idea of “one people” establishing sovereignty, which, of course, is what the colonists were doing at the time. He calls the Declaration “the birth certificate of the American nation.” (I would modify this slightly and call it the birth certificate of the American nation-state.) Between these “two distinct elements,” Armitage maintains, the founders and their successors paid more attention to “the assertion of popular sovereignty to create a new state” than to “ideas of individual rights.” He argues that the Declaration’s substantial universal appeal is based more on the sovereignty dimension than the rights one.86

在相关问题上，一些学者区分了公民民族主义和文化或种族民族主义。对他们而言，“公民”一词是“自由”的委婉说法，其本质含义是他们谈论的几乎完全基于自由主义价值观来构建一个国家。换言之，他们认为，即使没有一套被广泛接受的独特实践和信仰体系，也可以建立一个国家。仅凭自由主义就能做到这一点。持此观点的学者通常以美国和西欧国家为例，说明这种现象的成功之处。 87公民民族主义的概念恰好契合了哈茨对美国的描述。

On a related matter, some scholars make a distinction between civic nationalism and cultural or ethnic nationalism. For them, the word civic is a euphemism for liberal, which essentially means they are talking about fashioning a nation based almost exclusively on liberal values. In other words, they are asserting that one may have a nation without a culture based on a widely accepted package of distinct practices and beliefs. Liberalism alone can do the job. Scholars who make this argument usually hold up the United States and the countries of Western Europe as successful examples of this phenomenon.87 The notion of civic nationalism captures Hartz’s description of the United States.

公民民族主义并非一个有用的概念。虽然自由主义价值观可以成为一个国家文化的一部分，但它们不能成为国家认同的唯一基础。公民民族主义之所以缺乏意义，很大程度上是因为……像国家这样的社会群体，必然拥有各种根深蒂固的习俗和信仰，这些习俗和信仰对其成员的日常生活至关重要。一个国家如果没有多元的文化，几乎不可能有效运作。88这就是为什么当今大多数研究美国文化的学者都强调民族主义和自由主义的原因。美国，如同所有国家一样，拥有丰富的文化，其中包括各种各样的习俗和信仰。这使得美国人不仅是自由主义者，更是自由民族主义者。当一个人自认为是美国人时，实际上就是在表明她是一位美国民族主义者。

Civic nationalism is not a useful concept. While liberal values can be a component of a nation’s culture, they cannot be the sole basis of national identity. Civic nationalism is not a meaningful notion in good part because social groups like nations invariably have a variety of deeply rooted practices and beliefs that matter greatly in their members’ daily lives. It is virtually impossible for a nation to function effectively without a multifaceted culture.88 This is why most scholars who write about American culture today emphasize nationalism as well as liberalism. The American nation, like all nations, has a rich culture, which includes a variety of practices and beliefs. This makes Americans not simply liberals but liberal nationalists. When someone self-identifies as an American, she is effectively saying she is an American nationalist.

民族主义为何占据主导地位

Why Nationalism Dominates

现在应该很清楚，民族主义比自由主义更有影响力。民族主义无处不在，而自由主义则不然。自由主义总是必须在民族主义国家的背景下运作。然而，认为自由主义无关紧要是错误的。尽管在与民族主义的直接冲突中，自由主义几乎总是失败，但它仍然是一种强大的意识形态。

It should be clear by now that nationalism is a more powerful force than liberalism. Nationalism is pervasive, while liberalism is not. Liberalism always has to operate in the context of a nationalist state. Still, it would be wrong to think that liberalism matters for little. Even though it almost always loses in a direct conflict with nationalism, liberalism is a powerful ideology.

这两种主义并非总是水火不容。在一个主要由单一民族构成且拥有深厚文化底蕴的社会中，它们之间应该鲜有冲突。在包括美国在内的此类国家，民族主义不应阻碍充满活力的公民社会的建立，而公民社会应享有相当大的个人权利和免受国家干预的自由。同样的逻辑也适用于多民族国家，在这些国家中，核心民族和少数族裔相互尊重彼此的权利，并包容彼此的差异。当今的加拿大和印度，由于其民族文化较为单一，就属于这种情况。

The two isms are not always at loggerheads. There should be little conflict between them in a society that largely comprises one nation and has a thick culture. In such cases, which include the United States, nationalism should not get in the way of creating a vibrant civil society with considerable room for individual rights and freedom from state interference. The same logic should apply in multinational states where the core nation and the minority nations respect each other’s rights and are tolerant of each other’s differences. Present-day Canada and India, with their thin national cultures, fit in this category.

当一个多民族国家的不同群体之间存在根深蒂固的敌意时，自由主义与民族主义就会发生冲突。在这种情况下，面对民族间的敌意，自由主义几乎不可能立足。当群体间的关系充满愤怒和仇恨时，宽容和平等权利的倡导就极其困难。通常情况下，最强大的民族群体会以不自由的方式歧视较弱的群体。以色列对待巴勒斯坦人的行为就是一个很好的例子，而随着印度教极端主义的兴起，印度也面临着沦为非自由民主国家的危险。89

Liberalism and nationalism conflict when there is deep hostility between the different groups in a multinational country. In those circumstances, it is almost impossible for liberalism to take hold in the face of national animosities. When relations between groups are filled with anger and hatred, tolerance and equal rights are extremely difficult to promote. Usually in such instances, the most powerful national group discriminates against the weaker group in an illiberal way. Israel’s behavior toward the Palestinians is a good example, and with the rise of Hindu extremism, India is in danger of becoming an illiberal democracy.89

这些情况有利于民族主义，原因有二。首先，自由主义者过分强调个人权利的重要性，而个人权利正是其理论的核心。大多数人关心权利，但这并非他们迫切需要关注的问题，其在日常政治生活中的影响远比自由主义者所认为的要有限得多。尤其当权利与民族主义敌意激起的激情发生冲突时，这种影响就更加有限了。其次，也是更重要的一点，民族主义比自由主义更符合人性。自由主义错误地将个人视为只关心自身利益的效用最大化者，而非具有强烈社会意识的个体。民族主义基于一个正确的信念，即个人总是对自己的群体有着强烈的忠诚感，因此它更能满足一些至关重要的人类需求。这就是为什么它在现代世界无处不在，而自由主义却并非如此。

These circumstances favor nationalism for two reasons. First, liberals oversell the importance of individual rights, which is at the heart of their theory. Most people care about rights, but it is not a burning issue for them, and its influence in daily political life is much more limited than liberals recognize. It is especially limited when the rights conflict with the passions aroused by nationalist animosities. Second and more importantly, nationalism is more in sync with human nature than liberalism, which mistakenly treats individuals as utility maximizers who worry only about their own welfare, rather than as intensely social beings.90 Nationalism, which is predicated on the correct belief that individuals invariably have a strong sense of loyalty toward their own group, is better at addressing several critically important human needs.91 This is why it is a ubiquitous force in the modern world and liberalism is not.92

自由主义之所以无法成为维系社会团结的纽带，正是因为它无法赋予个人社群归属感。它无法让人们感受到自己是某个庞大而充满活力的群体的一份子，而这个群体既特殊又值得尊重。这种归属感对于人们的心理健康以及社会的完整性都至关重要。这个问题部分源于自由主义的特殊主义倾向——它强调原子化的个体，赋予他们权利，却鲜少赋予他们义务——部分源于其普遍主义倾向：它强调不可剥夺的权利，这些权利适用于所有人，而不仅仅是特定群体的成员。

It is because liberalism fails to provide individuals with a sense of community that it cannot provide the glue to hold a society together. It does not make them feel they are part of a large and vibrant group that is special and worthy of esteem, which is important to people psychologically as well as for keeping a society intact. This problem derives partly from liberalism’s particularist strand—that it rivets on atomistic individuals who have rights but few duties and obligations—and partly from its universalist strand: its emphasis on inalienable rights, which apply to all people, not just the members of a particular group.

事实上，自由主义不仅无法维系社会的完整，它还有可能侵蚀这些纽带，最终损害社会的根基。问题的根源在于自由主义的极端个人主义及其对效用最大化的强调。它几乎不重视培养社群意识和关爱同胞的重要性。相反，它鼓励每个人追求自身利益，并假定所有个人自私行为的总和将构成公共利益。当代自由主义强调人人机会平等，这在一定程度上抵消了这种利己主义行为，尽管并非所有自由主义者都支持这一目标。简而言之，自由主义不仅对社会建设贡献甚微，而且其某些特征还会破坏社会凝聚力。

In fact, liberalism does not simply fail to provide the bonds to keep a society intact; it also has the potential to eat away at those bonds and ultimately damage the society’s foundations. The taproot of the problem is liberalism’s radical individualism and its emphasis on utility maximization. It places virtually no emphasis on the importance of fostering a sense of community and caring about fellow citizens. Instead, everyone is encouraged to pursue his own self-interest, based on the assumption that the sum of all individuals’ selfish behavior will be the common good. This self-regarding behavior is somewhat countered by contemporary liberalism’s emphasis on ensuring equal opportunity for everyone, although not all liberals support that goal. In brief, liberalism not only contributes little to building societies but also has features that undermine social cohesion.

与此相反，民族主义的核心在于社群以及成员对集体的责任。与自由主义不同，民族主义致力于创造归属感，满足个人渴望成为拥有悠久传统和美好未来的大型群体一员的情感需求。此外，民族主义非常适合维系社会团结，但多民族国家除外，因为在这些国家中，各民族之间存在敌对关系。

Nationalism, in contrast, is all about community and members’ responsibilities to the collectivity. Unlike liberalism, it works toward creating a sense of belonging. It satisfies individuals’ emotional need to be part of a large group with a rich tradition and a bright future. Moreover, nationalism is well suited to holding a society together, except in multinational states where the constituent nations are hostile to each other.

自由主义在将个人与国家联系起来方面也做得不够好。在自由主义的叙事中，国家是个人之间社会契约的产物，其主要任务是保护个人免受彼此侵害，并允许每个人追求自己对美好生活的理解。尽管国家致力于促进公民机会平等，但一些自由主义者对这一使命提出质疑，而且根据定义，自由主义国家干预公民生活的能力有限。在自由主义的叙事中，个人不被期望对国家有深厚的感情依恋，也很难想象他们会为国家献出生命。另一方面，民族主义则在个人和国家之间建立起牢固的联系。许多人强烈倾向于为自己的民族国家而战，甚至在必要时献出生命。

Liberalism also does a poor job of tying the individual to the state. In the liberal story, the state is the product of a social contract among individuals, and its main task is to protect them from each other and allow each to pursue her own notion of the good life. Although the state works to promote equal opportunity for its citizens, some liberals contest that mission, and the liberal state, by definition, has limited capacity to interfere in its citizens’ lives. Individuals in the liberal story are not expected to have a deep emotional attachment to their state, and it is hard to imagine them putting their lives on the line for it.93 Nationalism, on the other hand, creates strong bonds between individuals and their state. Many people are strongly inclined to fight and die, if necessary, for their nation-state.

最后，现代世界绝大多数人都非常重视领土。他们的身份认同与他们视为神圣的土地紧密相连。当然，这种观点是民族主义的核心，也是其吸引力所在。自由主义则忽视了身份认同与领土之间的联系。乌代·梅塔认为，“英美自由主义传统的政治理论家们，大多不仅忽视了政治身份认同与领土之间的联系，而且在概念化前者时，至少在潜移默化中否认了后者及其与身份认同之间联系的重要性。” 94土地作为私有财产对自由主义而言固然重要，但这又是另一个问题了。

Finally, the vast majority of people in the modern world care greatly about territory. Their identity is bound up in land they consider sacred. This perspective, of course, is central to nationalism and accounts for much of its appeal. Liberalism ignores the link between identity and territory. Uday Mehta maintains that “political theorists in the Anglo-American liberal tradition have, for the most part, not only ignored the links between political identity and territory, but have also conceptualized the former in terms that at least implicitly deny any significance to the latter and the links between the two.”94 Land is important to liberalism as private property, but that is a different matter.

这一切都表明，自由主义在塑造日常生活中可以发挥重要作用，但它几乎总是屈居于民族主义之下。

All of this is to say that liberalism can have an important role in shaping daily life, but it almost always plays second fiddle to nationalism.

过度宣传个人权利

Overselling Individual Rights

自由主义对权利的论证基于两个论点。首先，世界上绝大多数人都认识到这些权利是什么，并认为这些权利是普遍的、不可剥夺的，这意味着它们平等地适用于所有人。每个人的权利都不可被赋予或剥夺。其次，人们普遍认为个人权利至关重要，在政治领域应享有优先权。然而，我们有充分的理由质疑这两种假设。权利并非无关紧要，人们当然可以论证权利应当是普遍的、不可剥夺的，即便这一点并非在所有地方都成立，但在某些国家，权利仍然至关重要，因为它们是根深蒂固的传统的一部分。例如，1689年的英国《权利法案》主要源于光荣革命的政治背景，它援引“古老的权利和自由”获得了合法性。95

The liberal case for rights rests on two claims. First, the overwhelming majority of people around the world recognize what those rights are and think they are universal and inalienable, meaning they apply equally to everyone in the world and cannot be given or taken away. Second, people across the board believe individual rights are truly important and should be privileged in the political arena. There are good reasons to doubt both of these suppositions. Rights are not insignificant, one can certainly argue that they should be universal and inalienable, and even if that is visibly not true everywhere, they are still of great importance in particular countries, where they form part of a well-established tradition. The 1689 English Bill of Rights, for example, which arose mainly out of the politics of the Glorious Revolution, gained legitimacy by invoking “ancient rights and liberties.”95

过分强调不可剥夺权利的概念会造成理论和证据上的双重难题。仔细审视其背后的逻辑，就会发现有三个理由让我们对任何被广泛认可的权利体系的存在持怀疑态度；而深入研究历史记录，会发现大量证据支持这种怀疑。

Privileging the concept of inalienable rights creates theoretical as well as evidentiary problems. When you look carefully at the underlying logic, there are three reasons to be skeptical that any widely agreed-upon body of rights can exist; and when you look closely at the historical record, it provides considerable evidence to back up that skepticism.

虚假的普世主义

False Universalism

首先，自由主义假定，对于何为美好生活，不可能达成全球共识。特定社会或许能在基本原则上达成实质性共识，但除了人人享有生存权这一基本信念之外，它们永远无法达成普遍共识。然而，与此同时，自由主义者坚持认为，存在一套客观正确的个人权利，而且这些权利是可以辨别的，它们彼此之间的关系，以及它们是不可剥夺的。

For starters, liberalism assumes there is no possibility of a worldwide consensus on what constitutes the good life. Particular societies may reach substantial agreement on first principles, but they will never achieve universal agreement, save for the belief that everyone has a basic right to survival. At the same time, however, liberals maintain that there is some objectively correct set of individual rights, and that it is possible to discern what those rights are, how they relate to each other, and that they are inalienable.

既然个人权利的核心在于基本原则，这又怎能说得通呢？它们对于界定人们如何看待和对待他人至关重要。因此，考虑到我们批判能力的局限性，很难相信人们能在权利是否不可剥夺、权利应该是什么以及哪些权利应该优先等问题上达成近乎普遍的共识。在“权宜之计”（modus vivendi）和进步自由主义者之间，关于个人是否享有平等机会以及更广泛的积极权利，存在着根本性的分歧。即使是见多识广、心怀善意的公民，在堕胎权或平权行动权等问题上也存在着深刻的分歧。这些都是……它们探讨了美好生活，并表明我们不应该指望理性提供集体真理。

How can this be, since individual rights are all about first principles? They are profoundly important for defining how people think about and act toward their fellow humans. Thus it is hard to believe, given the limits of our critical faculties, that there can be anything close to universal agreement on whether rights are inalienable, what they should be, and which ones should take precedence. There is a fundamental disagreement between modus vivendi and progressive liberals over whether individuals have a right to equal opportunity, and over positive rights more generally. Well-informed, well-meaning citizens disagree profoundly over whether there is a right to abortion or to affirmative action. These are matters that deal with the good life, and they show that we should not expect reason to provide collective truths.

更进一步来说，将权利置于任何政治体系的核心，就等同于认为最佳的政治秩序是自由主义秩序。很难想象，在没有自由主义国家，或者至少是准自由主义国家的情况下，如何才能赋予权利以特权。政治自由主义者有时对非自由主义团体或国家表现出令人惊讶的不宽容，他们认为唯一合法的政治秩序是自由主义秩序。这种信念在美国由来已久，路易斯·哈茨在《美国的自由主义传统》一书中对此进行了阐述。约翰·罗尔斯在《万民法》中也体现了这种信念，他明确指出，最佳的世界是由自由民主政体构成的世界。96约翰·洛克也强调，自由主义社会不能容忍不遵守自由主义规则的团体。

To take this a step further, placing rights at the core of any political system is tantamount to saying that the best political order is a liberal one. It is difficult to imagine how it is possible to privilege rights in the absence of a liberal or at least quasi-liberal state. Political liberals are sometimes surprisingly intolerant toward illiberal groups or states, thinking that the only legitimate political order is a liberal one. This belief has long been widespread in the United States, as Louis Hartz makes clear in The Liberal Tradition in America. It is also on display in John Rawls’s The Law of Peoples, where he makes it clear that the best world is one populated solely with liberal democracies.96 John Locke also emphasized that liberal societies cannot tolerate groups that do not play by liberal rules.

因此，当自由主义者谈论不可剥夺的权利时，他们实际上是在定义美好生活。他们并没有对这两者做出任何有意义的区分。但是，如果自由主义的一个公理（也得到了观察的支持）是，你无法就基本原则达成普遍共识，那么由此可知，你也无法就个人权利达成全球共识。

Thus when liberals talk about inalienable rights, they are effectively defining the good life. They make no meaningful distinction between these two subjects. But if it is an axiom of liberalism (backed up by observation) that you cannot get universal agreement on first principles, then it follows that you cannot get a planetary consensus on individual rights.

我在前一章中提到，政治自由主义存在一个悖论，其根源在于它的核心既包含特殊主义倾向，也包含普遍主义倾向。特殊主义倾向源于自由主义认为美好生活并无真理可言，而普遍主义倾向则与不可剥夺的权利概念紧密相连。我强调，这两个维度彼此之间存在张力。但根据我在此的分析，这个悖论便不复存在，因为正确理解的自由主义本质上就是特殊主义的。正如美好生活本身不存在普遍共识一样，个人权利也不存在普遍共识，因为这两个领域之间并无本质区别。

I noted in the previous chapter that there is a paradox in political liberalism, which stems from the fact that its core holds a particularist as well as a universalist strand. The particularism, of course, comes from the liberal belief that there is no truth regarding the good life, while the universalism is tied to the concept of inalienable rights. These two dimensions, I emphasized, are in tension with each other. But under my analysis here, that paradox disappears, because liberalism properly understood is particularist all the way down. There can be no universal agreement about individual rights, just as there is no universal agreement about the good life, because there is no meaningful difference between those two realms.

特朗普权利

Trumping Rights

自由主义关于权利的思想存在第二个理论问题：其他因素有时会将权利置于次要地位。当政治稳定（关乎个人安全和福祉）与权利发生冲突时，人们通常会优先考虑政治稳定而非权利。例如，如果权利以及自由民主本身会导致混乱，那么……如果个人权利意味着剥夺或死亡，那么在实践中，即使在原则上真心支持个人权利的公众中，个人权利也不太可能发挥多大作用。

There is a second theoretical problem with liberal thinking about rights: other considerations sometimes push them into the background. People will usually privilege political stability, which involves their personal security and welfare, over rights when the two come into conflict. For example, if rights, and liberal democracy generally, lead to disorder, which might mean privation or death, individual rights are unlikely to matter much in practice, even among a public that in principle genuinely favors them.

这种逻辑很可能适用于多民族国家，尤其是在各敌对派系之间存在根深蒂固的敌意的情况下。在这种情况下，许多人会倾向于选择一位能够遏制其他派系的威权领导人。然而，也存在一些国家因某种原因陷入动荡，而采用自由民主制度只会使问题更加恶化的情况。最后，个人权利有时会让位于对外部威胁的担忧。长期面临生存威胁的国家往往会变成“军事化国家”（也称为“国家安全国家”），这些国家常常践踏个人权利。97

This logic is likely to apply in multinational states where there are deep-seated animosities among the rival groups. In such instances, many people will prefer an authoritarian leader who can keep the other factions at bay. There will also be cases, however, where a country is in turmoil for some reason and adopting a liberal democratic system would only make the problem worse. Finally, individual rights sometimes take a backseat to concerns about an external threat. Countries facing existential threats over long periods tend to become garrison states—also known as national security states—that often trample on individual rights.97

关于权利的最后一个理论问题涉及民族主义。根据自由主义的理论，权利平等地适用于所有人，无论身处何地。但这与民族主义的理念背道而驰，因为在民族主义中，主权的概念意味着每个国家都有权自行决定哪些权利重要以及这些权利的重要性。民族国家往往会极力捍卫自身的自决权，因此很难想象它们能够就一套恰当的权利方案达成普遍共识。

The final theoretical problem regarding rights concerns nationalism. According to the liberal story, rights apply equally to everyone, everywhere. But this flies in the face of nationalism, in which the concept of sovereignty means that each state is free to determine for itself which rights matter and how much they matter. Nation-states are likely to be jealous defenders of their self-determination, and it is hard to imagine them reaching a universal consensus on the correct package of rights.

此外，民族主义的本质在于将自身群体置于其他群体之上。在一个几乎完全由民族国家构成的国际体系中，大多数人会更倾向于自己的同胞而非外来者。实际上，各国不太可能给予“他者”与本国人民同等的权利，而当民族主义走向极端时，它们会毫不犹豫地践踏那些它们不喜欢或憎恨的外国人的权利。简而言之，民族主义本质上是特殊主义的，它对不可剥夺的权利观念构成了严重威胁。

Furthermore, nationalism is all about privileging one’s own group over others. In an international system composed almost wholly of nation-states, most people will favor their fellow nationals over outsiders. In practice, countries are unlikely to accord the “other” the same rights given to their own people, and where nationalism turns ugly, they will have little difficulty trampling on the rights of foreigners they dislike or hate. In brief, nationalism, which is particularist to the core, presents a serious threat to the notion of inalienable rights.

有人认为，在民族国家林立的世界里，以普世权利的视角来思考问题很危险。这样做可能会让人们误以为存在某种更高权威——或许是某个国际机构——有权保护他们的权利。事实上，并不存在这样的实体；保护个人权利的是国家，而不是某种凌驾于国家之上的权威。汉娜·阿伦特看到了这个问题：“人权……被定义为‘不可剥夺的’，是因为它们被认为独立于所有政府；但事实证明，一旦人类失去了自己的政府，不得不依靠其最低限度的权利，任何权威都无能为力。”无人保护他们，也没有任何机构愿意保障他们的权利。” 98她认为，无国籍人士和居住在民族国家内部的不受欢迎的少数群体生活在极度危险之中，因为没有任何强制执行机制来捍卫他们的权利，包括生命权，以防他们遭受攻击。“仅仅作为人而赤裸裸地存在，”她辩称，“这才是他们最大的危险。” 99

One can make the case that it is dangerous to think in terms of universal rights in a world of nation-states. Doing so risks giving people the impression that there is some higher authority—maybe some international institution—empowered to protect their rights. In fact, there is no such entity; states protect an individual’s rights, not some superior authority. Hannah Arendt saw the problem: “The Rights of Man . . . had been defined as ‘inalienable’ because they were supposed to be independent of all governments; but it turned out that the moment human beings lacked their own government and had to fall back upon their minimum rights, no authority was left to protect them and no institution was willing to guarantee them.”98 She maintained that stateless people and unwanted minorities residing inside nation-states live in grave danger, because there is no enforcement mechanism to defend their rights, including the right to life, if they come under attack. “The abstract nakedness of being nothing but human,” she argued, “was their greatest danger.”99

阿伦特的解决方案是摒弃普世权利的论调，转而强调“国家保障的权利”。在这一点上，她与埃德蒙·伯克的观点一致，后者“反对法国大革命的《人权宣言》”，并主张权利“源于民族内部”。对阿伦特而言，正如对伯克一样，“依靠一种‘世袭继承’的权利，将其像生命一样传给子孙后代，并主张自身的权利是‘英国人的权利’而非不可剥夺的人权，这才是更明智的做法。” 100她反对这种普世主义的自由主义思潮，很大程度上是出于对自身生存的担忧。

Arendt’s solution was to eschew talk of universal rights and instead emphasize “nationally guaranteed rights.” In this she aligned herself with Edmund Burke, who “opposed the French Revolution’s Declaration of the Rights of Man” and instead made the case that rights “spring ‘from within the nation.’” For Arendt, as for Burke, “It was much wiser to rely on an ‘entailed inheritance’ of rights which one transmits to one’s children like life itself, and to claim one’s rights to be the ‘rights of an Englishman’ rather than the inalienable rights of man.”100 Her opposition to this universalist strand of liberalism was driven in good part by concerns about survival.

自然权利与历史

Natural Rights and History

如果理性告诉我们，每个人都拥有一套不可剥夺的权利（正如自由主义者所宣称的那样），那么我们理所当然地会认为，至少一些重要的前现代思想家应该理解这一基本事实。然而事实并非如此。亚里士多德、柏拉图以及马基雅维利显然都没有自然权利的概念。霍布斯和洛克直到十七世纪才开始构建自由主义的基础。其他一些思想家，如本杰明·康斯坦、康德和孟德斯鸠，继承了他们的事业，但许多其他政治哲学家对自由主义关于个人权利的论述却鲜有关注，甚至有些思想家，如伯克和边沁，还明确地对此提出了质疑。因此，我们甚至无法做出一个不那么笼统的论断：一旦主要思想家认识到自然权利的重要性，就必然会形成牢固的共识。关于权利是不可剥夺的，或者权利是政治生活的基础，从来没有达成过普遍共识。

If reason tells us that everyone possesses a set of inalienable rights, as liberals claim, then it seems reasonable to expect that at least some important premodern thinkers would have understood this basic fact of life. That is not the case. Aristotle and Plato, as well as Machiavelli, apparently had no concept of natural rights. Hobbes and Locke did not begin developing the foundations of liberalism until the seventeenth century. Others, such as Benjamin Constant, Kant, and Montesquieu, followed in their footsteps, but many other political philosophers paid little attention to the liberal story about individual rights, and some, such as Burke and Bentham, explicitly challenged it. Thus it is not even possible to make the less sweeping claim that once the leading thinkers recognized the importance of natural rights, a solid consensus emerged. There has never been universal agreement that rights are inalienable or that they are fundamental to political life.101

此外，自由主义者自身对于哪些权利最重要以及如何权衡这些权利之间的冲突也存在分歧。当平等问题也被纳入考量时，情况就变得尤为复杂。102 约翰·罗尔斯认为“运用自由主义原则具有某种简洁性”，但这并非总是如此。103以仇恨言论为例。一些在言论自由问题上持绝对主义立场的自由主义者认为，即使他们觉得仇恨言论令人憎恶，也应该容忍它。然而，另一些自由主义者则希望禁止仇恨言论，因为它会严重伤害那些被攻击的人，这些人有权免受言语攻击，正如他们有权免受身体攻击一样。104对于如何对这些不同的权利进行排序，并没有无可争议的办法。正如约翰·格雷所指出的，“所有政权都体现了对相互竞争的自由的特定权衡。” 105

Furthermore, liberals themselves disagree about which rights matter most and how to weigh them when they come into conflict. The problem is especially complicated when promoting equality is thrown into the mix.102 John Rawls maintains that “applying liberal principles has a certain simplicity,” but this is only sometimes true.103 Think about hate speech. Liberals who are absolutists regarding free speech believe it should be tolerated even if they find it abhorrent. Other liberals, however, want to ban it because it can seriously hurt those who are targeted, who have the right to be protected from verbal abuse just as they have a right to be protected from physical abuse.104 There is no indisputable way to determine how to rank these different rights. As John Gray notes, “All regimes embody particular settlements among rival liberties.”105

霍布斯和洛克关于个人权利的思想深受偶然性和历史因素的影响。当时天主教徒和新教徒之间充满仇恨的冲突，以及英国正在发生的深刻社会经济变革，都对自由主义的奠基思想产生了深远的影响。简而言之，政治意识形态并非仅凭理性就能产生。它们往往在历史的关键节点上发展起来，自由主义也不例外。

Hobbes’s and Locke’s thinking about individual rights was significantly shaped by contingency and history. The hate-filled conflict between Catholics and Protestants that raged in their day, coupled with the deep socioeconomic changes taking place in Britain, deeply influenced the foundational ideas of liberalism. In short, political ideologies are not created by reason alone. They tend to develop at critical points in history, and liberalism is no exception.

即使最坚定的个人权利拥护者，在极端紧急情况下通常也愿意限制甚至无视权利。当个人或国家的生存受到威胁时，权利绝不能妨碍人们采取一切必要手段来求生。例如，约翰·斯图亚特·密尔认为，“人类无论个体还是集体，干预任何成员行动自由的唯一正当理由是自卫。” 106迈克尔·沃尔泽主张各国应在严格的道德准则下进行战争，他的观点与密尔不谋而合。在他著名的正义战争理论论著的结尾，他写道，当“我们不仅面临失败，而且面临可能给政治共同体带来灾难的失败”时，所有规则都将失效。 107约翰·罗尔斯也认为，“政治自由主义允许在极端紧急情况下豁免某些权利。” 108

Even the staunchest advocates of individual rights are usually willing to limit, even disregard, rights in a supreme emergency. When an individual’s or a country’s survival is at stake, rights cannot be allowed to get in the way of doing whatever is necessary to endure. John Stuart Mill, for example, maintains that “the sole end for which mankind are warranted, individually or collectively, in interfering with the liberty of action of any of their number, is self-protection.”106 Michael Walzer, who argues that countries should fight wars under a strict moral code of conduct, follows in Mill’s footsteps. At the end of his famous tract on just war theory, he writes that all the rules go out the window “when we are face-to-face not merely with defeat but with a defeat likely to bring disaster to a political community.”107 John Rawls too maintains that “political liberalism allows the supreme emergency exemption.”108

经历过巨大动荡的国家或地区通常对政治稳定表现出强烈的渴望，这种渴望甚至超过了建立自由民主的愿望。例如，最近一项针对中东阿拉伯青年的调查发现，53%的受访者认为“促进地区稳定比促进民主更重要”，只有28%的人持反对意见。109再来看看保罗·卡加梅总统的例子，卡加梅是一位独裁领导人，他严重限制卢旺达的言论自由。卢旺达在1994年经历了种族灭绝。他的主要目标是限制胡图族（种族灭绝的实施者）和图西族（种族灭绝的主要受害者）之间的敌对行动。卡加梅取得了巨大的成功，尽管他的政策不自由，但他仍然连任三届总统，这并不令人意外。110

Countries or regions that have experienced great upheaval usually show a yearning for political stability that trumps any desire to create a liberal democracy. For example, a recent survey of Arab youth in the Middle East found that 53 percent of the respondents believe that “promoting stability in the region is more important than promoting democracy.” Only 28 percent disagreed.109 Consider too the case of President Paul Kagame, an authoritarian leader who seriously limits free speech in Rwanda, which experienced genocide in 1994. His main aim is to limit hostilities between the Hutus, who perpetrated the genocide, and the Tutsis, who were its principal victims. Kagame has enjoyed great success, and not surprisingly he has been elected to three terms as president despite his illiberal policies.110

鉴于俄罗斯在20世纪90年代的经历，如今俄罗斯强烈偏好秩序而非权利和民主也就不足为奇了。当时，俄罗斯试图拥抱西式民主，结果却惨遭失败，导致大规模的腐败和混乱。自21世纪初以来，俄罗斯的威权主义倾向稳步增强，并在此过程中基本恢复了秩序。全俄公共舆论中心2014年3月进行的一项民意调查显示，“71%的俄罗斯人表示，他们愿意牺牲公民自由来维护稳定、秩序和个人福祉。” 111

Russia’s strong preference for order over rights and democracy today is hardly surprising given what happened there in the 1990s, when its attempt to embrace Western-style democracy failed miserably, creating corruption and disorder on a grand scale. Since the early 2000s, Russia has become steadily more authoritarian, largely restoring order in the process. A March 2014 poll conducted by the All-Russian Public Opinion Center showed that “seventy-one percent of Russians say they are ready to sacrifice civil freedoms to maintain stability, order and personal well-being.”111

最后，如果个人权利得到几乎所有人的认可和高度尊重，那么将自由主义传播到其他国家应该相当容易。但事实并非如此。人们很容易被说服尊重自己的权利，但要让他们相信他人的权利同样重要却是一项艰巨的任务。推广一种最基本的民主模式要容易得多，这种模式只要求自由公正的选举，胜者当选即可。自由主义在西方扎根经历了漫长的过程，而西方正是它的发源地，也是它影响最大的地区。 112当然，这正是美国及其欧洲盟友致力于将自身价值观传播到西方以外地区的原因。 113

Finally, if individual rights are recognized and highly regarded by almost everyone, it should be reasonably easy to spread liberalism to other countries. But it is not. People are easily persuaded to respect their own rights, but convincing them that others’ rights are equally important is a difficult task. It is much easier to advance a bare-bones version of democracy that demands nothing more than free and fair elections in which the winners take office. It took a long time for liberalism to take root throughout the West, which is where it got started and has had the greatest impact.112 Of course, this is why the United States and its European allies are committed to spreading its values beyond the West.113

然而，即便在西方国家内部，对个人权利的承诺也比大多数人意识到的要软弱得多。在美国，一些领导人在认为国家面临极端紧急情况时，侵犯了个人权利。这种现象最著名的例子或许是亚伯拉罕·林肯在内战（1861-1865）期间的举措。当时，他暂停了人身保护令，审查邮件，设立军事法庭，并逮捕了“被他认定为正在或即将从事不忠和叛国行为”的人。 114此外，正如克林顿·罗西特在《宪政独裁》一书中明确指出的那样，内战并非美国政治领导人在他们认为极其危险的情况下严重限制公民权利的唯一一次。人们或许会认为，美国民众会对此强烈抗议，或者至少会发起大规模的示威活动。当他们的权利受到限制时，他们并没有抗议，主要是因为美国公众对个人权利的支持有时出人意料地软弱。

Even within the West, however, the commitment to individual rights is softer than most people realize. In the United States, leaders have violated individual rights when they thought the country was facing an extreme emergency. Probably the best-known example of this phenomenon is Abraham Lincoln’s actions during the Civil War (1861–65), when, among other things, he suspended habeas corpus, censored the mail, instituted military tribunals, and arrested individuals “who were represented to him as being or about to engage in disloyal and treasonable practices.”114 Moreover, as Clinton Rossiter makes clear in Constitutional Dictatorship, the Civil War is not the only time America’s political leaders seriously limited rights in circumstances they felt were highly dangerous. One might expect there was a huge outcry, or at least significant protests, from the American people when their rights were curtailed. But they did not protest, mainly because the public’s support for individual rights in the United States is sometimes surprisingly soft.

美国人民对自由主义的灵活态度的最佳例证，莫过于他们在内战前容忍奴隶制，以及在内战后对南北双方公然的种族主义容忍至20世纪60年代中期。如今，种族主义在社会上不再那么容易被接受，但远未消失。19世纪乃至20世纪的大部分时间里，对移民的歧视普遍存在。这种歧视如今也只是被掩盖了一部分。阿里斯蒂德·佐尔伯格将19世纪后半叶美国对华人移民的政策描述为“美国移民史上唯一一次成功的‘种族清洗’”。115 19世纪30年代开始大量移居美国的欧洲人，在20世纪的大部分时间里也面临着明显的歧视。 116或许没有哪个群体比爱尔兰人处境更糟，他们被统治阶级的盎格鲁-撒克逊新教徒精英所鄙视。对欧洲族裔群体而言，没有比第一次世界大战期间德裔美国人所遭受的歧视更严重的例子了。117虽然美国从建国之初在原则上就是一个彻底的自由主义国家，但在其历史的大部分时间里，它在实践中却几乎算不上自由主义美德的典范。

The best evidence of the American people’s flexible commitment to liberalism is that they tolerated slavery until the Civil War, and then tolerated blatant racism in both the North and the South until the mid-1960s. Racism today is less socially acceptable but has hardly vanished. There was widespread discrimination against immigrants throughout the nineteenth century and well into the twentieth. This too rests a few inches underground today. Aristide Zolberg describes U.S. policy toward Chinese immigrants in the latter half of the nineteenth century as the “only successful instance of ‘ethnic cleansing’ in the history of American immigration.”115 The Europeans who began moving to the United States in large numbers in the 1830s also faced marked discrimination well into the twentieth century.116 Probably no group had it worse than the Irish, who were despised by the ruling WASP elites. And there is no greater instance of discrimination against a European ethnic group than what happened to German Americans during World War I.117 Although America was a thoroughly liberal country in principle from its inception, for most of its history it has hardly been a paragon of liberal virtue in practice.

幸运的是，这种针对非裔美国人和移民的不自由行为已基本从公众视野中消失，美国如今在实践和理论上都力求成为一个自由主义国家。但美国公众对个人权利的支持并不特别深入。尽管关于权利的讨论在当代美国十分普遍，但这仅仅是自20世纪50年代以来才出现的现象。在此之前，美国人对个人权利并不太关注。118

Fortunately, this illiberal behavior toward African Americans and immigrants has mostly disappeared from public view, and the United States now strives to be a liberal country in practice as well as in theory. But the American public’s support for individual rights is not especially deep. While the discourse about rights is pervasive in contemporary America, that has been the case only since the 1950s. Before then, Americans did not pay much attention to individual rights.118

尽管目前人们对权利很感兴趣，但政治学家杰拉尔德·罗森伯格指出，许多美国人对不可剥夺权利的真正含义知之甚少，包括这些权利应当具有普遍适用性。罗森伯格指出，大多数人将权利等同于自身的偏好。他们倾向于提出符合自身利益的权利主张，而对那些不利于自身利益的主张则漠不关心。因此，美国人愿意在对自己有利时限制重要权利也就不足为奇了。罗森伯格在分析了各种民意调查后得出结论：他认为，“美国人将新闻自由权仅仅理解为出版人们想读的内容的权利。如果美国公众不喜欢某些内容，那么媒体就不应该出版。” 关于言论自由，他发现“美国人既非常认同抽象意义上的言论自由，又强烈反对不受欢迎群体的言论自由。” 他强调，这两种情况都“为权利即偏好这一概念提供了大量的经验支持。” 120显然，许多美国人并不真正认同普世权利原则。如果真是如此，很难想象其他地方会存在对不可剥夺权利的热情拥护，因为没有哪个国家像美国那样拥有如此丰富的自由主义传统。

The present interest in rights notwithstanding, according to the political scientist Gerald Rosenberg, many Americans understand little about the real meaning of inalienable rights, including that they are supposed to apply universally.119 Rosenberg shows that most equate rights with their own preferences. They tend to make rights claims that support their own interests but pay little attention to claims that do not. Thus it is unsurprising that Americans are willing to curtail important rights when it suits them. Rosenberg concludes, after examining a variety of public opinion surveys, that “Americans view the right to a free press as meaning only the ability to publish what people prefer to read. If the American public does not like the content, then the press should not be able to publish it.” Regarding free speech, he finds that “Americans are both deeply committed to free speech in the abstract and strongly opposed to free speech for unpopular groups.” Both cases, he emphasizes, provide “a good deal of empirical support for the notion of rights as preferences.”120 It seems clear that many Americans are not deeply committed to the principle of universal rights. If that is true, it is hard to imagine that a passionate commitment to inalienable rights exists elsewhere, since no country has as rich a liberal tradition as the United States.

归根结底，自由主义的普世价值远没有自由主义者所认为的那么强大。自由主义者关于个人权利重要性的主张远没有他们自己认为的那么令人信服，甚至可能完全错误。这种狭隘的权利观直接影响到宽容和国家——这两个在自由社会中促进和平与繁荣的机制。公民越尊重个人权利，就越容易促进宽容和以和平方式解决冲突，从而减少国家维护秩序的工作量。但如果对权利的尊重不足，促进宽容就会更加困难，国家在维护国内和平方面的作用也会更加突出。

The bottom line is that the universal strand of liberalism is nowhere near as powerful as liberals believe. Liberal claims about the importance of individual rights are much less compelling than liberals seem to believe, and might even be dead wrong. This circumscribed view of rights has direct implications for toleration and the state, the other two mechanisms that foster peace and prosperity in a liberal society. The more that citizens respect individual rights, the easier it is to promote tolerance and peaceful conflict resolution, and thus reduce the work the state has to perform to keep order. But if respect for rights is thin, it will be more difficult to promote tolerance, and the state’s role in maintaining peace at home will loom larger.

专制主义的诱惑

The Authoritarian Temptation

有一个可能对自由主义造成毁灭性打击的论点需要加以探讨。詹姆斯·麦迪逊早在《联邦党人文集》第十篇中就指出了这一点。 121我认为这个论点最终并不能揭示自由主义理论的致命缺陷，但它确实解释了为什么建立和维护自由主义政治秩序往往十分困难。

There is a potentially devastating argument against liberalism that needs to be addressed. James Madison identified it long ago, in Federalist No. 10.121 I do not think this argument ultimately reveals a fatal flaw in the theory, but it surely explains why it is often difficult to establish and maintain a liberal political order.

问题的根源在于，每个国家在基本原则上总会存在一些尖锐的分歧，因此总会有派系争夺权力。正如我们所见，谁来治理国家至关重要，因为掌权的派系可以制定规则，而在任何社会中，谁制定规则，谁就能在一定程度上决定什么是……美好生活。并不存在仅仅充当敌对派系间仲裁者的中立国家。政府必然由某个派系或几个派系联合执政，而在这个过程中，它将以重要的方式塑造社会。

The taproot of the problem is that because there are always some sharp differences over first principles in every country, there will always be factions competing for power. As we saw, it matters greatly who governs the state because the faction in charge gets to write the rules, and in any society, whoever writes the rules gets to determine in part what constitutes the good life. There is no such thing as a neutral state that merely acts as an umpire among rival factions. One faction, or some combination of factions, has to run the government, and in the process it will shape society in important ways.

因此，在自由民主政体中，每个派系都有强烈的动机去掌控国家，而不是将权力拱手让给竞争对手。在中东，这种现象通常被称为“一人一票，仅此一次”。122这里存在两种动机逻辑。显然，夺取政权的派系可以制定规则，而不必担心在未来的选举中输给可能修改规则的竞争对手。此外，每个派系都有充分的理由认为其他派系都理解这种逻辑，因此任何信任其他派系的派系都有可能被利用。最好先发制人，在其他派系抢占先机之前长期掌控国家。这种看似不可避免的行为，即使竞争对手本身对自由主义并无敌意，也会摧毁自由民主政体。

Thus each faction in a liberal democracy has a strong incentive to take over the state and not relinquish power to a rival faction. In the Middle East, this phenomenon is commonly referred to as “one man, one vote, one time.”122 Two motivating logics are at play here. Obviously, the faction that seized control would get to write the rules and not have to worry about losing a future election to a rival faction that might rewrite the rules. Additionally, each faction has good reason to think that every other faction understands this logic, and thus any faction that trusts another faction risks being played for a sucker. It is better to move first and capture the state for the long term before another faction beats you to the punch. This kind of behavior, which might seem unavoidable, would destroy a liberal democracy, even if the rival factions have no animus toward liberalism per se.

然而，自由民主并非注定会因为这种激励机制而失败。一个秩序井然的自由国家拥有一些独特的特征，有助于其免于崩溃，尽管各派系之间可能仍会存在一种不稳定的对峙局面。五个关键因素共同作用，缓解了这一问题。

Still, liberal democracy is not doomed to fail because of this incentive structure. A well-ordered liberal state has specific features that help insulate it from collapse, although it may remain an uneasy standoff between factions. Five key considerations work together to attenuate the problem.

第一个特点是各派系之间的权力平衡。如果没有哪个派系特别强大，那么任何派系试图夺取政权都意义不大，因为这种举动几乎肯定会导致内战。如果某个派系特别强大，它就可以遵守规则，赢得选举，并按照自己的意愿长期治理国家。它没有必要永久掌控政权。唯一潜在的危险情况是，某个特别强大的派系认为自己会随着时间推移而失去权力。这会促使它在衰落发生之前就破坏自由民主。这种情况的逻辑类似于预防性战争。但即便如此，其他派系也一定会制衡这个强大但正在衰落的派系。

The first feature is balance-of-power behavior among various factions. If no single faction is especially powerful, it makes little sense for any faction to try to capture the state, because that move would almost certainly lead to a civil war. And if one faction is especially powerful, it can afford to play by the rules, get elected, and run the state over the long term in ways that it sees fit. It has no need to take control permanently. The one potentially dangerous situation is where there is an especially powerful faction that thinks it will lose its power over time. This creates incentives to undermine liberal democracy before the decline happens. The logic of this situation resembles that of preventive war. But even in this case, the rival factions will surely balance against the powerful, albeit declining, faction.

第二个需要考虑的因素是交叉分歧的存在，这在自由主义国家很常见。大多数人都有多种利益，这些利益会影响他们的政治观点。同时，各种各样的问题都可能激发一个派别的行动，这意味着并非每个派别都出于相同的目的。社会关注的是同一个问题。123这两个事实结合起来意味着，不同的人有时会在一个问题上处于对立阵营，但在另一个问题上却站在同一阵线。这种结果使得任何试图掌控国家政权、终结自由民主的派系都面临着更加复杂的局面。

The second consideration is the presence of crosscutting cleavages, which are common in liberal states. Most people have multiple interests that contribute to their political views. At the same time, there is a diverse array of issues that can motivate a faction, which means that not every faction in a society is concerned with the same issue.123 These two facts, when put together, mean that different individuals will sometimes find themselves in competing factions on one issue but on the same side on another. This outcome complicates the problem for any faction that might try to capture the state and put an end to liberal democracy.

第三个因素是有机团结，借用涂尔干的术语来说。124自由社会内部的劳动分工造成了广泛的经济相互依存。人们在经济层面有着深刻的联系。他们依赖其他公民谋生、发展，而最重要的是，为了生存。如果某个派系试图征服国家，就可能引发内战，这将破坏这种团结，并严重损害整个社会。

The third factor is organic solidarity, to borrow Durkheim’s term.124 The divisions of labor within a liberal society create extensive economic interdependence. People are intertwined at the economic level in profound ways. They depend on their fellow citizens in order to make a living and prosper, and most importantly, to survive. A civil war, which might ensue if one faction tried to conquer the state, would undermine that solidarity and gravely harm the entire society.

第四个考量因素是民族主义。自由民主国家本质上是拥有根深蒂固文化的民族国家。其公民共享某些习俗和信仰，这有助于缓和彼此间的差异。至少对大多数人而言，这些关键信仰之一必然是对自由民主的普遍价值以及自身自由民主国家的价值深信不疑。换言之，自由主义是民族认同的一部分。公民在基本原则上仍会存在根本分歧，这意味着派系林立。然而，自由民主作为民族认同的组成部分，即使其理论本身无法提供这种凝聚力，也能起到一定的维系作用。

The fourth consideration is nationalism. Liberal democracies are ultimately nation-states with deeply rooted cultures. Their citizens share certain practices and beliefs, and this works to ameliorate differences among them. One of those key beliefs, at least for most people, is sure to be a deep-seated faith in the virtues of liberal democracy in general and their own liberal democratic state in particular. Being liberal, in other words, is part of one’s national identity. Citizens will still have fundamental differences over first principles, which means there will always be factions. Still, the fact of liberal democracy as an element of national identity can serve as a kind of glue, even if the theory cannot provide this glue.

第五个特征是“深层政府”。125自由民主国家，如同任何现代国家一样，高度官僚化，这意味着它包含大量由职业公务员组成的庞大机构。其中一些官僚机构的主要职责是保护国家免受内外威胁，这必然意味着它们拥有维护现有政治秩序的强大权力。这些机构往往独立运作，与政治基本隔绝，这意味着它们通常不认同任何特定的政治派别。例如，英国公务员忠心耿耿地为保守党和工党政府服务。然而，有时某个派别也能掌控一个官僚国家，就像纳粹在20世纪30年代的德国所做的那样。

The fifth feature is the deep state.125 A liberal democracy, like any modern state, is highly bureaucratized, meaning it contains a good number of large institutions populated by career civil servants. Some of those bureaucracies are principally concerned with protecting the nation and the state against threats from within and without, which invariably means they have significant power to safeguard the existing political order. These institutions tend to operate autonomously, largely insulated from politics, which means that they usually do not identify with any particular faction. British civil servants, for example, devotedly serve both Conservative and Labor governments. Sometimes, however, a faction can capture a bureaucratic state, as the Nazis did in Germany during the 1930s.

最后，至少有三个此类减弱因素通常会随着时间的推移而增强，这表明成熟的自由民主国家应该更加……比新兴国家更具韧性。随着时间的推移，社会成员之间的相互依存程度越高；他们越会受到国家建设的影响；而深层政府也会变得更加强大。总之，内部派系的竞争并不意味着自由主义国家注定会分崩离析。

Finally, at least three of these attenuating factors generally get stronger with time, which suggests that mature liberal democracies should be more resilient than fledgling ones. The more time passes, the more interdependent a society’s members become; the more they will be exposed to nation-building; and the stronger the deep state will become. In sum, the presence of competing internal factions does not mean that liberal states are doomed to fall apart.

然而，在国际舞台上，情况可能大不相同。

On the international stage, however, things may be quite different.

5

5

自由主义走向海外

Liberalism Goes Abroad

前两章着重描述和分析了政治自由主义在国内政治中的应用。现在是时候转换思路，探讨本书的核心问题：当一个强大的国家采取自由主义外交政策时会发生什么？换句话说，当一个高度重视个人权利并致力于通过社会工程来促进这些权利的国家，将这种模式运用到更广阔的国际舞台上时，又会发生什么？

THE PREVIOUS TWO CHAPTERS FOCUSED ON describing and analyzing political liberalism as it applies to politics at home. It is time to shift gears and address the question at the heart of this book: what happens when a powerful state adopts a liberal foreign policy? In other words, what happens when a country that is deeply committed to individual rights and doing social engineering to promote those rights employs that template in the wider world?

这个强大的国家最终将拥抱自由霸权，奉行高度干预主义的外交政策，包括发动战争和在世界各国进行大规模的社会改造。其主要目标是传播自由民主，在此过程中推翻威权政权，最终目标是创建一个完全由自由民主国家组成的世界。实际上，一个追求自由霸权的国家旨在按照自己的意愿重塑国际体系。它还将致力于促进开放的世界经济，并建立国际机构来应对经济和安全问题。

That formidable state will end up embracing liberal hegemony, a highly interventionist foreign policy that involves fighting wars and doing significant social engineering in countries throughout the world. Its main aim will be to spread liberal democracy, toppling authoritarian regimes in the process, with the ultimate goal of creating a world populated solely by liberal democracies. In effect, a state pursuing liberal hegemony aims to remake the international system in its own image. It will also work to foster an open world economy and build international institutions to deal with both economic and security issues.

当一个自由主义国家发现自己有能力推行这项雄心勃勃的政策时，它几乎总是会这样做，这很大程度上是因为它认为这样做的好处非常巨大。这项政策不仅有望保护世界各地人民的权利，据说还能使世界更加和平，并保护国内的自由主义免受敌人的攻击。此外，自由主义霸权为外交政策精英提供了许多诱人的职业机会，因为试图主导全球是一项劳动密集型的事业。最后，这些精英很可能认为自己拥有所需的专业知识和技能。有效地干预他国政治。这种对自身利益的感知以及对实现这些利益能力的信心，必然会促使强大的自由主义国家追求自由主义霸权。

When a liberal country finds itself in a position to pursue this ambitious policy, it will almost always do so, in large part because the perceived benefits are so great. Not only does this policy hold out the promise of protecting the rights of people all around the world, it is also said to make the world more peaceful and protect liberalism at home from its enemies. Moreover, liberal hegemony provides the foreign policy elite with many attractive career opportunities, since trying to dominate the globe is a labor-intensive enterprise. Finally, that elite is likely to think it has the know-how to interfere effectively in the politics of other countries. This combination of perceived benefits and faith in the ability to realize them invariably leads powerful liberal states to pursue liberal hegemony.

自由主义对不可剥夺或普世权利概念的重视意味着，基于自由主义原则的外交政策需要密切关注其他国家的人权状况。当外国人的权利受到威胁时，一个奉行自由主义霸权的强国很可能会感到有必要进行干预，以保护这些个人的权利。该国往往会得出结论：缓解乃至消除个人权利威胁的最佳途径是确保尽可能多的人生活在一个高度重视尊重个人权利的自由民主国家。这种逻辑直接导致其采取积极的政权更迭政策，旨在推翻专制政权，代之以自由民主政体。

The prominence that liberalism accords to the notion of inalienable or universal rights means that a foreign policy based on liberal principles requires careful monitoring of other countries’ human rights performance. When the rights of foreigners are threatened, a powerful state pursuing liberal hegemony will likely feel compelled to intervene to protect the rights of those individuals. That state is apt to conclude that the best way to ameliorate, even eliminate, the threat to individual rights is to make sure that as many people as possible live in a liberal democracy, where respect for individual rights is of great importance. This logic leads straight to an active policy of regime change aimed at toppling autocracies and replacing them with liberal democracies.

自由主义者认为，推广自由民主还有另一个重要原因：它有助于和平。他们认为，自由主义有助于培养超越国界的个人权利意识，进而促进不同国家人民之间的宽容，并激励他们以和平方式解决冲突。各国逐渐将自身视为基于跨国尊重人权的国际社会的一部分，这种强大的共同体意识限制了民族主义的有害影响，并帮助各国超越权力平衡政治的束缚。所有这些都使世界更加和平，核扩散和恐怖主义等问题得以有效解决。一些自由主义者认为，自由主义还能通过促进经济繁荣来进一步推动和平，而经济繁荣本身当然也是最终目标。

Liberals believe there is another important reason to promote the spread of liberal democracy: it facilitates peace. Liberalism, goes the argument, helps foster a deep commitment to individual rights that transcends state borders, and this in turn fosters tolerance among peoples living in different countries and also inspires them to settle their conflicts peacefully. States come to see themselves as part of an international community based on transnational respect for rights, and that powerful sense of community limits the pernicious effects of nationalism and helps states transcend balance-of-power politics. All of this makes for a more pacific world in which problems like nuclear proliferation and terrorism are effectively taken off the table. Some liberals argue that liberalism also helps further peace by enhancing economic prosperity, which of course is an end in itself.1

自由民主国家走​​向由志同道合的国家组成的世界的最终动力在于，这将有效地消除其主要的意识形态竞争对手，这些竞争对手可能在未来某个时候威胁到它们的生存。用伍德罗·威尔逊的名言来说，这将“使世界对民主来说是安全的”。毫无疑问，在全球范围内传播民主是一项极其雄心勃勃的事业，但自由主义者相信这是可以实现的。在他们看来，人们天生珍视个人权利，而且大多数自由主义者都对在国内和国际上进行社会改造的能力充满信心。

The final incentive for liberal democracies to move toward a world populated by like-minded states is that this would effectively eliminate their principal ideological competitors, who might at some point threaten their survival. To use Woodrow Wilson’s famous words, it would “make the world safe for democracy.” While there is no question that spreading democracy around the world is an exceptionally ambitious undertaking, liberals believe it is doable. In their story, people are hardwired to prize individual rights, and most liberals are confident about their ability to do social engineering at home as well as abroad.

我对这个说法有两点异议。首先，自由主义大国很少有机会追求自由主义霸权。它们通常别无选择，只能按照现实主义原则行事，因为它们通常与其他一个或多个大国存在竞争关系。这种论点符合自由主义的基本逻辑，即在缺乏世界国家的情况下，为了生存而战的国家别无选择，只能争夺权力。自由主义要想有效运作，就必须有“守夜人”：它需要一个类似于国家内部存在的等级政治体系。但国际体系是无政府状态，而非等级制。只要自由主义国家在两极或多极格局下运作，它们就别无选择，只能按照现实主义逻辑彼此互动。

I take issue with this story on two counts. First, liberal great powers are seldom in a position to pursue liberal hegemony. They normally have little choice but to act according to realist principles, because they are usually in competition with one or more other great powers. This argument is consistent with basic liberal logic, which effectively says that in the absence of a world state, states bent on survival have little choice but to compete for power. Liberalism has to have a night watchman if it is to work: it demands a hierarchic political system such as exists inside the state itself. But the international system is anarchic, not hierarchic. As long as liberal states operate in either bipolarity or multipolarity, they have no choice but to act toward each other according to realist logic.

其次，有时权力平衡对自由主义国家极为有利，以至于它可以自由地追求自由主义霸权。这种情况最有可能出现在单极格局中，单极格局指的是体系中只有一个大国，因此大国安全竞争成为不可能。冷战结束、苏联解体后，美国就处于这种局面，不出所料，它选择了自由主义霸权。然而，正如美国的例子所示，这种政策总是会以惨败告终，而那些渴望成为自由主义霸权的国家最终往往会为此付出沉重的代价。

Second, circumstances sometimes arise where the balance of power is so favorable to a liberal state that it is free to pursue liberal hegemony. This situation is most likely to occur in unipolarity, which is defined as the presence of only one great power in the system, thus rendering great-power security competition impossible. The United States found itself in this position when the Cold War ended and the Soviet Union collapsed, and unsurprisingly, it embraced liberal hegemony.2 As the American case shows, this policy invariably goes badly awry, and the aspiring liberal hegemon usually ends up paying a big price for having pursued it.

将一个国家转变为自由民主国家极其困难，不仅因为外国文化根深蒂固、难以改变，还因为世界上许多国家并不重视个人权利。此外，民族主义的核心在于自决，这会导致各国抵制外国干涉其内政。最后，即使一个国家追求自由霸权，其他国家也可能遵循权力平衡的逻辑行事，这意味着推行自由主义的国家会遭到它们的强烈抵制。总之，将自由主义作为外交政策会带来诸多问题。

Turning a country into a liberal democracy is extremely difficult, not only because foreign cultures have deep roots and are hard to manipulate, but also because many people around the world do not privilege individual rights. Moreover, nationalism, which is all about self-determination, leads countries to resist foreign interference in their domestic affairs. Finally, even if one country is pursuing liberal hegemony, others are likely to act according to balance-of-power logic, which means the liberalizer will meet stiff resistance from them. In short, liberalism as foreign policy is a source of trouble.

在国家间政治领域，自由主义远不及民族主义和现实主义。这两种主义共同主导了现代国际体系的形成，其影响很可能还会持续下去。当然，如果出现一个世界国家，将国家体系转变为等级制，那么自由主义在国际政治中的力量将会更加强大。但这几乎不可能发生。无政府状态将长期存在，只要无政府状态存在，自由主义就无法为一个国家的外交政策提供坚实的基础。

When it comes to politics among states, liberalism is no match for nationalism and realism. Those two isms together have played the leading role in shaping the modern international system, and their influence is likely to continue. Of course, the appearance of a world state, which would turn the state system hierarchic, would make liberalism a much more potent force in international politics. But there is hardly any chance that will happen. Anarchy is here to stay, and as long as it does, liberalism cannot provide a sound basis for a state’s foreign policy.

自由主义霸权的理由

The Case for Liberal Hegemony

在政治自由主义对外交政策的乐观论述中，关键角色是个人而非国家。自由主义鲜明的个人主义使其成为一种普世意识形态，这深刻影响着自由主义者对国际关系的思考方式。尤其值得一提的是，自由主义的核心假设——每个人，无论身处何地，都生而享有相同的权利——必然导致自由主义者以普世主义的视角看待世界。

The critical actor in political liberalism’s optimistic story about foreign policy is the individual, not the state. Liberalism’s stark individualism is what makes it a universal ideology, which profoundly affects how liberals think about international relations. In particular, liberalism’s core assumption that every individual, regardless of where she lives, is born with the same set of rights invariably leads liberals to see the world in universalist terms.

当然，自由主义国家会进行大量的国内社会工程，以保护和促进其公民的权利。但由于这些权利是普世的，因此，如果看到其他国家的权利受到侵犯，该国会感到一种真正的责任感，即代表其他国家的人民进行干预，甚至可能采取军事行动。迈克尔·多伊尔甚至认为“非自由主义政府对其人民处于侵略状态”，这种观点似乎要求干预所有非自由民主国家的政治，这将导致一项雄心勃勃的外交政策。³

A liberal state, of course, does significant domestic social engineering to protect and promote the rights of its citizens. But because those rights are universal, that same state feels a genuine sense of responsibility to intervene, perhaps even militarily, on behalf of people in other countries if it sees their rights violated. Michael Doyle goes so far as to argue that “nonliberal governments are in a state of aggression with their own people,” an idea that appears to call for intervention in the politics of every country that is not a liberal democracy and would lead to a remarkably ambitious foreign policy.3

自由主义对个人权利的重视，必然导致人们相信，保障这些权利的最佳途径是每个国家都成为自由民主国家。在促进和保护个人权利方面，没有任何政治制度能与自由主义相提并论，我们甚至很难想象，在一个并非至少在某种程度上是自由主义的政治秩序中，权利如何才能得到优先保障。因此，我们应该预料到，一个自由主义国家会奉行以推进自由民主为重点的外交政策。这项任务显然会涉及政权更迭，有时甚至会诉诸武力，以及旨在改造目标国家的大规模社会工程。考虑到其最终目标是将自由主义传播到世界各地，我们便能清楚地认识到，自由主义外交政策雄心勃勃，且具有高度干预性。

The importance liberalism accords individual rights inexorably leads to the belief that the best way to guard those rights is for every country to be a liberal democracy. No political system compares to liberalism when it comes to promoting and protecting individual rights, and it is hard even to envision how rights could be privileged in a political order that is not at least somewhat liberal. We should therefore expect a liberal state to pursue a foreign policy that emphasizes advancing liberal democracy. That task will obviously involve regime change, sometimes by military force, as well as heavy-duty social engineering to transform the target state. When you consider that the ultimate aim is to spread liberalism all around the world, it becomes clear that a liberal foreign policy is extremely ambitious and highly interventionist.

当然，自由主义国家也是民族国家，这意味着民族主义在很多重要方面影响着它们处理世界事务的方式。民族主义的一个特殊方面——根深蒂固的……对其他国家的优越感——有助于强化自由主义国家认为自己能够对全世界产生根本性影响的信念。这种民族沙文主义与自由主义理想主义的结合，在美国决策者经常宣称美国拥有特殊品质，使其能够指导和改造其他欠发达国家时，体现得淋漓尽致。

Liberal states, of course, are also nation-states, which means that nationalism helps shape their approach to dealing with the world in important ways. One particular aspect of nationalism—a deep-seated sense of superiority over other nations—helps reinforce a liberal state’s belief that it can affect fundamental change all over the world. This combination of nationalist chauvinism and liberal idealism is plainly reflected in the frequent claims of American policymakers who see the United States as having special qualities that enable it to instruct and transform other less fortunate countries.

缔造和平

Causing Peace

自由主义者希望传播自由民主，不仅是为了保护个人权利，更是因为他们相信这是促进和平的绝佳策略。原因很简单：自由民主国家之间不会发生战争。在自由主义的叙事中，国家就像生活在其中的个人一样：它们之间有时会存在不可调和的分歧。鉴于任何两个国家都可能在某个双方都极为关注的问题上产生根深蒂固的分歧，那么如何才能构建一个和平的世界呢？国际体系中没有像自由主义国家内部那样的更高权威来维护秩序。在一个没有守夜人的世界里，自由主义又如何能起到安抚作用呢？

Liberals want to spread liberal democracy not just to protect the rights of individuals but also because they believe it is an excellent strategy for causing peace. The reason is simple: liberal democracies do not fight wars with each other. In the liberal story, states are much like the individuals who live inside them: they sometimes have irreconcilable differences. Given that any two states may at some point have a deep-seated disagreement over an issue both care intensely about, how is it possible to construct a peaceful world? There is no higher authority to maintain order in the international system, as there is inside a liberal state. How can liberalism be a pacifier in a world without a night watchman?

答案就在于至关重要的个人权利概念。不仅每个人都被赋予了这些权利，而且（至少在自由社会中）人们对他人的权利有着根深蒂固且普遍的尊重。这种尊重与宽容密不可分，超越了国界。自由国家明白，不仅本国人民，外国人也拥有不可剥夺的权利，这些权利必须始终得到尊重。

The answer is found in the all-important concept of individual rights. Not only is everyone bestowed with those rights, but there is also (at least in liberal societies) a deep-rooted and widespread respect for the rights of others. This respect, which is inextricably bound up with tolerance, transcends national borders. Liberal states understand that not just their own people but foreigners as well have inalienable rights, which must be respected at all times.4

这种对个人权利的跨国尊重，在自由主义国家之间培育了一种强大的共同体意识，彼此间的信任十分普遍。值得注意的是，“共同体”一词在自由主义话语中出现的频率之高。除了我们熟悉的“国际社会”一词外，人们还经常听到“跨大西洋共同体”、“欧洲共同体”以及更广泛意义上的安全共同体等说法。伍德罗·威尔逊在谈到权力——自由主义者通常避免使用这个词——时，有时会使用“权力共同体”这一短语。 5自由主义者还会使用一些相关的词汇，例如国际社会、国际社会、人类共同体和集体安全。

This transnational respect for individual rights fosters a powerful sense of community among liberal states, where trust among them is commonplace. It is striking how often the word community appears in liberal discourse. In addition to the familiar term international community, one often hears reference to the transatlantic community, the European Community, and security communities more generally. When Woodrow Wilson spoke about power, a word liberals usually avoid, he would sometimes use the phrase “community of power.”5 Liberals also use cognate phrases like international society, family of nations, common humanity, and collective security.

自由社会发展出一套强有力的和平解决冲突的规范。它们之间的争端——即使是激烈的争端——也不会诉诸武力或战争威胁，而是通过仲裁和妥协来解决。克劳塞维茨那句著名的“战争是政治的另一种手段”在自由主义世界并不适用，因为自由主义国家并不认为战争是解决分歧的合法途径。然而，战争仍然是保护海外人权和在全球范围内传播自由民主的一种可接受的工具。多伊尔指出，自由民主国家倾向于以“鲁莽的热情”对非民主国家发动战争。正如R.H.托尼所言，对自由主义者而言，“战争要么是犯罪，要么是圣战。没有中间地带。”

Liberal societies develop a powerful norm of peaceful conflict resolution. Disputes between them—even bitter ones—are not settled by threats of force or war but by arbitration and compromise. Clausewitz’s famous dictum that war is an extension of politics by other means does not apply in a liberal world, because liberal states do not consider war a legitimate way of settling their disagreements. Yet war remains an acceptable instrument for protecting human rights abroad and for spreading liberal democracy around the world. Doyle points out that liberal democracies are inclined to wage wars against non-democracies with “imprudent vehemence.”6 For liberals, as R. H. Tawney notes, “war is either a crime or a crusade. There is no half-way house.”7

因此，在自由主义国家的世界里，现实主义逻辑被严重削弱。由于各国无意相互攻击，它们不再需要担忧自身生存，因此也无需为权力而相互竞争。正如约翰·伊肯伯里所指出的，“自由国际主义中潜藏着一种乐观的假设，即各国能够克服各种限制，通过合作解决安全困境，采取集体行动，并创建一个开放、稳定的体系。” 8

Realist logic is thus severely attenuated in a world of liberal states. Because they have no intention of attacking each other, they no longer have to worry about their survival and so need not compete with each other for power. As John Ikenberry notes, “There is an optimist assumption lurking in liberal internationalism that states can overcome constraints and cooperate to solve security dilemmas, pursue collective action, and create an open, stable system.”8

自由主义也主导着民族主义，后者对个人权利的理解与自由主义不同，更不用说其阴暗面有时会驱使国家之间互相仇恨和战争。一个坚定的民族主义者会认为其他国家的人不享有与其本国公民相同的权利。自由主义者自然反对这种特殊主义观点，而是强调权利平等适用于世界各地的人们。他们谈论的是人权，而非民族权利，前者凌驾于后者之上。这有效地抑制了极端民族主义。

Liberalism also dominates nationalism, which has a different take on individual rights, not to mention a dark side that sometimes pushes states to hate and fight each other. A committed nationalist would see someone in another nation as not entitled to the same rights as his fellow nationals. Liberals naturally reject this particularist perspective and instead emphasize that rights apply equally to people everywhere. They talk about human rights, not national rights, and the former trump the latter. This effectively neutralizes hypernationalism.

例如，约翰·罗尔斯在其国际关系主要论著中明确聚焦于“人民”，表明他理解世界是由不同的民族构成的。（在他的论述中， “人民”是“民族”的委婉说法。）然而，当自由主义的民族彼此交往时，民族主义丑陋的一面几乎完全消失。他写道：“正义的民族完全准备好给予其他民族应有的尊重和承认，视其为平等。” 9组成这些正义民族的个体，被“共同的同情心”所驱动，这种同情心压倒了任何民族的民族意识。对他人优越感。10这种自由主义对民族主义的看法体现在伯特兰·罗素对这两种主义之间关系的思考中：“我从小就是乐观自由主义的坚定信徒。我既希望也期待看到议会民主、个人自由以及当时受欧洲列强（包括英国）统治的国家的自由在世界各地逐步传播。我希望所有人最终都能理解科布登关于自由贸易的论点，民族主义也能逐渐消退，最终演变为普世人道主义。” 11

John Rawls, for example, focuses explicitly on “peoples” in his major treatise on international relations, showing that he understands the world is divided into different nations. (Peoples is a euphemism for nations in his story.) Yet when liberal peoples deal with each other, the nasty side of nationalism is almost completely absent. “Just peoples,” he writes, “are fully prepared to grant the very same proper respect and recognition to other peoples as equals.”9 The individuals who make up these just peoples are driven by “common sympathies” that overwhelm any nation’s sense of superiority over another.10 This liberal take on nationalism is captured in Bertrand Russell’s reflection about his own thinking on the relationship between those two isms: “I grew up as an ardent believer in optimistic liberalism. I both hoped and expected to see throughout the world a gradual spread of parliamentary democracy, personal liberty, and freedom for the countries that were at that time subject to European Powers, including Britain. I hoped that everybody would in time see the wisdom of Cobden’s arguments for Free Trade, and that nationalism might gradually fade into a universal humanism.”11

自由主义削弱民族主义和现实主义的最后一个论点涉及主权这一重要概念。毫无疑问，国家在政治自由主义中扮演着重要角色，即使在像罗尔斯这样主要关注人民或民族的人物的著作中也是如此。然而，国家并非牢不可破。现代自由主义对主权的态度似乎比民族主义或现实主义更为宽松。在自由主义的叙事中，国家边界是模糊且可渗透的，因为权利超越了这些边界，这意味着生活在不同国家的人们不仅拥有深厚的联系和共同的利益，而且自由主义国家也有权且有责任在其他国家侵犯其公民权利时干预其事务。在自由主义国家的世界里，关于个人权利的规范凌驾于主权规范之上。 12

The final dimension of the argument that liberalism undermines nationalism and realism concerns the important concept of sovereignty. There is no question the state plays a prominent role in political liberalism, even in the writings of someone like Rawls, who focuses largely on peoples or nations. Yet the state does not have a hard shell around it. Modern liberalism appears to have a more relaxed attitude toward sovereignty than either nationalism or realism. In the liberal story, state borders are soft and permeable, because rights transcend those boundaries, meaning not only that people living in different countries have deep ties and common interests but also that liberal states have the right and responsibility to intervene in other countries’ affairs if they violate their citizens’ rights. Norms about individual rights overshadow the norm of sovereignty in a world of liberal states.12

一个充满活力的自由国家国际共同体，顾名思义，彼此宽容，并致力于以和平方式解决争端，将削弱民族主义，并在很大程度上消除安全竞争和战争。各国将几乎不再需要核武器。威慑将成为一个无关紧要的概念。鉴于自由民主国家在其人民中自然享有相当高的合法性，恐怖主义问题应该会大大减少。而且，这些志同道合的国家应该能够轻松地协调应对任何出现的恐怖主义威胁。因此，自由国家越多越好，理想的世界应该完全由自由国家组成。13

A vibrant international community of liberal states, which by definition will be tolerant toward each other and deeply committed to settling their disputes peacefully, will defang nationalism and largely eliminate security competition and war. States will have little need for nuclear weapons. Deterrence will be an irrelevant concept. Terrorism should be much less of a problem, given that liberal democracies naturally enjoy significant legitimacy among their peoples. And those like-minded states should have little difficulty coordinating their efforts to deal with any terrorist threats that do arise. Thus the more liberal states there are, the better, and the ideal world would be populated only with liberal states.13

捍卫国内自由主义

Protecting Liberalism at Home

自由主义者热衷于政权更迭的第三个原因与自我保护有关。正如我在第三章中提到的，自由主义的核心弱点在于……在任何自由社会中，总会有人反对自由主义，并试图颠覆现有的政治秩序。自由国家总会面临内部敌人，尽管威胁的严重程度有所不同。当存在非自由主义国家可以与国内的反自由主义者结盟，从而加剧对自由秩序的威胁时，这个问题就会更加严重。当内部敌人和外部敌人之间存在紧密的意识形态联系时，问题尤其尖锐。这种威胁促使自由国家有强烈的动机通过将其自身转变为自由民主政体来消除外部敌人。当然，如果所有国家都是自由主义国家，这个问题自然就会迎刃而解。

A third reason liberals are attracted to regime change has to do with self-preservation. As I noted in chapter 3, liberalism has a core vulnerability in that there are always, in any liberal society, some people who reject liberalism and would overturn the political order if they could. A liberal state will always have internal enemies, although the severity of the threat varies. That problem is exacerbated when there are non-liberal countries that can join forces with those domestic anti-liberals and increase the threat to the liberal order. The problem is especially acute when there is a close ideological link between internal and external enemies. This threat gives liberal states a powerful incentive to eliminate the external enemy by transforming it into a liberal democracy. Of course, the problem would go away if all states were liberal.

国际关系学者约翰·欧文认为，这种内外敌对势力之间的联系不仅促使自由民主国家，而且促使所有国家在敌对意识形态统治的国家推行“强力政权扶植”。他写道：“正因为威胁是跨国的，政府既可以通过在国内打击敌对意识形态，也可以通过对外打击来削弱它。通过在国外压制敌对意识形态，政府可以消除敌对意识形态在国内的道德乃至物质支持来源。” 14双方都明白这种逻辑，这使得双方都更有动力尽快推翻对方的政权。
