The international relations scholar John Owen maintains that this link between internal and external enemies motivates not just liberal democracies but all states to pursue “forcible regime promotion” in countries governed by rival ideologies. “Precisely because the threat is transnational,” he writes, “the government can degrade it by attacking it abroad as well as at home. By suppressing an enemy ideology abroad, it can remove a source of moral and perhaps material support for enemy ideologues at home.”14 Both sides understand this logic, which gives each an added incentive to knock off the other side’s regime as quickly as possible.

归根结底，自由主义国家采取政权更迭政策有三个原因：保护外国人的权利、促进和平以及维护国内的自由主义。但如此雄心勃勃的战略往往难以实现。要实施这一战略，一个国家必须拥有强大的实力，并有能力以相对较低的成本推翻外国政权，有时甚至需要动用武力。它还必须具备足够的专业知识和耐心，来应对建立一个稳定的自由民主政体以取代被推翻政权的艰巨任务。然而，现代自由主义致力于社会工程，这不仅是为了促进和保护个人权利，也是因为当代生活的复杂性迫使国家深入参与社会管理。许多自由主义者认为政权更迭是一项可行的政策，能够带来巨大的收益。 15

The bottom line is that liberal states have three reasons for adopting a policy of regime change: protecting the rights of foreigners, facilitating peace, and safeguarding liberalism at home. But such an ambitious strategy is often out of reach. To pursue it, a state must be especially powerful and have the wherewithal to topple foreign regimes, sometimes with military force, at a reasonably low cost. It must also have the expertise and patience to manage the difficult task of building a stable liberal democracy to replace the ousted regime. Modern liberalism, however, is deeply committed to social engineering, not only for the purpose of fostering and protecting individual rights, but also because the complexities of contemporary life force states to be deeply involved in managing their societies. Many liberals think of regime change as a feasible policy that will reap huge benefits.15

虽然奉行自由霸权的国家主要关注保护个人权利和在世界范围内传播自由民主，但它也会追求另外两个值得注意的使命：建立国际机构和促进国家间的经济交流。这些目标源于两个论断：国际机构和经济相互依存能够促进和平。在第七章中，我将详细探讨这些理论，以及自由民主国家之间不会相互争斗的论断，重点在于判断其中是否有任何理论能够提出令人信服的论据。本章将着重阐述如何将构建国际机构和促进开放的国际经济视为自由主义外交政策的关键要素。

Although a state that pursues liberal hegemony will be mainly concerned with protecting individual rights and spreading liberal democracy around the world, it will also pursue two other noteworthy missions: building international institutions and advancing economic intercourse among states. These goals follow from the twin claims that international institutions and economic interdependence promote peace. In chapter 7, I will examine these theories at length, along with the claim that liberal democracies do not fight against each other, with an emphasis on determining whether any of them puts forward a compelling case. Here I will focus on explaining how constructing institutions and facilitating an open international economy can be considered key elements of a liberal foreign policy.

事实上，这两项任务都与该政策相辅相成。国际机构本质上是界定国家行为应遵循的权利和义务的规则。各国即使认为遵守这些规则不符合自身利益，也应遵守这些规则。除了高度重视法治和保障人权之外，这些机构还旨在和平解决国家间的争端。所有这些努力都是自由主义原则的一部分。

In fact, both tasks complement that policy. International institutions are essentially rules defining the rights and obligations that should guide state behavior. States are expected to obey these rules even when they believe that doing so is not in their interest. In addition to placing a high premium on the rule of law and safeguarding rights, institutions are designed to peacefully settle disputes between countries. All of these endeavors are part of the liberal canon.

自由主义外交政策倾向于市场经济，并呼吁促进国际贸易和投资，这不足为奇。拥有和交换财产的权利是政治自由主义的核心原则之一，而经济全球化为个人追求自身利益提供了丰富的机会。此外，自由主义者决心利用经济手段来减少政治分歧造成的损害。他们认为，开放的国际经济不仅能创造繁荣——繁荣本身就是一种善，它能促使人们倾向于和平与自由主义——还能使各国在经济上相互依存。这种贸易和投资关系是避免战争的强大动力：为什么要向一个你的繁荣所依赖的国家发动战争呢？

It is hardly surprising that a liberal foreign policy favors market-based economies and calls for furthering international trade and investment. The right to own and exchange property is one of the cardinal tenets of political liberalism, and economic globalization provides abundant opportunity for individuals to pursue their self-interest. Moreover, liberals are determined to use economics to limit the damage caused by political disagreements. An open international economy, they believe, not only generates prosperity—which is a good in itself that inclines people toward peace and liberalism—but also makes states economically dependent on each other. These trading and investment relationships are a strong disincentive to fighting: Why would you go to war against a state on which your prosperity depends?

我应该简单谈谈一项我鲜少关注，但有时却与自由主义外交政策联系在一起的使命。一些自由主义者和其他人士认为，各国应通过采取再分配政策来促进全球正义，以减少各国之间巨大的经济不平等。正如一位倡导者所言，各国应“努力影响全球资源和财富的分配”，使较贫穷的国家受益。 16这一目标与自由主义致力于促进自由主义国家内部个人机会平等的承诺相辅相成。然而，没有哪个自由主义国家真正有兴趣帮助其他国家在其自身内部获得经济优势。仅仅为了对抗全球不公正现象就需要耗费巨资，而且几乎没有理由认为将来会有人这样做。17

I should say a few words about a mission to which I give scant attention but which is occasionally identified with liberal foreign policy. Some liberals and others argue that states should promote global justice by adopting redistributive policies that reduce the sharp economic inequalities among states. They should, as one advocate puts it, “seek to influence the global distribution of resources and wealth” to advantage poorer countries.16 This goal complements the liberal commitment to promoting equal opportunity among individuals inside liberal states. No liberal state has ever shown serious interest in helping other states gain economic advantages at its expense just to fight global injustice, and there is little reason to think any ever will.17

精英、公众与自由主义霸权

Elites, the Public, and Liberal Hegemony

最后，值得注意的是，自由主义霸权在很大程度上是一种精英主导的政策。自由主义国家的外交政策机构通常比其公众更具国际主义倾向，而公众则往往更倾向于民族主义。尤其值得注意的是，外交政策精英比普通民众更热衷于在海外捍卫个人权利。这并非否认公众的自由主义倾向，也并非暗示精英阶层不具有民族主义倾向。但毫无疑问，外交政策精英比广大公众更热衷于在海外追求自由主义目标。

Finally, it is important to note that liberal hegemony is largely an elite-driven policy. The foreign policy establishments in liberal states are generally more internationalist than their publics, which tend to be more nationalist. In particular, the foreign policy elites tend to be much more committed to defending individual rights abroad than the average citizen. This is not to say these publics do not have liberal instincts or to suggest that the elites are not nationalists. But there is little doubt that foreign policy elites are more interested in pursuing liberal goals abroad than are their broader publics.

这种现象的成因多种多样。首先，自由派精英往往比普通民众受教育程度更高。他们通常需要花费数年时间在大学深造，而近几十年来，大学校园的国际化程度显著提高。如今，大多数大学校园都拥有大量外国学生以及在其他国家出生和长大的教职员工，本土学生也有机会出国留学。顶尖大学已成为彻底自由化的地方，民族主义情绪在这里几乎难觅踪迹。

There are a variety of reasons for this phenomenon. For starters, liberal elites tend to be better educated than the average citizen. They typically spend years attending colleges and universities, which have become remarkably international in recent decades. Most campuses today contain large numbers of foreign students as well as faculty born and raised in other countries, and native-born students are also given the opportunity to study abroad. The top colleges and universities have become thoroughly liberal places where nationalist sentiments are seldom on display.

此外，现代社会的精英们常常花费大量时间与来自其他国家的精英们交往。学者、专业人士、商界领袖、记者、政策制定者和智库成员都会出国访问，与外国同行会面，并常常与他们建立密切的友谊。因此，当今世界的外交政策精英往往具有鲜明的国际视野。这并非意味着他们都像塞缪尔·亨廷顿在瑞士达沃斯世界经济论坛上描绘的那样，“对国家忠诚度不高”，并将“国界视为正在消失的障碍”。 18但有些人确实与此相去不远。

Furthermore, elites in modern societies often spend a good deal of time hobnobbing with fellow elites from other countries. Academics, professionals, business leaders, journalists, policymakers, and think tankers all travel abroad, meet their foreign counterparts, and often form close friendships with them. Thus, the foreign policy elites in today’s world tend to be decidedly cosmopolitan. This is not to say they all match Samuel Huntington’s caricature of the men and women at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, “who have little need for national loyalty” and see “national boundaries as obstacles that are thankfully vanishing.”18 But some are not far off.

此外，外交政策属于国家专属领域，通常公众参与度不高。当然，公民团体可以就特定问题表达强烈立场，组织抗议活动，或敦促其代表在外交政策相关事项上投出特定票。但总体而言，公众直接参与日常外交政策的程度有限。外交政策由精英阶层掌控，他们有切身利益去推行诸如自由霸权之类的激进政策。试图掌控世界需要政府内外大量的高级职位，而采取更为保守的外交政策则会产生较少的工作。正如斯蒂芬·沃尔特所言，自由霸权“是外交政策机构实现充分就业的策略”。 19

Additionally, foreign policy is le domaine réservé of the state, generally carried out without much public involvement. Of course, groups of citizens can take strong positions on particular issues, organize protests, or press their representatives to vote a certain way on foreign policy–related matters. But overall, the public’s direct involvement in day-to-day foreign policy is limited. Elites run it, and they have a material interest in pursuing activist policies like liberal hegemony. Trying to run the world generates numerous high-level positions both inside and outside the government, whereas a more restrictive foreign policy would generate less work. As Stephen Walt puts it, liberal hegemony “is a full-employment strategy for the foreign policy establishment.”19

综合来看，自由主义霸权的这两大好处——保护世界各地的个人权利、防止战争、遏制国内的非自由主义势力，以及提供有趣、有意义且高薪的工作机会——有助于解释为什么自由主义精英如此坚定地致力于扩张性的外交政策，即使在外交政策遇到严重困难之后也是如此。

Taken together, these two benefits—liberal hegemony’s promise to protect individual rights around the world, prevent war, and thwart illiberal elements on the home front, as well as its promise of interesting, consequential, and well-paying job opportunities—help explain why liberal elites are so deeply committed to an expansive foreign policy, even after it runs into serious trouble.

鉴于外交政策精英如此热衷于追求自由主义霸权，他们构建了一套详尽的叙事体系来阐述其所谓的益处也就不足为奇了。他们通过智库报告、公开演讲、专栏文章和其他大众宣传方式来传播这套体系。他们热切地相信这项雄心勃勃的使命，并将其视为一项崇高的事业；而且，他们非常擅长向广大公众以及渴望加入外交政策机构的青年男女推销这套体系。正如沃尔特所指出的，他们在那些培养未来公共服务领导人的公共政策学院中尤其有效地推销着他们的理念。

Given that the foreign policy elite are so invested in pursuing liberal hegemony, it is hardly surprising that they have constructed a comprehensive narrative outlining its purported benefits, which they disseminate through think tank reports, public speeches, op-eds, and other forms of mass outreach. They fervently believe in this ambitious mission, which they envision as a noble one; and they do an excellent job of selling it to the public at large and to the young men and women who aspire to join the foreign policy establishment. As Walt notes, they are especially effective in marketing their message at the public policy schools that prepare future leaders for public service.

总之，自由主义外交政策主要关注的是最大限度地增加世界上的自由民主国家数量。它也关注构建国际机构和促进开放的国际经济等辅助性任务。但是，一个国家采取这种政策的可能性有多大？如果采取了，它能成功吗？

In sum, a liberal foreign policy is mainly concerned with maximizing the number of liberal democracies in the world. It is also concerned with the ancillary tasks of building international institutions and promoting an open international economy. But what are the prospects that a state will adopt such a policy? And if it does, can it be successful?

自由主义倡导现实主义

Liberalism Prescribes Realism

任何大国都无法在体系中至少存在另一个大国的情况下（这种情况通常都会发生）奉行自由主义霸权。只要体系是两极或多极的，强权国家就必须遵循现实主义原则行事。它不能在自身体系中优先考虑个人权利。外交政策之所以如此，是因为世界局势太过危险，不能为了保护他人的权利而牺牲自身安全。事实上，正确理解的自由主义认为，相互竞争的大国别无选择，只能争夺权力，以最大限度地提高自身在充满威胁的世界中生存的可能性。自由主义只有在存在一个更高权威（例如国家）来维护秩序的情况下才能发挥作用，但在国际体系中并不存在这样的更高权威。一旦失去了守夜人，自由主义就会沦为现实主义。

No great power can pursue liberal hegemony when there is at least one other great power in the system, which there typically is. As long as the system is either bipolar or multipolar, a powerful state must act according to realist principles. It cannot afford to privilege individual rights in its foreign policy, because the world is too dangerous to let protecting the rights of others come at the expense of one’s own security. In fact, liberalism properly understood says that rival great powers have little choice but to compete for power so as to maximize their prospects for survival in a threatening world. Liberalism only works if there is a higher authority, like the state, that can maintain order, but there is no higher authority in the international system. Once there is no night watchman, liberalism devolves into realism.

我将首先阐述现实主义的核心逻辑。我的主要目标是解释，在缺乏世界国家的情况下，各国为何会争夺权力，有时甚至爆发战争。我将解释自由主义为何依赖于等级制度，以及为何在任何拥有两个或两个以上大国的世界中，它实际上会演变为现实主义。然后，我将探讨在极少数情况下，当体系中只有一个大国，且该唯一力量拥抱自由主义霸权时，会发生什么。

I will begin by laying out realism’s core logic. My main goal is to show why states compete for power, and sometimes fight wars, in the absence of a world state. I will explain why liberalism depends on hierarchy and why it effectively becomes realism in any world with two or more great powers. Then I will explore what happens in those rare situations in which there is a single great power in the system and that sole pole embraces liberal hegemony.

现实主义入门

Realism 101

现实主义者认为，国际政治是一项危险的事业，各国竞相争夺权力，因为权力越大，生存的可能性就越大。有时，这种竞争会变得异常激烈，最终导致战争爆发。这种侵略行为背后的驱动力是国际体系的结构，它迫使各国别无选择，只能以牺牲他人利益为代价来追求权力。20

Realists maintain that international politics is a dangerous business and that states compete for power because the more power a state has, the more likely it is to survive. Sometimes that competition becomes so intense that war breaks out. The driving force behind this aggression is the structure of the international system, which gives states little choice but to pursue power at each other’s expense.20

该基本理论建立在五个假设之上，这些假设描述了该体系的基本架构。首先，国家是世界舞台上的主要行为体，不存在凌驾于国家之上的中央权威。诸如国际联盟或联合国之类的国际机构的重要性较低，甚至可以说是次要的，因为它们对国家的强制力有限。国家就像台球桌上的球，尽管大小不一。因此，国际体系是无政府状态的，但这并不意味着它混乱无序，仅仅意味着没有最终的仲裁者。

The basic theory is built on five assumptions, which describe the system’s basic architecture.21 First, states are the main actors on the world stage and there is no centralized authority above them. International institutions like the League of Nations or the United Nations are of secondary, if not tertiary, importance because they have little coercive leverage over states. States are like balls on a billiard table, though of varying size. Thus, the international system is anarchic, which is not to say it is chaotic or disordered, only that there is no ultimate arbiter.

第二和第三个假设涉及能力和意图，这是各国在相互评估时考虑的两个关键因素。所有国家都具备一定的进攻性军事能力，但大国的实力显然更强。现实主义者倾向于关注大国，因为……对国际政治影响最大的是各国；但即使在大国之间，一些大国的能力也强于其他国家。第三个假设是，各国永远无法确定潜在对手的意图是善意的还是敌意的。它们有时可以做出合理的猜测，但永远无法确定。22

The second and third assumptions deal with capabilities and intentions, the two key factors states consider when assessing each other. All states have some offensive military capability, although the great powers obviously have much more. Realists tend to focus on great powers because they have the biggest impact on international politics; but even among great powers, some have more capability than others. The third assumption is that states can never know for certain whether a potential rival’s intentions are benign or hostile. They can sometimes make reasonable guesses, but they can never be sure.22

造成这种不确定性的原因在于，意图存在于决策者的脑海中，因此无法被看清或衡量。而能力则通常是可见的，也相对容易评估。例如，在冷战期间，美国可以查看并清点苏联的坦克、攻击型潜艇和核导弹的数量，但却无法洞悉约瑟夫·斯大林或尼基塔·赫鲁晓夫的内心想法。有人或许会认同苏联的情况，并反驳说，美国至少从二战开始就肯定知道英国对美国怀有和平意图。毫无疑问，美国决策者长期以来一直将英国视为友好国家，但这仅仅是因为英国当时的实力：它太弱小，无法对美国构成威胁。二战期间，英国依靠华盛顿的保护来抵御纳粹德国；冷战期间，英国则依靠华盛顿的保护来抵御苏联。如果过去七十五年间，英国的实力是现在的三到四倍，那么美国就会对其意图感到担忧，因为届时英国的意图将难以辨别。在这种情况下，意图可以从能力中推断出来。

The reason for this uncertainty is that intentions are in the heads of policymakers and thus impossible to see or measure. Capabilities, on the other hand, are usually visible and reasonably easy to gauge. During the Cold War, for example, the United States could view and count the Soviet inventory of tanks, attack submarines, and nuclear-armed missiles, but it was impossible to see into the mind of Joseph Stalin or Nikita Khrushchev. One might concede the Soviet case and counter that the United States has surely known since at least the start of World War II that Britain has peaceful intentions toward it. There is no question that American policymakers have long viewed Britain as a friendly country, but that is because of its capabilities: it was too weak to threaten the United States. It depended on Washington to help protect it from Nazi Germany during World War II and the Soviet Union during the Cold War. If, over the past seventy-five years, Britain had been three or four times more powerful than it actually was, the United States would have worried greatly about its intentions, which would have been difficult to discern. In such cases, intentions are inferred from capabilities.

有人可能会说，政策制定者可以通过言辞明确表达意图，但空谈无益。领导人有时会歪曲事实，甚至撒谎。即便有人确信自己了解他国当前的意图，也无法预知其未来的意图。我们无法预知未来几年谁将执掌任何国家（包括我们自己的国家），而且未来的领导人所处的环境与现在截然不同，甚至可能天壤之别。这并非意味着领导人现在或将来都怀有恶意，只是说我们无法确切知晓。

One might argue that policymakers can make their intentions clear through their words, but talk is cheap. Leaders sometimes misrepresent their views or simply lie. Even if one is confident that he knows another state’s present intentions, it is impossible to know its future intentions. We have no idea who will be running any country (including our own) in the years ahead, and anyway those future leaders will be operating in circumstances that differ, perhaps drastically, from the present ones. None of this is to say that leaders have or will have malign intentions, only that you cannot know for sure.

第四，生存是每个国家的首要目标。国家当然还有其他目标——这也是我们难以了解其意图的原因之一——但生存必须始终放在首位。如果一个国家无法生存，它就无法追求任何其他目标。那么，生存究竟意味着什么？显然，它意味着……国家的生存至关重要。没有哪个国家愿意像朝鲜和波兰那样被征服和消灭。这也意味着各国都希望维护领土完整和主权。它们不希望其他国家能够左右其内政外交的重要方面，就像冷战时期苏联对东欧国家所做的那样。

Fourth, survival is every state’s primary goal. States always have other aims as well—one reason it is difficult to know their intentions—but survival must always take priority. If a state does not survive, it cannot pursue any other goals. What exactly does survival mean? It obviously means the physical survival of the state. No state wants to be conquered and eliminated the way Korea and Poland once were. It also means states want to maintain their territorial integrity as well as their sovereignty. They do not want another state to be able to dictate important aspects of their domestic or foreign policy, as the Soviet Union did with the countries of Eastern Europe during the Cold War.

第五，国家是理性行为体。它们有能力制定能够最大限度提高自身生存前景的战略。换言之，国家是工具理性的。由于国际政治错综复杂，这些战略有时会失败，甚至造成灾难性后果，但关键在于，这些战略都是有意识地为了实现某种目标而制定的。该理论不对国家的目标是否理性做出任何判断，生存目标除外。

Fifth, states are rational actors. They have the ability to devise strategies that maximize their prospects for survival. States, in other words, are instrumentally rational. Because international politics is a complicated business, the strategies sometimes fail, even disastrously, but the point is that they are consciously devised to advance some goal. The theory makes no judgments on whether a state’s goals are rational, with the one exception of survival.

这些假设本身都无法描绘出通常与现实主义联系在一起的充满竞争和危险的世界。只有当它们结合在一起时，麻烦才会出现。这五个假设共同表明，国家会表现出三种行为。首先，它们倾向于彼此恐惧。恐惧的程度各不相同，但大国之间总是存在某种程度的恐惧，部分原因是任何国家都无法确定另一个国家是否拥有强大的进攻能力和敌对意图。想想如今美国面对崛起中的中国，或者一战前几十年英国面对崛起中的德国。美国领导人无法高度确定中国未来的意图，正如英国决策者在1914年之前无法确定德国的意图一样。这种情况会引发对未来麻烦的担忧。更糟糕的是，中国也会担心美国可能对其怀有侵略意图，正如德国在一战前不信任英国的意图一样。

None of these assumptions by itself portrays the competitive and dangerous world usually associated with realism. It is when they are brought together that trouble ensues. The five assumptions together tell us that states exhibit three kinds of behavior. First, they tend to fear each other. The level of fear varies, but there is always some residual fear among the great powers, partly because no state can be sure another state will not have formidable offensive capabilities and hostile intentions. Think about the United States looking at a rising China today, or Britain looking at a rising Germany in the decades before World War I. American leaders cannot know China’s future intentions with high certainty, just as British policymakers could not be sure of Germany’s intentions before 1914. Such situations create fear that trouble lies ahead. To compound matters, China will also fear that the United States might have aggressive intentions toward it, just as Germany distrusted Britain’s intentions before the Great War.

国家之间相互畏惧还有另一个原因：一旦陷入困境，它们没有更高层级的权威可以求助。当一个受到威胁的国家拨打911求助时，电话另一端却无人接听，也无人提供援助。由于国际体系的无政府状态，各国都强烈地感受到，随时都可能发生严重的冲突。

There is another reason states fear each other: if they get into trouble, there is no higher authority they can turn to for help. When a threatened state dials 911, there is nobody at the other end to answer the phone and send help. Because of the anarchic structure of the international system, states have a powerful sense there is always potential for serious trouble.

鉴于911事件引发的问题，各国认识到它们身处一个自助体系，必须竭尽所能维护自身安全。它们可以随时与其他国家结盟，但永远无法成为……完全确信这些盟友会在危难之际伸出援手。即使是亲密的盟友，随着时间的推移也会渐行渐远：国家没有永远的朋友。23帕默斯顿勋爵在1848年对英国议会说：“认为某个国家或地区应该被划定为英国的永远盟友或永远敌人，这是一种狭隘的政策。我们没有永远的盟友，也没有永远的敌人。我们的利益是永恒不变的，而维护这些利益是我们的职责。” 24

Given this 911 problem, states recognize that they operate in a self-help system, where they must do all they can to provide for their own security. They can always form alliances with other states, but they can never be completely sure those allies will be there for them in times of trouble. Even close allies drift apart over time: states do not have permanent friends.23 Lord Palmerston told the British Parliament in 1848: “It is a narrow policy to suppose that this country or that is to be marked out as the eternal ally or the perpetual enemy of England. We have no eternal allies, and we have no perpetual enemies. Our interests are eternal and perpetual, and those interests it is our duty to follow.”24

最后，各国都明白，在无法确定其他国家意图的无政府状态体系中，生存的最佳途径就是尽可能地增强自身相对于竞争对手的实力。因此，各国力求最大限度地利用其控制的军事力量，确保其他国家不会以牺牲自身利益为代价而获得权力，同时伺机改变力量平衡，使之向己方倾斜。这种零和博弈式的权力竞争，有时甚至会导致战争，正是国际政治残酷无情、尔虞我诈的根源所在。

Finally, states understand that the best way to survive in an anarchic system in which they can never be certain about the intentions of other states is to be as powerful as possible relative to their competitors. States therefore aim to maximize the military assets they control and make sure other states do not gain power at their expense, while also looking for opportunities to shift the balance of power in their favor. This zero-sum competition for power, which sometimes leads to war, is what makes international politics a ruthless and treacherous business.

强大的实力并不能保证生存，但它能显著提高一个国家威慑潜在攻击者的可能性，并在威慑失败时提高赢得战争的可能性。拥有强大的战斗力也至关重要，因为在某些情况下，大国可能会感到不得不发动战争，无论是为了增强自身安全还是出于其他原因。对任何国家而言，理想的状态是成为霸主，这实际上意味着成为体系中唯一的大国。在这种情况下，没有其他国家拥有足够的军事实力来胁迫或击败霸主。

Being powerful does not guarantee survival, but it markedly increases a state’s prospects of deterring potential attackers, and of winning the war in the event deterrence fails. Having formidable fighting forces is also important because circumstances might arise where a great power feels compelled to initiate a war, either to enhance its security or for other reasons. The ideal situation for any state is to be the hegemon, which effectively means being the only great power in the system.25 In that circumstance, no other state has the military wherewithal to coerce or defeat the dominant power in a war.

简而言之，大国被困在一个铁笼里，它们别无选择，只能争夺权力，因为在一个冲突随时可能发生的无政府状态下，权力是生存的手段。

In short, great powers are trapped in an iron cage where they have little choice but to compete for power, because power is the means to survival in an anarchic system where conflict is an ever-present possibility.

现实主义的广泛意义

Realism’s Wide-Ranging Relevance

尽管现实主义与大约五百年前在欧洲兴起的国家体系密切相关，但它也可以用来解释古代和中世纪的国际政治。被广泛认为是现实主义之父的修昔底德，早在第一批国家出现之前就撰写了《伯罗奔尼撒战争史》（公元前431-401年）。16世纪初的欧洲。26马库斯·费舍尔指出，现实主义解释了中世纪欧洲各政治实体之间政治的许多重要方面。27现实主义是一种永恒的理论，原因很简单，因为国际体系始终处于无政府状态，而且从来没有办法确切地辨别其组成单位的意图。

Though closely identified with the state system that began to emerge in Europe roughly five hundred years ago, realism can also be used to explain international politics in antiquity and the Middle Ages. Thucydides, who is widely regarded as the father of realism, wrote his history of the Peloponnesian War (431–401 BC) long before the first states began to appear in Europe during the early 1500s.26 Markus Fischer shows how realism explains many important aspects of politics among the various political entities that populated Europe during the Middle Ages.27 Realism is a timeless theory, simply because the international system has always been anarchic and there has never been a way to discern the intentions of its constituent units with certainty.

现实主义逻辑不仅适用于国际政治，也适用于其他领域。它能很好地解释任何存在暴力冲突风险，且缺乏更高权威来维持秩序和提供保护的情况下的行为。例如，该理论可以用来解释世界各地非法毒品贩子的行为，以及美国禁酒时期私酒贩子之间的非法交易。无论是毒贩还是私酒贩子，如果被骗，都无法报警或诉诸法律。因此，他们在交易时通常会使用枪支，暴力或暴力威胁已成为他们日常生活的一部分，也就不足为奇了。

Realist logic also applies to other realms besides international politics. It goes a long way toward explaining behavior in any situation where there is a danger that the actors will use violence against each other, and there is no higher authority to impose order and provide protection. The theory can be used, for example, to explain the behavior of illegal drug dealers anywhere in the world, as well as illicit transactions among alcohol bootleggers in the United States during the era of Prohibition. Neither drug dealers nor bootleggers can call the police or go to court if they are cheated. Unsurprisingly, they usually bring guns to the table when dealing with each other, and violence, or the threat of it, is part of their daily lives.

现实主义逻辑同样适用于国家管辖范围之外的边远地区，因为在这些地区，个人在受到暴力威胁时无法拨打911求助。在这种情况下，人们武装起来，如果有人以威胁的方式接近他们，先开枪后问话，就显得合情合理。自人类历史之初，遍布全球的各种政治实体的影响力不断扩大，这似乎在很大程度上解释了为什么世界各地的暴力事件随着时间的推移而稳步下降。正如史蒂芬·平克所指出的，“政府控制降低凶杀率的效果对人类学家来说如此显而易见，以至于他们很少用数字来记录它。” 28

Realist logic also applies in frontier areas that are outside the reach of the state, because there is no 911 that an individual can call if she is threatened with violence. In that setting, it makes good sense for people to be well armed and to shoot first and ask questions later if someone comes toward them in menacing ways. The growing reach of the various political entities that have populated the planet since the beginning of human history seems to explain in good part why violence around the world has steadily declined over time. As Steven Pinker notes, “The reduction of homicide by government control is so obvious to anthropologists that they seldom document it with numbers.”28

最后，托马斯·霍布斯在《利维坦》中讲述的故事与结构现实主义基本一致。在自然状态下，也就是一个无政府状态，个体无法了解彼此的意图，而且每个人都有能力互相残杀。这种基本结构赋予了他们强大的动机去恐惧彼此，有时甚至为了提高自身的生存几率而杀人。在霍布斯看来，防止个体互相残杀的关键在于建立一个强大的国家——一个利维坦——来自上而下地维持秩序。如果没有这个国家，“没有共同的权力……”让他们都心生敬畏，”无政府主义世界的生活是“孤独、贫穷、肮脏、野蛮且短暂的。” 29

Finally, the story Thomas Hobbes tells in Leviathan is largely consistent with structural realism. Individuals in the state of nature, which is an anarchic system, cannot know each other’s intentions, and they all have the capability to kill each other. That basic structure gives them powerful incentives to fear each other, and sometimes even kill other people to enhance their own survival prospects. For Hobbes, the key to preventing individuals from killing each other is to create a powerful state—a leviathan—that can impose order from above. Absent that state, “without a common power to keep them all in awe,” life in an anarchic world is “solitary, poore, nasty, brutish, and short.”29

现实主义、人权与国际社会

Realism, Rights, and the International Community

由于国家会采​​取一切必要手段来保障自身生存，因此权利并非现实主义叙事的重要组成部分。现实主义当然容不下不可剥夺的权利这一概念，尽管国家之间可以达成协议，赋予所有成员国某些共同权利。然而，在实践中，权力最大化始终优先于尊重这些权利。大国通常只有在符合自身战略利益，或者尊重权利对自身战略影响甚微的情况下，才会尊重权利。当符合自身利益时，它们会与独裁者结盟；如果民选领导人被视为威胁，它们则会推翻这些领导人。

Because states do whatever they deem necessary to guarantee their survival, rights are not an important part of the realist story. Realism certainly has no room for the concept of inalienable rights, although states can reach agreements that confer certain rights on all of them. In practice, however, maximizing power will always take precedence over respecting those rights. Great powers typically respect rights only when it is in their strategic interest to do so, or when doing so is of little strategic consequence. They join forces with autocrats when it suits their interests and overthrow democratically elected leaders if they are seen as threats.

人们或许会认为现实主义叙事包含一项不可剥夺的权利——生存权。毕竟，生存假设是现实主义的核心。但国家往往认为只有自身才拥有生存权，它们不会将这项权利适用于其他国家。这并非意味着国家有意威胁竞争对手的生存，而是如果它们认为有必要，就会这样做。与自由主义不同，现实主义从上到下都是一种特殊主义理论，它不涉及自然权利。

One might think the realist story contains one inalienable right, the right to survive. The survival assumption, after all, lies at realism’s core. But states tend to think they alone have the right to survive. They do not apply the right to other states. It is not that states are committed to threatening the survival of rival states, but they will do just that if they deem it necessary. Realism, unlike liberalism, is a particularist theory from top to bottom. It has no story about natural rights.

因此，现实主义者并不重视所谓的国际社会，尽管国际社会建立在对不可剥夺权利的深刻尊重之上。在他们看来，国际社会不过是强国为了追求自身利益而用来标榜高尚情操的一种修辞手段，也是弱国在走投无路时才会援引的工具。各国当然可以为了互利而合作结成军事联盟，并建立其他类型的国际机构。但它们这样做是出于自身利益，而非出于对其他国家拥有共同价值观或崇高动机的考量。

For this reason, realists do not assign much importance to the so-called international community, which is based on a deep respect for inalienable rights. For them, that community is a rhetorical device that powerful states use to sound high-minded when they are pursuing their interests, and that weak states invoke when they have no other recourse. States may certainly cooperate to form military alliances and create other kinds of international institutions for their mutual benefit. But they do so for self-regarding reasons, not because they think other countries share common values or noble motives.

既然自由主义和现实主义在个人权利问题上持有如此截然不同的观点，那么在国际层面上，自由主义为何可能与现实主义难以区分呢？主要原因在于，自由主义需要更高的权威或监管者才能运作，而国际体系恰恰缺乏这样的权威或监管者。世界国家并不存在；只有无政府状态，各国别无选择，只能争夺权力。

Given that liberalism and realism say such different things about individual rights, how is it possible that liberalism is indistinguishable from realism at the international level? The main reason is that liberalism needs a higher authority or night watchman to work, and the international system has none. There is no world state; there is only anarchy, leaving individual countries little choice but to compete for power.

自由主义与国际无政府状态

Liberalism and International Anarchy

政治自由主义的出发点是，人们认为自然状态是一个危险且可能致命的地方，这主要是因为人们在基本原则上总是存在不可调和的分歧。自由主义者通过主张每个人都拥有一套不容置疑的权利，这些权利应当受到他人的尊重，并倡导和平解决冲突和宽容的规范来应对这一问题，这些规范是他们普世权利信念的必然结果。然而，权利和宽容并不足以在自然状态下维持和平。个人的生存仍然面临风险。解决之道在于社会契约，它能够建立一个可以维护秩序的国家。

Political liberalism starts with the assumption that individuals find the state of nature a dangerous and potentially deadly place, mainly because those individuals invariably have irreconcilable differences over first principles. Liberals deal with this problem by arguing that everyone has an incontrovertible set of rights that should be respected by others and by promoting the norms of peaceful conflict resolution and tolerance, which follow logically from their belief in universal rights. But rights and tolerance are not enough to keep peace in the state of nature. The individual’s survival is still at risk. The solution is a social contract, which results in a state that can maintain order.

当政治自由主义应用于世界政治时，其关注点从个人转向国家间的互动。30当分析单位是国家而非个人时，同样的逻辑仍然适用。

When political liberalism is applied to world politics, the focus shifts from individuals to the interactions among states.30 When states, not individuals, are the unit of analysis, the same basic logic applies.

自由主义叙事中的国家与现实主义叙事中的国家之间存在着显著的相似性。支撑现实主义的五个关键假设同样适用于自由主义。两种理论都假定国家在国际无政府状态下运作，并且生存是其首要目标。两者都承认所有国家都拥有某种进攻性军事能力，并且都假定国家是工具理性行为体。此外，意图的不确定性——这是现实主义的一个至关重要的假设——也是自由主义的一个基本特征。具体而言，国家永远无法确定其他国家不会制定敌对计划来实现其目标，尤其是在这些目标或基本原则存在争议的情况下。 31

There is a marked similarity between states in the liberal story and states in the realist story. The five key assumptions that underpin realism turn out to apply equally to liberalism. Both theories assume that states operate in international anarchy and that survival is their principal goal. Both recognize that all states have some offensive military capability, and each assumes that states are instrumentally rational actors. Furthermore, uncertainty about intentions, which is a critically important assumption in realism, is an essential feature of liberalism as well. Specifically, states can never be sure that other states will not develop hostile plans for pursuing their goals, especially if those goals, or first principles, are disputed.31

自由主义与现实主义的区别在于，前者强调自然权利、宽容以及和平解决冲突的规范，所有这些都被认为是使世界更加和平的必要条件。但根据自由主义自身的逻辑，这种模式行不通，因为自由主义认为，仅靠这些因素不足以促成和维护和平。人们还必须团结起来，摒弃自然状态，建立国家。他们必须从无政府状态走向等级制度。在国际层面，这意味着，除非存在一个世界国家，否则政治自由主义就无法如其所宣称的那样发挥作用。只要国际体系处于无政府状态，自由主义在这一领域就与现实主义并无二致。世界国家尽管大谈权利、宽容和和平解决争端，但自由主义却无法提供超越权力平衡政治的途径。

Where liberalism differs from realism is in its emphasis on natural rights, tolerance, and norms of peaceful conflict resolution, all of which are supposed to provide the necessary ingredients for making the world more peaceful. But that formula does not work according to liberalism’s own logic, which says that these factors alone are not enough to cause and maintain peace. Individuals must also come together, leave the state of nature behind, and create a state. They must move from anarchy to hierarchy. At the international level, this means that political liberalism cannot work as advertised unless there is a world state. As long as the international system is anarchic, liberalism is no different from realism in that realm. Without a world state, despite all its talk about rights, tolerance, and settling disputes peacefully, liberalism provides no way to move beyond balance-of-power politics.

一些著名的自由主义思想家确实阐述过这一点。例如，约翰·洛克在《政府论》下篇中以概括性的形式指出：“在一个共同体中，其成员彼此之间仍然是不同的个体，因此受社会法律的约束；然而，就全人类而言，他们构成一个整体，这个整体如同其每个成员之前一样，仍然与全人类处于自然状态。”他补充说，这个共同体“因此包含了战争与和平、联盟与同盟以及与外部所有个人和社群进行一切交往的权力”。 32当代自由主义者斯蒂芬·霍姆斯也表达了基本相同的观点，他写道：“自由权利只有在既有的、领土明确的国家范围内，并且只有在存在权利强制执行力量的情况下才有意义。如果国家之间或跨越国界不存在强制执行力量，那么自由权利就是徒劳的。” 33这一点也是G·洛伊斯·迪金森的核心论点，他将“无政府状态”一词引入了国际关系文献；黛博拉·布科扬尼斯在一篇关于自由主义和现实主义的重要论文中也提到了这一点。34

A few prominent liberal thinkers have actually made this point. John Locke, for example, states it in synoptic form in The Second Treatise: “In a commonwealth the members of it are distinct persons still in reference to one another, and as such are governed by the laws of the society, yet, in reference to the rest of mankind, they make one body which is, as every member of it before was, still in the state of nature with the rest of mankind.” He adds that this commonwealth, “therefore, contains the power of war and peace, leagues and alliances, and all the transactions with all persons and communities” outside it.32 Stephen Holmes, a contemporary liberal, makes essentially the same point when he writes: “Liberal rights are meaningful only within the confines of pre-existing, territorially bounded states, and only where there exists a rights-enforcing power. To the extent that no enforcing power operates between states or across borders, liberal rights are futile.”33 This point is also a central theme for G. Lowes Dickinson, who introduced the term anarchy into the international relations literature, and in an important essay on liberalism and realism written by Deborah Boucoyannis.34

单凭国际无政府状态这一因素，就足以证明，除非一个国家实力远超体系内其他所有国家，否则奉行自由主义外交政策在战略上是愚蠢的。但这种政策不明智的原因还有另一个。正如我在前一章中所解释的，自由主义夸大了权利的重要性。几乎没有证据表明大多数人认为个人权利是不可剥夺的，或者认为它们在日常政治生活中至关重要。权利固然重要，但自由主义者夸大了它们对政治的影响，这使得民主的传播成为一项格外艰巨的任务。

International anarchy alone makes it strategically foolish for a state to pursue a liberal foreign policy unless it is far more powerful than every other state in the system. But there is another reason why such a policy makes little sense. As I explained in the previous chapter, the liberal story oversells rights. There is little evidence that most people think individual rights are inalienable or that they matter greatly in daily political life. Rights do matter to some extent, but liberals exaggerate their influence on politics, which makes spreading democracy an especially difficult task.

正如我在前一章中提到的，人们对个人权利的重视程度直接影响着宽容和和平解决冲突的规范，以及国家的角色。对不可剥夺权利的尊重越少，就越难培养宽容，越难说服人们和平解决分歧，也就越需要一个强大的国家来维护秩序。如果自由主义的普世主义倾向不如大多数自由主义者所认为的那样强大，那么……因此，建立一个强大的世界国家就显得尤为重要。然而，国际体系仍然处于无政府状态。

As I also noted in the previous chapter, the importance people accord to individual rights has direct implications for the norms of tolerance and peaceful conflict resolution as well as for the role of the state. The less regard there is for inalienable rights, the more difficult it is to foster tolerance and persuade people to settle their disagreements peacefully, and the more a powerful state is needed to maintain order. If the universalist strand of liberalism is a less potent force than most liberals recognize, this makes it all the more important to have a formidable world state. The international system, however, remains anarchic.

总之，正确理解的自由主义并不能凌驾于现实主义之上。在世界国家建立之前，任何头脑清醒、坚定拥护自由主义原则的思考者都应该以现实主义者的视角看待国际政治。自由主义在国家内部可以成为一股强大的向善力量，但在国家与更广阔的世界打交道时则不然。35

In sum, liberalism properly understood does not trump realism. Until we have a world state, any clear-headed thinker who is deeply committed to liberal principles should approach international politics like a realist. Liberalism can be a powerful force for good inside states, but not when states are dealing with the wider world.35

民族主义与社会工程的局限性

Nationalism and the Limits of Social Engineering

尽管必须遵循现实主义的准则，但自由主义国家有时会发现自己处于极其安全的状态，以至于可以拥抱自由主义霸权而无需担忧权力平衡。在单极世界中，体系中唯一的超级大国无需担心其他超级大国的威胁，因为根本不存在这样的超级大国。较弱的自由主义国家可以自由地加入自由主义单极阵营，尝试在全球范围内传播民主。冷战结束后，美国及其西欧盟友，特别是英国，就发现自己处于这种有利的战略环境中，这使得它们能够联合起来追求自由主义霸权。

The imperative to act according to realist dictates notwithstanding, a liberal state will sometimes find itself so secure that it can embrace liberal hegemony without having to worry about the balance of power. In a unipolar world, the sole great power in the system does not have to fear another great power threatening it, because there are none. Weaker liberal countries are free to join with the liberal unipole to try to spread democracy around the globe. In the wake of the Cold War, the United States and its West European allies, especially Britain, found themselves in just this benign strategic situation, which allowed them to join together to pursue liberal hegemony.

值得注意的是，无论是否奉行自由主义，单极国家都可以采取截然不同的外交政策。努诺·蒙泰罗指出，主导力量有三种基本选择：它可以退出世界舞台，因为它既强大又安全；它可以继续在国际政治中扮演核心角色，并寻求维持现状；或者它可以尝试以有利于自身的方式改变现状。36国际体系的结构并不能决定哪种战略最优；这一决定很大程度上取决于国内政治。一个强大的自由民主国家如果发现自己处于单极格局，至少在初期，会本能地追求自由霸权，因为按照自己的意愿重塑世界已经根植于其基因之中，而且成本似乎也在可控范围内。

It is important to note that a unipole, liberal or not, can pursue strikingly different foreign policies. Nuno Monteiro points out that the dominant power has three basic choices: it can retreat from the world stage, knowing that it is both powerful and secure; it can remain a central player in international politics and seek to maintain the status quo; or it can attempt to change the status quo in ways favorable to itself.36 The structure of the international system does not determine which strategy is optimal; that decision is largely a function of domestic politics. A powerful liberal democracy that finds itself in unipolarity will reflexively pursue liberal hegemony, at least initially, because remaking the world in its own image is baked into its DNA and the costs will appear manageable.

一个在两极或多极格局下运作的自由主义大国，由于其他大国的存在，无法追求自由主义霸权。然而，它有时可能会在不该忽视权力平衡政治的情况下，选择性地推行自由主义政策。可能的结果是这种有限形式的自由干预主义，与单极国家追求自由霸权的结局如出一辙：失败。倡导个人权利并将其他国家转变为自由民主国家是一项极其艰巨的任务，鲜有成功案例，而且往往会适得其反。

A liberal great power operating in either bipolarity or multipolarity cannot pursue liberal hegemony, because of the presence of other great powers. Nevertheless, it might occasionally ignore balance-of-power politics when it should not and selectively pursue liberal policies. The likely outcome of this limited form of liberal interventionism is the same as when a unipole pursues liberal hegemony: failure. Promoting individual rights and turning other countries into liberal democracies is an exceedingly difficult undertaking that rarely succeeds and often backfires.

原因之一是，任何被如此针对的国家都拥有根深蒂固的文化，难以被操纵和重塑。除非发生社会革命，否则即使是当地精英也很难对其社会进行根本性的变革。对于外国人来说，进入一个他们并不熟悉的国家，将其改造为自由民主国家，甚至仅仅是使其停止侵犯公民权利，都更加困难。大多数人对个人权利的认同度不高，这使得问题更加复杂。在政治动荡时期，他们更倾向于维护稳定。此外，民族主义的强大力量也进一步加剧了自由主义传播的难度。我之前论述过，自由主义和民族主义在一个国家内部可以有效共存，尽管民族主义几乎总是占据主导地位。一旦关注点转移到国际体系，民族主义几乎在所有方面都会压倒自由主义。

One reason is that any country so targeted will have a deep-rooted culture that is hard to manipulate and reorder. Short of a social revolution, it is difficult even for local elites to make fundamental changes in their own societies. It is even harder for foreigners to come into a country they do not know well and transform it into a liberal democracy, or even just get it to stop abusing its citizens’ rights. This problem is compounded by most people’s soft commitment to individual rights. In the midst of political turmoil, they are more likely to be concerned with fostering stability. And then there is the remarkably powerful force of nationalism, which further complicates the task of spreading liberalism. I argued earlier that liberalism and nationalism could operate effectively together inside a state, although nationalism is almost always dominant. Once the focus shifts to the international system, nationalism tends to overwhelm liberalism at almost every turn.

民族主义在很大程度上关乎身份认同。人们眼中的世界由众多不同的民族和国家组成，并且总是对自己的民族怀有特殊的归属感。他们通常与外国公民的联系远不如本国公民紧密。这正是大多数人更倾向于将本国公民视为享有平等权利的伙伴，而非尊重外国公民权利的原因之一。外来者在人们关注的方面与本国公民截然不同，有时甚至会遭到蔑视，甚至仇恨。国际体系加剧了这一问题。国家间的安全竞争和偶尔发生的战争不仅强化了这种差异感，也助长了极端民族主义。即使外来者受到尊重，他们也很少被视为平等的一员。

Nationalism is in large part about identity. Individuals see the world comprising a wide variety of different peoples and nations, and invariably feel a special attachment to their own people. They usually feel far less connected with foreign nationals. This is one reason most people are much more inclined to treat their fellow nationals as equals deserving of rights than they are to respect the rights of foreign nationals.37 Outsiders are distinctly different in ways that matter to people, and sometimes they are viewed with contempt, if not hatred. Life in the international system exacerbates this problem. Security competition and occasional war between countries not only strengthen this sense of difference but also foster hypernationalism. Even when outsiders are treated with respect, they are rarely seen as equals.

在美国这个典型的自由主义国家，这种思维方式有大量的证据。例如，奥斯汀·萨拉特在研究美国人如何看待权利时发现，他们“没有意识到自身自由与他人自由之间的相互关联；他们珍视自身的自由，却不珍视他人的自由。” 38很难让美国人仅仅为了保护其他民族的权利而战斗甚至牺牲。其中包括至关重要的生命权。美军唯一一次纯粹出于人道主义目的参与战斗是在1993年的索马里首都摩加迪沙。在18名美国人在战斗中丧生后，克林顿总统迅速撤回了所有美军作战部队。索马里事件令他和他的副手们深感不安，以至于他们拒绝在第二年派遣军队阻止卢旺达种族灭绝，尽管这项任务几乎不会造成美军伤亡。39

There is substantial evidence of this kind of thinking in the United States, the paradigmatic liberal country. For example, in his study of how Americans think about rights, Austin Sarat found that they “do not perceive the interrelatedness of their own freedom and the freedom of others; they value their own freedom but not the freedom of others.”38 It is difficult to get Americans to fight and die solely to protect the rights of other peoples, including the all-important right to life. The only instance where U.S. troops engaged in combat for humanitarian purposes alone was in Mogadishu, Somalia, in 1993. After eighteen Americans were killed in battle, President Clinton quickly withdrew all U.S. combat forces. He and his lieutenants were so unnerved by what happened in Somalia that they refused to commit troops the following year to stop the Rwandan genocide, even though the mission would have involved few U.S. casualties.39

当外国人杀害美国人时，普通美国人对此的关注度远高于外国人之间互相残杀或杀害其他国家公民的情况。 40 2014年，伊斯兰国（ISIS）斩首两名美国记者，此事在美国引发的强烈抗议是促使奥巴马总统对ISIS发动战争的事件之一。 41美国人对ISIS造成的广泛屠杀和破坏感到震惊，但他们更关心的是本国同胞的死亡。与此同时，杀害外国人（尤其是非白人外国人）的美国人很少像杀害本国公民的美国人那样受到严厉惩罚。例如，1968年3月在越南臭名昭著的美莱村大屠杀中指挥美军的威廉·卡利中尉，在被软禁三年半后获释，而且在他扮演的角色被媒体曝光后，他获得了公众的压倒性支持。他的部队中没有其他人被判犯有刑事罪行，尽管有大约350到500名平民（其中大部分是妇女和儿童）被杀害。 42如果卡利和他的部下屠杀了同样数量的手无寸铁的美国平民，他们肯定不会受到如此宽容的对待。正如约翰·穆勒所指出的：“尽管美国人对美国伤亡极其敏感，但他们似乎对外国人的伤亡，包括那些基本上没有卷入战争——也就是无辜的——平民的伤亡，却异常冷漠。” 43约翰·蒂尔曼曾就此主题进行过深入研究，他也赞同这一观点：“美国战争最显著的特点之一是，我们很少讨论非美国人的受害者。” 44当然，这种思维方式并非美国独有。所有国家都有这种想法，而这与自由主义的普世性维度直接相悖。

When foreigners murder Americans, it is of much more concern to the average American than when those same foreigners murder each other or people from other countries.40 The outcry in the United States when the Islamic State (ISIS) beheaded two American journalists in 2014 is one of the events that persuaded President Obama to go to war against ISIS.41 Americans had been appalled by the widespread carnage and destruction wrought by ISIS, but they cared more about the deaths of their fellow Americans. Meanwhile, Americans who murder foreigners, especially nonwhite foreigners, are rarely treated as harshly as Americans who murder their fellow citizens. For example, Lieutenant William Calley, who commanded the U.S. soldiers involved in the infamous My Lai massacre in Vietnam in March 1968, served only three and a half years under house arrest before he was freed, and he enjoyed overwhelming support from the public after his role was revealed in the media. Nobody else in his unit was convicted of a criminal offense, even though somewhere between 350 and 500 civilians, mostly women and children, were murdered.42 Calley and those under his command surely would not have received such benevolent treatment if they had butchered that number of unarmed American civilians. As John Mueller notes: “Although Americans are extremely sensitive to American casualties, they seem to be remarkably insensitive to casualties suffered by foreigners including essentially uninvolved—that is, innocent—civilians.”43 John Tirman, who has done a major study on this subject, concurs: “One of the most remarkable aspects of American wars is how little we discuss the victims who are not Americans.”44 Of course, this kind of thinking is not peculiar to the United States. All nations think this way, and it cuts directly against liberalism’s universalist dimension.

世界被划分成一个个截然不同且往往相互猜忌的国家，这对社会工程活动产生了重大影响。自由主义外交政策的核心在于民族自决。生活在民族国家的民众渴望在不受外部势力干涉的情况下塑造自己的政治。他们不愿让外国人告诉他们该如何生活，即便这些干预势力怀有崇高的意图。在大多数情况下，目标国家会强烈抵制自由主义的“十字军东征”，这种抵制甚至可能采取恐怖主义的形式。自由主义在异国他乡并非易于推行。

This division of the world into distinct and often mutually suspicious nations has significant consequences for the social engineering enterprise at the heart of a liberal foreign policy. Nationalism is all about self-determination, and people who live in a nation-state will want to shape their own politics without interference from an outside power. They will not want foreigners telling them how to conduct their lives, even if the intervening forces have noble intentions. In most cases, the target state will fiercely resist the liberal crusaders, and this resistance may even take the form of terrorism. Liberalism is not an easy sell in alien lands.

除了目标国内部的困难之外，自由化推行者还可能遭遇其他国家的阻力。一些国家或许有充分的理由遏制自由化推行者传播其意识形态的努力。而大多数其他国家则会出于现实主义的考量，因为与自由化推行者不同，它们并不面临着宽松的威胁环境。因此，它们可能会担心，如果自由化推行者成功地将其他国家转变为自由民主国家，它可能会获得新的盟友，并改变力量平衡，使其向自身倾斜。例如，俄罗斯就对美国主导的、旨在通过所谓的“颜色革命”在东欧推行民主的努力深感怀疑。2014年2月22日，美国协助策划的乌克兰政变推翻了一位亲俄领导人，引发了莫斯科与西方之间的重大危机。 45

In addition to the difficulties the liberalizer faces inside the target country, it is likely to meet resistance from other states as well. Some countries may have compelling reasons to check the liberalizer’s efforts to spread its ideology. Most other countries will be motivated by realism because, unlike the liberalizer, they do not face a permissive threat environment. They are thus likely to worry that if the liberalizer succeeds in its efforts to turn other countries into liberal democracies, it might gain new allies and shift the balance of power in its favor. Russia, for example, was deeply suspicious of the American-led effort to promote democracy in Eastern Europe through the so-called color revolutions. The February 22, 2014, coup in Ukraine, which the Americans helped facilitate and which toppled a pro-Russian leader, precipitated a major crisis between Moscow and the West.45

此外，很可能至少有一些国家——罗尔斯称之为“非法国家”——反对自由主义的传播，因为它们在原则上对自由主义抱有根深蒂固的敌意。 46 罗尔斯承认，世界上“许多人”拒绝自由主义。他写道：“对他们而言，政治自由主义所设想的社会世界，即便不是彻头彻尾的邪恶，也是社会分裂和谬论的噩梦。” 47所有这些原因都意味着，在全球范围内传播自由民主注定失败的次数远多于成功的次数。

There are also likely to be at least a few countries—Rawls calls them “outlaw states”—that oppose the spread of liberalism because they are deeply hostile to liberalism in principle.46 Rawls acknowledges that “many persons” in the world reject liberalism. “For them,” he writes, “the social world envisaged by political liberalism is a nightmare of social fragmentation and false doctrines, if not positively evil.”47 All of these reasons mean that spreading liberal democracy around the world is destined to fail much more often than it succeeds.

那么，作为自由主义外交政策组成部分的两项辅助性任务——构建国际机构和促进开放的国际经济——又该如何看待呢？这两项任务更有可能成功，因为与推广民主不同，它们既符合现实主义外交政策，也符合自由主义外交政策。

What about the two ancillary missions that are part of a liberal foreign policy: building international institutions and promoting an open international economy? These two missions are more likely to succeed because, unlike democracy promotion, they are consistent with a realist foreign policy as well as a liberal one.

现实主义者认为，制度是国家治理的重要工具。例如，美国在冷战中高度依赖北大西洋公约组织（北约）、欧洲共同体、国际货币基金组织（IMF）、世界银行和其他机构。战争。促进经济交流总体上符合现实主义。冷战期间，现实主义者热情支持全球化，这无疑对美国有利。自由主义者和现实主义者在制度和经济相互依存问题上的争论核心在于它们是否促进世界和平。自由主义者认为它们能够缓解冲突；现实主义者则不这么认为。48

Realists believe that institutions are important instruments of statecraft. The United States, for example, relied heavily on the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), the European Community, the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the World Bank, and other institutions in waging the Cold War. Facilitating economic intercourse is generally consistent with realism. Realists enthusiastically supported globalization during the Cold War, which certainly worked to America’s advantage. The nub of the dispute between liberals and realists regarding both institutions and economic interdependence has to do with whether they promote world peace. Liberals believe they ameliorate conflict; realists do not.48

自由主义的生存模式：如果……会怎样？

Modus Vivendi Liberalism: What If?

迄今为止，我一直认为进步自由主义主导着权宜之计式自由主义。我们没有理由认为这种情况会改变。这表明，权宜之计式自由主义几乎不可能成为自由主义国家外交政策的模板。

Up to this point, I have assumed that progressive liberalism dominates modus vivendi liberalism. We have no reason to think this situation will change. This suggests that there is hardly any chance modus vivendi liberalism will provide the template for a liberal state’s foreign policy.

但这种结论或许过于悲观。正如我将在第八章论述的那样，美国在追求自由霸权屡屡失败之后，有可能（虽然可能性不大，但并非微不足道）转向更为克制的对外政策。这种更为有限且明智的战略将基于现实主义逻辑，并结合对民族主义如何影响大国行为的深刻理解。它将与基于“共存之道”自由主义的对外政策有显著的相似之处。因此，有必要简要阐述一下这种自由主义对外政策的具体内容，这不仅因为它与克制有所重叠，也因为它与自由霸权截然不同。

But this conclusion may be too pessimistic. As I will argue in chapter 8, there is a chance (small, but not trivial) that the United States will move toward a more restrained foreign policy in the wake of all the failures its pursuit of liberal hegemony has produced. That more limited and wiser strategy would be based on realist logic, coupled with an informed understanding of how nationalism affects the behavior of great powers. It would bear a marked resemblance to a foreign policy based on modus vivendi liberalism. A few words are therefore in order regarding what that liberal foreign policy would look like, not just because it overlaps with restraint but also because it differs from liberal hegemony.

以“共存模式”（modus vivendi）为核心的自由主义外交政策，其干预程度远低于以进步主义为基础的外交政策。 49诚然，这种政策会优先考虑不可剥夺的权利，从而在外国人权利受到严重威胁时，促使其采取干预措施。然而，这种干预冲动会被“共存模式”自由主义者强烈反对社会工程这一事实所抵消。他们原则上不喜欢社会工程，并且认为社会工程往往以失败告终。他们认为，积​​极干预的政府在国内都难以发挥多大作用，更遑论在国外，因此，“共存模式”自由主义者拒绝接受自由国家应在全球范围内推动政权更迭以传播自由民主的观点。毕竟，这样的政策涉及大规模的社会工程。相反，他们强调重视自决原则的重要性。

A liberal foreign policy centered on the modus vivendi variant would be much less interventionist than one grounded on progressivism.49 For sure, it would privilege inalienable rights, which would generate incentives to intervene abroad when the rights of foreigners are seriously threatened. That interventionist impulse, however, would be offset by the fact that modus vivendi liberals are deeply opposed to social engineering, which they do not like in principle and which they think fails more often than not. Their belief that activist governments cannot do much good at home, much less in foreign countries, leads modus vivendi liberals to reject the notion that liberal states should promote regime change around the world so as to help spread liberal democracy. Such a policy, after all, involves social engineering on a grand scale. Instead, they emphasize the importance of paying heed to the principle of self-determination.

基于这种思维模式，奉行“权宜之计”的自由主义者不愿批准对其他国家的人权干预，除非该国政府或反叛组织实施大规模屠杀。在这些罕见的情况下，他们会力求尽快解决问题，然后返回本国，避免陷入重塑目标国家政治的泥潭。当然，迅速撤离并非易事。他们很容易受到诱惑，想要留下来收拾残局，并着手解决最初导致干预的根本政治和社会问题。奉行“权宜之计”的自由主义者深知这种滑坡效应，这也更加坚定了他们反对干预海外事务的立场。

Given this mind-set, modus vivendi liberals are reluctant to sanction human rights interventions in another country unless there is wholesale killing either by the government or by a rebel group. In those rare instances, they would aim to deal with the problem as quickly as possible and then return home without getting bogged down trying to reorder the target state’s politics. Of course, a quick exit is difficult. There is a powerful temptation to stay and clean up the mess the intervention created, and then fix the underlying political and social problems that compelled it in the first place. Modus vivendi liberals understand this slippery slope, and it reinforces their opposition to intervening abroad.

奉行“共存模式”的自由主义者反对干涉主义外交政策还有另一个原因。在国内，他们倾向于一个主要维护秩序、保障个人自由的国家。他们不希望一个强大的国家干预他们的日常生活，这也是他们强烈反对社会工程的原因之一，尤其是不希望以促进积极权利为目的的社会工程。一个奉行干涉主义外交政策的自由主义国家最终必然会建立一个强大的国家机器，而这个机器又极有可能干预公民社会。奉行“共存模式”的自由主义者对这种国家安全型国家深感恐惧，因此他们倾向于小规模的军事机构和高度克制的外交政策。尽管他们认为自由主义是最佳的政治秩序，但他们对世界其他地区更倾向于奉行“互不干涉”的政策，这也是他们被称为“共存模式”自由主义者的原因之一。

Modus vivendi liberals are inclined to reject an interventionist foreign policy for another reason as well. Within their own country, they favor a state that mainly keeps order and guarantees individual freedoms. They do not want a powerful state interfering in their daily lives, which is one reason they intensely dislike social engineering, especially for the purpose of fostering positive rights. A liberal country with an interventionist foreign policy invariably ends up building a formidable state, which then is powerfully inclined to interfere in civil society. Modus vivendi liberals deeply fear this kind of national security state, so they favor a small military establishment and a highly restrained foreign policy. Although they consider liberalism the best political order, they prefer a live-and-let-live policy toward the rest of the world, which is one reason they are called modus vivendi liberals.

然而，进步自由主义在过去一个多世纪以来一直是政治自由主义的主导形式，也是自由主义霸权背后的驱动力。尽管如此，民族主义和现实主义对国际政治的塑造产生了更为深远的影响。或许，要真正理解民族主义和现实主义相对于自由主义的影响力，最好的方法就是考察过去五百年间国际体系基本架构的显著转变。

Progressive liberalism, however, has been the dominant form of political liberalism for well over a century now, and it is the driving force behind liberal hegemony. Nevertheless, nationalism and realism have had a much more profound influence in shaping international politics. Perhaps the best way to capture just how powerful nationalism and realism are compared with liberalism is to consider the remarkable transformation over the last five hundred years in the basic architecture of the international system.

现代国际体系的形成

The Making of the Modern International System

1500年以前，欧洲并不存在统一的国家。当时的欧洲地区存在着各种各样的政治实体，包括帝国、城邦、公国、侯国、城市联盟以及各种宗教组织。主权在欧洲，它与许多不同类型的政治实体相关联。50欧洲以外也没有任何国家。

There were no states in Europe before 1500. The region instead housed a variety of political entities, including empires, city-states, duchies, principalities, urban federations, and various religious organizations. Sovereignty in Europe was associated with many different kinds of political units.50 Nor were there any states outside Europe.

最早的几个国家——英国、法国和西班牙——在十六世纪初开始形成，并在接下来的三百年里，王朝国家成为欧洲的主要政治力量。1800年以后，这些王朝国家逐渐让位于民族国家，这种政治形式最终遍及全球，直至今日，国际体系几乎完全由民族国家构成。正如戴维·阿米蒂奇所指出的，“过去五百年全球历史上最伟大的政治事实，是帝国世界向国家世界的转变。这一事实——比民主的扩张、民族主义、权利话语，甚至全球化——更能从根本上定义我们所有人所处的政治世界。” 51

The first states—England, France, and Spain—began to take form in the early sixteenth century, and over the next three hundred years the dynastic state became the principal political actor in Europe. After 1800, those dynastic states slowly gave way to nation-states, and that political form eventually spread across the globe until today, the international system is made up almost exclusively of nation-states. As David Armitage notes, “The great political fact of global history in the last 500 years is the emergence of a world of states from a world of empires. That fact—more than the expansion of democracy, more than nationalism, more than the language of rights, more even than globalization—fundamentally defines the political universe we all inhabit.”51

从异质世界体系到同质世界体系的这种非凡转变，显然是由多种因素造成的。然而，两大主要驱动力是民族主义和现实主义，二者相互作用，共同促成了现代国家体系的形成。这两种主义都强调国家和生存，它们之间的联系促进了民族国家的扩散。52

This extraordinary change, from a heterogeneous world system to a homogeneous one, obviously had many causes. The two main driving forces, however, were nationalism and realism, which interacted in important ways to help create the modern state system. The emphasis each of those isms places on the state and survival links them in ways that promoted the proliferation of nation-states.52

现实主义与现代国家的兴起

Realism and the Rise of the Modern State

要理解民族主义和现实主义如何共同塑造国际体系，一个有效的方法是首先解释生存的考量——这是权力平衡政治的核心——如何促成了民族国家的形成，并将这种政治形式传播到世界各地。在国家出现之前，欧洲的各个政治实体几乎一直处于安全竞争之中，有时甚至演变为战争。 53当然，16世纪初开始兴起的国家也深陷于这种永无休止的冲突之中。欧洲所有政治实体都极其重视自身的生存，因为它们始终面临着被从地图上抹去的危险。

A good way to understand how nationalism and realism have combined to shape the international system is to begin with an explanation of how the preoccupation with survival, which is at the core of balance-of-power politics, helped create nation-states and spread that political form around the world. Before there were states, the political entities that populated Europe engaged in almost constant security competition, which sometimes led to war.53 The states that began to emerge in the early sixteenth century were, of course, deeply immersed in that pit of never-ending conflict. All of the political units in Europe cared greatly about their survival, as they faced an ever-present danger of being erased from the map.

在那个残酷无情的世界里，能否生存很大程度上取决于军事表现，不出所料，最强大的势力往往最终胜出。查尔斯·蒂利曾讲述过一个著名的故事，说明国家在建立军事力量和赢得战争方面如何优于所有其他组织形式。54 军事上的成功很大程度上取决于是否有足够的资金来维持陆军和海军，以及是否有足够的人口来组建一支庞大而高效的作战部队。但这些资源必须从人口中获取，这意味着人口越多越好。事实证明，国家在从居民中获取资源并将其转化为军事力量方面，优于所有其他政治形式。因此，国家最终将竞争对手逐出了欧洲体系，因为其他政治形式无法建立足够的军事力量与国家在战场上抗衡。生存最终取决于是否拥有国家。

Staying alive in that cutthroat world largely depended on military performance, where, unsurprisingly, the most powerful actors tended to prevail. Charles Tilly famously tells the story of how the state proved superior to all other organizational forms at building military power and winning wars.54 Military success depends in good part on having money to finance an army and a navy as well as enough people to fill out a large and effective fighting force. But those resources have to be extracted from the population, which means it is better to have a large population than a small one. States proved to be superior to all other political forms at extracting resources from the resident population and translating them into military might. Hence the state ultimately ran its competitors out of the European system, because the others could not build sufficient military power to compete with the state on the battlefield. Survival came to depend on having a state.

这种逻辑深刻地影响了马基雅维利的《君主论》。在他写作的十六世纪初，意大利并非一个统一的国家。意大利半岛上遍布着许多小城邦，它们之间战乱不断，而且经常沦为奥地利和法国侵略的牺牲品。“这种蛮族统治，”他写道，“令所有人感到厌恶”，并使意大利陷入了“奴役和耻辱”的境地。他认为问题的根源在于意大利的分裂：“因为我不相信分裂有任何好处；相反，当敌人来袭时，分裂的城邦必然会立即沦陷，因为弱者总是会加入外敌，而弱者则无力统治。” 55

This logic deeply informs Machiavelli’s The Prince. At the time he was writing, in the early sixteenth century, Italy was not a unified state. The Italian peninsula was populated with small city-states that fought among themselves and often fell prey to Austrian and French aggression. “This barbarian domination,” he wrote, “stinks to everyone” and had brought Italy into a state of “slavery and disgrace.” He thought the taproot of the problem was that Italy was divided: “For I do not believe that divisions ever do any good; on the contrary, when the enemy approaches, of necessity divided cities are immediately lost, because the weaker party always joins the external forces and the other will not be able to rule.”55

马基雅维利明白，解决这个问题的最佳途径是超越意大利的城邦体系，建立一个能够对抗奥地利和法国并遏制它们的统一的意大利国家。他向未来的意大利君主提出的残酷而坦率的建议，主要目的在于帮助这位君主统一意大利，“使她摆脱这些野蛮的暴行和侮辱”。56如果意大利人想要生存下去，就必须效仿他们更强大、更发达的邻国，建立自己的国家。然而，这一统一直到1870年才实现。

Machiavelli understood that the best way to fix this problem would be to transcend Italy’s city-state system and create a single Italian state that could stand up to Austria and France and keep them at bay. The brutal and frank advice he offered to some future Italian prince was principally aimed at helping that leader unify Italy and “redeem her from these barbarous cruelties and insults.”56 Italians would have to imitate their larger and more powerful neighbors and create a state of their own if they hoped to survive. This unification, however, did not happen until 1870.

马基雅维利写作的时代，正是王朝国家在欧洲兴起之时。虽然这种早期形式的国家善于从民众身上榨取资源，却难以赢得民众的忠诚。主权掌握在君主手中，而非民众手中，因此马基雅维利向君主传授了如何操纵民众的道理。法国大革命（1789年）之后，这种情况发生了翻天覆地的变化，法国由此成为欧洲第一个民族国家。民族主义在法国的兴起意味着……许多法国人开始对自己的国家产生强烈的忠诚感，甚至愿意为之战斗乃至牺牲。民族主义极大地增强了法国革命和拿破仑时期的军队实力，使其得以建立一支极其强大的军队，横扫欧洲大部分地区。最终，法国用了23年（1792-1815年）的时间，并经历了六大强国联盟的联合才将其击败。57

Machiavelli wrote at a time when the dynastic state was just emerging in Europe. While that early version of the state was good for extracting resources from its population, it elicited little loyalty from the people living within its borders. Sovereignty was lodged in the crown, not in the population, which is why Machiavelli addressed a prince and instructed him on how to manipulate his people. That situation changed drastically in the wake of the French Revolution (1789), when France transformed itself into Europe’s first nation-state. The arrival of nationalism in France meant that many French people began to feel a powerful allegiance to their state and were even willing to fight and die for it. Nationalism was a huge force multiplier that allowed Revolutionary and Napoleonic France to create a remarkably powerful mass army that overran most of Europe. Twenty-three years (1792–1815) and six great power coalitions were required to defeat it.57

其他欧洲国家最终意识到，如果想要在欧洲舞台上生存下去，它们别无选择，只能效仿法国，成为民族国家。普鲁士在拿破仑战争期间的行动便是这一现象的鲜明例证。1806年10月，拿破仑的军队在耶拿和奥尔施泰特战役中彻底击败普鲁士军队后，普鲁士领导人意识到，克服对民族主义的恐惧，并利用民族主义将军队打造成为一支更加强大的战斗力量，是他们摆脱拿破仑统治的唯一希望。他们采取了必要的措施，普鲁士随后在击败拿破仑军队、结束其无情侵略统治的过程中发挥了重要作用。58

The other European states eventually realized that if they hoped to survive in the European arena, they had little choice but to imitate France and become nation-states. Prussia’s actions during the Napoleonic Wars provide a clear example of this phenomenon. After Napoleon’s forces decisively defeated the Prussian army in battles at Jena and Auerstedt in October 1806, Prussia’s leaders realized that overcoming their fear of nationalism and using it to turn their army into a much more formidable fighting force was their only hope for getting out from under Napoleon’s yoke. They took the necessary steps, and Prussia subsequently played an important role in helping to defeat Napoleon’s armies and end his reign of relentless aggression.58

到二十世纪初，欧洲的每个国家实际上都已成为民族国家。主权不再属于君主，而是属于人民。59以生存为导向的权力政治逻辑，对于王朝国家战胜竞争对手至关重要，而对于民族国家最终将王朝国家淘汰出局也同样至关重要。

By the early twentieth century, every state in Europe was effectively a nation-state. Sovereignty no longer resided in the crown but was lodged in the people.59 The logic of power politics, with its emphasis on survival, had been critical in helping the dynastic state best its competitors, and then in helping the nation-state put the dynastic state out of business.

国家和国家

Nations and States

民族主义在构建当今国际体系中也发挥了至关重要的作用。这方面的内容在第四章已详述，因此此处仅作简要概述。由于种种原因（这些原因超出了本书的讨论范围），在18世纪下半叶王朝国家占据主导地位的政治单位时期，民族国家开始在欧洲和北美出现。民族国家的特殊之处在于，它们是当代世界最高形式的社会群体。它们作为生存载体，使成员能够携手合作，保障基本生活所需。但民族国家也担忧自身的生存，因为它们身处一个充满竞争对手的世界，这些竞争对手可能出于某种动机而对它们构成威胁。

Nationalism also played a crucial role in making the present-day international system. Much of this story has been told in chapter 4, so just a brief synopsis is necessary here. For a variety of reasons that lie outside the scope of this book, nations began to appear in Europe and North America in the latter half of the eighteenth century, when dynastic states were the dominant political unit. What makes nations so special is that they are the highest form of social group in the contemporary world. They function as survival vehicles that allow their members to work together to secure the basic necessities of life. But nations also worry about their survival, since they operate in a world of rival nations that might have incentives to harm them.

一个国家保障自身生存的最佳途径是拥有自己的国家，这并非意味着没有国家就注定灭亡。但拥有国家无疑能最大限度地提高其生存的可能性。因此，从……首先，各国都怀有建立自身国家的强烈愿望，这最终导致了民族国家的兴起。此外，鉴于这些国家在国际无政府状态下运作，每个国家都希望自己的国家格外强大，以确保自身的长期生存。本质上，民族主义强化了基本的现实主义逻辑，而现实主义本身也在深刻地塑造着现代世界。

The best way for a nation to guarantee its survival is to have its own state, which is not to say nations are condemned to ruin if they do not control a state. But it certainly maximizes their prospects of survival. Thus, from the start, nations had an irresistible incentive to have their own state, which eventually led to the rise of nation-states. Moreover, given that those states operate in international anarchy, each nation wanted its own state to be especially powerful, so as to guarantee the nation’s long-term survival. In essence, nationalism reinforced basic realist logic, which by itself was shaping the modern world in profound ways.

这种逻辑也适用于欧洲以外的地区，许多帝国主义的受害者都深切担忧自身文化的长远存亡。随着时间的推移，被统治的人民逐渐意识到，应对这种威胁的最佳途径是奋起反抗，摆脱帝国的统治，建立自己的国家。这一过程在二十世纪的许多地方上演，也在很大程度上解释了为什么所有欧洲帝国最终走向衰落，以及为什么如今世界完全由主权民族国家组成。

This logic also applies outside Europe, where many of imperialism’s victims were deeply concerned about their culture’s long-term survival. Over time, it became clear to the subject peoples that the best way to deal with this threat was to rise up, break away from the empires that controlled them, and establish their own states. This process played out in numerous places during the twentieth century and explains in good part why the sun eventually set on all of the European empires, as well as why the world is now entirely populated with sovereign nation-states.

不仅各国都渴望拥有自己的国家，国家本身也有强大的动力确保其人民组成一个民族。正如上文所述，国家倾向于民族主义，因为它已成为不可或缺的军事力量来源。但中央政府也会出于与安全无关的原因而培育本国的民族国家。拥有共同语言和教育体系的民族文化不仅在经济上意义重大，在行政管理上也同样重要。一个公民拥有统一的文化，并且对国家抱有强烈的认同感，这​​样的国家更容易治理。国家需要民族，民族也需要国家，最终，民族国家成为了地球上最主要的政治形态。

Not only do nations want their own state, but states also have powerful incentives to make sure their people constitute a nation. As discussed above, states gravitate to nationalism because it has become an indispensable source of military power. But central governments also cultivate their own nation-states for reasons unrelated to security. Not only does it make good economic sense to have a national culture with a common language and educational system, it also makes sense administratively. It is much easier to run a country whose citizens are part of a standardized culture and also feel a strong bond with the state. States want nations and nations want states, and the result is that nation-states have become the dominant political form on the planet.

要了解民族主义的强大力量，一种方法是考察它与其他普世意识形态（而非自由主义）碰撞时会发生什么。例如，马克思主义与自由主义有一些惊人的相似之处。正如约翰·格雷所说：“两者都是开明的意识形态，都展望着一个普世文明。” 60阶级分析是马克思普世主义背后的驱动力：他和他的追随者认为，社会阶级超越了民族群体和国界。最重要的是，他们认为，不同国家的工人阶级之间存在着一种强大的纽带，这种纽带是由资本主义剥削造成的。这种思路使一些马克思主义者相信，欧洲各地的工人不会在……时期互相残杀。第一次世界大战爆发。当然，他们错了。这些工人为了各自的民族国家浴血奋战，牺牲了大量生命。

One way to see the brute power of nationalism is to consider what happens when it comes up against other universal ideologies besides liberalism. Marxism, for example, has some striking similarities with liberalism. As John Gray puts it: “Both were enlightened ideologies that looked forward to a universal civilization.”60 Class analysis is the driving force behind Marx’s universalism: he and his followers maintain that social classes transcend national groups and state borders. Most importantly, they argue that a powerful bond exists among the working classes in different countries, created by capitalist exploitation. This line of thinking led some Marxists to believe that the workers across Europe would not take up arms against each other at the start of World War I. Of course, they were wrong. Those workers fought and died in huge numbers for their respective nation-states.

苏联是二十世纪典型的共产主义国家。但它包含许多不同的民族，尽管政府试图削弱它们，这些民族仍然保持着牢固的完整性，而民族主义最终在苏联的解体中扮演了关键角色。 61 此外，正如本尼迪克特·安德森所指出的，“自二战结束以来，每一次成功的革命都以民族主义的视角来定义自身”，包括中国和越南等马克思主义国家的革命。安德森还强调，共产主义国家之间爆发战争的案例屡见不鲜，“交战各方都只是敷衍了事地试图用公认的马克思主义理论视角来为流血冲突辩护”。根据马克思主义理论，这些战争本不应该发生，但它们确实发生了。安德森接着引用了著名马克思主义学者汤姆·奈恩的观点，奈恩认为“民族主义理论代表了马克思主义历史上的重大失败”。 62

The Soviet Union was the quintessential communist country in the twentieth century. But it contained many distinct nations, which remained firmly intact despite government efforts to weaken them, and nationalism ultimately played a key role in the unraveling of the Soviet Union.61 Furthermore, as Benedict Anderson notes, “Since the end of World War II every successful revolution has defined itself in national terms,” including those in Marxist countries like China and Vietnam. Anderson also emphasizes there are a number of cases where communist countries fought wars with each other, and “none of the belligerents has made more than the most perfunctory attempts to justify the bloodshed in terms of a recognizable Marxist theoretical perspective.” Those wars were not supposed to happen, according to Marxist theory, but they did. Anderson goes on to quote the eminent Marxist scholar Tom Nairn, who argues that “the theory of nationalism represents Marxism’s great historical failure.”62

归根结底，当代民族国家体系在很大程度上是民族主义与权力平衡政治相互作用的产物，两者都赋予国家特权，并受生存考量所驱动。自由主义固然在现代世界的形成过程中发挥了作用，但其影响充其量只能算是次要的。

The bottom line is that the contemporary nation-state system is largely the product of the interplay between nationalism and balance-of-power politics, both of which privilege the state and are motivated by concerns about survival. Liberalism has certainly played a role in creating the modern world, but its influence has been secondary at best.

世界状态是否可能存在？

Is a World State Possible?

你或许会同意我反对将政治自由主义作为外交政策的观点，但会认为解决方案显而易见：我们需要一个世界国家。一些学者认为，我们正在走向世界国家，这在很大程度上是因为民族国家无法应对当今世界面临的诸多经济、监管、安全和环境挑战。一旦新的政治秩序建立起来，现实主义将不再重要，民族主义的阴暗面将被掩盖，世界国家将拥有自由主义的政治体系。

You might agree with my case against political liberalism as a foreign policy but argue that the solution is obvious: we need a world state. Some scholars argue that we are moving toward a world state, in large part because nation-states cannot deal with many of the economic, regulatory, security, and environmental challenges the world now faces. Once that new political order is in place, realism will no longer matter, the dark side of nationalism will be put under wraps,63 and the world state will have a liberal political system.

现实主义将被削弱，因为国际体系将不再是无政府状态，而是等级森严的。64在等级制度下，权力平衡逻辑不再适用，因为有守夜人来保护它。弱小的国家。国际政治将大规模地转化为国内政治，自由主义得以蓬勃发展。全球大多数人无疑会继续效忠于他们现有的国家，但根据定义，这些国家都不会拥有自己的国家。届时只会有一个超级大国，世界各地的人们大概都会拥有某种与该国相关的普世身份认同，这种认同会凌驾于，或者至少会削弱他们由来已久的民族主义。即便事实并非如此，这个超级大国也会努力阻止那些敌对国家之间的战争。

Realism would be neutralized because the international system would no longer be anarchic; it would be hierarchic.64 Balance-of-power logic does not apply under hierarchy, because there is a night watchman to protect weaker states. International politics would be transformed into domestic politics on a grand scale, leaving liberalism free to blossom. Most people around the globe would surely retain some allegiance to their present nation, but none of those nations, by definition, would have its own state. There would be only one super-sized state, and people everywhere would presumably have some sort of universal identity linked with that state, which would override, or at least dampen, their long-standing nationalisms. But even if that proved not to be the case, the überstate would work to keep those rival nations from fighting.

世界国家短期内不会出现。首先，任何拥有主权的国家几乎不可能自愿放弃其主权。而且，那些渴望建立国家的国家也很难放弃这一愿望。各国都执着于自决，因此不太可能愿意将自己的命运交到一个它们最多只能有限控制的超级大国手中。

There is not going to be a world state anytime soon. For starters, there is virtually no chance that any nation with its own state will voluntarily give it up. And it is hard to imagine that those nations clamoring for a state will abandon that aspiration. Nations are obsessed with self-determination and thus unlikely to be willing to put their fate in the hands of a superstate over which they have at best limited control.

有人可能会认为，全球化正促使各国趋向某种普世文化，以此作为世界国家的基础。然而，几乎没有证据支持这种观点，反而有大量证据表明，即使在互联网时代，根深蒂固的文化仍然以其广为人知且备受推崇的独特性而存在。此外，要形成一种普世文化，就意味着要让绝大多数人类就美好生活的构成达成广泛共识。鉴于达成这种共识是不可能的，普世文化也就无从谈起，这意味着不太可能出现一个拥有自由政治制度的可行的世界国家。

One might argue that globalization is causing nations to converge toward some universal culture that can serve as the foundation of a world state. There is little evidence to support this belief, and abundant evidence that even in the age of the Internet, deeply rooted cultures remain distinct in ways that are widely recognized and often celebrated. Furthermore, generating a universal culture would mean getting most of humankind to reach broad agreement on what constitutes the good life. Given that it is impossible to achieve such a consensus, there is no prospect of a universal culture, meaning that there will likely be no viable world state with a liberal political system.

建立世界国家的另一种可能途径是通过征服。一个特别强大的国家必须主动出击，征服其他国家。但这也不可能发生。地球太大了，一个国家不可能征服全部甚至大部分，尤其考虑到跨越海洋投射军事力量的难度。征服者将面临潜在被征服民族的顽强抵抗，这些民族会出于强烈的动机结盟，以遏制并最终消灭侵略者。美国，有史以来最强大的国家，从未暗示过要用武力建立一个由美国主导的世界国家。原因很简单：这是一项不可能完成的任务。

The other conceivable route to a world state is via conquest. One especially powerful nation-state would have to take the offensive and subjugate the other countries. This is also not going to happen. The planet is simply too big for one country to conquer all or even most of it, especially when you consider the difficulty of projecting military power across oceans. The conqueror would face fierce resistance from its potential subject peoples, who would have powerful incentives to ally with each other to contain and ultimately destroy the aggressor. The United States, the most powerful state in recorded history, has never even hinted at using force to create an American-dominated world state. The reason is simple: it is an impossible task.

如果我的分析有误，世界国家真的成为现实，它很可能不会是一个自由主义国家。自由主义不仅对许多国家而言是陌生的，而且在新的地区发展也需要时间，难度很大。为了遏制世界国家内部的各种离心力——而这些离心力肯定很多——中央政权必须实行铁腕统治。即便如此，它也未必能够阻止大规模暴力冲突的爆发。这正是许多自由主义者对世界国家缺乏热情的原因之一。例如，康德和罗尔斯都反对世界国家，因为他们认为世界国家要么会走向专制，要么正如罗尔斯所说，“会成为一个饱受内战蹂躏的脆弱帝国”。 65

If my analysis is wrong and a world state becomes a reality, it would probably not be a liberal state. Not only is liberalism foreign to many countries, it is also time-consuming and difficult to grow in new places. To keep all the centrifugal forces within that world state at bay—and there would be many—the center would have to rule with an iron fist. Even then it might not be able to prevent major outbreaks of violence. This is one reason why many liberals have little enthusiasm for a world state. Both Kant and Rawls, for example, opposed the idea because they thought it would be either despotic or, as Rawls put it, “a fragile empire torn by frequent civil war.”65

无政府状态将长期存在

Anarchy Is Here to Stay

如果未来没有世界国家，那就意味着国际无政府状态将长期存在，大国别无选择，只能按照现实主义的法则行事。生存需要如此。然而，有时，有利的权力平衡会允许一个国家追求自由主义霸权，但这种情况下很可能失败。自由主义作为一种政治制度有很多优点，但当它应用于国际政治时，其政策往往难以成功。

If we have no world state in our future, it means international anarchy is here to stay, and the great powers have little choice but to act according to realist dictates. Survival demands no less. At times, however, a favorable balance of power will allow a state to pursue liberal hegemony, in which case failure is likely. Liberalism has many virtues as a political system, but when it is applied to international politics, the resulting policies do not succeed.

我们可以进一步批判自由主义，认为追求自由主义霸权会带来巨大的代价——不仅对自由主义国家自身，也对目标国家而言。此外，一个奉行自由主义原则的强权国家最终很可能加剧全球动荡。换言之，自由主义外交政策不仅可能失败，而且很可能适得其反。

We can take this criticism of liberalism a step further and argue that pursuing liberal hegemony imposes huge costs—not only on the liberal state but also on the target state. Moreover, a powerful state acting according to liberal dictates is likely to end up fostering instability around the world. A liberal foreign policy, in other words, is likely not only to fail but also to backfire.

6

6

自由主义是麻烦的根源

Liberalism as a Source of Trouble

自由主义霸权的代价始于自由主义国家为了保护人权和在全球传播自由民主而卷入的无休止战争。一旦登上世界舞台，自由主义单极政权很快就会沉迷于战争。

THE COSTS OF LIBERAL HEGEMONY BEGIN with the endless wars a liberal state ends up fighting to protect human rights and spread liberal democracy around the world. Once unleashed on the world stage, a liberal unipole soon becomes addicted to war.

这种军国主义源于五个因素。首先，全球民主化是一项庞大的事业，它提供了大量的战争机会。其次，自由主义政策制定者认为他们有权、有责任、也有能力运用武力来实现其目标。第三，他们往往以传教士般的热情来对待这项任务。第四，追求自由主义霸权会削弱外交手段，使和平解决与其他国家之间的争端变得更加困难。第五，这种雄心勃勃的战略也破坏了主权的概念，而主权是国际政治的核心准则，旨在限制国家间的战争。

This militarism arises from five factors. First, democratizing the globe is a vast mission that provides abundant opportunities to fight. Second, liberal policymakers believe they have the right, the responsibility, and the know-how to use military force to achieve their goals. Third, they often approach their task with missionary zeal. Fourth, pursuing liberal hegemony undercuts diplomacy, making it harder to settle disputes with other countries peacefully. Fifth, that ambitious strategy also undermines the notion of sovereignty, a core norm of international politics that is intended to limit interstate war.

一个强权国家若频繁发动战争，就会加剧国际体系的冲突，造成不稳定。这些武装冲突通常以失败告终，有时甚至会酿成灾难，而最终付出代价的往往是那些本应得到自由主义巨头拯救的国家。人们或许会认为，自由主义精英会从失败中吸取教训，从而避免在海外动用武力，但这种情况却鲜少发生。

The presence of a powerful state prone to fighting war after war increases the amount of conflict in the international system, creating instability. These armed conflicts usually end up failing, sometimes disastrously, and mainly at the expense of the state purportedly being rescued by the liberal goliath. One might think liberal elites would learn from their failures and become averse to using military force abroad, but that seldom happens.

自由主义霸权还会以其他方式加剧不稳定。强大的自由民主国家也倾向于采取不诉诸战争的雄心勃勃的政策。自由主义外交政策往往适得其反，损害其与目标国家的关系。例如，它们经常干涉他国内政。在与专制国家进行外交接触时，它们也倾向于忽视其利益，自以为是地认为自己知道什么对该国最有利。最后，对外自由主义往往会削弱国内自由主义，因为军事化的外交政策必然会催生一个强大的国家安全机构，而这个机构往往会侵犯公民的公民自由。

Liberal hegemony promotes instability in other ways as well. Formidable liberal democracies also tend to embrace ambitious policies short of war that often backfire and poison relations between them and the target countries. For example, they often interfere in the politics of other countries. They are also inclined when engaging diplomatically with an authoritarian country to disregard its interests and think they know what is best for it. Finally, liberalism abroad tends to undermine liberalism at home, because a militaristic foreign policy invariably fosters a powerful national security state prone to violating its citizens’ civil liberties.

我的论点是，一个奉行自由主义霸权的国家最终会给自身和其他国家（尤其是它原本打算帮助的国家）带来弊大于利的后果。我将以比尔·克林顿1992年11月当选总统以来的美国外交政策为例来阐述这一论点。随着1989年冷战的结束和1991年苏联的解体，美国一跃成为当时世界上最强大的国家。不出所料，克林顿政府从一开始就奉行自由主义霸权，这一政策在布什和奥巴马政府时期也得以延续。

My argument is that a country that embraces liberal hegemony ends up doing more harm than good to itself as well as other countries, especially those it intends to help. I will illustrate this argument by focusing on American foreign policy since Bill Clinton was elected to the White House in November 1992. With the end of the Cold War in 1989 and the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991, the United States emerged as by far the most powerful country on the planet. Unsurprisingly, the Clinton administration embraced liberal hegemony from the start, and the policy remained firmly intact through the Bush and Obama administrations.
