不出所料，在此期间，美国卷入了无数战争，几乎在所有冲突中都未能取得实质性胜利。华盛顿在破坏大中东地区的稳定方面也扮演了核心角色，给当地人民带来了巨大的损害。自由主义的英国在这些战争中一直是华盛顿的忠实盟友，也应为美国造成的麻烦承担部分责任。美国决策者还在制造与俄罗斯因乌克兰问题而引发的重大危机中扮演了关键角色。截至本文撰写之时，这场危机仍未见缓和迹象，而且显然不符合美国的利益，更遑论乌克兰的利益。回到美国国内，美国公民的公民自由正受到日益强大的国家安全机构的侵蚀。

Not surprisingly, the United States has been involved in numerous wars during this period and has failed to achieve meaningful success in almost all of those conflicts. Washington has also played a central role in destabilizing the greater Middle East, to the great detriment of the people living there. Liberal Britain, which has acted as Washington’s faithful sidekick in these wars, also bears some share of the blame for the trouble the United States has helped cause. American policymakers also played the key role in producing a major crisis with Russia over Ukraine. At this writing, that crisis shows no signs of abating and is hardly in America’s interest, let alone Ukraine’s. Back in the United States, Americans’ civil liberties have been eroded by an increasingly powerful national security state.

自由主义军国主义

Liberal Militarism

由于自由主义者经常谈论战争的罪恶以及超越强权政治、创造和平世界的重要性，因此将他们描述为军国主义者似乎有些奇怪。但事实上，许多自由主义者都是军国主义者，他们坚定地致力于一项雄心勃勃的外交政策议程，并且毫不犹豫地动用武力来推进该议程。

Because liberals so often speak about the evils of war and the importance of moving beyond power politics to create a peaceful world, it might seem odd to describe them as militarists. But many are militarists, deeply committed to a remarkably ambitious foreign policy agenda and not shy about using military force to advance it.1

自由主义的核心使命之一是保护那些权利受到严重侵犯的人们。当大量外国人遭到杀害时，干预他国事务的冲动尤为强烈。这种使命感在“保护责任”（R2P）中得到了清晰的体现。这一准则源于所谓国际社会未能阻止1994年卢旺达种族灭绝和1995年斯雷布雷尼察大屠杀的惨剧。 2 “保护责任”要求各国不仅有责任保护本国人民免受种族清洗和大规模屠杀等严重侵犯人权行为的侵害，也有责任保护其他国家的人民免受此类罪行的侵害。本质上，各国被要求密切关注全球范围内发生的重大侵犯人权行为，并在此类行为发生时迅速采取行动予以制止。拥有足够军事力量进行干预的强大自由主义国家，会被强烈鼓励发动战争以保护受害者。

One of liberalism’s core missions is to protect people whose rights are being seriously violated. The urge to intervene in other countries is especially powerful when large numbers of those foreigners are being killed. This undertaking is clearly reflected in Responsibility to Protect (R2P), a norm that grew out of the failure of the so-called international community to prevent the Rwandan genocide in 1994 and the Srebrenica massacre in 1995.2 R2P mandates that states have a responsibility not only to protect their own populations from serious human rights violations like ethnic cleansing and mass murder, but also to protect people in other countries from these crimes. In essence, nations are told to be on the lookout for major human rights abuses around the globe and, when they arise, to move quickly to stop them. A powerful liberal state with the military wherewithal to intervene in such circumstances is strongly encouraged to go to war to protect the victims.

捍卫个人权利的任务很容易演变为一项更为雄心勃勃的战略：通过在其他国家积极推广自由民主来消除问题的根源。自由国家顾名思义，致力于保护公民的权利，而这一战略，正如有人所论证的那样，也将带来一个更加和平的世界，并有助于保护自由民主免受内部敌人的侵害。自由主义也被认为能够促进经济繁荣，这不仅本身就是一个积极的目标，而且也有助于和平。简而言之，传播自由主义被认为能够使世界更加安全、和平与繁荣。

This task of defending individual rights easily morphs into the more ambitious strategy of removing the source of the problem by actively promoting liberal democracy in other countries. Liberal states, by definition, are committed to protecting their citizens’ rights, and this strategy, so the argument goes, will also lead to a more peaceful world and help protect liberal democracy from its internal enemies. Liberalism is also said to facilitate economic prosperity, which not only is a positive end in itself but also contributes to peace. In short, spreading liberalism is thought to make the world safer, more peaceful, and more prosperous.

从无数美国自由派人士的评论中我们可以看出，这种世界观的拥护者往往对此深信不疑。例如，在第一次世界大战期间，曾任西奥多·罗斯福总统国务卿和陆军部长的伊莱休·鲁特曾表示：“为了确保安全，民主必须在力所能及的范围内消灭敌人。世界不能一半民主一半专制。”在越南战争期间，国务卿迪安·腊斯克宣称，“只有当整个国际环境在意识形态上安全时，美国才能安全。”正如克里斯托弗·莱恩所指出的，“这些并非孤立的评论……美国政治家经常表达这种观点。” ³

As we can see from countless comments by American liberals, proponents of this worldview tend to be deeply committed to it. In the midst of World War I, for example, Elihu Root, who had been both secretary of state and secretary of war under President Theodore Roosevelt, stated, “To be safe democracy must kill its enemy when it can and where it can. The world cannot be half democratic and half autocratic.” In the midst of the Vietnam War, Secretary of State Dean Rusk declared that the “United States cannot be secure until the total international environment is ideologically safe.” As Christopher Layne notes, “These are not isolated comments. . . . American statesmen have frequently expressed this view.”3

这种传教热情绝不仅限于政策制定者。例如，约翰·罗尔斯写道：“自由而体面的民族的特点是……”他们寻求一个所有民族都拥有良好秩序的政权的世界……他们的长远目标是最终使所有社会都尊重万民法，并成为良好秩序民族社会中享有良好地位的正式成员。” 4这一雄心勃勃的计划并非必然导致战争，罗尔斯也谨慎地明确表示，他并非主张通过武装十字军东征来将自由民主传播到世界各地。 5 然而，毫无疑问，战争常常被视为促进自由主义的一种可行甚至颇具吸引力的选择。这种倾向于运用武力来实现自由主义目标的做法，在著名自由主义干涉主义者约翰·欧文的著作中有所体现。他评论道：“自由主义思想使自由民主国家倾向于避免彼此之间的战争，……同样的思想也促使这些国家与非自由主义国家开战。”此外，他还写道：“所有人都渴望和平，并且应该只将战争作为实现和平的工具。” 6

This missionary zeal is hardly limited to policymakers. John Rawls, for example, writes, “It is characteristic of liberal and decent peoples that they seek a world in which all peoples have a well-ordered regime. . . . Their long-range aim is to bring all societies eventually to honor the Law of Peoples and to become full members in good standing of the society of well-ordered peoples.”4 This ambitious agenda does not axiomatically lead to war, and Rawls is careful to make clear that he is not advocating armed crusades to spread liberal democracy across the planet.5 Still, there is no question that war is often seen as a viable and even attractive option for promoting liberalism. This penchant for employing force to achieve liberal goals is reflected in the writings of John Owen, a prominent liberal interventionist, who comments that “liberal ideas cause liberal democracies to tend away from war with one another, and . . . the same ideas prod these states into war with illiberal states.” Moreover, he writes, “all individuals share an interest in peace, and should want war only as an instrument to bring about peace.”6

布什主义于2002年制定，并被用来为2003年3月入侵伊拉克辩护，它或许是此类自由主义干涉主义的最佳例证。在9·11事件之后，布什政府得出结论：要赢得其所谓的“全球反恐战争”，不仅要击败基地组织，还要对抗伊朗、伊拉克和叙利亚。这些所谓的“流氓国家”政权被认为与基地组织等恐怖组织关系密切，并且一心想要获得核武器，甚至可能将其提供给恐怖分子。简而言之，它们是美国的死敌。布什提议动用军事力量将这些国家以及中东其他国家转变为自由民主国家。 2003年初，就在美国入侵伊拉克之前，他简洁地阐述了这一点：“凭借美国以及我们的朋友和盟友的决心和目标，我们将创造一个进步与自由的时代。自由的人民将决定历史的进程，自由的人民将维护世界和平。” 8

The Bush Doctrine, developed during 2002 and used to justify the March 2003 invasion of Iraq, is probably the best example of this kind of liberal interventionism. In the wake of the 9/11 attacks, the Bush administration concluded that to win what it termed the “global war on terror” it must not only defeat al Qaeda but also confront Iran, Iraq, and Syria. The regimes in these so-called rogue states were assumed to be closely tied to terrorist organizations like al Qaeda and were bent on acquiring nuclear weapons, which they might even give to terrorists.7 In short, they were mortal enemies of the United States. Bush proposed to use military might to turn those countries and others across the Middle East into liberal democracies. He put the point succinctly in early 2003, just before the United States attacked Iraq: “By the resolve and purpose of America, and of our friends and allies, we will make this an age of progress and liberty. Free people will set the course of history, and free people will keep the peace of the world.”8

毫无疑问，布什总统及其副手推翻萨达姆·侯赛因政权的另一个原因是，他是一个残暴的独裁者，践踏公民的权利。但这本身是一个由来已久的问题，不足以促使美国除掉侯赛因，代之以民选领导人。真正驱使美国入侵伊拉克的是其认为需要应对恐怖主义和核扩散问题。布什团队认为，解决这一问题的最佳途径是将整个中东地区的所有国家都转变为自由主义国家。民主国家。这将使该地区成为一片巨大的和平区，并彻底解决这两个问题。“世界显然希望民主价值观得以传播，”总统说，“因为稳定自由的国家不会滋生杀戮的意识形态。它们鼓励人们以和平的方式追求更美好的生活。”

There is no question that President Bush and his lieutenants were also motivated to topple Saddam Hussein from power because he was a brutal dictator who trampled on the rights of his citizens. But that was a long-standing problem that, by itself, could not cause the United States to get rid of Hussein and replace him with a democratically elected leader. What drove the United States to invade Iraq was the perceived need to deal with the proliferation and terrorism. And the best way to do that, the Bush team thought, was to turn all the countries in the greater Middle East into liberal democracies. This would make the region a giant zone of peace and take both problems off the table. “The world has a clear interest in the spread of democratic values,” the president said, “because stable and free nations do not breed the ideologies of murder. They encourage the peaceful pursuit of a better life.”9

这些行动充分展现了自由主义霸权的特征。拥有强大军事力量的自由主义者极易发动战争，不仅是为了保护他国的个人权利，也是为了传播自由民主——他们认为这是保障人权和抵御重大安全威胁的最佳途径。鉴于地球上不乏独裁政权、严重侵犯人权的国家以及构成军事威胁的国家，像美国这样的强国，如果任其自由地推行自由主义霸权，最终很可能陷入永无休止的战争状态。

These actions show all the earmarks of liberal hegemony. Liberals with a formidable military at their disposal are strongly inclined to fight wars not only to protect individual rights in other countries but also to spread liberal democracy, which they see as the best way to safeguard rights and protect against important security threats. Given that our planet has no shortage of autocracies, serious human rights violators, or countries that present a military threat, a powerful country like the United States, left free to pursue liberal hegemony, is likely to end up in a perpetual state of war.

自由主义使外交更加困难

Liberalism Makes Diplomacy Harder

自由主义单极格局军事化的另一个因素是，自由主义霸权使得与威权国家的外交更加困难，从而进一步增加了战争的可能性。外交是两个或多个国家之间就一个对它们都至关重要的问题进行谈判的过程，这些国家的观点存在冲突。其目标是达成一项和平解决争端的协议。为了取得成功，各方都必须做出一些让步，尽管这些让步不必是对称的。这就是为什么亨利·基辛格认为外交“是限制权力行使的艺术”。 10双方不必将彼此视为平等。但为了使外交奏效，即使是宿敌也必须彼此尊重。

Another factor that helps militarize the liberal unipole is that liberal hegemony makes diplomacy with authoritarian states more difficult, further increasing the likelihood of war. Diplomacy is a bargaining process between two or more states that have conflicting views on an issue that matters to all of them. The aim is to produce an agreement that settles the dispute peacefully. To achieve success, each party must make some concessions, although they need not be symmetrical. This is why Henry Kissinger maintains that diplomacy “is the art of restraining the exercise of power.”10 It is not necessary that each side treat the other as an equal. But for diplomacy to work, even bitter foes have to show some respect for each other.

战争与外交是两种截然不同的治国手段——二者互为替代方案。前者依靠对话与谈判解决争端，后者则诉诸武力。外交通常被认为是一种更安全、成本更低的选择：正如温斯顿·丘吉尔1954年在白宫所说，“谈判总比战争好。” 11 然而，外交与战争往往相辅相成。例如，在武力威胁的支持下，外交通常更为有效。而且，外交也常被用于战争期间，以寻求结束战争的途径。然而，“大棒外交”的目标仍然是避免或结束战争。如果一个面临敌对对手的国家放弃外交手段，战争发生的可能性就会增加，而且一旦爆发，就更难结束。

War and diplomacy are distinct instruments of statecraft—each is an alternative to the other. One relies on dialogue and negotiations to settle disputes, while the other employs military force. Diplomacy is generally considered the safer and less expensive option: as Winston Churchill said at the White House in 1954, “Jaw-jaw is always better than war-war.”11 Nevertheless, diplomacy and war often work in tandem. For example, diplomacy is usually more effective when backed up by the threat of military force. And it is often employed during wars to find a way of ending the fighting. Still, the aim of “big stick diplomacy” is to either avoid or terminate a war. If a state facing a hostile rival abjures diplomacy, war becomes more likely and harder to terminate once it starts.

当自由民主国家遵循现实主义原则行事时（这种情况占大多数），它们与非自由主义国家开展外交活动几乎毫无困难。在这种情况下，自由民主国家会竭尽所能地维护自身生存，这其中就包括与专制领导人进行谈判。它们有时甚至会支持或与残暴的独裁者结盟，例如二战期间美国与斯大林合作击败纳粹德国，或者1972年后与毛泽东合作遏制苏联。有时，它们甚至会推翻它们认为敌对的民主政权。自由民主国家竭力用自由主义的辞藻掩盖这种行为，但实际上，它们的所作所为违背了自身的原则。这就是现实政治的影响。

Liberal democracies have little difficulty conducting diplomacy with illiberal states when they are acting according to realist dictates, which is most of the time. In those circumstances, liberal democracies do whatever is necessary to maximize their survival prospects, and that includes negotiating with authoritarian leaders. They sometimes even support or form alliances with murderous dictators, as the United Stated did in World War II when it worked with Joseph Stalin to defeat Nazi Germany, or when it cooperated with Mao Zedong after 1972 to contain the Soviet Union. Occasionally they even overthrow democratic regimes they perceive as hostile. Liberal democracies go to great lengths to disguise such behavior with liberal rhetoric, but in fact they are acting contrary to their own principles. Such is the influence of realpolitik.

然而，当一个单极国家能够摒弃权力平衡逻辑并采取自由主义外交政策时，外交就会受到损害。这样的国家倾向于避免与非自由主义对手进行外交接触，原因大家应该都耳熟能详。尽管宽容是自由主义的核心原则，但当一个自由主义国家面对侵犯其公民权利的对手时，宽容往往会被搁置一旁。毕竟，权利是不可剥夺的。由于威权国家经常损害——有时甚至是践踏——其人民的权利，因此，摆脱了现实主义束缚的自由主义国家很可能会将它们视为存在严重缺陷的政治实体，不值得进行外交接触。

Diplomacy gets shortchanged, however, when a unipolar state is able to push aside balance-of-power logic and adopt a liberal foreign policy. Such a state is strongly inclined to eschew diplomacy with its illiberal foes, for reasons that by now should be familiar. Although tolerance is a core principle of liberalism, it tends to get pushed aside when a liberal state confronts a rival that violates its citizens’ rights. After all, rights are inalienable. Since authoritarian states regularly shortchange—and sometimes trample on—the rights of their people, liberal states freed from the shackles of realism are likely to treat them as deeply flawed polities not worthy of diplomatic engagement.

奉行自由主义霸权的国家往往会对非自由主义国家产生根深蒂固的反感。它们倾向于将国际体系视为由善恶国家组成的对立体系，双方之间几乎没有妥协的余地。这种观点促使它们一旦有机会，便会不惜一切手段消灭专制国家。这种憎恶的一个后果是，自由主义国家难以与非自由主义对手进行有限战争，反而倾向于寻求对它们取得决定性胜利。无条件投降成为常态，因为与邪恶妥协几乎是不可能的。当然，民族主义通常会滋生仇恨。在交战国之间，战争会加剧这种战争升级到极端程度的趋势。

Countries pursuing liberal hegemony often develop a deep-seated antipathy toward illiberal states. They tend to see the international system as consisting of good and evil states, with little room for compromise between the two sides. This view creates a powerful incentive to eliminate authoritarian states by whatever means necessary whenever the opportunity presents itself. One consequence of this loathing is that liberal states find it hard to engage in limited wars with illiberal foes and instead are inclined to pursue decisive victories against them. Unconditional surrender becomes the order of the day, as it is virtually impossible to countenance compromising with evil.12 Of course, nationalism, which usually generates hatred between states at war with each other, reinforces this tendency for wars to escalate to their extreme.

这种消灭主义心态或许最能体现伍德罗·威尔逊在第一次世界大战后如何处理德国和其他战败国的问题上。他认为，既然和平无法通过“安排、妥协或利益调整”来实现，那么就不能与同盟国政府进行任何形式的交易或妥协。威尔逊将妥协与权力平衡政治联系起来，他轻蔑地称之为“旧的国际政治秩序”，并认为必须“彻底摧毁”。目标必须是“战胜邪恶，一劳永逸地击败那些破坏和平、使和平成为不可能的邪恶势力”。1919年末，他谈到《凡尔赛条约》时说：“我听说这项条约对德国非常苛刻。当一个人犯下罪行时，惩罚固然严厉，但并非不公正。这个国家通过不择手段的统治者，犯下了反人类的罪行，它必将受到惩罚。” 13

This eliminationist mentality is perhaps best reflected in Woodrow Wilson’s thinking about how to deal with Germany and the other defeated powers after World War I. Since peace could not be achieved by an “arrangement or compromise or adjustment of interests,” he argued, there could not be “any kind of bargain or compromise with the governments of the Central Empires.” Wilson associated compromise with balance-of-power politics, what he contemptuously called the “old order of international politics,” and which he felt had to be “utterly destroyed.” The goal had to be “the overcoming of evil, by the defeat once [and] for all of the sinister forces that interrupt peace and render it impossible.” In late 1919 he said of the Treaty of Versailles, “I hear that this treaty is very hard on Germany. When an individual has committed a criminal act, the punishment is hard, but the punishment is not unjust. This nation permitted itself, through unscrupulous governors, to commit a criminal act against mankind, and it is to undergo the punishment.”13

归根结底，当一个自由民主国家能够按照其立国原则在国际上自由行事时，它便会发现很难与一个非自由主义的对手进行外交接触，这增加了双方试图以暴力手段解决分歧的可能性。自由主义的不宽容，有时甚至伴随着对自由主义的憎恨，会将一个摆脱了权力平衡政治约束的自由主义单极国家拖入无休止的战争。

The bottom line is that when a liberal democracy is free to act abroad according to its foundational principles, it finds it difficult to engage in diplomacy with an illiberal opponent, increasing the likelihood that the two sides will attempt to settle their differences violently. Liberal intolerance, sometimes accompanied by liberal loathing, leads a liberal unipole freed from balance-of-power politics into endless wars.

自由主义与主权

Liberalism and Sovereignty

追求自由主义霸权的国家好战的最后一个原因是：自由主义损害了主权。尊重主权是国际政治中最重要的准则，其目的是最大限度地减少战争，促进国家间的和平关系。例如，《联合国宪章》第一条第一款规定，联合国的宗旨是“维护国际和平及安全”。第二条第一款规定，“本组织建立在所有会员国主权平等的原则之上”。

There is a final reason why states pursuing liberal hegemony become warlike: liberalism undermines sovereignty. Respect for sovereignty is the most significant norm in international politics, and its purpose is to minimize war and facilitate peaceful relations among states. Consider, for example, the United Nations Charter. The first sentence of Article I states that the goal of the United Nations is “to maintain international peace and security.” The first sentence of Article II says that “the Organization is based on the principle of the sovereign equality of all its members.”

主权意味着国家对其境内发生的一切都拥有最终决定权，外国势力无权干涉其政治。所有国家在这方面一律平等，这意味着无论强弱，所有国家都应享有制定自身内政外交政策的自由，不受其他国家的影响。国家主权这一概念已成为国际法的基石，它意味着各国不得相互侵略，至少未经联合国安理会许可不得如此。

Sovereignty means that states have the ultimate authority over what happens inside their borders, and that foreign powers have no right to interfere in their politics.14 All states are equal in this regard, which means that weak as well as powerful countries are supposed to be free to make their own policies, domestic and foreign, without outside influence from other states. This notion of state sovereignty, which has become the cornerstone of international law, means that countries are not supposed to invade each other, at least not without permission from the United Nations Security Council.

然而，毫无疑问，规范对国家行为的影响是有限的。主权遭到侵犯的案例屡见不鲜。正如任何现实主义者都会告诉你的那样，当事关重大安全问题时，各国会采取它们认为符合自身利益的行动，而不管这是否违反了现行规范或国际机构的成文规则。尽管如此，几乎所有领导人都重视合法性，因此会密切关注既定的规范，因为他们不希望被其他国家视为肆意践踏那些广受尊重和支持的规则。主权问题尤其如此，因为它在国际政治中占据核心地位。至少在某些情况下，当决策者不确定入侵他国是否具有战略意义时，主权规范很可能会影响最终决策。

There is no question, however, that norms have a limited impact on state behavior. Sovereignty has been violated many times.15 As any realist can tell you, when matters of vital security are at play, states will do what they think is in their self-interest, regardless of whether it violates prevailing norms or the written rules of international institutions.16 Nonetheless, almost all leaders care about legitimacy and thus pay careful attention to well-established norms, as they do not want to be seen by other states as wantonly disregarding rules that enjoy widespread respect and support. This is especially true of sovereignty because of its centrality to international politics. In at least some cases where policymakers are not sure whether invading another country makes good strategic sense, the norm of sovereignty is likely to influence the final decision.

主权作为一种规范，在16世纪初欧洲国家开始形成时便已初露端倪，但直到《威斯特伐利亚和约》签订后才真正确立其地位。该和约有助于结束1618年至1648年间血腥无比的三十年战争，据估计，这场战争导致德国三分之一的人口丧生。18当时欧洲的大部分冲突都源于宗教分歧。天主教国家和新教国家互相入侵，企图使对方皈依基督教。主权规范旨在通过禁止此类武装干预来制止这种行为。主权或许有助于结束那些致命的宗教战争，但它并未阻止欧洲各国进行权力平衡政治博弈，导致它们在认为自身重大利益受到威胁时便会违反主权规范。此外，主权的概念原本并不适用于欧洲以外的地区，这一例外情况也使得欧洲国家难以摆脱主权的束缚。欧洲列强得以在世界各地自由建立帝国。因此，在《威斯特伐利亚和约》签订后的大约两百年间，主权对欧洲国家的行为几乎没有产生任何影响。19

Sovereignty began to emerge as a norm when states first started forming in Europe in the early 1500s, but it did not achieve prominence until the Treaty of Westphalia, which helped bring an end to the incredibly bloody Thirty Years’ War of 1618–48,17 which by some estimates killed one-third of Germany’s population.18 Much of the conflict in Europe during that era was motivated by religious differences. Catholic and Protestant countries invaded each other with the hope of converting the target state. The norm of sovereignty was designed to put an end to this behavior by ruling such armed interventions out of court. Sovereignty may have helped put an end to those deadly religious wars, but it did not stop the European states from engaging in balance-of-power politics, which led them to violate the norm whenever they thought their vital interests were at stake. Nor was the concept of sovereignty meant to apply outside Europe, an exception that left the European great powers free to build empires throughout the world. So sovereignty had little effect on the behavior of European states for roughly two hundred years after the Peace of Westphalia.19

随着民族主义的兴起——19世纪在欧洲，以及20世纪在殖民帝国——主权的概念变得更加深刻。民族主义的核心在于自决，它认为生活在国家疆界内的人民有权决定自身的命运，任何外部势力都无权将其观点强加于其他民族国家。因此，主权与民族和国家密不可分。本质上，民族主义逻辑强化了威斯特伐利亚体系下的主权。然而，民族主义对主权的影响主要体现在欧洲以外的地区，它通过强调自决和不干涉原则，促进了20世纪的非殖民化进程。实际上，它有助于削弱帝国的合法性。因此，那些曾经遭受欧洲帝国主义蹂躏的国家如今坚定地拥护主权理念也就不足为奇了。

With the growth of nationalism—in Europe during the nineteenth century and in the colonial empires during the twentieth century—sovereignty became a more meaningful concept. Nationalism, which is all about self-determination, says that the people living inside a state’s borders have the right to determine their own fate, and no outside power has the right to impose its views on another nation-state. Sovereignty is thus inextricably bound up with the nation as well as the state. In essence, nationalist logic reinforced Westphalian sovereignty. But nationalism had its greatest impact on sovereignty outside Europe, where it helped facilitate decolonization in the twentieth century by focusing great attention on the principles of self-determination and nonintervention.20 In effect, it helped delegitimize empire. It is no surprise that the countries that were once victims of European imperialism staunchly support the concept of sovereignty today.

主权的影响力在20世纪80年代末期可能达到了顶峰，当时冷战即将结束。世界各国都拥护主权，这尤其引起了试图摆脱苏联控制的东欧国家的共鸣。冷战结束后，许多苏联加盟共和国开始讨论争取主权，最终也实现了这一目标。但到了20世纪90年代中期，主权准则开始瓦解，这主要是因为美国比以往任何时候都更加频繁地干涉他国内政。这个唯一的极点不仅拥有令人敬畏的军事力量，能够将力量投射到全球各地，而且作为一个自由主义国家，它有动机干涉他国内政。英国和西欧大多数国家都乐于帮助华盛顿推行其雄心勃勃的外交政策。

The influence of sovereignty was probably at its height in the late 1980s, as the Cold War was coming to an end. States all around the globe embraced it, and it definitely resonated with the Eastern European countries trying to free themselves from the Soviet yoke. And once the Cold War ended, many of the republics that comprised the Soviet Union began talking about gaining their own sovereignty, which they eventually did. But the norm was eroding by the mid-1990s, mainly because the United States took to interfering in the politics of other countries even more than it had in the past. Not only did the sole pole have a truly impressive military that could project power all over the globe, but as a liberal state it had the motive to interfere in other countries’ affairs. Britain and most of the countries in Western Europe were eager to help Washington pursue its ambitious foreign policy agenda.

当然，自由主义的本质在于干涉他国内政，无论其目的是为了保护外国人的权利，还是为了传播自由民主。从本质上讲，自由主义与主权是根本对立的。这一点在政策制定者和学者中几乎不存在争议。例如，1999年4月，英国首相托尼·布莱尔在芝加哥发表了一篇广为人知的演讲，他说：“在新千年到来之际，我们身处一个全新的世界……我们面临的最紧迫的外交政策问题是，在何种情况下我们应该积极介入他国的冲突。不干涉原则长期以来被视为国际秩序的一项重要原则，我们不希望轻易放弃它。任何国家都不应认为自己有权改变他国的政治制度，或煽动颠覆活动，或夺取其自认为拥有主权的领土。但是，不干涉原则必须在某些重要方面加以限定。” 21

Liberalism, of course, is all about meddling in other countries’ politics, whether the aim is protecting the rights of foreigners or seeking to spread liberal democracy. In essence, liberalism and sovereignty are fundamentally at odds with each other. This point is hardly controversial among either policymakers or scholars. In April 1999, for example, British prime minister Tony Blair said, in a highly publicized speech in Chicago: “On the eve of a new Millennium we are now in a new world. . . . The most pressing foreign policy problem we face is to identify the circumstances in which we should get actively involved in other people’s conflicts. Non-interference has long been considered an important principle of international order. And it is not one we would want to jettison too readily. One state should not feel it has the right to change the political system of another or foment subversion or seize pieces of territory to which it feels it should have some claim. But the principle of non-interference must be qualified in important respects.”21

五年后，即2004年3月，布莱尔在试图为伊拉克战争辩护时，再次提及他在芝加哥的演讲：“因此，对我而言，在9·11事件之前，我已经在国际关系中寻求一种不同于自1648年《威斯特伐利亚和约》以来一直占据主导地位的传统理念；即一个国家的内政属于它自己，除非它威胁到你，或者违反条约，或者触发联盟义务，否则你不应该干涉。” 22 2000年5月，德国外交部长约施卡·菲舍尔在柏林对听众表示：“1945年后的欧洲核心概念过去是、现在仍然是对欧洲权力平衡原则和1648年《威斯特伐利亚和约》后出现的个别国家霸权野心的否定，这种否定表现为核心利益的更紧密融合以及将民族国家的主权权利移交给超国家的欧洲机构。” 23这一主题在学术界引起了广泛共鸣，例如《超越威斯特伐利亚体系？国家主权与国际干预》和《主权的终结？一个日益萎缩和分裂的世界的政治》等书籍就体现了这一点。24

Five years later, in March 2004, as he was trying to justify the Iraq war, Blair referred back to his Chicago speech: “So, for me, before September 11th, I was already reaching for a different philosophy in international relations from a traditional one that has held sway since the treaty of Westphalia in 1648; namely that a country’s internal affairs are for it and you don’t interfere unless it threatens you, or breaches a treaty, or triggers an obligation of alliance.”22 In May 2000, the German foreign minister Joschka Fischer told a Berlin audience: “The core concept of Europe after 1945 was and still is a rejection of the European balance-of-power principle and the hegemonic ambitions of individual states that emerged after the Peace of Westphalia in 1648, a rejection that took the form of a closer meshing of vital interests and the transfer of nation-state sovereign rights to supranational European institutions.”23 This theme has resonated widely in the academic world, as reflected in books with titles such as Beyond Westphalia? State Sovereignty and International Intervention and The End of Sovereignty? The Politics of a Shrinking and Fragmenting World.24

鉴于其强大的实力和对自由主义原则根深蒂固的坚持，美国在冷战后的主权侵蚀浪潮中扮演了先锋角色。当然，它也极其珍视自身的主权。25虽然华盛顿偶尔会采取单边行动，但它通常会不遗余力地将其他国家卷入其干预行动中，以便声称其行动已获得“国际社会”的认可。然而，削弱主权的一个后果是，它使得美国领导人更容易对其他国家发动战争。主权的侵蚀是另一个原因解释了为什么奉行自由外交政策的强国最终会陷入无休止的战争，并在国内滋生军国主义。

Given its power and its deep-seated commitment to liberal principles, the United States has spearheaded the post–Cold War assault on sovereignty. Of course, it jealously guards its own sovereignty.25 While Washington has occasionally acted unilaterally, it usually has gone to considerable lengths to involve other countries in its interventions so that it can claim that the “international community” has legitimized its actions. One consequence of undermining sovereignty, however, has been to make it easier for American leaders to launch wars against other countries. The erosion of sovereignty is one more reason a powerful state with a liberal foreign policy ends up fighting never-ending wars and fostering militarism at home.

不稳定和代价高昂的故障

Instability and Costly Failures

自由主义霸权也会带来其他代价。首先，尽管其目标是使世界更加和平，但它却加剧了体系的不稳定性。换言之，战争很可能增多而非减少。考虑到自由主义国家的相对实力和固有的好战倾向，这一结果并不令人意外。此外，当一个大国可以自由地奉行自由主义外交政策时，它最终必然会造成严重的麻烦——不仅对自身，也对其盟友、目标国家以及最终被卷入战火的无辜国家造成麻烦。

Liberal hegemony also brings other costs. For starters, even though its aim is to make the world more peaceful, it creates greater instability in the system. In other words, there are likely to be more rather than fewer wars. This outcome is hardly surprising, given the liberal state’s relative power and inherent bellicosity. Furthermore, when a great power is free to pursue a liberal foreign policy, it invariably ends up causing serious trouble—for itself, for its allies, for its target states, and for uninvolved states that end up caught in the crossfire.

激怒列强

Antagonizing the Major Powers

自由主义单极国家不太可能动用武力来保护个人权利或推动大国政权更迭，主要是因为代价太高。然而，它很可能会以其他方式干预该国的政治。其策略可能包括：依靠非政府组织（NGO）支持目标国境内的某些机构和政治人物；将援助、国际机构成员资格和贸易与目标国的人权记录挂钩；以及通过公开报道目标国的人权侵犯行为来使其蒙羞。然而，这种做法不太可能奏效，因为大国总是会将自由主义国家的行为视为对其内政的非法干涉。它会认为其主权受到侵犯，从而导致政策适得其反，并毒化两国关系。

A liberal unipole is unlikely to use military power to protect individual rights or foster regime change in a major power, mainly because the costs are too high. Nevertheless, it is likely to interfere in that country’s politics in other ways. Its tactics might include relying on nongovernmental organizations (NGOs) to support certain institutions and politicians inside the target state; linking aid, membership in international institutions, and trade to the major power’s human rights record; and shaming the target state by publicly reporting its human rights violations. This approach is unlikely to work, however, because the major power invariably views the liberal power’s behavior as illegitimate interference in its internal affairs. It will think its sovereignty is being violated, causing the policy to backfire and poisoning relations between the two countries.

这种行为模式体现在美国近期对中国和俄罗斯的行动中。自1989年中国政府镇压天安门广场抗议者以来，华盛顿一直在推动在中国更广泛地促进人权和自由民主。自1991年俄罗斯建国以来，美国也一直在俄罗斯采取同样的做法，尽管自2000年代初弗拉基米尔·普京就任总统以来，美国决策者对俄罗斯的人权状况尤为关注。美国领导人经常告诉中国和俄罗斯的听众，他们的国家需要变得更像美国。

This pattern of behavior appears in recent U.S. actions toward both China and Russia. Washington has been pushing to promote human rights and liberal democracy more generally in China since the government cracked down on protestors in Tiananmen Square in 1989. It has been doing the same in Russia since that state was created in 1991, although American policymakers have become especially concerned about rights there since the early 2000s, when Vladimir Putin became president. American leaders often tell Chinese and Russian audiences that their countries need to become more like the United States.

就俄罗斯而言，美国不仅关注俄罗斯本身，也关注其近邻。华盛顿大力推动格鲁吉亚（玫瑰革命）、乌克兰（橙色革命）等地的所谓“颜色革命”，希望将它们转变为自由民主国家。当然，这些国家对莫斯科具有重要的战略意义，因为它们与俄罗斯接壤。美国也暗示希望在俄罗斯本土推动一场“颜色革命”。例如，由美国政府资助、致力于在全球范围内推动政权更迭的“国家民主基金会”负责人曾在2013年9月《华盛顿邮报》的一篇评论文章中警告普京，他的执政时间可能屈指可数。 26

In the Russian case, Americans have focused not just on Russia but also on its immediate neighbors. Washington vigorously promoted so-called color revolutions in Georgia (Rose Revolution), Ukraine (Orange Revolution), and elsewhere, in the hope of turning them into liberal democracies. Those countries, of course, are of great strategic importance to Moscow because they share borders with Russia. The United States has also hinted that it would like to encourage a color revolution in Russia itself. For example, the head of the National Endowment for Democracy, which is funded by the U.S. government and dedicated to promoting regime change around the world, warned Putin in a September 2013 op-ed in the Washington Post that his days in office might be numbered.26

2012年1月至2014年2月，迈克尔·麦克福尔担任美国驻莫斯科大使期间，他言行一致地表明了自己长期以来致力于在俄罗斯推动民主的决心。不出所料，俄罗斯政界对麦克福尔的行为感到反感，这加剧了莫斯科与华盛顿之间的紧张关系。正如他自己所承认的，他的所作所为导致俄罗斯媒体称他为“奥巴马派来发动另一场颜色革命的特工”。 27谁又能责怪他们呢？美国人厌恶外国干涉其政治，2016年美国总统大选引发的巨大争议就充分说明了这一点。当自己成为被干涉的目标时，美国人会更加坚定地捍卫自决原则。不出所料，俄罗斯人也是如此。

When Michael McFaul was the American ambassador in Moscow, from January 2012 to February 2014, he made clear by both actions and words his long-standing commitment to promoting democracy in Russia. Predictably, the Russian political establishment recoiled at McFaul’s behavior, which helped poison relations between Moscow and Washington. As he acknowledges, his activities led the Russian press to describe him as “an agent sent by Obama to lead another color revolution.”27 And who can blame them? Americans abhor the idea of foreign interference in their politics, as the huge controversy about Russian involvement in the 2016 U.S. presidential election makes clear. When they find themselves the target nation, Americans become deeply committed to the principle of self-determination. Not surprisingly, so do the Russians.

在捍卫自身主权方面，中国领导人也并无二致。他们对美国频繁就人权问题发表的言论感到不满，认为这是美国不可告人的阴谋，其最终目的是推翻美国政权。他们对美国意图的怀疑根深蒂固，以至于当香港爆发民主抗议活动时，即使没有任何证据支持这种想法，中国领导人也确信美国在背后支持。28针对美国在人权问题上的批评，中国每年都会发布自己的人权报告，严厉批评美国的人权记录。29简而言之，华盛顿的推动北京走向自由化的努力，如同对俄关系一样，恶化了中美两国关系。与此同时，两国在人权方面均未取得任何进步，也没有任何迹象表明两国会在短期内成为自由民主国家。

Chinese leaders are no different when it comes to guarding their own sovereignty. They resent the frequent American harangues about human rights, which they see as part of a hidden agenda whose ultimate goal is regime change. Their suspicions of America’s intentions run so deep that when there are pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, Chinese leaders are sure the United States is behind them, even when there is no evidence to support that belief.28 The Chinese have responded to American criticism about human rights by issuing an annual human rights report of their own in which they severely criticize the U.S. record.29 In short, Washington’s efforts to push Beijing to liberalize have worsened relations between the two countries, just as they did with Russia. At the same time, neither country has made any improvement on human rights, and there is no evidence either one will become a liberal democracy anytime soon.

美国在像中国和俄罗斯这样的大国内部能够进行的社会工程活动存在诸多限制。它当然无法通过入侵来制止侵犯人权的行为或推动政权更迭。它也无法通过经济制裁和其他外交手段取得显著成效，部分原因是大国并不容易受到胁迫，但更重要的是，它们通常能够进行报复。而那些缺乏自卫能力的弱小国家则更容易成为攻击目标。毫不奇怪，那些走上自由霸权道路的大国往往会在弱小国家进行最为深入的社会工程，因为它们认为这样做成本低、收益大。

There are significant limits on how much social engineering the United States can do inside major powers like China and Russia. It certainly cannot invade to stop human rights violations or promote regime change. It cannot achieve much with economic sanctions and other diplomatic tools, partly because major powers are not that vulnerable to coercion, but also because they usually can retaliate. Weaker states, which lack the material capabilities to defend themselves, make easier targets. Not surprisingly, great powers that go down the liberal hegemony road do their most serious social engineering in weak states, thinking the costs will be low and the benefits great.

即使是弱小的国家，也是难以攻克的难题。

Even Weak States Are Tough Nuts to Crack

然而，对小国的干预也常常失败。美国在“9·11”事件后开始，并在布什和奥巴马两届政府时期持续推进，试图推翻中东地区的威权统治者，代之以民主政权，这正是社会工程局限性的典型案例。美国的目标是五个国家：阿富汗、埃及、伊拉克、利比亚和叙利亚。它动用自身军事力量推翻了阿富汗、伊拉克和利比亚的政权，但在埃及和叙利亚却没有这样做。尽管如此，政权更迭在埃及两次成功，但结果却并非好事。在叙利亚，它反而助长了一场血腥而灾难性的内战。

Yet interventions in minor powers often fail too. The American effort to topple authoritarian rulers in the greater Middle East and replace them with democratic regimes, which began in earnest after 9/11 and continued throughout both the Bush and Obama administrations, is a textbook case of the limits of social engineering. The United States has taken aim at five countries: Afghanistan, Egypt, Iraq, Libya, and Syria. It used its own military to help topple the regimes in Afghanistan, Iraq, and Libya but did not do so in Egypt or Syria. Nevertheless, regime change worked twice in Egypt, although not for the better. In Syria, it helped produce a bloody and disastrous civil war.

在每一种情况下，美国决策者都认为他们能够建立一个对美国友好的稳定民主政体，并帮助美国应对核扩散和恐怖主义等严峻问题。华盛顿领导人对改变这五个国家乃至整个地区的政治格局的能力抱有如此大的信心，着实令人震惊。但他们每次都以失败告终，给整个中东地区带来了杀戮和破坏，并使美国陷入了阿富汗、伊拉克和叙利亚看似永无止境的战争之中。

In each case, American policymakers thought they could put in place a stable democracy that would be friendly to the United States and help it deal with serious problems like nuclear proliferation and terrorism. It is quite striking how much confidence Washington’s leaders had in their capacity to transform the politics of those five countries, and the region more generally. But they failed every time, bringing killing and destruction to the greater Middle East and committing the United States to what appear to be endless wars in Afghanistan, Iraq, and Syria.

美国于2001年10月中旬对阿富汗发动战争，大约在9·11事件发生一个月后。到12月初，情况似乎……美军取得了一场辉煌的胜利。塔利班被击溃，一位看似致力于民主的领导人哈米德·卡尔扎伊入主喀布尔。这一表面上的成功让布什政府认为，他们也能在伊拉克，乃至最终在该地区其他国家复制同样的局面。这便是布什主义的起源。2003年3月，美国入侵伊拉克，迅速推翻了萨达姆·侯赛因政权，似乎华盛顿找到了将该地区转变为稳定民主国家的灵丹妙药。然而到了夏末，伊拉克陷入内战，美军开始面临一场大规模的叛乱。

The United States went to war against Afghanistan in mid-October 2001, about one month after the 9/11 attacks. By early December, it appeared that the American military had won a spectacular victory. The Taliban was routed and a leader who seemed committed to democracy, Hamid Karzai, was installed in Kabul. That apparent success led the Bush administration to think it could produce the same outcome in Iraq, and eventually in the region’s other countries as well. This was the genesis of the Bush Doctrine. The United States invaded Iraq in March 2003 and quickly removed Saddam Hussein from power, making it look as though Washington had found the magic formula for transforming the region into a sea of stable democracies. But by late summer, Iraq had descended into civil war, and the American military was beginning to face a major insurgency.

当布什政府忙于应对伊拉克局势（到2004年，伊拉克已逐渐失控）时，塔利班开始死灰复燃。阿富汗也陷入了内战的泥潭。为了防止塔利班及其盟友推翻卡尔扎伊政府并再次掌权，美国向阿富汗派遣了大量军队。此时，美国同时在阿富汗和伊拉克都面临着严峻的冲突。与之前的预期相反，华盛顿并没有找到平息整个中东局势的办法，反而疲于应对这两个国家的困境。

While the Bush administration was preoccupied with Iraq, which was spinning out of control by 2004, the Taliban began to come back from the dead. Afghanistan too found itself consumed by civil war. To make sure the Taliban and its allies did not topple the Karzai government and once again take control, the United States moved large numbers of troops into that country. It was now fighting major conflicts in both Afghanistan and Iraq. Contrary to earlier expectations, Washington had not found the way to pacify the greater Middle East and instead was trying to rescue the situation in two countries.

然而，这两场战争如今看来都已成定局。奥巴马政府于2011年12月将所有美军撤出伊拉克，留下了一个支离破碎的国家，并迅速陷入巴格达什叶派主导的政府与“伊斯兰国”（ISIS）之间的内战。“伊斯兰国”是一个强大的逊尼派武装组织，布什政府推翻萨达姆政权并挑起伊拉克什叶派和逊尼派之间的内战，从而助长了该组织的形成。“伊斯兰国”最初在伊拉克和叙利亚的战场上取得了巨大成功，并声称建立了事实上的“国家”。美国于2014年8月对“伊斯兰国”发动战争，但主要依靠空中力量。此外，不愿加入统一伊拉克的伊拉克库尔德人也在北部建立了事实上的“国家”。鉴于伊拉克库尔德人和逊尼派的明显实力，以及巴格达政府的软弱，2003年的伊拉克已不复存在。然而，美国却再次卷入了这场分裂而满目疮痍的国家的战争。

Both wars, however, now look like lost causes. The Obama administration pulled all American fighting forces out of Iraq in December 2011, leaving behind a broken country that quickly fell into a civil war between the Shia-dominated government in Baghdad and ISIS, a formidable group of militant Sunnis the Bush administration helped create by toppling Saddam and precipitating a civil war between Iraq’s Shias and Sunnis. ISIS was initially so successful on the battlefield in Iraq and Syria that it claimed its own de facto state, which the United States went to war against in August 2014, albeit mainly with airpower.30 Moreover, the Iraqi Kurds, who do not want to be part of a unified Iraq, have created their own de facto state in the north. Given the apparent strength of the Iraqi Kurds and Sunnis, coupled with the weakness of the Baghdad government, the Iraq that existed in 2003 is no more. Still, the United States is back in the fight in that fractured and wrecked country.

奥巴马总统于2009年1月就职一个月后宣布，他将向阿富汗增派17000名士兵。在原有36000名驻阿美军的基础上，奥巴马决定增派30000名士兵。同年晚些时候，他又决定增派30000名士兵。与此同时，奥巴马承诺这些部队不会无限期地驻扎在阿富汗，并将在他2017年1月卸任前完全撤出。 31 然而，这一计划最终失败了，因为塔利班顽强抵抗，甚至在美军撤离的同时还占领了更多领土。此外，喀布尔亲美政权指挥的军队也无力独自对抗塔利班，而“伊斯兰国”如今已成为阿富汗境内一股日益壮大的势力。奥巴马离开白宫时，阿富汗境内仍有8400名美军士兵， 32而特朗普总统正面临着来自驻阿美军指挥官的压力，要求他增加驻阿美军人数，这场战争已成为美国历史上持续时间最长的战争。

One month after taking office in January 2009, President Obama announced that he would send an additional 17,000 troops to Afghanistan on top of the 36,000 who were already there. Later that year, he decided to commit 30,000 more. At the same time, Obama promised that those forces would not stay indefinitely and would be completely out of Afghanistan by the time he left office in January 2017.31 That plan went awry because the Taliban stood its ground and even conquered more territory as the American forces were drawn down. Moreover, the army commanded by the pro-American regime in Kabul proved incapable of standing up to the Taliban unaided, and ISIS is now a growing force in the country. There were 8,400 U.S. troops remaining in Afghanistan when Obama departed the White House,32 and President Trump is under pressure from his commanders there to increase U.S. troop levels in what has become the longest war in American history.

无论特朗普政府在阿富汗采取何种政策，都不可能击败塔利班，并将该国转变为一个稳定的民主国家。它所能做的，最多也就是延缓塔利班（目前控制着该国约30%的领土）重新控制剩余领土的那一天。简而言之，尽管美国军方付出了巨大的努力，并且在阿富汗重建方面投入的资金甚至超过了二战后马歇尔计划对欧洲的援助，但美国注定会在阿富汗失败。33

Whatever policy the Trump administration pursues in Afghanistan, there is no chance it will defeat the Taliban and turn that country into a stable democracy. The best it can do is delay the day that the Taliban, which now controls roughly 30 percent of the country, regains control of the rest. In short, the United States is destined to lose in Afghanistan, despite the Herculean efforts of the American military and having invested more money in its reconstruction than was committed to Europe with the Marshall Plan in the aftermath of World War II.33

利比亚是又一个试图改变一个弱小国家政治的失败案例。2011年3月，美国及其欧洲盟友发动空袭，旨在推翻穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲上校的统治。当时，这位利比亚领导人正面临着一场强大的叛乱，西方列强以他即将进行大规模屠杀为借口，试图结束他的统治。同年7月，超过30个国家承认由叛军领导的全国过渡委员会为利比亚合法政府。卡扎菲于2011年10月遇刺身亡，此后利比亚陷入了旷日持久的血腥内战，看不到尽头。没有任何理由认为利比亚在不久的将来会成为一个稳定的民主国家。34

Libya represents another failed effort to alter a weak state’s politics. In March 2011, the United States and its European allies launched an air campaign aimed at toppling Colonel Muammar Gaddafi from power. The Libyan leader was dealing with a formidable insurrection, and the Western powers used the false pretext that he was about to engage in mass murder to help end his rule. In July, more than thirty countries recognized the rebel-led National Transitional Council as the legitimate government of Libya. Gaddafi was murdered in October 2011, and Libya has since been consumed by a bloody civil war with no end in sight. There is no reason to think it will become a stable democracy in the near future.34

就在美国推翻利比亚卡扎菲政权的同时，叙利亚爆发了反对其独裁统治者巴沙尔·阿萨德的抗议活动。叙利亚政府反应过度，动用暴力镇压抗议，导致这场冲突演变成一场至今仍在持续的致命内战。但美国在加剧这场冲突中也扮演了关键角色。尽管没有直接干预，但冲突仍在持续。35 2011年8月，在动乱爆发几个月后，奥巴马政府站在反政府武装一边，要求阿萨德下台。36阿萨德拒绝后，华盛顿与卡塔尔、沙特阿拉伯和土耳其联手，试图推翻他。美国向“温和派”反叛组织提供支持，中央情报局（CIA）和五角大楼最终为这些组织花费了超过15亿美元用于武器和训练。37

At the time the United States was upending the Gaddafi regime in Libya, protests broke out in Syria against its authoritarian ruler, Bashar al-Assad. The government overreacted and used violence to suppress the protests, helping to turn that conflict into a deadly civil war that continues today. But the United States also played a central role in escalating the conflict, although it did not intervene directly.35 In August 2011, a few months after the trouble started, the Obama administration sided with the anti-government forces and demanded that Assad step down from power.36 After he refused, Washington joined forces with Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and Turkey in an effort to topple him. The United States provided support to “moderate” rebel groups, for whom the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and the Pentagon ultimately spent more than $1.5 billion on weaponry and training.37

这一策略彻底失败了。阿萨德仍然掌权，叙利亚内战已造成超过40万人死亡（其中许多是平民），近一半人口被迫逃离家园。 38但即便阿萨德政府垮台，像与基地组织有关联的努斯拉阵线这样的激进叛乱组织几乎肯定会取而代之。如果该组织或任何其他类似组织掌权，几乎肯定会对阿萨德政权的众多成员和支持者发动血腥镇压。此外，新政权将对美国抱有强烈的敌意。然而，叙利亚政府不太可能垮台，因为俄罗斯、伊朗和真主党已直接介入以维持阿萨德的统治。这场内战可能会持续数年，造成更大的破坏和灾难。

The strategy has failed completely. Assad is still in power, more than four hundred thousand people (many of them civilians) have died in Syria’s civil war, and almost half of the population has been forced to flee their homes.38 But even if the Assad government had fallen, a radical insurgent group like the Nusra Front, which is affiliated with al Qaeda, almost certainly would have replaced it. If that group or any other like-minded group were to come to power, it would almost certainly embark on a bloody rampage against the many members and supporters of the Assad regime. Moreover, the new regime would be deeply hostile to the United States. The Syrian government is not likely to fall, however, because Russia, Iran, and Hezbollah have directly intervened to keep Assad in power. The civil war will probably drag on for several years, wreaking more havoc and destruction.

叙利亚冲突还带来了另一个可怕的后果。大量叙利亚人逃离家园，试图在欧洲定居，与此同时，来自阿富汗、伊拉克和利比亚持续冲突的难民也涌入欧洲。起初，大多数欧洲国家欢迎这些流亡者，但随着人数的最终激增，一些国家，甚至包括欧盟自身，都设置了重重障碍来阻止他们入境。这些举措违背了欧洲珍视的开放边界原则及其开明的庇护政策。大量难民的涌入助长了欧洲极右翼政党的壮大，这些政党致力于阻止移民和难民进入本国。简而言之，这场由美国挑起的叙利亚战争，除了给叙利亚人民带来惨重的损失外，还有可能对欧盟造成严重损害。

There is another terrible consequence of the Syrian conflict. Huge numbers of Syrians have fled their homeland and are trying to settle in Europe, joined by refugees from the ongoing conflicts in Afghanistan, Iraq, and Libya. Most European countries welcomed these exiles at first, but the numbers eventually grew so large that some countries, as well as the European Union (EU) itself, erected significant barriers to keep them out. These moves are contrary to Europe’s cherished principle of open borders as well as its enlightened policies on asylum. The huge influx of refugees is fueling the growth of Europe’s far-right political parties, which are committed to keeping immigrants and refugees out of their countries. In short, the war in Syria, which the United States helped start, has the potential to do serious damage to the EU in addition to the horrendous costs it has inflicted on the Syrian people.

最后，还有埃及的例子。2011年1月，埃及爆发了反对总统穆巴拉克的抗议活动。随着这些抗议活动愈演愈烈，奥巴马政府介入并帮助推翻了埃及领导人。39奥巴马欢迎埃及走向民主，并支持2012年6月上台的新当选政府，尽管当时穆斯林兄弟会掌握着政权。但执政一年后，身为穆斯林兄弟会成员的穆罕默德·穆尔西总统面临着来自埃及军方和大部分民众的巨大压力，要求他辞职。奥巴马政府对穆尔西一直抱有敌意，但还是介入了这一混乱局面，并委婉地暗示埃及领导人应该下台，这最终促成了他的下台。 40接替他的是阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·塞西将军，一位继承了穆巴拉克传统的军事强人。

Finally, there is the case of Egypt, where protests broke out against President Hosni Mubarak in January 2011. As these protests gained momentum, the Obama administration stepped in and helped oust the Egyptian leader from power.39 Obama welcomed Egypt’s move toward democracy and supported the newly elected government that came to power in June 2012, even though the Muslim Brotherhood was in charge. But after one year in office, President Mohamed Morsi, a member of the Brotherhood, was being pressed hard by the Egyptian military and much of the public to resign. The Obama administration, never enthusiastic about Morsi, stepped into this messy situation and gently hinted that it was time for the Egyptian leader to go, which helped facilitate his overthrow.40 He was replaced by General Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, a military strongman in the Mubarak tradition.

美国采取这一步骤，实际上是促成了一场针对民选领导人的政变，而这位领导人对美国并不构成威胁。埃及新独裁者随后对穆斯林兄弟会及其支持者展开镇压，杀害了一千多人，并判处穆尔西死刑，尽管截至本文撰写之时，穆尔西仍被关押在狱中。奥巴马政府曾试图阻止这场血腥镇压，但最终失败了。尽管美国法律规定，如果任何国家的民选政府首脑被军事政变或法令推翻，美国就必须停止向埃及提供全部援助，但美国政府却不愿停止每年向埃及提供的15亿美元援助。 41

In taking this step, the United States helped foster a coup against a democratically elected leader who was not a threat to the United States. The new Egyptian dictator then turned against the Brotherhood and its supporters, killing over one thousand people and sentencing Morsi to death, although he remains in jail at this writing. The Obama administration lamely tried to prevent this bloody crackdown but failed. It was not willing to withhold the entire $1.5 billion the United States gives Egypt each year, even though American law mandates that all foreign aid be cut to any country “whose duly elected head of government is deposed by military coup or decree.”41

华盛顿在阿富汗、埃及、伊拉克、利比亚和叙利亚的表现令人失望。美国不仅未能保护这些国家的人权，也未能促进自由民主，反而助长了整个中东地区的死亡和混乱。 42如今，恐怖主义在该地区是一个更为严重的问题。尽管达成了伊朗核协议，但面对美国强行推翻政权的政策，世界各国获取或保留核武器的动机却日益增强。与美国存在严重分歧的国家的决策者肯定记得，卡扎菲上校在2003年12月放弃了大规模杀伤性武器的研发计划，而华盛顿承诺不会试图推翻他的政权。 43 八年后，奥巴马政府在推翻卡扎菲政权的过程中发挥了关键作用；此后不久，卡扎菲便被谋杀。如果他拥有核威慑力量，他很可能至今仍统治着利比亚。

Washington’s performance in Afghanistan, Egypt, Iraq, Libya, and Syria has been dismal. Not only has the United States failed to protect human rights and promote liberal democracy in those countries, it has played a major role in spreading death and disorder across the greater Middle East.42 Terrorism is a much greater problem in the region today, and the Iran nuclear deal notwithstanding, the incentives for countries around the world to either acquire or keep their nuclear weapons have increased in the face of America’s policy of forcible regime change. Policymakers in countries that have serious differences with the United States surely remember that Colonel Gaddafi gave up his programs to create weapons of mass destruction in December 2003 on the promise that Washington would not try to remove him from power.43 Eight years later, the Obama administration played a key role in removing him from power; soon thereafter he was murdered. It is likely he would still rule Libya today if he had possessed a nuclear deterrent.

社会工程的局限性和风险

The Limits and Perils of Social Engineering

这种惨痛的失败本应在预料之中。在任何社会，包括本国社会，进行大规模的社会改造都是一项极其复杂的任务。令人惊讶的是，如此多的美国政策制定者和评论员竟然自信地认为，他们能够从根本上改变众多中东国家的政治格局，并将它们转变为民主国家。美国干预这些国家时，对这些国家知之甚少——很少有政府官员会说阿拉伯语，或者知道逊尼派和什叶派是伊斯兰教的不同分支——其对这些国家自决权的侵犯必然会引发强烈不满。此外，这些国家都派系林立，一旦政府垮台，很可能陷入动荡。在努力控制一个外国的同时进行社会改造，是一项极其艰巨的任务。

This abysmal record of failure should have been foreseen. Doing large-scale social engineering in any society, including one’s own, is an enormously complicated task. What is amazing is that so many American policymakers and pundits were confident they could fundamentally alter the political landscape in a host of Middle Eastern countries and turn them into democracies. The United States was intervening in countries it knew astonishingly little about—few government officials even spoke Arabic or knew that Sunni and Shi’a were different branches of Islam—and its violation of those states’ right of self-determination was bound to generate resentment. Furthermore, the countries were all riven with factions and were likely to be in turmoil once the government was brought down. Doing social engineering in a foreign country while fighting to control it is a wickedly hard task.

当美国入侵他国时，这个问题尤为突出，因为占领该国的美军最终不可避免地要承担起建立国家和政权的重任，以建立一个运转良好的自由民主政体。然而，在民族主义盛行的时代，占领几乎总是会滋生叛乱，正如美国早在菲律宾和后来的越南（远早于其入侵阿富汗和伊拉克）就已发现的那样。占领者随后必须进行反叛乱作战，这意味着要打一场漫长而血腥的军事战役，而且失败的概率极高。美国陆军和海军陆战队2006年12月版的《反叛乱作战手册3-24》清楚地反映了反叛乱作战的难度。该手册不仅警告说“叛乱本质上是旷日持久的”，而且还告诫说“政治和军事领导人及策划者绝不应低估叛乱的规模和复杂性”。 44

The problem is particularly acute when the United States invades another country, because the American military forces occupying that country inevitably end up tasked with the nation- and state-building necessary to produce a functioning liberal democracy. In the age of nationalism, however, occupation almost always breeds an insurgency, as the United States discovered long ago in the Philippines and later in Vietnam, long before it entered Afghanistan and Iraq. The occupier must then engage in counterinsurgency, which means fighting a long and bloody military campaign with high odds of failure. The difficulty of winning at counterinsurgency is clearly reflected in the December 2006 edition of the U.S. Army and Marine Corps Counterinsurgency Field Manual 3-24. It not only warns that “insurgencies are protracted by nature” but also cautions that “political and military leaders and planners should never underestimate [their] scale and complexity.”44

历史记录清楚地表明，试图将民主强加于他国的努力通常会失败。例如，安德鲁·恩特莱恩和J·迈克尔·格雷格研究了180​​0年至1994年间43个强加民主政权的案例，发现其中近63%失败了。杰弗里·皮克林和马克·佩塞尼调查了1946年至1996年间自由主义国家干预的民主化后果，他们的结论是：“自1945年以来，自由主义干预……在民主化进程中极少发挥作用。” 47正如亚历山大·唐斯和乔纳森·蒙滕所指出的，将民主强加于他国“只有在具备有利的内部前提条件时”才有可能奏效。“不幸的是，在干预成本较低的国家，这些条件相对罕见。” 48然而，像美国这样的大国，只有在成本较低的情况下才会入侵并试图进行政权更迭，这意味着自由民主的必要前提条件可能并不存在。

It is clear from the historical record that the effort to impose democracy on another country usually fails.45 Andrew Enterline and J. Michael Greig, for example, examined forty-three cases of imposed democratic regimes between 1800 and 1994 and found that nearly 63 percent failed.46 Jeffrey Pickering and Mark Peceny, who investigated the democratizing consequences of interventions by liberal states from 1946 to 1996, conclude that “liberal intervention . . . has only very rarely played a role in democratization since 1945.”47 As Alexander Downes and Jonathan Monten point out, imposing democracy on another country is likely to work “if favorable internal preconditions are present. These conditions, unfortunately, are relatively rare in countries where the costs of intervention are low.”48 Great powers like the United States, however, do not invade to attempt regime change unless the costs are low, which means the necessary preconditions for liberal democracy will not be present.

不出所料，美国在试图将民主强加于其他国家方面屡屡失败。纽约大学教授布鲁斯·布埃诺·德·梅斯基塔和乔治·唐斯指出，从二战到2004年，“美国干预了世界各地发展中国家35次以上……只有一次——1989年美国决定对哥伦比亚发动禁毒战争后——在10年内出现了一个成熟稳定的民主政体。成功率不到3%。” 49皮克林和佩塞尼发现，只有一次——巴拿马在曼努埃尔·诺列加下台后——美国的干预明确促成了巩固民主政体的出现。50纽约大学的威廉·伊斯特利及其两位同事研究了冷战期间美苏干预如何影响自由政体的前景，发现“超级大国的干预会导致民主显著衰落，而且这种实质性影响巨大。” 51

Predictably, the United States has a rich history of failing to impose democracy on other countries. New York University professors Bruce Bueno de Mesquita and George Downs report that between World War II and 2004, “the United States intervened more than 35 times in developing countries around the world. . . . In only one case—Colombia after the American decision in 1989 to engage in the war on drugs—did a full-fledged, stable democracy . . . emerge within 10 years. That’s a success rate of less than 3%.”49 Pickering and Peceny find only one case—Panama after the removal of Manuel Noriega—in which American intervention clearly resulted in the emergence of a consolidated democracy.50 William Easterly and two colleagues at New York University looked at how U.S. and Soviet interventions during the Cold War affected the prospects for a liberal form of government, and found that “superpower interventions are followed by significant declines in democracy, and that the substantive effects are large.”51

有人可能会认为，1989年前后东欧的事件提供了一个令人鼓舞的先例。但这种说法是错误的。民主在东欧地区兴起，当时共产主义政权崩溃，独裁统治者下台，但这些案例与美国在中东地区所做的事情几乎没有关联。民主并非强加于东欧各国，而是各国自身孕育的，这些国家已经具备了民主化的许多必要前提条件。毫无疑问，美国帮助培育了这些新兴民主政体，但这并非华盛顿成功地将民选统治输出到外国的案例，而这正是布什主义的核心所在。52

One might argue that events in Eastern Europe circa 1989 provide an encouraging precedent. But that claim is wrong. Democracy sprouted in that region when communism collapsed and the ruling autocrats fell from power, but these cases have little relevance to what the United States has been trying to do in the greater Middle East. Democracy was not imposed on the countries of Eastern Europe. It was homegrown in every instance, and the countries already possessed many of the necessary preconditions for democratization. There is no question the United States has helped nurture these nascent democracies, but these are not cases of Washington successfully exporting popular rule to foreign lands, which is what the Bush Doctrine was all about.52

美国并非不可能在海外推行自由民主制度。但成功案例只是例外，而非普遍现象，而且通常情况下，这些成功案例都会以失败告终。这种现象通常发生在具有特定内部特征的国家。例如，如果目标国家在种族和宗教上较为单一，拥有强有力的中央政府、相对较高的经济繁荣水平以及一定的民主经验，那么成功的可能性就非常大。二战后的德国和日本经常被视为美国能够向中东输出自由民主的例证，它们符合这些条件。但这两个国家的情况非常特殊。

It is not impossible for the United States to impose liberal democracy abroad. But successes are the exception, not the rule, and they usually occur in countries with a particular set of internal characteristics. It helps greatly, for example, if the target state is ethnically and religiously homogeneous and has a strong central government, reasonably high levels of prosperity, and some experience with democracy. Post–World War II Germany and Japan, which are often held up as evidence that the United States can export liberal democracy to the Middle East, fit these criteria. But they are highly unusual.

忽视地缘政治的代价

The Costs of Ignoring Geopolitics

撇开成功干预他国内政的难度不谈，还有一个问题更多地与现实主义而非民族主义有关。当一个强国追求自由主义霸权时，它面临着其他国家会遵循现实政治法则的风险。这大大增加了误判的可能性，而误判可能导致危机甚至战争。例如，一个自由主义国家可能真心相信其政策是良性的，甚至是高尚的，而另一个奉行现实主义原则的国家则可能将同样的政策视为威胁。自由主义国家仅仅因为其奉行不同的主义，就很可能无法理解这一点。

Putting aside the difficulty of interfering successfully in other countries’ domestic politics, there is an additional problem that has more to do with realism than nationalism. When a powerful country pursues liberal hegemony, it runs the risk that other states will follow the dictates of realpolitik. This greatly increases the likelihood of miscalculation, which could lead to a crisis or even a war. For example, a liberal state might genuinely believe that its policy is benign or even noble, while another state, operating according to realist principles, might view the same policy as threatening. The liberal state, simply because it acts under a different ism, would probably fail to understand this.

对自由主义大国而言，这种情况之所以如此危险，是因为大多数国家在大多数情况下都遵循权力平衡的逻辑。自由主义大国通常也遵循这一原则，尤其是在与其他大国交往时。但有时，它们也会自由地拥抱自由主义霸权。如果它们忘记了自己仍然身处一个基本现实主义的世界，就可能给自己和其他国家带来诸多麻烦。持续不断的乌克兰危机就是一个例证。根据西方的普遍观点，这个问题主要是俄罗斯侵略的结果。这种观点认为，弗拉基米尔·普京总统一心想要建立一个类似于前苏联的“大俄罗斯”，这意味着要控制其“近邻”——包括乌克兰、波罗的海国家以及其他一些东欧国家——的政府。2014年2月22日针对乌克兰总统维克托·亚努科维奇的政变，为普京吞并克里米亚和在乌克兰东部发动战争提供了借口。

What makes this situation so dangerous for a liberal great power is that most states, most of the time, follow balance-of-power logic. Liberal great powers typically act this way as well, especially toward other great powers. But occasionally they are free to embrace liberal hegemony. Should they forget that they are still operating in a largely realist world, they may cause a lot of trouble for themselves and other states. The ongoing crisis over Ukraine is a case in point. According to the prevailing wisdom in the West, this problem is largely the result of Russian aggression. President Vladimir Putin, the argument goes, is bent on creating a greater Russia akin to the former Soviet Union, which means controlling the governments in its “near abroad”—its neighboring states—including Ukraine, the Baltic states, and possibly other Eastern European countries. The coup against Ukrainian president Viktor Yanukovych on February 22, 2014, provided Putin with a pretext for annexing Crimea and starting a war in eastern Ukraine.

这种说法是错误的。美国及其欧洲盟友才是这场危机的主要责任人。53问题的根源在于北约扩张。这是将包括乌克兰在内的整个东欧地区从俄罗斯势力范围中剥离出来，并将其纳入西方阵营的更大战略的核心要素。人们或许会认为这项政策是一种旨在遏制潜在侵略性俄罗斯的经典威慑战略，但事实并非如此。54西方的战略主要基于自由主义原则，其主要设计者认为莫斯科不应将其视为威胁。55其目标是将乌克兰纳入冷战期间在西欧发展起来的“安全共同体”，该共同体自冷战结束后一直在向东扩张。但俄罗斯人采取的是现实主义策略。由此引发的重大危机令许多西方领导人感到措手不及。

This account is false. The United States and its European allies are mainly responsible for the crisis.53 The taproot of the trouble is NATO expansion, the central element in a larger strategy to move all of Eastern Europe, including Ukraine, out of Russia’s orbit and integrate it into the West. One might think this policy is a classic deterrence strategy aimed at containing a potentially aggressive Russia, but it is not.54 The West’s strategy was based mainly on liberal principles, and its chief architects did not think Moscow should have seen it as threatening.55 The aim was to integrate Ukraine into the “security community” that had developed in western Europe during the Cold War and had been moving eastward since its conclusion. But the Russians were using a realist playbook. The major crisis that resulted left many Western leaders feeling blindsided.

瞄准乌克兰

Taking Aim at Ukraine

将乌克兰纳入西方阵营的战略包含三个相互关联的组成部分：北约东扩、欧盟扩张以及旨在乌克兰推行民主和西方价值观的“橙色革命”，后者据推测会在基辅扶植亲西方领导人。从莫斯科的角度来看，该战略中最具威胁性的方面是北约的东进。

The strategy for making Ukraine part of the West consists of three linked components: NATO enlargement, EU expansion, and the Orange Revolution, which aimed at fostering democracy and Western values in Ukraine and thus presumably produce pro-Western leaders in Kiev. From Moscow’s perspective, the most threatening aspect of that strategy is NATO’s movement eastward.

冷战结束时，苏联明确表示支持美国继续驻扎在欧洲并维持北约。苏联领导人明白，自二战以来，这一安排一直有效地控制着德国，而且在德国统一后国力大增时，这一作用仍将继续。但莫斯科强烈反对北约扩张。俄罗斯人认为，西方国家理解他们的担忧，北约不会向苏联扩张。 56但克林顿政府却不这么认为，并在20世纪90年代开始推动北约扩张。

When the Cold War was ending, the Soviet Union made it clear that it favored keeping the U.S. military in Europe and maintaining NATO. The Soviet leaders understood that this arrangement had kept Germany pacified since World War II and would continue doing so after the country reunified and became much more powerful. But Moscow was deeply opposed to NATO enlargement. The Russians believed their Western counterparts understood their fears and that the alliance would not expand toward the Soviet Union.56 But the Clinton administration thought otherwise and in the 1990s began pushing NATO expansion.

1999年的第一次扩容将波兰、匈牙利和捷克共和国纳入北约。2004年的第二次扩容则包括保加利亚、罗马尼亚、斯洛伐克、斯洛文尼亚和波罗的海三国。俄罗斯领导人从一开始就强烈抗议。例如，鲍里斯·叶利钦在1995年北约轰炸塞尔维亚期间曾表示：“这是北约逼近俄罗斯联邦边界可能带来的后果的第一个迹象……战争的火焰可能会席卷整个欧洲。” 57然而，俄罗斯当时实力不足以阻止这一进程。无论是扩张还是其他方面。此外，除了波罗的海三国之外，北约新成员国中没有一个与俄罗斯接壤。

The first extension, in 1999, brought Poland, Hungary, and the Czech Republic into the alliance. The second tranche, which occurred in 2004, included Bulgaria, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, and the three Baltic countries. Russian leaders complained bitterly from the start. Boris Yeltsin, for example, said during NATO’s 1995 bombing campaign against Serbia: “This is the first sign of what could happen when NATO comes right up to the Russian Federation’s borders. . . . The flame of war could burst out across the whole of Europe.”57 The Russians, however, were too weak to derail either expansion. Moreover, save for the tiny Baltic countries, none of NATO’s new members shared a border with Russia.

真正的麻烦始于2008年4月在布加勒斯特举行的北约峰会，当时乌克兰和格鲁吉亚的入盟问题被提上议程。法国和德国出于担心接纳两国会过度激怒俄罗斯而反对，但布什政府坚持要让这两个国家加入北约。这场僵局的结果是，北约没有启动接纳乌克兰和格鲁吉亚加入联盟的必要程序，但峰会的最终声明中包含了“北约欢迎乌克兰和格鲁吉亚加入北约的欧洲-大西洋愿望。我们今天一致同意，这两个国家将成为北约成员国。” 58莫斯科立即做出愤怒回应。俄罗斯副外长警告说，“格鲁吉亚和乌克兰加入联盟是一个巨大的战略错误，将对泛欧安全造成极其严重的后果。”普京坚称，接纳这两个国家将对俄罗斯构成“直接威胁”。一家俄罗斯报纸报道称，普京直接对布什说，“非常直白地暗示，如果乌克兰加入北约，它将不复存在。” 59

The real trouble began at the NATO summit in Bucharest in April 2008, when Ukraine’s and Georgia’s membership came up for discussion. France and Germany were opposed out of fear that admitting them would unduly antagonize Russia, but the Bush administration was committed to bringing these countries into NATO. The outcome of this standoff was that NATO did not initiate the process necessary to bring Ukraine and Georgia into the alliance, but the summit’s final declaration included the news that “NATO welcomes Ukraine’s and Georgia’s Euro Atlantic aspirations for membership in NATO. We agreed today that these countries will become members of NATO.”58 Moscow reacted immediately and angrily. Russia’s deputy foreign minister warned that “Georgia’s and Ukraine’s membership in the alliance is a huge strategic mistake which would have most serious consequences for pan-European security.” Putin maintained that admitting those two countries would represent a “direct threat” to Russia. One Russian newspaper reported that Putin, speaking directly to Bush, “very transparently hinted that if Ukraine was accepted into NATO, it would cease to exist.”59

2008年8月的俄格战争本应消除人们对俄罗斯阻止乌克兰和格鲁吉亚加入北约的决心的任何疑虑。格鲁吉亚总统米哈伊尔·萨卡什维利一心想让格鲁吉亚加入北约，在布达佩斯峰会后，他决定重新纳入阿布哈兹和南奥塞梯这两个分离主义地区，这两个地区加起来约占格鲁吉亚领土的20%。加入北约的前提是解决这些悬而未决的领土争端，但普京绝不会允许这种情况发生。他更希望格鲁吉亚保持虚弱和分裂的状态，并决定羞辱萨卡什维利。60在格鲁吉亚和奥塞梯分离主义分子之间爆发冲突后，俄罗斯以“人道主义干预”为借口入侵格鲁吉亚，并控制了阿布哈兹和南奥塞梯。西方对此几乎没有采取任何行动，使萨卡什维利陷入困境。俄罗斯已经表明了自己的立场，但北约仍然拒绝放弃将乌克兰和格鲁吉亚纳入联盟的努力。

Any doubts about Russia’s determination to prevent Ukraine and Georgia from joining NATO should have been dispelled by the Russia-Georgia war in August 2008. Georgian president Mikheil Saakashvili, who was deeply committed to bringing his country into NATO, decided after the Budapest summit to reincorporate two separatist regions, Abkhazia and South Ossetia, which together make up about 20 percent of Georgia’s territory. NATO membership required that these outstanding territorial disputes be resolved, but Putin was not about to let that happen. He preferred to keep Georgia weak and divided and decided to humiliate Saakashvili.60 After fighting broke out between Georgia and the Ossetian separatists, Russia invaded Georgia under the pretense of a “humanitarian intervention” and gained control over Abkhazia and South Ossetia. The West did little in response, leaving Saakashvili in the lurch. Russia had made its point, yet NATO refused to give up on bringing Ukraine and Georgia into the alliance.

将乌克兰纳入西方阵营也涉及到了欧盟，欧盟和北约一样，自冷战结束以来一直在向东扩张。奥地利、芬兰、瑞典于1995年加入欧盟，八个中东欧国家（捷克、爱沙尼亚、匈牙利、拉脱维亚、立陶宛、波兰、斯洛伐克和斯洛文尼亚）以及塞浦路斯和马耳他于2004年5月加入欧盟。保加利亚和罗马尼亚于2007年加入。2009年5月，就在北约宣布乌克兰将成为其成员国一年多之后，欧盟推出了“东部伙伴关系”倡议，并将其描述为“欧盟与其东部邻国关系中雄心勃勃的新篇章”。该倡议旨在促进东欧国家的繁荣与稳定，并推动“与欧盟经济的深远融合”。不出所料， 61位俄罗斯领导人将“东部伙伴关系”视为对其国家利益的敌对行为。俄罗斯外长谢尔盖·拉夫罗夫抱怨欧盟试图在东欧建立“势力范围”，并暗示欧盟正在进行“讹诈”。62事实上，莫斯科将欧盟扩张视为北约扩张的幌子。63欧盟领导人驳斥了这些说法，并辩称俄罗斯也将从东部伙伴关系中受益。

Integrating Ukraine into the West also involved the EU, which like NATO had been expanding eastward since the Cold War ended. Austria, Finland, and Sweden joined the EU in 1995, and eight Central and Eastern European countries (Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland, Slovakia, and Slovenia) joined in May 2004 along with Cyprus and Malta. Bulgaria and Romania joined in 2007. In May 2009, just over a year after NATO announced Ukraine would become a member, the EU unveiled its Eastern Partnership initiative, which it described as “an ambitious new chapter in the EU’s relations with its Eastern neighbors.” Its aim was to foster prosperity and stability in Eastern European countries and promote “far reaching integration into the EU economy.”61 Russian leaders, not surprisingly, viewed the Eastern Partnership as hostile to their country’s interests. The Russian foreign minister, Sergei Lavrov, complained that the EU was trying to create a “sphere of influence” in Eastern Europe and hinted that it was engaging in “blackmail.”62 In fact, Moscow sees EU expansion as a stalking horse for NATO enlargement.63 EU leaders dismiss these claims and argue that Russia too would benefit from the Eastern Partnership.

将乌克兰从俄罗斯手中剥离的最后一个手段是推动“橙色革命”。美国及其欧洲盟友致力于在曾经受苏联控制的国家推动社会和政治变革。他们的目标是传播西方价值观，促进自由民主，这意味着支持这些国家的亲西方个人和组织——这些努力既有官方政府机构的资助，也有非政府组织的资助。当然，俄罗斯领导人担心乌克兰的社会改造，这不仅是因为这对乌克兰意味着什么，还因为他们认为俄罗斯可能成为下一个目标。

The final tool for peeling Ukraine away from Russia was the effort to promote the Orange Revolution. The United States and its European allies are deeply committed to fostering social and political change in countries formerly under Soviet control. They aim to spread Western values and promote liberal democracy, which means supporting pro-Western individuals and organizations in those countries—efforts that are funded by official government agencies as well as NGOs.64 Of course, Russian leaders worry about social engineering in Ukraine, not just because of what it means for Ukraine but also because they think Russia might be the next target.

北约东扩、欧盟扩张和民主推广是一系列紧密结合的政策，旨在将乌克兰融入西方，同时避免激怒俄罗斯。然而，这些政策却无意中将莫斯科变成了敌人，直接导致了乌克兰危机。

NATO enlargement, EU expansion, and democracy promotion are a close-knit package of policies designed to integrate Ukraine into the West without antagonizing Russia. But they inadvertently turned Moscow into an enemy, leading directly to the Ukraine crisis.

直接原因

The Immediate Causes

危机始于2013年11月下旬，当时亚努科维奇总统拒绝了他与欧盟谈判达成的一项重要经济协议，转而接受俄罗斯的反提案。这一决定引发了针对政府的抗议活动，并在接下来的三年里不断升级。数月后，两名抗议者于2014年1月22日丧生，2月中旬又有约一百人死亡。西方特使匆忙飞往基辅试图解决危机，并于2月21日达成协议，允许亚努科维奇继续掌权，直至年底前举行新的选举。但抗议者要求他立即下台，他于次日逃往俄罗斯。65

The crisis began in late November 2013, when President Yanukovych rejected a major economic deal he had been negotiating with the EU and decided instead to accept a Russian counteroffer. That decision led to protests against the government that escalated over the following three months. Two protestors were killed on January 22, 2014, and about one hundred more died in mid-February. Western emissaries, hurriedly flown to Kiev to resolve the crisis, struck a deal on February 21 that would have allowed Yanukovych to stay in power until new elections were held sometime before year’s end. But the protestors demanded that he leave office immediately, and he fled to Russia the next day.65

基辅新政府彻底亲西方、反俄。此外，其中四名成员完全可以被贴上新法西斯主义的标签。最重要的是，美国政府支持了这场政变，尽管其参与的程度尚不清楚。例如，负责欧洲和欧亚事务的助理国务卿维多利亚·纽兰和亚利桑那州共和党参议员约翰·麦凯恩都参加了反政府示威活动，而美国驻基辅大使在政变后宣称这是“载入史册的一天”。 66一份泄露的电话录音显示，纽兰主张政权更迭，并希望亲西方的阿尔谢尼·亚采纽克在新政府中担任总理，而亚采纽克也确实做到了。因此，俄罗斯各派人士都认为西方挑衅者，尤其是中央情报局，帮助推翻了亚努科维奇，也就不足为奇了。

The new government in Kiev was thoroughly pro-Western and anti-Russian. Moreover, it contained four members who could legitimately be labeled neofascists. Most importantly, the U.S. government backed the coup, although the full extent of its involvement is unknown. Victoria Nuland, the assistant secretary of state for European and Eurasian Affairs, and Senator John McCain (R-AZ), for example, participated in anti-government demonstrations, while the U.S. ambassador in Kiev proclaimed after the coup that it was “a day for the history books.”66 A leaked transcript of a phone conversation revealed that Nuland advocated regime change and wanted Arseniy Yatsenyuk, who was pro-Western, to become prime minister in the new government, which he did. It is hardly surprising that Russians of all persuasions think Western provocateurs, especially the CIA, helped overthrow Yanukovych.

对普京而言，行动的时机已经到来。2月22日政变后不久，他便开始调动力量，试图从乌克兰手中夺取克里米亚，并将其并入俄罗斯。鉴于俄罗斯在克里米亚港口塞瓦斯托波尔的海军基地已驻扎了数千名士兵，这并非难事。此外，俄罗斯还增派了其他部队，其中许多人并未身着军装。克里米亚之所以成为易于征服的目标，是因为当地约60%的居民是俄罗斯族，而他们中的大多数人都希望成为俄罗斯的一部分。

For Putin, the time to act had arrived. Shortly after the February 22 coup, he set the forces in motion to take Crimea from Ukraine and incorporate it into Russia. This was not difficult given that Russia already had thousands of troops at its naval base in the Crimean port of Sevastopol. Those forces were augmented with additional troops from Russia, many of them not in uniform. Crimea was an easy target because roughly 60 percent of the people living there were ethnic Russians, and most preferred to become part of Russia.

普京还向基辅政府施加了巨大压力，阻止其与西方结盟对抗莫斯科。他明确表示，他宁愿摧毁乌克兰的社会秩序，也不愿允许西方势力在俄罗斯家门口建立据点。为此，他向乌克兰东部的俄罗斯分裂分子提供武器和秘密部队，助长了该国的内战。他还在俄罗斯与乌克兰的边境地区维持了大量地面部队，并威胁说，如果基辅镇压叛军，俄罗斯将入侵乌克兰。最后，他还提高了……俄罗斯向乌克兰出售天然气，要求乌克兰立即支付拖欠款项，甚至一度切断了对乌克兰的天然气供应。正如他对格鲁吉亚所做的那样，普京对乌克兰采取强硬手段，如果乌克兰不放弃加入西方的计划，他有能力无限期地颠覆这个国家。

Putin also put massive pressure on the Kiev government to discourage it from siding with the West against Moscow. He made it clear that he would wreck Ukraine as a functioning society before allowing a Western stronghold to exist on Russia’s doorstep. Toward that end, he has supported the Russian separatists in eastern Ukraine with weapons and covert troops, helping to push the country into civil war. He has also maintained substantial ground forces on Russia’s border with Ukraine and threatened to invade if Kiev cracks down on the rebels. Finally, he has raised the price of gas Russia sells to Ukraine, demanded immediate remittance of overdue payments, and at one point even cut off the supply of gas to Ukraine. As he did with Georgia, Putin is playing hardball with Ukraine, and he has the means to subvert the country indefinitely if it does not abandon its plans to join the West.

自由主义者的盲点

Liberal Blinders

任何对地缘政治稍有了解的人都应该预料到这种情况。西方正在入侵俄罗斯的后院，威胁其核心战略利益。乌克兰是一片广袤的平原，拿破仑时代的法国、德意志帝国和纳粹德国都曾越过这片土地攻击俄罗斯本土，因此它对俄​​罗斯而言是极其重要的战略缓冲地带。任何一位俄罗斯领导人都不会容忍昔日敌国的军事联盟入侵乌克兰。同样，任何一位俄罗斯领导人也不会袖手旁观，任由西方扶植一个决心加入该联盟的基辅政府。

Anyone with a rudimentary understanding of geopolitics should have seen this coming. The West was moving into Russia’s backyard and threatening its core strategic interests. A huge expanse of flat land that Napoleonic France, Imperial Germany, and Nazi Germany have all crossed to strike at Russia itself, Ukraine serves as an enormously important strategic buffer to Russia. No Russian leader would tolerate a former enemy’s military alliance moving into Ukraine. Nor would any Russian leader stand idly by while the West helped install a government in Kiev that was determined to join that alliance.

华盛顿或许不认同莫斯科的立场，但它应该理解其背后的逻辑。大国总是对本土附近的威胁高度敏感。例如，根据门罗主义，美国绝不容忍远在西半球的列强部署军事力量，更遑论在其边境。试想一下，如果中国建立了一个强大的联盟，并试图在加拿大和墨西哥扶植愿意加入该联盟的政府，华盛顿会作何反应？抛开逻辑不谈，俄罗斯领导人已多次向西方国家表明，他们绝不容忍北约扩张至乌克兰和格鲁吉亚，或任何挑拨这些国家与俄罗斯关系的企图——2008年的俄格战争本应使这一信息更加清晰明了。

Washington may not like Moscow’s position, but it should understand the logic behind it. Great powers are always sensitive to threats near their home territory. The United States, for instance, under the Monroe Doctrine does not tolerate distant great powers deploying military forces anywhere in the Western Hemisphere, much less on its borders. Imagine the outrage in Washington if China built an impressive alliance and tried to install governments in Canada and Mexico that wanted to join. Logic aside, Russian leaders have told their Western counterparts many times that they will not tolerate NATO expansion into Ukraine and Georgia, or any effort to turn those countries against Russia—a message the 2008 Russia-Georgia War should have made crystal clear.

西方官员辩称，他们曾努力消除俄罗斯的担忧，莫斯科本应理解北约对俄罗斯并无敌对意图。北约不仅否认其扩张旨在遏制俄罗斯，而且从未在任何新成员国的领土上永久部署军事力量。2002年，为了加强与莫斯科的合作，北约甚至成立了北约-俄罗斯理事会。为了进一步安抚俄罗斯，美国于2009年宣布，其新型导弹防御系统将部署在欧洲的军舰上。至少在初期，这些水域并非捷克或波兰领土。然而，这些措施均未奏效；俄罗斯始终坚决反对北约扩张，尤其是反对北约向乌克兰和格鲁吉亚扩张。最终，决定何为对其构成威胁的，是俄罗斯人，而非西方国家。

Western officials contend that they tried hard to assuage Russian fears and that Moscow should have understood NATO has no hostile intentions toward Russia. In addition to denying that its expansion was aimed at containing Russia, the alliance had not permanently deployed military forces on the territory of any new member state. In 2002, hoping to foster cooperation with Moscow, it even created a body called the NATO-Russia Council. To further mollify Russia, the United States announced in 2009 that its new missile defense system would be deployed on warships in European waters, at least initially, not on Czech or Polish territory. None of these measures worked; Russia remained steadfastly opposed to NATO enlargement, especially into Ukraine and Georgia. And it is the Russians, not the West, who ultimately get to decide what counts as a threat to them.

西方精英对乌克兰局势感到意外，因为他们大多对国际政治存在误解。他们认为，现实主义和地缘政治在21世纪已无关紧要，“完整自由的欧洲”完全可以建立在自由主义原则之上。这些原则包括法治、经济相互依存和民主化。他们认为，美国最适合引领这一新世界的构建，因为它是一个温和的霸权国家，不会对俄罗斯或任何其他国家构成威胁。

Western elites were surprised by events in Ukraine because most of them have a flawed understanding of international politics. They believe that realism and geopolitics have little relevance in the twenty-first century and that a “Europe whole and free” can be constructed entirely on the basis of liberal principles. These principles include the rule of law, economic interdependence, and democratization. The United States is well suited to lead the creation of this new world, goes the story, because it is a benign hegemon that does not threaten Russia or any other country.

将欧洲打造为巨型安全共同体的宏伟计划因乌克兰危机而受挫，但这场灾难的种子早在上世纪90年代中期就已埋下，当时克林顿政府开始推动北约扩张。67位专家学者和政策制定者就扩张问题提出了各种支持和反对的论点，但始终未能达成共识。大多数居住在美国的东欧移民及其亲属强烈支持扩张，因为他们希望波兰和匈牙利等国能够得到北约的保护。一些现实主义者也赞成这项政策，因为他们认为遏制俄罗斯仍然十分必要。但大多数现实主义者反对扩张，因为他们认为一个人口老龄化、经济结构单一且日渐衰落的国家无需被遏制，而且他们担心扩张会极大地刺激莫斯科制造事端。美国传奇外交家和战略思想家乔治·凯南在1998年接受采访时表示，就在参议院批准北约第一轮扩张后不久，“我认为俄罗斯人会逐渐做出非常不利的反应，这将影响他们的政策。我认为这是一个悲剧性的错误。这样做完全没有道理。没有人威胁任何人。” 68

This grand scheme to turn Europe into a giant security community went awry over Ukraine, but the seeds of this disaster were sown in the mid-1990s, when the Clinton administration began pushing for NATO expansion.67 Pundits and policymakers advanced a variety of arguments for and against enlargement, but they never reached a consensus. Most Eastern European émigrés in the United States and their relatives strongly supported expansion because they wanted NATO protection for countries like Poland and Hungary. A few realists favored the policy because they thought it was still necessary to contain Russia. But most realists opposed expansion because they thought a declining power with an aging population and a one-dimensional economy did not need to be contained, and they feared that enlargement would strongly motivate Moscow to cause trouble. The legendary U.S. diplomat and strategic thinker George Kennan said in a 1998 interview, shortly after the Senate approved the first round of NATO expansion, that “I think the Russians will gradually react quite adversely and it will affect their policies. I think it is a tragic mistake. There was no reason for this whatsoever. No one was threatening anyone else.”68

大多数自由派人士，包括克林顿政府的许多关键成员，都赞成扩大欧盟。他们认为冷战的结束改变了国际政治格局，在新秩序下，几个世纪以来指导国家行为的现实主义逻辑不再适用。在这个新世界里，美国不仅是国务卿马德琳·奥尔布赖特所说的“不可或缺的国家”，而且也是一股强大的力量。这件好事不应该让任何理性的领导人感到恐惧。美国之音的一位记者在2004年2月评论道：“大多数分析人士都认为，北约和欧盟的扩张不应构成对俄罗斯利益的长期威胁。他们指出，拥有稳定安全的邻国可以增强俄罗斯的稳定和繁荣，同时也有助于克服冷战时期遗留的恐惧，并鼓励前苏联卫星国以更积极、合作的方式与俄罗斯接触。” 69

Most liberals, including many key members of the Clinton administration, favored enlargement. They believed the end of the Cold War had transformed international politics, and in the new post-national order, the realist logic that had guided state behavior for centuries no longer applied. In this new world, the United States was not only the “indispensable nation,” to quote Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, but also a force for good that should not strike fear in the heart of any rational leader. A Voice of America reporter commented in February 2004 that “most analysts agree the enlargement of NATO and the EU should not pose a long-term threat to Russian interests. They point out that having stable and secure neighbors may increase stability and prosperity in Russia, as well as help overcome old Cold War fears and encourage former Soviet satellites to engage Russia in a more positive, cooperative way.”69

到了20世纪90年代末，克林顿政府内部的自由派人士赢得了北约扩张的胜利。随后，他们几乎毫不费力地就说服了欧洲盟友支持北约扩张。事实上，鉴于欧盟在20世纪90年代的成功，西欧精英或许比美国人更加坚信地缘政治不再重要，一个包容一切的自由秩序能够维护欧洲的长期和平。20世纪末，美国及其欧洲自由派盟友的共同目标是在东欧各国推广民主，增强它们之间的经济相互依存，并将它们纳入国际机构。其最终目标是使整个欧洲大陆看起来像西欧。

By the late 1990s, the liberals within the Clinton administration had won the battle for NATO expansion. They then had little difficulty convincing their European allies to support enlargement. Given the EU’s success during the 1990s, in fact, Western European elites may have been even more wedded than the Americans to the notion that geopolitics no longer matter and that an all-inclusive liberal order could maintain long-term peace in Europe. The common aim of the United States and its liberal European allies as the twentieth century ended was to promote democracy in the countries of Eastern Europe, increase economic interdependence among them, and embed them in international institutions. The ultimate goal was to make the entire continent look like Western Europe.

在21世纪的第一个十年里，自由主义者彻底主导了关于欧洲安全的论述，以至于北约的进一步扩张在西方几乎没有遭到现实主义者或其他任何人的反对，即便该联盟实际上已经对未来的成员国采取了开放政策。 70自由主义的世界观主导了布什和奥巴马两届政府的思维。例如，在2014年3月关于乌克兰危机的演讲中，奥巴马总统反复谈到西方政策的“理想”，以及这些理想“常常受到一种更古老、更传统的权力观的威胁”。国务卿约翰·克里对俄罗斯吞并克里米亚的回应也反映了同样的观点：“在21世纪，你不能再像19世纪那样，以完全捏造的借口入侵另一个国家。” 71

Liberals came to dominate the discourse about European security so thoroughly during the first decade of the twenty-first century that further NATO expansion faced little opposition in the West from realists or anyone else, even after the alliance had effectively adopted an open-door policy regarding future membership.70 The liberal worldview dominated the thinking of both the Bush and Obama administrations. In a March 2014 speech about the Ukraine crisis, for example, President Obama talked repeatedly about “the ideals” that motivate Western policy and how those ideals “have often been threatened by an older, more traditional view of power.” Secretary of State John Kerry’s response to the Russian annexation of Crimea reflected the same perspective: “You just don’t in the twenty-first century behave in nineteenth-century fashion by invading another country on completely trumped up pretext.”71

总之，俄罗斯和西方一直遵循着不同的行事准则。普京及其同僚的思维和行动都体现了现实主义，而西方领导人则恪守着教科书式的自由主义国际政治理念。结果是，美国及其盟友在不知不觉中……引发了一场重大危机，而且这场危机丝毫没有结束的迹象，这在很大程度上是因为自由民主国家发现与专制国家进行外交非常困难。

In sum, Russia and the West have been operating with different handbooks. Putin and his compatriots have been thinking and acting like realists, while Western leaders have adhered to textbook liberal ideas about international politics. The result is that the United States and its allies unwittingly provoked a major crisis that shows no sign of ending, in large part because liberal democracies find it so difficult to engage in diplomacy with authoritarian states.

海外自由主义削弱国内自由主义

Liberalism Abroad Undermines Liberalism at Home

奉行自由主义霸权的国家，必然会损害其国内的自由主义根基。主要原因显而易见：一个在海外推行这种雄心勃勃的战略的国家，别无选择，只能建立强大的国家安全官僚机构，以发动无休止的战争，并按照自己的意愿监控和塑造世界。然而，一个强大的国家安全机构几乎总是会对国内的自由主义价值观和制度构成威胁。开国元勋们对此问题有着深刻的理解：正如詹姆斯·麦迪逊所言，“任何国家都无法在持续不断的战争中保住其自由。” 72

States that pursue liberal hegemony invariably damage the fabric of liberalism inside their own borders.
