The main reason is straightforward: a country pursuing this ambitious strategy abroad has little choice but to create a powerful national security bureaucracy to fight its endless wars and monitor and shape the world in its own image. But a formidable national security state almost always threatens liberal values and institutions at home. The Founding Fathers understood this problem well: as James Madison observed, “No nation can preserve its freedom in the midst of continual warfare.”72

军事化的自由主义国家必须依赖秘密，甚至在国家利益需要时欺骗本国人民，而这种情况在国家安全人员看来发生的频率高得惊人。当这些人员认为侵犯个人权利和破坏法治对于自由主义外交政策的实施至关重要时，同样的本能也会导致此类行为。频繁发动战争的自由主义国家也常常最终采取与自身法律和自由主义价值观相悖的残酷政策来对待其对手。73

Militarized liberal states must rely on secrecy and must even deceive their own people when the country’s interest requires it, which turns out to be surprisingly often in the eyes of their national security operatives. This same instinct gives way to violating individual rights and undermining the rule of law when those operatives deem it essential for making a liberal foreign policy work. Liberal states that fight frequent wars also routinely end up treating their adversaries with ruthless policies that conflict with their own laws and liberal values.73

自冷战结束以来，美国已经发动了七场战争，并且自9·11事件发生后的一个月起就一直处于战争状态，而且这些战争丝毫没有停止的迹象。所有这些冲突使得1991年苏联解体时就已存在的强大国家安全体系，在今天变得更加强大。

The United States has waged seven wars since the Cold War ended and has been at war continuously since the month after 9/11, and the wars show no sign of stopping. All of this conflict has made the formidable national security state that existed in 1991, when the Soviet Union collapsed, even more powerful today.

秘密与欺骗

Secrecy and Deception

在国内层面，透明度对于自由民主政体的有效运作至关重要。它不仅使选民能够做出明智的决定，也使媒体和外部专家能够评估政府政策，并参与到有效的思想交流中。它是任何成功的自由民主政体不可或缺的组成部分。它有助于公民。当政策制定者犯错或从事犯罪活动时，必须追究他们的责任。保密的本质在于限制透明度，这意味着过度保密很容易破坏自由民主政体。

At the domestic level, transparency is indispensable if liberal democracies are to function effectively. It not only allows voters to make informed decisions but also allows the media and outside experts to assess government policies and participate in a workable marketplace of ideas. It is an essential ingredient of any successful liberal democracy. It helps citizens hold policymakers accountable when they make mistakes or engage in criminal behavior. Secrecy, by definition, is all about limiting transparency, which means too much of it can easily undermine a liberal democratic regime.

毫无疑问，每个国家的外交政策都需要一定程度的保密。然而，对于自由民主国家而言，至关重要的是尽可能减少保密，尽可能提高透明度。但追求自由霸权却会产生相反的效果，部分原因是任何追求自由霸权的国家都会有强烈的动机去限制对手了解其政策、战略和武器装备的信息。有时，甚至对盟友隐瞒信息也是合理的。一个国家的外交政策越雄心勃勃，它就越有理由对朋友和敌人隐瞒秘密。自由国家也喜欢保密，因为这有助于保护领导人免受国内批评，从而更容易推行可能引发争议的政策。如果记者和学者对某项政策一无所知，他们就很难对其进行批评，甚至最终对其进行监督。最后，如果政策制定者选择的政策出现偏差，或者推行该政策导致他们触犯法律，他们就希望避免承担责任。实现这一目标的最佳方法就是对公众隐瞒真相。

There is no question that every country’s foreign policy requires some secrecy. For a liberal democracy, however, it is imperative to minimize the amount of secrecy and maximize the amount of transparency. But pursuing liberal hegemony has the opposite effect, in part because any country that does so is powerfully motivated to limit the amount of information that adversaries have about its policies, strategies, and weaponry. Sometimes it makes sense to hide information even from allies. The more ambitious a country’s foreign policy, the more reason it has to hide secrets from friends and foes alike. Liberal states also like secrecy because it helps protect leaders from criticism at home, making it easier to pursue policies that might be controversial. It is hard for journalists and academics to criticize a policy, and perhaps ultimately check it, if they know nothing about it. Finally, policymakers want to avoid accountability if their chosen policy goes awry or if pursuing it leads them to break the law. The best way to accomplish this is to keep the public in the dark.

布什和奥巴马两届政府对保密表现出的极度热衷并不令人惊讶，因为他们对美国公民进行了非法或至少是可疑的监视，并试图向公众、国会和法院隐瞒这些行为。 74这也是奥巴马总统如此决心惩罚布拉德利·曼宁和爱德华·斯诺登的原因之一，也是他以前所未有的热情向记者和举报人发起攻击的原因。 75他还竭力掩盖美国在叙利亚内战中的深度介入，并尽可能少地披露有关无人机袭击的信息。奥巴马经常声称他领导的是“历史上最透明的政府”。 76如果这是真的，那么功劳应该归于那些挑战他根深蒂固的政府保密原则的记者和举报人。

The deep affection for secrecy shown by both the Bush and Obama administrations is not surprising in light of their illegal or at least questionable surveillance of American citizens, which they tried to hide from the public, Congress, and the courts.74 This is one reason President Obama was so determined to punish Bradley Manning and Edward Snowden, and more generally why he went to war with unprecedented fervor against reporters and whistleblowers.75 He also went to great lengths to disguise how deeply involved the United States was in the Syrian civil war, and to divulge as little information as possible about drone strikes. Obama was given to claiming that he ran “the most transparent administration in history.”76 If true, the credit should go to the reporters and whistleblowers who defied his deep commitment to government secrecy.

高度干预主义外交政策的另一个有害后果是，它为领导人提供了大量撒谎或至少歪曲事实的机会，以便动员公众支持海外军事行动。这种行为在第一次世界大战期间表现得尤为明显，当时威尔逊将军……政府发起了一场全面的宣传运动，以煽动公众情绪支持对抗德意志帝国的战争。夸大苏联的威胁在冷战期间司空见惯，而乔治·W·布什政府在2003年伊拉克战争前夕也发动了一场卓有成效的欺骗运动。

Another harmful consequence of a highly interventionist foreign policy is that it gives leaders numerous occasions to lie, or at least distort the truth, when trying to motivate the public to support military action abroad. This behavior was clearly on display during World War I, when the Wilson administration unleashed a comprehensive propaganda campaign to stir up public sentiment in support of the fight against Imperial Germany. Inflating the Soviet threat was commonplace during the Cold War, and the George W. Bush administration waged a highly effective deception campaign in the run-up to the 2003 Iraq war.

欺骗行为涉及三种手段：撒谎、歪曲事实和隐瞒。撒谎是指政策制定者明知其虚假却故意发表虚假声明，希望他人信以为真。歪曲事实是一种更为常见的欺骗手段，指领导人为了推销或捍卫某项政策，讲述一个强调某些事实而淡化或忽略其他事实的故事。他们并不试图提供完全准确的信息。换句话说，歪曲事实包含夸大和歪曲，但不涉及谎言。隐瞒是指向公众隐瞒可能损害或削弱其所支持的政策的信息。显然，这种欺骗手段与保密密切相关。77

Deception campaigns involve three kinds of behavior: lying, spinning, and concealment. Lying is where a policymaker makes a statement that he knows to be false in the hope that others will think it is true. Spinning, a more common form of deception, is where a leader tells a story that emphasizes certain facts and either deemphasizes or omits other facts, for the purpose of selling or defending some policy. No attempt is made to render a fully accurate account. Spinning, in other words, involves exaggeration and distortion but not prevarication. Concealment is withholding information from the public that might undermine or weaken a favored policy. Obviously, this form of deception is most closely related to secrecy.77

拥有雄心勃勃的外交政策议程的自由主义国家往往会进行欺骗性宣传，因为激励人们为战争而战死并非易事。个人和国家一样，都深受生存本能的驱使。自由主义战争尤其难以推销，因为这些战争的最终目的并非抵御对国家生存的威胁，而是为了保护外国人的权利或传播自由民主。让人们为这些自由主义目标而战死并非易事。领导人总是会受到诱惑，欺骗公众，让他们支持自己选择的战争。78

Liberal states with ambitious foreign policy agendas are prone to engage in deception campaigns, because inspiring people to fight and die in a war is not easy. Individuals, like states, are deeply motivated to survive. It is especially challenging to sell liberal wars because they are ultimately not about fighting off threats to a country’s survival but about protecting the rights of foreigners or spreading liberal democracy. Getting people to fight and die for these liberal goals is not an easy sell. Leaders are always tempted to deceive their publics to get them on board for wars of choice.78

政府在试图掩盖非法或违宪活动时，也会欺骗公众。例如，国家情报总监詹姆斯·克拉珀于2013年3月12日出席国会听证会，被问及：“国家安全局是否收集数百万或数亿美国人的任何类型的数据？”他回答说没有。很快，他的谎言就被揭穿，他被迫在6月向国会承认：“我的回答显然是错误的——对此我道歉。”后来，他又说，他当时的回答已经是“尽可能不说谎”的方式了。尽管向国会撒谎是重罪，但克拉珀并未被起诉，也没有被解雇。79

Governments also deceive their publics when they are trying to hide illegal or constitutionally suspect activities. For example, James Clapper, the director of national intelligence, appeared before Congress on March 12, 2013, and was asked: “Does the NSA [National Security Agency] collect any type of data at all on millions or hundreds of millions of Americans?” He answered no. It quickly became apparent that he was lying, which he was forced to admit to Congress in June: “My response was clearly erroneous—for which I apologize.” Later, he said he responded to that question in the “least untruthful” manner possible. Although lying to Congress is a felony, Clapper was not charged and was not fired from his job.79

普遍存在的混淆视听必然会滋生有害的不诚实文化，严重损害任何政治体，尤其是自由民主政体。谎言不仅使公民难以就候选人和议题做出明智的选择，还会破坏政策制定。如果政府官员之间缺乏信任，办事成本将大幅增加。此外，在一个歪曲或隐瞒真相司空见惯的世界里，法治将受到严重削弱。任何有效的法律体系都依赖于公众的诚实和信任。最后，如果谎言在自由民主政体中泛滥成灾，可能会疏远公众，使其对政治秩序失去信心，从而更容易接受威权统治。

Pervasive obfuscation inevitably creates a poisonous culture of dishonesty, which gravely damages any body politic but especially a liberal democracy. Not only does lying make it difficult for citizens to make informed choices about candidates and issues, it also undermines policymaking. If government officials cannot trust each other, the transaction costs of doing business are greatly increased. Furthermore, in a world where distorting or hiding the truth is commonplace, the rule of law is severely weakened. Any legal system, to work effectively, demands public honesty and trust. Finally, if lying becomes pervasive in a liberal democracy, it may alienate the public to the point where it loses faith in that political order and becomes open to authoritarian rule.

公民自由的侵蚀

Eroding Civil Liberties

一个不断备战、发动战争并大肆宣扬武力益处的自由民主国家，最终很可能会侵犯作为自由社会核心的个人权利和法治。在战争等国家紧急状态下，领导人可能会认为他们有充分的理由通过限制言论自由和新闻自由来压制对其政策的批评。他们往往会深感内部存在敌人，而这个敌人可能包括不忠的公民，甚至是外国人。恐惧弥漫在空气中。这种猜忌的氛围必然会导致以不自由的方式限制个人权利和监控公民，而这些往往得到广泛的公众支持。

A liberal democracy that is constantly preparing for and fighting wars, as well as extolling the benefits of using force, is likely to end up violating the individual rights and rule of law that are at the heart of a liberal society. In times of national emergency such as war, leaders may think they have good reasons to stifle criticism of their policies by curtailing freedom of speech and freedom of the press. They are apt to have deep concerns about an enemy within, which might include disloyal citizens or even aliens. Fear is the order of the day. The atmosphere of suspicion invariably leads to restricting individual rights and monitoring citizens in illiberal ways, often with wide public support.

领导人这样做并非出于邪恶。在危难时期，或者人们认为危难的时期，安全与公民自由之间存在权衡，决策者几乎总是选择安全。一个国家的最高目标必须是生存，因为如果无法生存，就无法追求其他任何目标。美国历史上有大量此类行为的例证，包括林肯在南北战争期间的非自由主义政策、第一次世界大战期间对反战声音的压制、战后臭名昭著的“红色恐慌”、第二次世界大战期间对日裔美国公民的监禁，以及20世纪40年代末和50年代初的麦卡锡主义。

Leaders do not act this way because they are evil. Given the trade-off between security and civil liberties in dire times, or what are perceived to be dire times, policymakers almost always choose security. A country’s highest goal has to be its survival, because if it does not survive, it cannot pursue any other goals. The ample evidence of this kind of behavior in American history includes Lincoln’s illiberal policies during the U.S. Civil War, the silencing of anti-war voices during World War I, the infamous “Red Scare” immediately after that conflict, the imprisonment of Japanese American citizens in World War II, and McCarthyism in the late 1940s and early 1950s.

自9/11事件以来，美国外交政策机构普遍存在对外国威胁的过度恐惧，因此，布什总统和奥巴马总统都推行削弱国内公民自由的政策也就不足为奇了。以下三个例子足以说明问题，第一个例子涉及与第四修正案搜查令相关的隐私权。一般而言，未经法官授权，政府不得收集美国公民的信息。通常情况下，要获得搜查令，调查人员必须证明有合理理由相信某人正在从事非法活动。即使政府认为某人危险或行为违法，通常也必须获得司法批准才能采取行动。

Given the exaggerated fear of foreign threats that has permeated the American foreign policy establishment since 9/11, it is unsurprising that both Presidents Bush and Obama pursued policies that diminished civil liberties at home. Three examples are in order, the first of which involves the right to privacy as it relates to the Fourth Amendment’s warrant requirements. Generally speaking, the government cannot gather information on American citizens without a judge’s authorization. Normally, to obtain a search warrant, investigators must show there is probable cause to think an individual is engaging in illegal activity. Even when the government thinks someone is dangerous or behaving unlawfully, it ordinarily cannot act without judicial approval.

毫无疑问，从9/11事件后不久到2007年1月，布什政府一直在未经授权的情况下对美国公民进行监视。 80我们还从爱德华·斯诺登那里得知，政府，主要是国家安全局（NSA），还会搜索和存储大量的电子邮件和短信。 81虽然法律限制其只能出于外国情报目的监控国际通信，但国家安全局仍然收集了美国公民之间的国内通信。政府还定期收集数百万美国人的电话记录，并跟踪“电话元数据”，其中包括通话双方的电话号码、通话时长、通话地点和通话时间。很难反驳参议员罗恩·怀登（俄勒冈州民主党）的观点，即“政府收集守法美国公民信息的权力实际上是无限的”。 82

There is little doubt the Bush administration was engaged in warrantless surveillance of American citizens from shortly after 9/11 until January 2007.80 We also know, thanks to Edward Snowden, that the government, mainly the NSA, also searches and stores vast amounts of emails and text-based messages.81 While limited by law to monitoring international communications for foreign intelligence purposes, the NSA nevertheless collected domestic communications between American citizens. The government also regularly collects telephone records of millions of Americans and keeps track of “telephony metadata” that includes the phone numbers of parties to a call, its duration, location, and time. It is hard to disagree with Senator Ron Wyden’s (D-OR) comment that “the government’s authority to collect information on law-abiding American citizens is essentially limitless.”82

为了进行这种监视，政府通常会从一个名为“外国情报监视法庭”（FISA法庭）的秘密法庭获得搜查令。但这一过程存在严重的透明度和公信力问题。FISA法庭实际上形同橡皮图章：1979年至2012年间，它收到了近34000份在美国境内进行电子监视的申请，但仅驳回了11份。此外，几乎不可能对FISA法庭的裁决提出质疑，这不仅是因为这些裁决是秘密进行的，还因为除了政府之外，任何人都不能参与诉讼程序。而且，当FISA证据被用于联邦刑事诉讼时，如果司法部长像往常一样证明披露搜查令申请会危及国家安全，那么被告及其律师都无法获得该申请。当一家联邦上诉法院裁定美国国家安全局（NSA）收集大量数据的行为非法时，奥巴马政府指示FISA法庭无视该裁决。

To do this surveillance, the government often gets a warrant from a secret court known as the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court (or FISA court). But this process has significant transparency and credibility problems. The FISA court is a virtual rubber stamp:83 between 1979 and 2012, it received almost thirty-four thousand requests to conduct electronic surveillance within the United States and denied eleven.84 Moreover, it is virtually impossible to challenge FISA court rulings, not only because they are secret but because no one but the government is a party to the proceedings. And when FISA evidence is used in federal criminal prosecutions, neither the defendant nor his attorney can obtain access to the warrant application if the attorney general certifies, as he routinely does, that disclosure would endanger national security.85 When a federal appeals court ruled that the NSA’s collection of bulk data was illegal, the Obama administration instructed the FISA court to ignore the ruling.86

第二个损害公民自由的政策例子涉及正当程序，正当程序是美国宪法保护的核心，也是法治的基石。毫不夸张地说，就全球反恐战争中所谓的敌方战斗人员而言，传统的正当程序概念已沦为笑柄。2002年1月，9·11事件后，美国开始在阿富汗及其他地区大规模搜捕恐怖嫌疑人，布什政府在关塔那摩湾设立了一个名副其实的“古拉格”，并强烈阻挠被拘留者争取正当程序的努力。自关塔那摩湾启用以来，已有779人被关押于此。奥巴马总统曾誓言要关闭关塔那摩湾，但未能如愿，至今仍是一个程序混乱的泥潭。截至2017年1月，关塔那摩湾仍有41名囚犯，其中5人已被批准释放，但仍被关押，这在该监狱屡见不鲜。另有26名囚犯因证据不足而无法被起诉，但政府以他们构成安全威胁为由拒绝释放他们。这种任意且史无前例的无限期拘留政策公然违反了大多数公认的正当程序原则。

The second example of policies that undermine civil liberties concerns due process, which lies at the very core of America’s constitutional protections and is the backbone of the rule of law. It is no exaggeration to say that as it applies to so-called enemy combatants in the global war on terror, the traditional notion of due process has become laughable. In January 2002, when the United States began sweeping up suspected terrorists in Afghanistan and elsewhere after 9/11, the Bush administration created a virtual gulag at Guantanamo Bay and strongly resisted the detainees’ efforts to obtain due process. Since it was opened, 779 men have been imprisoned there. President Obama vowed to close it but could not, and it remains a due process quagmire. Of the 41 individuals still imprisoned at Guantanamo as of January 2017, 5 have been cleared for release but remain imprisoned, which has been a common pattern at the prison. Twenty-six prisoners cannot be prosecuted, because of insufficient evidence; but the government refuses to release them because it considers them security threats.87 This arbitrary and unprecedented policy of indefinite detention blatantly violates most commonly held notions of due process.

更糟糕的是，布什政府制定了臭名昭著的“非常规引渡”政策，将高价值囚犯送往埃及和叙利亚等漠视人权的国家，对他们进行酷刑和审讯。中央情报局似乎也在其位于欧洲的“黑狱”以及阿富汗的巴格拉姆空军基地和伊拉克的阿布格莱布监狱对囚犯实施了酷刑。 88这项政策显然违反了美国和国际法，这两项法律都禁止酷刑。正如开放社会正义倡议组织国家安全与反恐项目主任阿姆里特·辛格所报告的那样，毫不奇怪，“秘密拘留计划和非常规引渡计划都是高度机密的，在美国境外进行，其目的是使对被拘留者的审讯不受法律约束。” 89总而言之，非法拘留和非法酷刑政策不仅破坏了法治，而且阻碍了法治在未来的恢复。

Worse yet, the Bush administration devised the infamous policy of extraordinary rendition, in which high-value prisoners were sent to countries that cared little about human rights, like Egypt and Syria, to be tortured and interrogated. It appears the CIA also tortured prisoners at its “black sites” in Europe as well as at Bagram Air Base in Afghanistan and Abu Ghraib in Iraq.88 This policy clearly violated American and international law, both of which forbid torture. Not surprisingly, as Amrit Singh, who directs the project on national security and counterterrorism at the Open Society Justice Initiative, reported, “The secret detention program and the extraordinary rendition program were highly classified, conducted outside the United States, and designed to place detainee interrogations beyond the reach of the law.”89 Taken together, the policies of illegal detention and illegal torture not only subvert the rule of law but conspire to prevent its restoration in the future.

这种令人不齿的情况又引出了第三个例子。由于奥巴马政府既无法起诉也无法释放关塔那摩监狱的囚犯，因此它对抓捕新囚犯并将其无限期拘留兴趣寥寥。于是，奥巴马和他的顾问们显然决定，无论在哪里发现疑似敌方战斗人员，都要将其暗杀。90杀死嫌疑人当然比逮捕他们容易得多。如果这项新政策继续将关塔那摩监狱置于法律泥潭之中，其后果可能更加恶劣。

This disgraceful situation brings to mind yet a third example. Because the Obama administration could neither prosecute nor release the detainees at Guantanamo, it had little interest in capturing new prisoners and subjecting them to indefinite detention. So Obama and his advisors apparently decided instead to assassinate suspected enemy combatants wherever they were found.90 While it is surely easier to kill suspects than bring them to Guantanamo and perpetuate its legal morass, the effects of this new policy may be even more poisonous.

当然，无人机在这些暗杀行动中扮演着核心角色。奥巴马有一份被称为“处置矩阵”的暗杀名单，每周二白宫都会召开一次会议——被称为“恐怖星期二”——会上会选定下一个目标。 91奥巴马政府对这一战略的接受程度，可以从2002年11月无人机袭击开始到2013年5月期间的无人机袭击分布情况中看出。米卡·曾科报告称，“大约发生了425起非战场定点清除行动（超过95%由无人机实施）。其中约50起发生在布什执政期间，375起（且数量还在增加）发生在奥巴马执政期间。” 92正如记者汤姆·恩格尔哈特所写，“曾几何时，秘密暗杀通常是一种罕见的国家行为，总统可以否认。如今，它已成为白宫和中央情报局的日常运作。总统作为首席刺客的角色几乎已被公开宣传为一种政治优势。” 93

Drones, of course, play a central role in these assassinations. Obama had a kill list known as the “disposition matrix,” and every Tuesday there was a meeting in the White House—it was called “Terror Tuesday”—where the next victims were selected.91 The extent to which the Obama administration bought into this strategy is reflected in the distribution of drone strikes between November 2002, when they began, and May 2013. Micah Zenko reports that there were “approximately 425 non-battlefield targeted killings (more than 95 percent by drones). Roughly 50 took place during Mr. Bush’s tenure, and 375 (and counting) under Mr. Obama’s.”92 As the journalist Tom Engelhardt writes, “Once upon a time, off-the-books assassination was generally a rare act of state that presidents could deny. Now, it is part of everyday life in the White House and at the CIA. The president’s role as assassin in chief has been all but publicly promoted as a political plus.”93

这种暗杀策略几乎没有给正当法律程序留下任何空间。中央情报局甚至被授权杀害那些并非已知恐怖分子、仅仅因为行为可疑（无论可疑之处是什么）的年轻人。此外，从数千英尺的高空清晰识别目标也十分困难。因此，无人机造成无辜平民伤亡的案例屡见不鲜也就不足为奇了。虽然难以获得确切数字，但至少有10%到15%的受害者似乎是平民。前中央情报局局长迈克尔·海登在2012年的一番评论，恰恰体现了奥巴马的暗杀策略是多么的错误：“现在，除了阿富汗，或许还有以色列，地球上没有哪个政府会认同我们这些行动的法律依据。” 94 在一个拥有庞大而强大的军队、并且沉迷于战争的国家，个人权利和法治很难得到保障。 95

This assassination strategy leaves hardly any room for due process under the law. The CIA is even authorized to kill young men who are not known to be terrorists but are merely exhibiting suspicious behavior, whatever that might be. It is also difficult to clearly identify targets from thousands of feet above. Thus it is hardly surprising that there are many cases where drones have killed innocent civilians. While it is hard to get firm numbers, at least 10 to 15 percent of the victims appear to have been civilians. A comment by former CIA director Michael Hayden in 2012 captures just how misguided Obama’s assassination strategy was: “Right now, there isn’t a government on the planet that agrees with our legal rationale for these operations, except for Afghanistan and maybe Israel.”94 Individual rights and the rule of law do not fare well in a country that maintains a large and powerful military and is addicted to fighting wars.95

高现代主义意识形态

The High-Modernist Ideology

在《像国家一样思考》一书中，詹姆斯·斯科特试图探究“为什么这么多旨在改善人类状况的善意计划最终都以悲剧性的方式失败了”。96他重点关注的是像中国这样的灾难性国内项目。俄国的“大跃进”（1958-1962）和集体化运动（1928-1940）就是很好的例子。但我认为斯科特的论点同样适用于国际政治。97有人可能会认为，自由主义霸权失败的可能性更高，因为它涉及在外国而非本国进行社会改造。

In Seeing Like a State, James Scott sets out to determine “why so many well-intended schemes to improve the human condition have gone so tragically awry.”96 His focus is on disastrous domestic programs like China’s Great Leap Forward (1958–62) and collectivization in Russia (1928–40). But I believe Scott’s thesis can also be applied to international politics.97 One could argue that the chances of failure are even higher with liberal hegemony, because it involves social engineering in a foreign country, not at home.

斯科特认为，现代史上许多重大灾难都是由依赖于“高度现代主义意识形态”的“宏大乌托邦式社会工程计划”造成的。自由主义霸权似乎在这两方面都符合这一描述。它呼吁在全球范围内进行社会工程，这本身就是乌托邦式的。斯科特指出，高度现代主义意识形态“最好被理解为一种强烈的、甚至可以说是强硬的自信，这种自信源于对科学技术进步、生产扩张、人类需求日益增长的满足、对自然（包括人性）的掌控，以及最重要的，与对自然规律的科学理解相称的理性社会秩序设计的自信。” 自由主义霸权凭借其对自由民主和开放经济市场优点的自信，以及利用国际机构来推广使各国更易于理解的标准指标，再次完美地契合了这一描述。

Scott maintains that many of the great disasters in modern history are caused by “great utopian social engineering schemes” that depend on a “high-modernist ideology.” Liberal hegemony appears to qualify on both counts. It calls for doing social engineering all across the globe, which is nothing if not utopian. A high-modernist ideology, Scott says, “is best conceived as a strong, one might even say muscle-bound, version of the self-confidence about scientific and technical progress, the expansion of production, the growing satisfaction of human needs, the mastery of nature (including human nature), and, above all, the rational design of social order commensurate with the scientific understanding of natural laws.” Again, liberal hegemony, with its confidence in the virtues of liberal democracy and open economic markets and its use of international institutions to purvey standard metrics that make states more legible, fits the bill well.

斯科特认为，灾难性的失败还需要两个额外要素：“一个愿意且能够动用全部强制力来实现这些高度现代主义设计的威权国家”以及“一个匍匐在地、缺乏能力抵制这些计划的公民社会”。自由民主国家和威权国家代表着截然不同的政治形式，但在国际领域，这种区分在很大程度上无关紧要。一个强大的自由国家可能极其执着于自己的目标，并且当它认为这样做不仅在道德上正确，而且有利于自身安全时，就愿意胁迫其他国家。当自由民主国家感到自身受到严重威胁时，它们很可能会宣布进入紧急状态，从而使自身具备威权国家的诸多特征。

According to Scott, disastrous failure requires two additional ingredients: “an authoritarian state that is willing and able to use the full weight of its coercive power to bring these high-modernist designs into being” and “a prostrate civil society that lacks the capacity to resist these plans.” Liberal democracies and authoritarian states represent fundamentally different political forms, but this distinction is largely moot in the international realm. A powerful liberal state can be intensely single-minded and willing to coerce other countries when it thinks this is not only morally correct but also good for its own security. When liberal democracies feel seriously threatened, they are likely to declare a state of emergency, allowing themselves to take on many of the features of an authoritarian state.

此外，公民社会在国际上根本没有对应的组织。所有关于“国际社会”的言论，都暗示着世界公民可以团结起来对抗大国，但这最终不过是空洞的言辞。国际社会从一开始就处于弱势地位。民众的反对几乎不可能阻止一个自由主义大国试图将其高度现代主义的意识形态强加于较弱小的国家。当然，这个积极倡导正义的国家可能会遇到其他国家的反对，但这不足以阻止它实现其让世界对自由民主而言安全的雄心壮志。

Moreover, civil society simply has no international equivalent. All the talk one hears about the “international community,” which implies that the citizens of the world might come together and stand up to a great power, is ultimately empty rhetoric. The international community is prostrate from the outset. There is little danger that popular opposition will stop a liberal great power from trying to impose its high-modernist ideology on weaker states. Of course, the crusading state may run into opposition from other states, but there will not be enough to prevent it from trying to fulfill its ambition to make the world safe for liberal democracy.

9·11事件尘埃落定后，斯科特所设想的所有要素在美国都已具备。布什政府采取了一项政策，即利用美国军事力量推翻政权，并将民主制度引入中东地区——一个几乎没有民主经验的地区。布什主义是一项激进的战略，在美国历史上前所未有。奥巴马总统虽然比他的前任更为谨慎，但仍然延续了布什推翻非自由主义政权、试图在中东地区推广民主的政策。两位总统不仅几乎在每个方面都以失败告终，而且他们的政策还给该地区带来了广泛的杀戮和破坏。

All of Scott’s ingredients were firmly in place in the United States as the dust was settling after 9/11. The Bush administration adopted a policy of using the American military to topple regimes and bring democracy to the greater Middle East, an area that had little experience with democracy. The Bush Doctrine was a radical strategy that has no parallel in American history. President Obama, though more cautious than his predecessor, nonetheless continued Bush’s policy of toppling illiberal regimes and trying to promote democracy across the Middle East. Not only did both presidents fail at almost every turn, their policies brought widespread killing and devastation to the region.

我们已经看到，自由主义外交政策很可能失败，而且失败的代价很高。然而，即使是那些认识到风险的人，有时也会辩称这种努力是合理的。

We have seen that a liberal foreign policy is likely to fail and that the costs of failure are high. Yet even those who recognize the risks sometimes argue that the effort can be justified.

7

7

自由主义和平理论

Liberal Theories of Peace

自由主义霸权围绕三大目标构建：增加世界上的自由民主国家数量、促进开放的经济秩序以及构建国际机构。其假设是，实现这些目标，尤其是第一个目标，就能带来国际和平。我在前两章中论证过，这样的政策不仅在国内和国际上代价巨大，而且很可能失败。奉行自由主义外交政策的国家最终往往会发现自己的处境更加糟糕。

LIBERAL HEGEMONY IS BUILT AROUND three missions: increasing the number of liberal democracies in the world, facilitating an open economic order, and building international institutions. The assumption is that achieving these goals, especially the first one, is a formula for international peace. I argued in the previous two chapters that such a policy is not only enormously costly both at home and abroad but also likely to fail. States that pursue a liberal foreign policy invariably find themselves worse off.

本章我将探讨自由主义霸权所宣称的益处：它能带来和平与繁荣，并有效终结核扩散和恐怖主义等问题。有人可能会认为，即便代价巨大，努力实现这些目标也是合理的，因为其带来的益处更大。为了验证这种观点是否正确，我将考察国际政治的三大自由主义理论——民主和平理论、经济相互依存理论和自由制度主义——以探究它们的有效性。这三大理论分别对应着自由主义外交政策的三大主要目标。我的结论是，这些理论都无法提供和平的灵丹妙药。自由主义霸权不仅容易导致代价高昂的失败，即便它实现了其目标，也无法为我们带来一个没有战争的世界。

In this chapter I will examine liberal hegemony’s purported benefit: that it will bring peace and wealth and effectively end problems like nuclear proliferation and terrorism. One might argue that it makes sense to try to realize those aims even if the costs are great, simply because the benefits are even greater. To determine whether that might be true, I examine the three main liberal theories of international politics—democratic peace theory, economic interdependence theory, and liberal institutionalism—to see how well each works. These three theories correspond with the three principal missions of a liberal foreign policy. My bottom line is that none of these theories provides a formula for peace. Not only is liberal hegemony prone to costly failures, it would not bring us a world without war even if it achieved its goals.

每一种自由主义理论都直指现实主义，现实主义认为大国之间的安全竞争和战争是国际体系中正常的一部分。自由主义理论家寻求的是一种能够凌驾于现实主义之上的、令人信服的理论。现实主义有助于构建一个更加和平的世界。然而，这些自由主义理论都没有提出建立世界政府的必要性，这似乎合情合理，因为政治自由主义只有在更高权威机构维护秩序的情况下才能在一个国家内部发挥作用。相反，每一种理论都假定现有的国家体系将继续存在，我们需要一种在国际无政府状态下实现和平的策略。

Each liberal theory takes dead aim at realism, which takes security competition among the great powers and war to be a normal part of life in the international system. Liberal theorists seek a compelling story that trumps realism and leads to a more peaceful world. But none of these liberal theories makes the case for world government, which might seem to make sense given that political liberalism can work inside a country only when there is a higher authority that maintains order. Instead, each theory assumes that the existing state system is here to stay and that we need a strategy for producing peace under international anarchy.

此外，这三种理论都没有假定国家不再有发动战争的理由。它们并非设想弗朗西斯·福山在其1989年著名文章《历史的终结？》中所描述的世界。相反，每种理论都承认，国家有时会存在根本性的政治分歧，这可能导致它们考虑采取军事行动。然而，自由主义的支持者认为，当战争的可能性真正存在时，其他更强大的因素会与现实主义逻辑相悖，并最终压倒现实主义逻辑。国家有时会出于这样或那样的原因而受到诱惑，想要拔剑相向；但一种或多种自由主义逻辑会战胜这种诱惑，从而避免战争的发生。

Furthermore, none of the three theories assumes that states no longer have reasons to go to war. They are not positing a world such as Francis Fukuyama describes in his famous 1989 article “The End of History?” Instead, each theory acknowledges that states sometimes have fundamental political differences, which may cause them to consider military action. Yet liberalism’s proponents maintain that other, more powerful factors cut against realist logic and ultimately overwhelm it when there is a serious possibility of war. States will sometimes be tempted, for one reason or another, to unsheathe the sword; but one or more of the liberal logics will outweigh that temptation, and there will be no war.

民主和平理论认为，自由民主国家之间不会发生战争，但它并未预测民主国家与非民主国家之间的战争会减少。自由民主国家之间和平的主要解释是，它们对个人权利根深蒂固的尊重，以及对宽容与和平解决冲突的重视，压倒了它们发动战争的任何理由。其他观点则认为，阻止自由民主国家之间发生战争的，是民主制度和规范的特定特征，而非自由权利本身。

Democratic peace theory maintains that liberal democracies do not fight wars with each other, but it does not predict any decrease in wars between democracies and non-democracies. The principal explanation for peace among liberal democracies is that their deep-seated respect for individual rights, coupled with their emphasis on tolerance and peaceful conflict resolution, overwhelms any rationale they might have to initiate a war. Other accounts maintain that specific institutional and normative characteristics of democracy, not liberal rights, prevent war between liberal democracies.

经济相互依存理论源于自由主义对财产所有权和交换权的强调，这种强调必然会促进国家间的投资和贸易。由此产生的经济交往不仅使贸易国更加繁荣，也使它们彼此依赖，共同繁荣。该理论认为，这种经济相互依存会抑制战争，因为战争成本变得难以承受。最终，对繁荣的考量凌驾于政治和安全考量之上。

Economic interdependence theory grows out of the liberal emphasis on the right to own and exchange property, which inexorably leads to promoting investment and trade among states. The ensuing economic intercourse not only leads to greater prosperity for the trading states but also makes them dependent on each other for their prosperity. This economic interdependence, the theory says, militates against war, simply because the costs of fighting become unacceptable. In the end, concerns about prosperity trump political as well as security considerations.

自由制度主义源于自由主义者对遵循既定规则的重视，这些规则规定了个人的权利和义务。根据这一理论，国家自愿遵守这些规则。各国携手建立国际机构，这些机构实际上是一套各国同意遵守的规则，即使它们面临无视这些规则并采取侵略行动的诱惑。在关键时刻，对法治的根深蒂固的承诺将遏制任何国家发动战争的冲动。

Liberal institutionalism stems from the importance liberals place on acting according to well-established rules that stipulate the rights and obligations of individuals. According to the theory, states voluntarily come together and establish international institutions, which are effectively a set of rules that states agree to obey even when they are tempted to disregard them and act aggressively. When push comes to shove, a deep-seated commitment to the rule of law will quash any temptation a state might have to start a war.

这些理论在学术界和政策界都广为人知。自由主义理论家和政策制定者经常将它们结合起来，认为它们彼此互补，从而协同作用以促进和平。例如，康德认为，最大限度实现“永久和平”的最佳途径是促进商业发展，使战争无利可图；推广共和制宪法；并建立一个由共和制国家组成的邦联，这将成为一种国际机构。 1 近年来，两位自由主义学者布鲁斯·鲁塞特和约翰·奥尼尔合著了一本书，书名体现了他们致力于将这些理论联系起来的理念：《三角和平：民主、相互依存与国际组织》。 2在这些学者看来，自由主义的每个分支都能强化其他分支，从而增加和平的可能性。两个分支比一个分支更能带来和平，而三个分支则能带来更大的和平。另一位著名的自由主义理论家迈克尔·道尔则持不同观点：他认为，自由主义要实现和平，这三种理论必须同时发挥作用。3.对多伊尔而言，如果其中任何一种理论不适用或未能达到预期效果，自由主义的和平论证就会崩溃。然而，对拉塞特和奥尼尔来说，必须推翻所有三种理论，才能令人信服地证明自由主义无法带来和平。

These theories are well known in both the academic and policy worlds. Liberal theorists and policymakers often bundle them together, arguing that they complement each other and thus work in tandem to foster peace. Kant, for example, maintained that the best way to maximize the prospects for “perpetual peace” is to foster commerce, which makes war unprofitable; promote republican constitutions; and create a confederation of republican states, which would be an international institution.1 More recently, two liberal scholars, Bruce Russett and John Oneal, wrote a book whose title captures their commitment to tying these theories together: Triangulating Peace: Democracy, Interdependence, and International Organizations.2 For these scholars, each strand of liberalism reinforces the others to increase the chances of peace. Two strands cause more peace than one, and all three strands cause even more. Another prominent liberal theorist, Michael Doyle, has a different take: he maintains that all three theories must work together at once for liberalism to produce peace.3 For Doyle, the liberal case for peace collapses if just one of the theories either does not apply or does not work as expected. For Russett and Oneal, however, all three theories need to be knocked out to make a convincing case that liberalism does not produce peace.

自由派政策制定者也喜欢将这些理论打包在一起。不妨看看比尔·克林顿总统的政府是如何推销其两项最重要的政策——北约扩张和与中国接触的。1995年，副国务卿斯特罗布·塔尔博特认为，将东欧国家同时纳入北约和欧盟是实现该地区稳定的关键。他写道：“北约的扩张将成为欧洲新兴民主国家内部以及它们之间维护法治的力量。”此外，它还将“促进和巩固民主和自由市场价值观”，从而进一步促进和平。与此同时，国务卿马德琳·奥尔布赖特则声称，维持与崛起中的中国和平关系的关键在于与其接触，而不是像……那样试图遏制它。冷战期间，美国遏制了苏联。与中国接触将有助于中国实现民主化，融入美国主导的经济秩序，并使其加入一些世界主要机构。作为国际体系中的“负责任的利益攸关方”，中国将有强烈的动机与其他国家保持和平关系。

Liberal policymakers are also fond of packaging these theories together. Consider how President Bill Clinton’s administration sold two of its most important policies, NATO expansion and engagement with China. Deputy Secretary of State Strobe Talbott argued in 1995 that embedding the countries of Eastern Europe in both NATO and the EU was the key to producing stability in the region. “Enlargement of NATO,” he wrote, “would be a force for the rule of law both within Europe’s new democracies and among them.” Moreover, it would “promote and consolidate democratic and freemarket values,” further contributing to peace.4 At the same time, Secretary of State Madeleine Albright claimed that the key to sustaining peaceful relations with a rising China is to engage with it, not try to contain it the way the United States contained the Soviet Union during the Cold War. Engagement would help democratize China, integrate it into the American-led economic order, and lead to its membership in some of the world’s major institutions. As a “responsible stakeholder” in the international system, China would be highly motivated to maintain peaceful relations with other countries.5

我不同意这些自由主义理论能够提供和平世界的公式。每一种理论都存在致命缺陷，将它们拼凑在一起并不能解决问题。为了阐明我的观点，我将详细考察每一种理论，并提出两个问题。首先，它们的预测与经验记录的吻合程度如何？是否有确凿的证据表明，任何一种自由主义理论确实带来了和平？其次，这些理论背后的因果逻辑是否合理？这些理论是否能够对和平爆发的原因给出令人信服的解释？

I take issue with the claim that these liberal theories offer a formula for a peaceful world. Each theory is fatally flawed, and packaging them together does not remedy the problem. To make my case, I will examine each theory in detail, asking two questions. First, how well do its predictions fit the empirical record? Is there good evidence that any of the liberal theories have actually caused peace? Second, is the causal logic behind the theory sound? Does the theory offer a compelling story about why peace breaks out?

但在详细评估每种理论之前，我想先探讨它们共有的两个特征：范围条件和对和平确定性的主张。目的是表明，即使我们接受这些理论本身的前提，它们也无法提供摆脱现实主义的方案。问题在于，包括这三种理论在内的自由主义论证结构，使得我们无法削弱各国对生存动机的重视，而生存动机恰恰是现实主义的核心。

But before assessing each theory in detail, I want to consider two features that are common to all of them: scope conditions and claims about the certainty of peace. The aim is to show that even if you accept these theories on their own terms, they still do not provide a formula for leaving realism behind. The problem is that the case for liberalism, including all three theories, is structured in a way that makes it impossible to diminish the importance that countries place on the survival motive, which sits at the core of realism.

生存至上

The Primacy of Survival

在现实主义叙事中，国家最关心的是自身生存，这驱使它们不惜牺牲彼此的利益来争夺权力。因此，为了超越现实主义，自由主义理论必须提供一种比生存更为重要的替代性考量。对于民主和平理论而言，尊重个人权利，以及宽容和以和平方式解决冲突的规范，凌驾于对生存的担忧之上。在经济相互依存理论中，对繁荣的深切追求超越了对生存的恐惧；而自由制度主义者则认为，遵守规则是缓解这种恐惧的关键。

In the realist story, states worry about their survival above all else, and this motivates them to pursue power at each other’s expense. To supersede realism, therefore, a liberal theory must offer an alternative consideration that figures more prominently in policymakers’ minds than survival. For democratic peace theory, respect for individual rights, coupled with tolerance and norms of peaceful conflict resolution, dominates concerns about survival. With economic interdependence theory, a deep-seated interest in prosperity overshadows fears about survival; and liberal institutionalists see adherence to rules as the key to alleviating those fears.

然而，所有这些因素都无法凌驾于对生存的担忧之上，也无法将现实主义逻辑排除在外。它们之所以站不住脚，有两个原因，这两个原因都是：这些理论都存在一些自由主义理论共有的局限性。首先，它们的适用范围都有限，只有在必要条件具备的情况下才能发挥作用。例如，国际机构若不存在，便无法促进和平；经济相互依存对于繁荣凌驾于安全之上至关重要。然而，这些条件并非总是存在。世界历史上从未完全由民主国家组成，这极大地限制了民主和平理论的适用范围。对于像多伊尔这样的理论家而言，他们认为所有三种理论都必须发挥作用才能实现和平，那么相关的适用情况就更加有限了。当然，在缺乏国际机构和经济相互依存的情况下，各国会遵循现实政治的法则，正如民主国家在面对非民主国家时所做的那样。

None of these factors, however, can eclipse concerns about survival and take realist logic off the table. They come up short for two reasons, both of which involve limitations that are common to all the liberal theories. First, they all have restricted scope, in that they do not apply unless the necessary conditions are present. International institutions, for example, cannot promote peace if they do not exist, and there must be economic interdependence for prosperity to trump security. But these conditions do not always exist. The world has never been populated with democracies alone, which significantly restricts the scope of democratic peace theory. For theorists like Doyle, who maintain that all three theories must be operative to achieve peace, the range of relevant circumstances is even more restricted. Of course, in the absence of institutions and economic interdependence, states follow the dictates of realpolitik, just as democracies do when confronting non-democracies.

例如，想想看，在冷战时期，所有自由主义理论都与超级大国竞争格格不入。苏联并非民主国家，双方经济往来甚少，鲜有国际机构同时接纳双方成员。再想想大多数自由主义者是如何谈论中国和平崛起的前景的。如今的中国并非民主国家，而且几乎没有成为民主国家的迹象。人们很少听到“民主和平理论能够为亚洲和平奠定基础”这种论调。但我们却经常听到“经济相互依存理论可以解释中国崛起为何会和平”的说法。中国的经济与其竞争对手的经济紧密相连，这种联系不仅意味着中国及其贸易伙伴相互依赖才能持续繁荣，也意味着繁荣依赖于彼此间的和平关系。一场涉及中国的战争无异于经济层面的相互确保摧毁。因此，随着中国的崛起，经济相互依存将维护亚洲的和平。

Consider, for instance, that none of the liberal theories was relevant to the superpower competition during the Cold War. The Soviet Union was not a democracy, the two sides had little economic intercourse, and few international institutions had both sides as members. Or think about how most liberals talk about the prospects of China’s rising peacefully. China is not a democracy today and shows little prospect of becoming one. One rarely hears the argument that democratic peace theory can provide the basis for peace in Asia. But one frequently hears that economic interdependence theory can explain why China’s rise will be peaceful. China’s economy is tied to the economies of its rivals, and this linkage means not only that China and its trading partners depend on each other to keep prospering, but also that prosperity depends on their peaceful relations. A war involving China would be tantamount to mutual assured destruction at the economic level. Hence, economic interdependence will keep the peace in Asia as China rises.

我们可以假设存在这样一种世界：其中一种或多种自由主义理论普遍适用，而另一种世界则完全不适用。但这并非我们所处的世界。在我们的世界里，这些理论可能适用于某些情况，但无法涵盖其他情况。例如，设想一下，如果美国从欧洲撤军，北约解散，民主和平理论将如何适用。届时，欧洲大陆将只剩下三个主要强国：法国、德国和俄罗斯。根据该理论，法国和德国不会互相开战，因为它们都是自由民主国家，因此不会相互竞争权力。但它们与非民主的俄罗斯的关系则截然不同：它们会遵循现实主义逻辑，强调生存动机。在这种情况下，这三个国家最终都会竭力在全球权力平衡中占据最大地位。

It is possible to hypothesize a world in which one or more of the liberal theories apply universally, and one where none of them applies at all. But those are not our world. In our world, those theories are likely to cover certain situations but not others. Consider, for example, how democratic peace theory would apply to a scenario in which the United States removes its military forces from Europe and NATO disappears. There would then be three major powers on the Continent: France, Germany, and Russia. According to the theory, France and Germany would not fight each other, because they are both liberal democracies and thus would not compete with each other for power. But they would have a fundamentally different relationship with non-democratic Russia: they would be guided by realist logic, with its emphasis on the survival motive. In that situation, all three countries would end up trying to maximize their positions in the global balance of power.

假设俄罗斯成为民主国家。那么，民主和平理论将适用于三大强国之间的关系。然而，民主的俄罗斯不得不提防南部边境崛起的非民主国家——中国，因此在与中国交往时，必须遵循权力平衡的逻辑。法国和德国虽然与中国不接壤，但如果中国成为超级大国，它们仍然需要担忧潜在的威胁。只要体系中存在一个强大的非民主国家，任何民主国家都无法逃脱现实主义逻辑的束缚。正如亚历山大·温特所指出的，“一个掠夺者可以战胜一百个和平主义者，因为无政府状态无法提供任何保障。这一论点之所以有力，部分原因在于它的薄弱之处：它并没有做出所有国家本质上都追求权力的强假设……而是假设只有一个国家追求权力，而其他国家不得不效仿，因为无政府状态允许这个国家剥削它们。” ⁶即使体系中的民主国家之间仍然会保持和平，至少根据这一理论，这种逻辑仍然适用。

Let us assume that Russia becomes a democracy. Democratic peace theory would then apply to relations among all three major powers. Yet democratic Russia would have to fear a rising China, which is not a democracy, on its southern border, and so would have to act according to balance-of-power logic in its dealings with China. France and Germany do not share a border with China, but they would still have to worry about a possible threat if China became a superpower. As long as there is one powerful non-democracy in the system, no democracy can escape from acting according to realist logic. As Alexander Wendt notes, “One predator will best a hundred pacifists because anarchy provides no guarantees. This argument is powerful in part because it is so weak: rather than making the strong assumption that all states are inherently power-seeking . . . it assumes that just one is power-seeking and that the others have to follow suit because anarchy permits the one to exploit them.”6 This logic applies even though the democracies in the system would still behave peacefully toward each other, at least according to the theory.

自由主义三大理论的第二个，也是更为根本的问题，在于它们对和平可能性的论述。任何一种理论要想凌驾于现实主义之上，其支持者都必须论证该理论能确保战争不会发生。仅仅声称其理论能够促进国家间合作或大大降低战争的可能性是不够的。或许有人会觉得我要求过高。但只要体系中任何两个国家之间存在战争的可能性，每个国家都别无选择，只能优先考虑自身生存，并按照现实主义原则行事。即便战争的可能性被认为只有1%或2%，各国也必须按照权力平衡的逻辑思考和行动，因为战败的严重后果迫使它们担忧自身的生存。这种情况类似于核威慑。任何拥有核武器的国家使用那些威力巨大的武器的可能性都存在。核武器数量虽少，但后果不堪设想。正因如此，核武器才成为终极威慑力量。

A second and even more fundamental problem inherent in the three liberal theories concerns what they say about the likelihood of peace. For any of these theories to dominate realism, its proponents have to argue that it makes war certain not to occur. It is not enough for them to argue that their theories lead to enhanced interstate cooperation or make war much less likely. One might think I am setting the bar too high. But as long as there is some chance of war between any two states in the system, every state has little choice but to privilege survival and act in accordance with realist principles. Even if the likelihood of war is judged to be only 1 or 2 percent, states must think and act according to balance-of-power logic because the dire consequences of losing a major war require them to worry about their survival. This situation resembles nuclear deterrence. The likelihood that any nuclear-armed state would use those incredibly destructive weapons is low, but the consequences would be horrendous. This is what makes nuclear weapons the ultimate deterrent.

毫无疑问，合作可以缓解冲突。然而，合作也可能增加战争的可能性，因为两国可以合作对第三国发动战争，例如1939年德国和苏联联手对抗波兰，或者1973年埃及和叙利亚联手对抗以色列。此外，强国有时也会合作掠夺弱小地区的资源，例如第一次世界大战期间，英国和法国通过1916年的《赛克斯-皮科协定》瓜分了中东的大部分地区。合作与和平固然相关，但二者并非同一概念。自由主义理论家需要解释的并非他们的理论为何能促进合作，而是为何能消除战争的可能性。

There is no question that cooperation can ameliorate conflict. Yet it can also increase the likelihood of war, since two states can cooperate to launch a war against a third country, as the Germans and Soviets did against Poland in 1939 or as Egypt and Syria did against Israel in 1973. Furthermore, powerful states sometimes cooperate to exploit the resources of weaker regions, as Britain and France did during World War I, when they arranged via the Sykes-Picot agreement of 1916 to divide up much of the Middle East between themselves. Cooperation and peace are certainly related, but they are not the same thing. What liberal theorists must explain is not why their theories produce more cooperation but why they eliminate the possibility of war.

几乎没有自由主义理论家认为，当他们的理论成立时，战争就完全不可能发生。他们提出大胆的论断，但并未排除战争的可能性。他们有时强调国家间合作的加强，或者认为战争发生的可能性极低。提出最大胆论断的民主和平理论家强调，民主国家之间“很少”或“极少”发生战争。正如迈克尔·多伊尔所言：“没有人应该认为此类战争不可能发生；但初步证据似乎表明，自由主义国家之间存在着一种显著的反对战争的倾向。”换句话说，和平并非理所当然。但即便取得了实质性的和平进展，也远远不够。只要战争仍然是一个不容忽视的可能性，各国就别无选择，只能将生存置于一切其他考量之上，包括权利、繁荣和规则。

Hardly any liberal theorists argue that war is taken off the table when their theories are operative. They make bold claims but do not rule out war as a possibility. They sometimes emphasize enhanced cooperation among states or say that war becomes highly unlikely. Democratic peace theorists, who make the boldest claims, stress that democracies “seldom” or “rarely fight each other.”7 As Michael Doyle puts it, “No one should argue that such wars are impossible; but preliminary evidence does appear to indicate that there exists a significant predisposition against warfare between liberal states.”8 Peace, in other words, is not guaranteed. But moving the needle toward peace, even substantially, is not enough. As long as war remains a serious possibility, states have little choice but to put survival above all other considerations, including rights, prosperity, and rules.

到目前为止，我一直都接受自由主义理论本身的观点，并想当然地认为它们像宣传的那样有效。现在是时候检验一下这个假设了。

So far I have taken the liberal theories on their own terms and assumed they work as advertised. It is time to examine that assumption.

民主和平理论

Democratic Peace Theory

“民主和平理论”一词暗示它阐述的是民主而非自由主义如何带来和平。但这个名称并不准确，因为支撑民主和平理论的论点既强调民主也强调自由主义。这一理论体系中的一些学者甚至称之为“自由和平”。更准确的说法应该是“自由民主和平”。和平理论。此外，自由主义国家几乎都是民主国家，这主要是因为自由和不可剥夺的权利的核心地位清楚地表明，所有公民都有权决定谁来统治他们。正如我在引言中强调的，这就是我关注自由民主政体而非仅仅是自由主义国家的原因。因此，我将考察民主和平理论背后基于民主和基于自由主义的逻辑。

The words democratic peace theory imply that it offers a story about how democracy, not liberalism, brings peace. But the title is a misnomer, because the arguments underpinning democratic peace theory emphasize liberalism as well as democracy. A number of scholars in this tradition even refer to “liberal peace.” It would be more accurate to call it liberal-democratic peace theory. Moreover, liberal states are almost always democratic as well, mainly because the centrality of freedom and inalienable rights clearly implies that all citizens have the right to determine who governs them. As I emphasized in the introduction, this is why I focus on liberal democracies, not simply liberal states. Hence, I will examine both the democracy-based and liberalism-based logics behind democratic peace theory.

冷战结束后的二十年间，民主和平理论风靡一时。迈克尔·道尔在1983年发表的两篇开创性文章中将其引入学术界和政策界。9 1989年超级大国对抗结束后，人们普遍认为自由民主将稳步席卷全球，为世界带来和平。当然，这种观点正是福山《历史的终结？》一书的核心论点。然而，时间并未对福山的论点宽容。威权主义已成为一种可行的替代方案，而且几乎没有迹象表明自由民主会在短期内征服全球。自由之家指出，2006年至2016年间，全球民主国家的份额实际上有所下降，这自然缩小了该理论的适用范围。10

Democratic peace theory was remarkably popular in the two decades after the Cold War ended. Michael Doyle introduced it to the academic and policy worlds in a pair of seminal articles published in 1983.9 When the superpower rivalry ended in 1989, it was widely believed that liberal democracy would steadily sweep across the globe, spreading peace everywhere. This perspective, of course, is the central theme in Fukuyama’s “The End of History?” But time has not been kind to Fukuyama’s argument. Authoritarianism has become a viable alternative, and there are few signs that liberal democracy will conquer the globe anytime soon. Freedom House maintains that the world’s share of democracies actually declined between 2006 and 2016, which naturally reduces the scope of the theory.10

即便自由民主正在蓬勃发展，也无法提升和平前景，因为这一理论存在严重缺陷。不妨看看它的核心论断。一些支持者认为，历史上从未发生过两个民主国家之间的战争。但这种说法是错误的：近代史上至少有四起民主国家之间交战的案例。与民主和平理论家的说法相反，德国在一战（1914-1918）期间是一个自由民主国家，它与另外四个自由民主国家——英国、法国、意大利和美国——交战。 11在布尔战争（1899-1902）中，英国与南非共和国和奥兰治自由邦交战，而这两个国家都是民主国家。 12美西战争（1898）和1999年印巴卡吉尔战争也是民主国家之间交战的案例。 13

Even if liberal democracy were on the march, however, it would not enhance the prospects for peace, because the theory is seriously flawed. Consider its central finding. Some of its proponents argue that there has never been a war between two democracies. But this is wrong: there are at least four cases in the modern era where democracies waged war against each other. Contrary to what democratic peace theorists say, Germany was a liberal democracy during World War I (1914–18), and it fought against four other liberal democracies: Britain, France, Italy, and the United States.11 In the Boer War (1899–1902) Britain fought against the South African Republic and the Orange Free State, both of which were democracies.12 The Spanish-American War (1898) and the 1999 Kargil War between India and Pakistan are also cases of democracies fighting each other.13

其他一些案例也接近于民主国家之间的战争。14美国内战通常不被计入，因为它被认为是内战而非国家间战争。然而，有人可能会认为，这种区分在这里意义不大。南方邦联成立于1861年2月4日，但战争直到4月才开始，而到那时，南方邦联实际上已经成为一个主权国家。此外，值得注意的是……民主国家之间曾发生过许多军事冲突，其中一些甚至爆发了战斗并造成人员伤亡，但最终并未演变成真正的战争。 15此外，也有许多民主国家，特别是美国，推翻其他国家民选领导人的案例，这种行为似乎与民主国家之间和平相处的说法相悖。

Other cases come close to qualifying as wars between democracies.14 The American Civil War is usually not counted because it is considered a civil war rather than an interstate war. One might argue, however, that the distinction is not meaningful here. The Confederacy was established on February 4, 1861, but the war did not begin until April, by which time the Confederacy was effectively a sovereign state. It is also worth noting that there have been a host of militarized disputes between democracies, including some cases where fighting broke out and people died, but that fell short of actual war.15 There are also many cases of democracies, especially the United States, overthrowing democratically elected leaders in other countries, a behavior that seems at odds with the claim that democracies behave peacefully toward one another.

但让我们回到我举的四个民主国家之间实际发生的战争案例。有人或许会承认我的观点正确，但仍然认为如此少的战争并不会实质性地挑战这一理论。然而，这种结论是错误的，民主和平理论家詹姆斯·L·雷对此有明确的阐述：“由于国家间的战争在统计上如此罕见……即使民主国家之间发生少数几场战争，也会完全抹杀民主国家之间（一方面）与国家之间（另一方面）历史战争发生率差异的统计意义，进而可以说抹杀其实质性意义。” ¹⁶换句话说，这四场民主国家之间的战争削弱了民主和平理论家的核心论点。

But let us get back to my four cases of actual wars between democracies. One might concede that I am right yet still argue that this tiny number of wars does not substantially challenge the theory. This conclusion would be wrong, however, for reasons clearly laid out by the democratic peace theorist James L. Ray: “Since wars between states are so rare statistically . . . the existence of even a few wars between democratic states would wipe out entirely the statistical and therefore arguably the substantive significance of the difference in the historical rates of warfare between pairs of democratic states, on the one hand, and pairs of states in general, on the other.”16 Those four wars between democracies, in other words, undermine the central claim of democratic peace theorists.

民主和平理论的第二个主要问题是，它无法解释为什么自由民主国家之间不应该互相争斗。民主和平理论家们提出了各种各样的解释，有些侧重于民主制度和规范，有些则强调自由主义规范。但这些解释都缺乏说服力。

The second major problem with democratic peace theory is that it offers no good explanation for why liberal democracies should not fight each other. Democratic peace theorists have put forward various explanations, some of which focus on democratic institutions and norms and others that emphasize liberal norms. But none are compelling.

民主制度与和平

Democratic Institutions and Peace

自由民主国家之间为何不发生战争，有三种制度性解释。第一种解释强调公众天性爱好和平，如果被问及是否发动战争，他们几乎肯定会说不。康德在《论永久和平》中阐述了这一论点：“如果宣战需要公民的同意……那么，他们自然会非常谨慎地开始这场糟糕的游戏，将战争的所有灾难都揽在自己身上。” 17这种论点在冷战时期的新保守主义者中很流行，他们认为自由民主国家倾向于安抚专制国家，因为民主国家的人民不仅温和，而且有影响力，因为他们拥有投票权。 18

There are three institutional explanations for why liberal democracies do not go to war with each other. The first emphasizes that publics are pacific by nature, and if asked whether to initiate a war they will almost certainly say no. Kant articulates this argument in Perpetual Peace: “If the consent of the citizens is required in order to decide that war should be declared . . . nothing is more natural than that they would be very cautious in commencing such a poor game, decreeing for themselves all the calamities of war.”17 This argument was popular during the Cold War among neoconservatives, who believed that liberal democracies were inclined to appease authoritarian states because democratic peoples were not only soft but influential, because they could vote.18

这种论证的致命缺陷在于它过于武断。如果自由民主国家的公民真的如此厌恶战争，他们不仅不愿与民主国家开战，也不愿与非民主国家开战。他们甚至根本不想打任何战争。然而，历史记录清楚地表明，事实并非如此。例如，自冷战结束以来，美国已经发动了七场战争，而且这七场战争都是由美国挑起的。在此期间，美国平均每三年就有两年处于战争状态。毫不夸张地说，美国对战争上瘾。此外，另一个自由民主国家英国在这些战争中始终与美国站在一起。这有助于解释为什么民主和平理论家并不认为民主国家普遍比非民主国家更爱好和平。

The fatal flaw in this argument is that it proves too much. If the citizens of a liberal democracy were so averse to war, they would be disinclined to fight against non-democracies as well as democracies. They would not want to fight any wars at all. It is clear from the historical record, however, that this is not the case. The United States, for instance, has fought seven wars since the Cold War ended, and it initiated all seven. During that period it has been at war for two out of every three years. It is no exaggeration to say that the United States is addicted to war. Moreover, Britain, another liberal democracy, has been at America’s side throughout those wars. This helps explain why democratic peace theorists do not argue that democracies are generally more peaceful than non-democracies.

民主国家的人民有时倾向于发动战争，原因有以下几点。首先，战争有时有合理的战略理由，大多数公民都能理解。此外，民主国家的领导人往往善于说服那些不愿公开表态的民众，让他们相信战争是必要的，即便并非如此。 19有时甚至无需过多劝说，因为民众的民族主义热情如此高涨，以至于无论战争是否必要，他们都会推动领导人发动战争。 20 最后，认为国家发动战争必然会给民众带来巨大损失是错误的。富裕国家通常拥有雄厚的军事实力，这意味着实际服役的人口比例很低。此外，自由民主国家往往善于找到减少伤亡的方法——例如，使用无人机攻击敌方。至于财政成本，一个国家有很多方法可以支付战争费用，而不会给民众造成沉重的负担。 21

Several factors explain why democratic peoples sometimes favor starting wars. For one, there are sometimes good strategic reasons for war and most citizens will recognize them. Furthermore, democratic leaders are often adept at convincing reticent publics that war is necessary, even when it is not.19 Sometimes not much convincing is necessary, because the people’s nationalist fervor is so great that, if anything, they are pushing their leaders to go to war, whether necessary or not.20 Finally, it is wrong to assume that the public axiomatically pays a big price when its country goes to war. Wealthy countries often have a highly capitalized military, which means that only a small slice of the population actually serves. Moreover, liberal democracies are often adept at finding ways to minimize their casualties—for example, by using drones against an adversary. As for the financial costs, a state has many ways to pay for a war without seriously burdening its public.21

第二个制度性解释是，政府领导人更难动员民主国家发动战争。这种繁琐的决策过程部分源于需要获得公众许可，而鉴于公众天生不愿卷入战争和冒生命危险，获得公众许可的过程十分耗时。民主制度中固有的制度性障碍，例如权力制衡，也减缓了这一进程。这些问题不仅使得发动战争变得困难，也使得制定和执行明智的外交政策变得困难。

The second institutional explanation is that it is more difficult for government leaders to mobilize a democracy to start a war. This cumbersome decision making is partly a function of the need to get public permission, which is time-consuming given the public’s natural reluctance to fight wars and risk death. The institutional obstacles built into democracies, like checks and balances, slow down the process. These problems make it difficult not only to start a war but also to formulate and execute a smart foreign policy.

如果这些说法属实，民主国家就不会对非民主国家发动战争。但事实并非如此。或许存在这样的情况：民主制度的低效性阻碍了执政精英发动战争，尽管正如我上文所述，这种情况并不常见。此外，那些可能阻碍领导人发动战争的制度性障碍通常作用不大，因为发动战争的决定往往是在严重的危机时期做出的，此时行政部门会接管权力，权力制衡以及个人权利都会服从于国家安全考量。在极端紧急情况下，自由民主国家完全有能力迅速果断地做出反应，并在必要时发动战争。

If these claims were true, again, democracies would not initiate wars against non-democracies. But they do. There may be instances where democratic inefficiencies prevent governing elites from taking their country to war, although as I noted above, that will happen infrequently. Moreover, the institutional impediments that might thwart leaders bent on starting a war usually count for little, because the decision to start a war is often made during a serious crisis, in which the executive takes charge and checks and balances, as well as individual rights, are subordinated to national security concerns. In an extreme emergency, liberal democracies are fully capable of reacting swiftly and decisively, and initiating a war if necessary.

最后，一些人认为“公众成本”是解释民主和平的关键。22这一观点基于这样一种信念：民选领导人尤其擅长在危机中表明决心，因为他们可以公开承诺在特定情况下采取行动，并且有义务履行这些承诺。换句话说，他们可以约束自己。如果他们违背承诺，公众会通过投票将他们赶下台。这种观点认为，一旦领导人划清界限，公众就会对其施加压力。因此，两个民主国家可以互相明确彼此究竟会在哪些方面发生冲突，从而避免误判并达成和解。

Finally, some argue that “audience costs” are the key to explaining the democratic peace.22 This claim rests on the belief that democratically elected leaders are especially good at signaling their resolve in crises because they can make public commitments to act in particular circumstances, which they are then obligated to follow through on. In other words, they can tie their own hands. If they renege on their commitments, the public will punish them by voting them out of office. Once a leader draws a red line, the argument goes, his audience will hold his feet to the fire. Two democracies can thus make it clear to each other what exactly they would fight over, which allows them to avoid miscalculation and negotiate a settlement.

“受众成本”理论乍听之下很有吸引力，但实证研究表明其解释力有限。23几乎没有证据表明“受众成本”理论在实际危机中发挥了预期的作用。此外，该理论的内在逻辑也存在诸多疑问。例如，领导人通常不愿划定红线，而是倾向于模糊威胁，以最大程度地扩大谈判空间。在这种情况下，“受众成本”逻辑根本不起作用。即便领导人划定了红线却未能履行，如果危机最终以对公众有利的方式结束，公众也不太可能因此惩罚她。此外，我们绝不能低估政治领导人粉饰太平的能力，他们往往能掩盖自己的失信行为。即使领导人发出信号，也无法保证对方能够正确解读。

The audience-costs story is intuitively attractive, but empirical studies have shown that it has little explanatory power.23 There is hardly any evidence that audience costs have worked as advertised in actual crises. Moreover, there are many reasons to question the theory’s underlying logic. For example, leaders are usually wary about drawing red lines, preferring instead to keep their threats vague so as to maximize their bargaining space. In such cases, audience-costs logic does not even come into play. But even if a leader draws a red line and then fails to follow through, the public is unlikely to punish her if she ends the crisis on favorable terms. Moreover, one should never underestimate political leaders’ ability to spin a story so that it appears they did not renege on a commitment when they actually did. And even if a leader gives a signal, there is no guarantee the other side will read it correctly.

总之，涉及民主制度的任何机制都无法令人满意地解释为什么民主国家很少与西方国家交战。彼此之间。24一些著名的民主和平理论家认识到这些制度性解释的局限性，转而依赖于与民主和自由主义相关的规范性论证。25

In sum, none of the mechanisms involving democratic institutions provides a satisfactory explanation for why democracies rarely fight wars with each other.24 Some prominent democratic peace theorists recognize the limits of these institutional explanations and instead rely on normative arguments linked to democracy and liberalism.25

规范逻辑

The Normative Logics

民主的规范逻辑与自由主义的规范逻辑存在诸多重叠之处。两者都强调四个关键概念：和平解决冲突、尊重他人、宽容和信任。然而，民主和自由主义对这些概念的重视程度不同，且各自侧重的方面也各有侧重。

There is substantial overlap between the normative logic that flows from democracy and the one that flows from liberalism. Both emphasize four key concepts: peaceful conflict resolution, respect for others, tolerance, and trust. Democracy and liberalism, however, rivet on those concepts for different reasons, and each emphasizes some more than others.

民主的核心特征是选举过程，公民正是通过选举来解决分歧，并决定哪种政治秩序愿景将占据主导地位。这种运作方式有助于促进和平解决冲突。鲁塞特写道：“自由民主理论的基本准则是，争端可以通过民主的政治程序在不诉诸武力的情况下得到解决。” 26此外，他认为，“民主国家在与世界政治中的其他国家行为体交往时，会将规范的政治竞争、政治冲突的妥协解决方案以及权力和平交接等准则外化。” 最重要的是，“当两个民主国家发生利益冲突时，它们能够在互动中运用民主规范。” 27

The central feature of democracy is the electoral process, which is how citizens settle their differences and determine whose vision of the political order will prevail. This way of doing business has the effect of promoting peaceful conflict resolution. “The basic norm of liberal democratic theory,” Russett writes, is “that disputes can be resolved without force through democratic political processes.”26 Furthermore, he maintains that “the norms of regulated political competition, compromise solutions to political conflicts, and peaceful transfer of power are externalized by democracies in their dealing with other national actors in world politics.” Most importantly, “when two democracies come into a conflict of interest, they are able to apply democratic norms in their interaction.”27

在一个即使是激烈的争端也能通常以和平方式解决的世界里，相关各方之间很可能存在着相当程度的信任，因为他们不必担心对手会诉诸暴力。在重大的政治斗争中，对立双方也应该抱有基本的尊重。每个人都愿意接受选举结果，这无疑意味着他们愿意容忍对手获胜的可能性。如果他们要与对手寻求妥协方案，双方都必须对彼此表示尊重；否则，达成共识将难上加难。因此，除了致力于通过选举解决分歧之外，生活在民主国家的人们往往也更倾向于信任、宽容和尊重他人。这种观点认为，同样的信念也适用于民主国家之间的关系。

In a world where even bitter disputes are routinely settled peacefully, there is likely to be significant trust among the relevant actors, since they do not have to worry that their opponents may employ violence against them. There should also be a modicum of respect for those on the opposing side in big political fights. The fact that everyone is willing to accept election results surely means they are willing to tolerate the possibility their rivals might win. And if they are going to pursue compromise solutions with their opponents, both sides have to show some respect toward the other; otherwise it would be difficult to find agreement. Thus, in addition to being wedded to settling their differences via elections, individuals living in a democracy tend to be trustful, tolerant, and respectful of others. These same beliefs, the argument goes, carry over to relations between democracies.

与强调选举重要性的民主制度不同，自由主义讲述的是个人权利的故事。当然，本书的读者对此早已耳熟能详。政治自由主义者认为，权利和宽容相辅相成，鼓励人们彼此尊重，即便存在根本分歧，也能以和平方式解决分歧。在自由主义的世界里，暴力几乎没有立足之地。

Unlike democracy, which emphasizes the importance of elections, liberalism tells a story of individual rights. Of course, this is by now familiar to readers of this book. Political liberals maintain that rights and tolerance work together to encourage people to respect each other, even when they have fundamental disagreements, and to settle their differences peacefully. There is hardly any place for violence in a liberal world.

由于个人权利具有普遍性，自由主义逻辑不仅适用于自由民主国家内部的日常生活，也适用于它们之间的互动。正如迈克尔·道尔所言：“自由国际理论的基本假设是，国家有权免受外国干涉。既然道德自主的公民享有自由权，那么代表他们的国家也有权行使政治独立。相互尊重这些权利便成为国际自由主义理论的基石。” 28这些不可剥夺的权利包括生命权，这使得自由主义国家不会相互发动战争，因为这会剥夺其他自由主义国家公民的生命。

Because individual rights are universal, liberal logic applies not just to daily life inside liberal democracies but to interactions between them as well. To quote Michael Doyle, “The basic postulate of liberal international theory holds that states have the right to be free from foreign intervention. Since morally autonomous citizens hold rights to liberty, the states that represent them have the right to exercise political independence. Mutual respect for these rights then becomes the touchstone of international liberal theory.”28 Those inalienable rights include the right to life, which precludes liberal countries from initiating wars against each other since they would be taking the lives of fellow liberals.

当自由国家彼此交往时，宽容也超越了国界。自由国家应当彼此信任和尊重，绝不以战争来解决分歧。“这些相互尊重的约定，”多伊尔写道，“为自由民主国家间卓有成效的合作关系奠定了基础。” 29 换言之，自由主义规范解释了民主和平的由来。约翰·欧文总结了这一基本论点：“自由主义者认为，世界各地的人们本质上是相同的，追求自我保护和物质福祉才是最佳选择。自由是实现这些目标的必要条件，而和平又是自由的必要条件；胁迫和暴力只会适得其反。因此，所有人都对和平有着共同的利益，战争也应当仅仅是实现和平的工具。” 30

Tolerance, too, extends beyond borders when liberal states are dealing with each other. Liberal countries should trust and respect each other and never go to war to settle their differences. “These conventions of mutual respect,” Doyle writes, “have formed a cooperative foundation for relations among liberal democracies of a remarkably effective kind.”29 Liberal norms, in other words, explain the democratic peace. John Owen sums up the basic argument: “Liberals believe that individuals everywhere are fundamentally the same, and are best off pursuing self-preservation and material well-being. Freedom is required for these pursuits, and peace is required for freedom; coercion and violence are counter-productive. Thus all individuals share an interest in peace, and should want war only as an instrument to bring about peace.”30

显而易见，民主和自由主义各自独立却又相辅相成，它们共同解释了为何自由民主国家之间不会兵戎相见，即便它们之间存在引发重大危机的深刻分歧。根据民主和平理论，战争之所以不会爆发，是因为这些逻辑能够独立运作或协同作用，从而促进一套强大的规范体系，这些规范有利于和平解决冲突、尊重他人、宽容和信任。

It should be clear that democracy and liberalism provide separate but complementary logics that explain why liberal democracies do not fight each other, even when they have a profound disagreement that provokes a major crisis. Wars do not break out, according to democratic peace theory, because these logics work either separately or in tandem to promote a formidable set of norms that favor peaceful conflict resolution, respect for the other, tolerance, and trust.

为什么规范无效

Why Norms Are Ineffectual

认为自由民主规范是和平的强大力量这一论断存在五个问题。正如我在第五章中所论述的，如果没有更高权威来维护秩序，自由主义就无法发挥其宣称的作用。原因很简单：自由主义承认个人有时会在基本原则上存在深刻分歧，也认识到尊重权利和宽容并不能保证一方甚至双方不会诉诸暴力。冲突无法保证一定能够和平解决。正因如此，几乎所有自由主义者都承认国家存在的必要性——包括约翰·罗尔斯，他对宽容的强大力量尤为乐观。

There are five problems with the claim that liberal democratic norms are a powerful force for peace. As I argued in chapter 5, without a higher authority to maintain order, liberalism cannot work as advertised. The reason is simple: liberalism accepts that individuals will sometimes have profound differences over first principles and also recognizes that respect for rights and tolerance cannot guarantee that one side, or even both sides, will not turn to violence. There is no assurance that conflicts will be resolved peacefully. This is why virtually every liberal recognizes the need for a state—including John Rawls, who is especially optimistic about the hexing power of tolerance.

民主也面临着同样的问题。它也建立在公民有时会在核心政治和社会问题上存在激烈分歧的假设之上。民主国家的公民被广泛教育要通过投票解决争端，但这种教育有其局限性，民主国家总是会维持强大的警察力量来维护秩序。仅靠和平解决冲突的准则并不能确保民主国家的和平；与自由主义一样，它也需要一个强大的国家来应对那些认为有必要以暴力来捍卫自身观点的人。

Democracy faces the same problem. It too is predicated on the assumption that citizens will sometimes have fierce differences about core political and social issues. Citizens in a democracy are heavily socialized to settle their disputes at the ballot box, but that socialization has its limits, and democracies always maintain formidable police forces to keep order. The norm of peaceful conflict resolution alone cannot ensure peace in a democracy; like liberalism, it requires a strong state to deal with people who feel compelled to back up their views with violence.

由于不存在世界国家，国际体系中也就不存在一个凌驾于其他国家之上的权威机构，供各国在受到威胁时寻求帮助。这一简单的现实，再加上自由民主国家之间并非总是宽容、尊重与和平相处，意味着即使在与其他自由民主国家交往时，它们也必须担忧自身的生存。一旦这种逻辑发挥作用，它们就别无选择，只能彼此进行权力平衡的政治博弈。

Since there is no world state, there is no higher authority in the international system to which countries can turn when another state threatens them. That simple fact of life, coupled with the fact that liberal democracies are not always tolerant, respectful, and peaceful toward each other, means they must worry about their survival even when dealing with other liberal democracies. Once this logic is at play, they have no choice but to engage in balance-of-power politics with each other.

民族主义是自由民主规范论断面临的另一个难题。它是一种极具影响力的意识形态，导致各国强调彼此间的差异。每个民族国家都倾向于认为自己优于其他国家，有时甚至彼此之间存在真正的仇恨。这种敌意——我称之为极端民族主义——之所以存在，是因为民族国家有时在基本原则上存在根本分歧，有时还会陷入激烈的安全竞争，最终导致战争。自由民主国家也难以免受民族主义的影响，而民族主义可能会破坏自由民主。宽容和互信缺失，甚至导致他们以暴力手段解决分歧。此外，世界范围内对自由主义不可剥夺权利原则的尊重也并不根深蒂固，而自由主义者往往夸大了这一原则的重要性。尤其是在面对民族主义时，自由主义的普世性远不如自由主义者所认为的那样具有影响力。

Nationalism is another problem for claims about liberal democratic norms. It is an enormously influential ideology that causes countries to emphasize the differences among them. Each nation-state tends to think it is superior to the others, and sometimes there is genuine hatred between them. That animosity—what I call hypernationalism—exists because nation-states sometimes differ profoundly on first principles, and sometimes engage in harsh security competition that leads to war. Liberal democracies are hardly immune from nationalism, which can undermine tolerance and mutual trust, and even cause them to resolve their disagreements violently. Nor is there a deep-seated worldwide respect for the liberal principle of inalienable rights, whose importance liberals often exaggerate. Especially when it confronts nationalism, liberalism’s universalist dimension holds less sway than liberals assume.

此外，大量经验证据反驳了自由民主规范是和平的强大力量这一说法。例如，美国推翻民选政府的“辉煌历史”，尤其是在冷战时期。较为著名的案例包括1953年的伊朗、1954年的危地马拉、1964年的巴西和1973年的智利。 31 2006年1月巴勒斯坦大选后，哈马斯击败了美国支持的法塔赫，美国和以色列（另一个民主国家）随即采取行动，破坏新政府的稳定并边缘化哈马斯。尽管法塔赫输掉了选举，他们仍然将其视为巴勒斯坦人民的合法代表。32正如我们所见，美国在2013年推翻埃及民选的穆斯林兄弟会政权的过程中也扮演了重要角色。塞巴斯蒂安·罗萨托指出：“美国干预发展中国家的记录表明，民主的信任和尊重往往被置于安全和经济利益之下。” 33

Furthermore, there is considerable empirical evidence to contradict the claim that liberal democratic norms are a potent force for peace. The United States, for example, has a rich history of toppling democratically elected governments, especially during the Cold War. The more prominent cases include Iran in 1953, Guatemala in 1954, Brazil in 1964, and Chile in 1973.31 Following the January 2006 Palestinian elections, in which Hamas defeated the U.S.-supported Fatah, the United States and Israel (another democracy) moved to destabilize the new government and marginalize Hamas. They treated Fatah as the legitimate representative of the Palestinian people, even though it had lost the election.32 The United States, as we saw, also played a role in toppling the democratically elected Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt in 2013. “The record of American interventions in the developing world,” Sebastian Rosato notes, “suggests that democratic trust and respect has often been subordinated to security and economic interests.”33

或许对自由民主规范的论证最具说服力的证据，来自克里斯托弗·莱恩对四个案例的细致考察。在这些案例中，两个自由民主国家都曾濒临战争边缘，但最终一方选择退让，结束了危机。他仔细分析了1861年特伦特号事件、1895-96年委内瑞拉危机、1898年英法法绍达危机以及1923年法德鲁尔危机期间，英国和美国的决策过程，并令人信服地论证了自由规范与这些危机的解决几乎无关。双方都存在着强烈的民族主义情绪，而所有这四起危机的最终结果，主要都取决于涉及权力平衡的战略考量。 34

Perhaps the most damning evidence against the case for liberal democratic norms is found in Christopher Layne’s careful examination of four cases where a pair of liberal democracies marched to the brink of war, but one side pulled back and ended the crisis. He carefully examines the decision-making process in both Britain and the United States during the 1861 Trent Affair and the Venezuelan Crisis of 1895–96, the Fashoda Crisis between Britain and France in 1898, and the 1923 Ruhr Crisis involving France and Germany, and convincingly argues that liberal norms had little to do with settling these crises. There was substantial nationalist fervor on each side, and all four outcomes were primarily determined by strategic calculations involving the balance of power.34

最后，尽管是间接的，还有一个理由让人怀疑自由主义规范在国际政治中是否具有多大影响力，那就是几乎没有证据表明自由民主国家在战争中采取了特别高尚的方式。鉴于自由主义强调不可剥夺的权利，人们可能会期望自由民主国家在战争中采取更合乎道德的方式。民主国家应尽力避免杀害平民，或者至少要比专制国家做得更好。这是正义战争理论的核心原则之一，该理论本质上是一种以个人权利为核心的自由主义理论。例如，迈克尔·多伊尔（Michael Doyle）就敦促冲突各方“严格遵守战争法”。

A final, albeit indirect, reason to doubt that liberal norms carry much weight in international politics is that there is little evidence that liberal democracies fight wars in especially virtuous ways. Given the emphasis liberalism places on inalienable rights, one would expect liberal democracies to go to some lengths to avoid killing civilians, or at least do better than authoritarian states. This is one of the central tenets of just war theory, a quintessentially liberal theory that has individual rights at its core.35 Michael Doyle, for instance, urges that all sides in a conflict maintain “a scrupulous respect for the laws of war.”36

但亚历山大·唐斯在其开创性的战争平民受害研究中发现，“民主国家比非民主国家更有可能以平民为攻击目标。” 37约翰·蒂尔曼在其对美国战争方式的详细分析中指出，美国已造成数百万平民死亡，其中许多是蓄意谋杀。38尽管杰弗里·华莱士的研究表明，专制国家比民主国家更有可能虐待战俘，但他同时也提供了大量证据，证明民主国家也会虐待战俘。 39 9·11事件后美国广泛使用酷刑就是一个例证。唐斯和华莱士都指出，当国家在战争中陷入绝境时，它们会迅速遗忘敌人的尊严，并将人权置于有效作战之上。自由民主国家也不例外。

But when Alexander Downes did his groundbreaking study of civilian victimization in war, he found that “democracies are somewhat more likely than nondemocracies to target civilians.”37 John Tirman shows in his detailed analysis of how the United States fights its wars that it has killed millions of civilians, many on purpose.38 And although Geoffrey Wallace shows autocracies are more likely than democracies to abuse prisoners of war, he provides plenty of evidence that democracies mistreat their prisoners.39 The widespread use of torture by the United States in the wake of 9/11 is just one example. Both Downes and Wallace show that when states get desperate in wartime, they quickly forget the enemy’s humanity and begin to value rights far less than effective fighting. Liberal democracies are no exception.

简而言之，自由民主国家的规范并不能令人信服地解释它们为何永远不会互相争斗。民主和平理论既缺乏令人信服的制度性解释，也缺乏规范性解释。

In short, the norms of liberal democracies provide no persuasive explanation for why they would never fight against each other. There is neither a compelling institutional story nor a normative story underpinning democratic peace theory.

质疑这一理论的另一个原因是民主制度倒退的问题。民主国家总有可能演变成威权国家。 40这种情况屡见不鲜，正如我之前提到的，自由之家报告称，近年来全球民主都在衰落。即使在民主制度根基稳固的地方，也无法保证民主会永远存在。 41假设中国在未来十年内成为民主国家，我们也不能完全确信它能够长期维持这种政治制度。美国必须做好中国可能无法维持民主制度的准备，这意味着为了安全起见，美国会努力增强自身相对于中国的实力。

Another reason to doubt this theory is the problem of backsliding. A democracy may always become an authoritarian state.40 It has happened many times, and as I noted, Freedom House reports that in recent years democracy has been in worldwide retreat. There is no guarantee democracy will last forever even where it is well established.41 If China were to become a democracy in, say, the next ten years, we could not be highly confident it would retain that political system over the long term. The United States would have to be prepared for the eventuality that it might not, which means that just to be safe, it would try to maximize its power relative to China.

自由民主政体往往比非自由民主政体更具持久性，因为前者既有自由主义价值观，也有民主价值观——这可谓是双重优势。然而，任何自由民主政体都无法保证长久存在。想想魏玛德国就知道了，它曾是一个自由民主国家，但仅仅维持了十多年，便在1933年被历史上最具侵略性和邪恶性的政权之一所取代。因此，即便在彼此交往中，自由民主国家也必须做好倒退的准备，这意味着它们应该根据现实主义的原则来处理彼此之间的关系。

Liberal democracies tend to have more staying power than illiberal democracies, because the former are buttressed by liberal as well as democratic values—a formidable one-two punch. Still, there is no guarantee that any liberal democracy will last. Remember that Weimar Germany, which was a liberal democracy, lasted a little over a decade before giving way in 1933 to one of the most aggressive and evil regimes in recorded history. Thus, even in their relations with each other, liberal democracies must be prepared for the possibility of backsliding, which means they should deal with each other according to the dictates of realism.

经济相互依存理论

Economic Interdependence Theory

根据经济相互依存理论，两个经济高度依赖彼此的国家即使存在激烈的政治分歧，也不会发动战争。即使有充分的战略理由发动战争，它们也会避免战争，因为战争会给双方带来灾难性的经济后果。本质上，战争的经济成本将超过其政治收益，包括潜在的战略优势。该理论假设繁荣而非生存才是国家的首要目标。换句话说，经济考量凌驾于战略考量之上。

According to economic interdependence theory, two countries that are highly dependent on each other for their economic well-being will not go to war even over intense political differences. They will avoid war even if there are good strategic reasons for starting a fight, because a war would have disastrous economic consequences for both sides. In essence, the economic costs of war will outweigh the political benefits, including potential strategic gains. The theory assumes that prosperity, not survival, is the number one goal of states. Economic considerations, in other words, trump strategic concerns.

该理论对繁荣的强调主要基于这样一种信念：公众要求领导人促进和保护他们的经济福祉，如果领导人未能做到这一点，他们就会被赶下台，甚至可能引发严重的社会动荡。这种创造财富的迫切需求意味着任何理性的领导人都不太可能发动战争。此外，往往存在一些利益集团反对战争，因为战争可能会损害他们的盈利能力。例如，一些学者认为，银行家始终是维护和平的一股强大力量，因为想要保住权力的领导人不太可能冒着得罪他们的风险。所有这些都表明，在一个经济相互依存的国家中，领导人对冲突有着明显的厌恶，因为他们担心冲突会危及繁荣，从而危及他们的政治生涯。即使是这些国家之间的安全竞争也可能较为温和，这不仅是因为领导人更倾向于专注于最大化本国财富，还因为激烈的竞争可能会无意中导致战争和经济灾难。

The theory’s emphasis on prosperity is based largely on the belief that publics demand that their leaders promote and protect their economic welfare, and if those leaders fail to deliver, they will be thrown out of office. There might even be significant unrest. This imperative to generate wealth means no rational leader is likely to start a war. There are also apt to be interest groups opposed to war because it might undermine their ability to make money.42 Some scholars argue, for example, that bankers are invariably a powerful force for peace, because leaders who want to stay in power are unlikely to risk crossing them. All of this is to say that in a world of economically interdependent states, leaders have a marked aversion to conflict, for fear it will endanger prosperity and thus their political careers. Even security competition among these countries is likely to be moderate, not just because leaders prefer to concentrate on maximizing their country’s wealth but because an intense rivalry might inadvertently lead to war and economic disaster.

不同的学者以各种方式完善了这一基本逻辑。在其早期版本中，该理论从国家间的贸易关系角度描述了经济相互依存。诺曼·安吉尔的名字广为人知。尽管他在1910年的经典著作《大幻觉》中提出了略有不同的论点，但这种观点仍然根深蒂固。43近年来，理查德·罗斯克兰斯在其1986年出版的《贸易国家的崛起》一书中论证了贸易的和平作用。44 然而，埃里克·加茨克认为，在评估经济相互依存关系时，贸易并非合适的考量因素，他主张关注资本市场。 45他认为，“一体化的资本市场”能够促进国家间的和平关系。另一方面，帕特里克·麦克唐纳则认为，贸易的基础是“自由经济制度……市场促进制度”。他强调，“国内经济中私有财产和竞争性市场结构的普遍存在……能够带来和平。” 46

Different scholars refine this basic logic in various ways. In its early incarnation, the theory described economic interdependence in terms of trading relations among countries. Norman Angell’s name is famously attached to this perspective, even though he makes a somewhat different argument in his classic 1910 book The Great Illusion.43 More recently, Richard Rosecrance argued for the pacifying effects of trade in his 1986 book The Rise of the Trading State.44 Erik Gartzke contends, however, that trade is the wrong factor to look at when assessing economic interdependence, and instead argues for focusing on capital markets.45 “Integrated capital markets,” he maintains, foster peaceful relations among states. Patrick McDonald, on the other hand, claims that it is trade underpinned by “the presence of liberal economic institutions . . . market-promoting institutions.” He stresses that “the predominance of private property and competitive market structures within domestic economies . . . produce peace.”46

并非所有经济相互依存理论家都认为贸易和资本流动能够阻止武装冲突。例如，斯蒂芬·布鲁克斯认为，当今全球化世界和平的关键在于跨国公司的生产设施遍布全球，这意味着几乎每个主要国家都依赖许多其他国家提供其消费的产品。 47因此，任何发达国家都无法承受战争的后果，因为战争会使其跨国公司瘫痪，并最终导致其自身经济崩溃。最后，通常被认为是现实主义者的戴尔·科普兰提出了一个兼具自由主义和现实主义特征的论点。 48他认为，当两个国家预期彼此间的高水平贸易能够持续时，基本的经济相互依存逻辑将促进和平关系。但当它们预期这种贸易无法长期维持时，现实主义逻辑就会发挥作用，并可能将双方推向战争。

Not all economic interdependence theorists believe that trade and capital flows thwart armed conflict. Stephen Brooks, for example, argues that the key to peace in today’s globalized world is the fact that the production facilities of multinational corporations are dispersed all over the globe, which means that virtually every major country is dependent on many other countries for the products it consumes.47 Thus no developed country can afford to go to war for fear this would paralyze its multinational corporations and ultimately its own economy. Finally, Dale Copeland, who is usually regarded as a realist, makes an argument that has both liberal and realist strands.48 He maintains that when any two states expect the high levels of trade between them to continue, the logic of basic economic interdependence will facilitate peaceful relations.
