But when they do not expect to sustain that trade over time, realist logic kicks in and may push the two sides toward war.

最后，经济相互依存理论家有时会认为，在现代世界，征服并不划算。工业革命之前，领土扩张确实能带来经济利益，但如今，一个国家的经济几乎不会从征服另一个国家中获益。这实际上是安吉尔在《大幻觉》一书中的主要观点，也是《贸易国家的兴起》一书中的一个重要主题。当我们把这一论点纳入考量时，其核心论点便是：经济相互依存使得战争成本高昂，而征服带来的益处却微乎其微。我将主要关注经济相互依存通过提高战争成本来带来和平这一论点，这也是该理论的核心主张。

Finally, economic interdependence theorists sometimes argue that conquest does not pay in the modern world. Before the Industrial Revolution, the economic benefits of territorial expansion were real, but today a country’s economy hardly benefits from conquering another state. This is actually Angell’s main point in The Great Illusion as well as an important theme in The Rise of the Trading State. When we include this additional argument, the overarching claim is that economic interdependence makes war prohibitively costly, while conquest provides few benefits. I will focus mainly on the argument that economic interdependence brings peace by driving up the costs of war, which is the theory’s core assertion.

经济相互依存理论的局限性

The Limits of Economic Interdependence Theory

认为经济相互依存完全无关紧要是错误的。诚然，在某些情况下，经济相互依存能够扭转局势，避免战争，尤其是在战争的经济代价巨大而政治风险不大的情况下。然而，在许多情况下，经济相互依存并不会左右决策者的决策，因此它远不能保障经济相互依存国家之间的和平。为了使现实政治不再重要，这种保障是必不可少的。

It would be wrong to say that economic interdependence does not matter at all. There will surely be cases where it tips the balance away from war, especially when the economic costs of fighting are great but the political stakes are not. Nevertheless, in many circumstances it will not sway policymakers, and thus it does not come close to guaranteeing peace between economically interdependent states. To render realpolitik irrelevant, that guarantee is necessary.

经济相互依存理论存在三大问题。首先，对于经济相互依存的国家而言，战争成本并非总是很高，而且即便成本很高，在战前也往往被低估。此外，战争有时反而会带来经济利益。其次，即便各国意识到战争将付出巨大代价，政治上的战争冲动通常也会凌驾于经济考量之上，尤其是在核心安全利益受到威胁的情况下。最后，鲜有实证证据表明经济相互依存是国际和平的主要推动力。

Economic interdependence theory has three main problems. First, the costs of going to war for economically interdependent countries are not always high, and often when they prove to be high, they are underestimated before the fighting starts. Moreover, wars sometimes lead to economic gains. Second, even when states recognize that there will be significant costs, the political urge to go to war usually trumps economics, especially when core security interests are at stake. Finally, there is little empirical evidence that economic interdependence is a major force for international peace.

经济相互依存的国家有时可以在避免重大经济损失的情况下发动战争。一个国家可能瞄准单一对手，制定巧妙的军事战略，迅速取得决定性胜利。或者，它也可能挑起与实力远逊于自己的对手的战争，并迅速轻松地将其击败。大多数国家发动战争都期望速战速决，尽管并非总能如愿。 49然而，即便最终取得胜利，经济损失通常也很小。 50 代价最高的战争是旷日持久、涉及多个国家的战争，例如两次世界大战。但同样，大多数领导人发动战争并非出于这种预期结果。

Economically interdependent countries can sometimes fight wars while avoiding significant economic costs. A country might take aim at a single rival, come up with a clever military strategy, and win a quick and decisive victory. Or it might pick a fight with a much weaker adversary that it defeats rapidly and easily. Most states go to war anticipating a swift triumph, not that they always get it.49 When they do, however, the economic costs are often small.50 The costliest wars are protracted ones involving multiple countries, such as the two World Wars. But again, most leaders do not take their countries to war expecting that outcome.

此外，核武器的存在使得当代大国之间爆发类似二战那样的大规模常规冲突的可能性极低。它们之间的战争无论在手段还是目标上都可能受到限制。例如，很难想象中国和美国会在亚洲爆发全面常规战争；但我们不难想象，它们会在南海或台湾问题上进行有限冲突，并认为此类战争的经济代价可以控制在可控范围内。

Furthermore, nuclear weapons make it highly unlikely that contemporary great powers will fight a major conventional conflict like World War II. Wars between them are likely to be limited in both means and goals. It is hard to imagine, for example, that China and the United States would engage in an all-out conventional war in Asia; but it is not difficult to envision them fighting a limited conflict in the South China Sea or over Taiwan with the thought that the economic costs of such a war could be kept manageable.

还有大量证据表明，交战国并非总是切断经济关系。有时，它们在战时也会与敌方进行贸易，因为双方都认为持续的贸易往来对自身有利。杰克·利维和凯瑟琳·巴比耶里是该领域的两位权威专家，他们写道：“显然，与敌方进行贸易的现象十分普遍，足以驳斥战争会系统性地、显著地扰乱敌对双方贸易的传统观点。”他们补充道：“与敌方进行贸易不仅发生在为争取国家独立或全球霸权而进行的全面战争中，也发生在较为有限的军事冲突中。” 51简而言之，一个国家可能与一个与其经济相互依存的对手开战，而不会威胁到自身的繁荣。 52

There is also abundant evidence that states at war with each other do not always break off economic relations. Sometimes they trade with the enemy in wartime because each side believes it benefits from the continued intercourse. Jack Levy and Katherine Barbieri, two of the leading experts on this subject, write: “It is clear that trading with the enemy occurs frequently enough to contradict the conventional wisdom that war will systematically and significantly disrupt trade between adversaries.” They add, “Trading with the enemy occurs during all-out wars fought for national independence or global dominance as well as during more limited military encounters.”51 In short, a country may fight a war against a rival with which it remains economically interdependent and not threaten its own prosperity.52

最后，正如彼得·利伯曼在其重要著作《征服有利可图吗？》中所解释的那样，有时征服确实有利。53例如，如果中国发动战争并赢得南海控制权，它最终将拥有海底丰富的自然资源，这无疑将有助于推动中国的经济增长。国家有时会发动战争，期望胜利带来的经济和战略利益能够超过破坏相互依存关系的代价。

Finally, as Peter Liberman explains in his important book Does Conquest Pay?, sometimes it does.53 For example, if China fought and won a war for control of the South China Sea, it would end up owning the abundant natural resources on the sea floor that would surely help fuel Chinese economic growth. States occasionally start wars with the expectation that victory will bring economic and strategic benefits that outweigh the costs of undermining interdependence.

政治优先于经济

The Primacy of Politics over Economics

即使假设两个经济相互依存的国家之间发生战争会付出巨大的代价，战争仍然是一种现实的可能性。该理论的支持者对此持不同意见，因为他们认为战争的高昂代价将超过预期的政治收益。他们实际上假设国家的主要目标是繁荣而非生存。但这是错误的。政治考量往往凌驾于经济考量之上。当国家安全受到威胁时，这一点尤其如此，因为生存最终比繁荣更为重要。一个国家如果无法生存，就不可能繁荣，但即使是因战争而贫困的国家也能恢复并变得富裕。1914年以前，欧洲相当繁荣，但第一次世界大战爆发了。德国是这场冲突的主要责任国，它一心想要阻止俄国的崛起，并建立自己在欧洲的霸权。政治凌驾于经济之上。

But even if one assumes significant costs of war between two economically interdependent states, war remains a real possibility. Proponents of the theory disagree, because they believe the high cost of war will outweigh the expected political benefits. They assume in effect that the principal goal of states is prosperity, not survival. But this is wrong. Political calculations often trump economic ones. This is certainly true when matters of national security are at stake, because survival is ultimately more important than prosperity. A country cannot prosper if it does not survive, but even countries impoverished by war can recover and become rich. Europe was quite prosperous before 1914, yet World War I happened. Germany, which was principally responsible for that conflict, was bent on preventing Russia from growing more powerful and also wanted to establish its own hegemony in Europe.54 Politics overwhelmed economics.

有人可能会说，并非所有涉及安全的争端都关乎国家存亡。并非所有危机都等同于1914年7月危机。这种说法固然有一定道理，这也是经济相互依存逻辑有时确实有效的原因之一。但归根结底，这并非一个令人信服的论点，很大程度上是因为我称之为“因小失大”的逻辑。各国常常担心，如果它们不解决一些小的安全问题，对手就会继续占便宜，最终导致力量平衡发生严重逆转，对它们不利。与其等到生死攸关才采取行动，不如防患于未然。这种观点的影响力会随着国家生存重要程度的提高而增强。55

One might argue that not every dispute involving security is a matter of national survival. Not every crisis is the equivalent of the July crisis in 1914. There is certainly truth in this claim, and it is one reason economic interdependence logic sometimes works as advertised. But ultimately it is not a compelling argument, largely because of what I call “want of a nail” logic. States often worry that if they fail to address minor security problems, their adversary will continue to take advantage and the balance of power will eventually shift profoundly against them. It is better to nip the problem in the bud than wait until survival really is at stake. The power of this viewpoint is magnified by the degree to which survival matters for states.55

关于科普兰的论点，我应该简单提几句。他声称，当竞争对手之间存在未来贸易前景时，经济相互依存凌驾于现实政治之上。这种说法并不合理。问题之一在于，我们无法确切知道任何相互依存关系会持续多久，因此各国都有强烈的动机为这种关系的终结做好准备。根据科普兰的说法，一旦这种关系结束，这些国家就回到了现实主义的世界，而最好的做法始终是在“未雨绸缪”之前，遵循现实主义的准则来应对这种情况。此外，正如科普兰本人所强调的，我们不可能预知各国的未来意图。56对意图的无知意味着，一个今天致力于和平与繁荣的国家，将来可能会找到发动战争的理由，即使这会造成严重的经济后果。再次强调，最好的做法是遵循未雨绸缪的逻辑。57

I should say a brief word about Copeland’s argument. He claims that economic interdependence trumps realpolitik when there is the prospect of future trade among rivals. This does not make sense. One problem is that it is impossible to know for sure how long any mutual dependence will last, and thus states have powerful incentives to prepare for its end. When it stops, according to Copeland, those states are back in a realist world, and it is always best to plan for that “rainy day” by following realist dictates before it arrives. Furthermore, as Copeland himself emphasizes, it is impossible to know the future intentions of states.56 Ignorance about intentions means that a state deeply committed to peace and prosperity today might someday find reasons to start a war, despite the economic consequences. Again, it is best to act according to rainy day logic.57

当民族主义盛行时，政治往往凌驾于繁荣之上。以北京在台湾问题上的立场为例。中国领导人一再强调，如果台湾宣布独立，即使会损害中国经济，中国也将对台湾开战。中国人对台湾的看法深受民族主义影响；几乎所有中国人都认为台湾是神圣的领土，最终必须回归大陆。58我还应该指出，历史上充斥着内战，几乎在所有情况下，交战双方在战争爆发前都存在经济上的相互依存关系。然而，政治考量最终却占据了主导地位。

Politics also wins out over prosperity when nationalism is at play. Consider Beijing’s position on Taiwan. Chinese leaders have repeatedly emphasized that they will go to war against Taiwan if it declares its independence, even at the cost of damaging China’s economy. Chinese thinking about Taiwan is deeply influenced by nationalism; almost everyone in China considers that island sacred territory that must eventually be reintegrated into the mainland.58 I should also note that history is littered with civil wars, and in almost every instance the combatants had been economically interdependent before the fighting broke out. Nevertheless, political calculations proved more influential.

为了进一步说明政治和战略因素往往比经济因素更重要，不妨看看经济制裁的有效性。历史记录清楚地表明，制裁通常无法达到预期目的。其中一个原因是，被制裁国即使承受巨大的惩罚，也依然不会屈服于制裁者的要求。59这种强硬态度很大程度上源于民族主义，民族主义总是促使被制裁国的民众团结在领导人周围，而不是起来反抗他们。英国和美国在二战中就体会到了这一点，当时他们对德国和日本城市的轰炸并未激起当地民众的起义。 60因此，俄罗斯民众对西方因乌克兰危机而对俄罗斯实施的制裁表示支持，并团结在弗拉基米尔·普京周围，也就不足为奇了。

To drive home the point that political and strategic factors often outweigh economic ones, consider the effectiveness of economic sanctions. The historical record clearly shows that sanctions usually do not achieve their goal. One reason they fail is that the target states can absorb enormous punishment and still not bend to the coercer’s demands.59 This toughness is driven in good part by nationalism, which invariably causes the people in the targeted state to rally around their leaders, not to revolt against them. Britain and the United States discovered this in World War II, when their bombing campaigns against German and Japanese cities failed to spur uprisings by the target populations.60 It is no surprise that the Russian people have responded to the West’s sanctions on Russia over the Ukraine crisis by rallying around Vladimir Putin.

乌克兰危机凸显了制裁在政治或战略考量面前屡屡失效的另一个原因。对俄罗斯而言，乌克兰是其核心战略利益所在，西方试图将乌克兰从莫斯科的势力范围剥离并纳入西方体系的做法，是俄罗斯绝对不可接受的。在普京看来，美国及其欧洲盟友的政策威胁着俄罗斯的生存。正是这种观点促使俄罗斯不遗余力地阻止乌克兰加入西方阵营。61

The Ukraine crisis points up the other reason sanctions regularly fail in the face of political or strategic calculations. For Russia, Ukraine is a core strategic interest, and the West’s efforts to peel Ukraine away from Moscow’s orbit and incorporate it into Western institutions is categorically unacceptable. From Putin’s perspective, the policy of the United States and its European allies is a threat to Russia’s survival. This viewpoint motivates Russia to go to enormous lengths to prevent Ukraine from joining the West.61

我们不应感到惊讶，一个既受权力平衡逻辑又受民族主义挑战的理论，在历史记录中鲜有佐证。诚然，有些研究声称经济相互依存会降低冲突发生的可能性，但该理论的支持者并未声称它能有效排除经济紧密相连的国家之间发生战争的可能性。62然而，也有其他研究表明，经济相互依存对冲突的发生没有明显影响。63一些学者甚至声称，经济相互依存会增加战争发生的可能性，因为它有可能在经济动荡时期加剧贸易伙伴之间的紧张关系。 64例如，欧元危机是如何助长欧洲民族主义的。尽管伊拉克和科威特经济联系紧密，但伊拉克还是在1990年8月入侵了科威特，部分原因是科威特违反了石油输出国组织（欧佩克）设定的产量限制，导致伊拉克的石油利润下降。

We should not be surprised that a theory that is undermined by both balance-of-power logic and nationalism finds little support in the historical record. For sure there are studies that claim economic interdependence makes conflict less likely, although no proponent of the theory argues that it effectively rules out war between countries whose economies are tied closely together.62 There are other studies, however, showing no effect one way or the other.63 Some scholars even claim that it makes war more likely because it has the potential in troubled economic times to fuel tensions between trading partners.64 Consider, for example, how the crisis over the euro is fueling nationalism in Europe. Iraq invaded Kuwait in August 1990, despite their close economic ties, in part because Kuwait was violating production limits set by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting States (OPEC) and driving down Iraq’s oil profits.

总之，没有理由相信经济相互依存能够为国际和平奠定坚实的基础，即使它有时可能起到阻止战争的作用。

In sum, there is no basis for believing that economic interdependence makes a firm foundation for international peace, even if it may occasionally serve as a brake on war.

自由制度主义

Liberal Institutionalism

自由制度主义可能是三大自由主义理论中最薄弱的一种。65其主要支持者对国际机构在促进和平方面所能发挥的作用持保守态度，而历史记录清楚地表明，对于任何走向战争的大国而言，这些机构只不过是前进道路上的一个小障碍。这其中也包括英国和美国这样的自由民主国家。

Liberal institutionalism is probably the weakest of the three major liberal theories.65 Its chief proponents make modest claims about what international institutions can actually do to bring peace, and the historical record shows clearly that for any great power on the road to war, they are little more than a speed bump. That includes liberal democracies like Britain and the United States.

制度是一套描述国家间合作与竞争方式的规则。它们规定了可接受的行为方式，并禁止不可接受的行为。这些规则由各国协商制定，而非强加。大国主导着这些规则的制定，并承诺遵守这些规则，即便它们认为这样做不符合自身利益。实际上，各国加入国际机构时，就等于自愿束缚了自己的手脚。这些规则通常以国际协定的形式正式确立，并由拥有自身人员和预算的组织进行管理。然而，必须强调的是，这些组织本身并不能强制各国遵守规则。国际机构并非独立于组成该体系的国家之外的强大机构，它们无力强迫各国遵守规则。它们并非世界政府。各国必须自行选择遵守它们制定的规则。简而言之，制度要求的是“各个主权国家之间分散的合作，而没有任何有效的指挥机制”。 66

Institutions are the set of rules that describe how states should cooperate and compete with each other. They prescribe acceptable forms of behavior and proscribe unacceptable behavior. The rules are negotiated by states; they are not imposed. The great powers dominate the writing of these rules and pledge to obey them, even where they think it is not in their interest to do so. In effect, countries voluntarily tie their hands when they join an international institution. The rules are typically formalized in international agreements and administered by organizations with their own personnel and budgets. It is important to emphasize, however, that those organizations per se do not compel states to obey the rules. International institutions are not powerful bodies, which are independent of the states that comprise the system, and they are not capable of forcing states to follow the rules. They are not a form of world government. States themselves must choose to obey the rules they created. Institutions, in short, call for the “decentralized cooperation of individual sovereign states, without any effective mechanism of command.”66

这种对自愿服从的强调也体现了国际法的运作方式，这表明在国际层面上，制度和法律之间没有实质性的区别。国际制度有时被称为“机制”，许多学者交替使用这两个术语。因此，本文的分析既适用于国际法和机制，也适用于国际制度。67

This emphasis on voluntary obedience also captures how international law works, which tells us there is no meaningful difference between institutions and law at the international level. International institutions are sometimes called “regimes,” and many scholars use those terms interchangeably. Thus the analysis here is as applicable to international law and regimes as it is to international institutions.67

最终目标：国家间合作

The Ultimate Goal: Cooperation among States

自由制度主义者很少认为国际机构是维护和平的强大力量。相反，他们提出的论点较为保守，即国际机构通过促进国家间合作来帮助和平解决争端。合作。这种对合作的强调在罗伯特·基欧汉的《后霸权时代：世界政治经济中的合作与冲突》一书中体现得尤为明显，该书可能是国际制度领域最具影响力的著作。68但正如书名所示，基欧汉着重阐述如何加强国家间的经济合作。他对战争与和平着墨不多。一些自由制度主义者确实直接探讨安全问题，但他们也主要讨论的是安全机构如何促进合作。69这种对合作的关注贯穿于整个制度主义文献，许多重要著作的标题都包含“合作”一词，但几乎没有人详细阐述合作如何带来和平。 70

Liberal institutionalists rarely argue that international institutions are a powerful force for peace. Instead, they make the less ambitious claim that institutions help settle disputes peacefully by promoting interstate cooperation. This emphasis on cooperation is clearly evident in Robert Keohane’s After Hegemony: Cooperation and Discord in the World Political Economy, probably the most influential work on international institutions.68 But as his title indicates, Keohane concentrates on explaining how to enhance economic cooperation among states. He says little about war and peace. Some liberal institutionalists do deal directly with security issues, but they too mainly talk about how those security institutions enhance cooperation.69 This focus on cooperation is found throughout the institutionalist literature, where many of the key pieces have “cooperation” in the title, and where hardly anyone elaborates on how cooperation causes peace.70

明确制度在何种特定情况下能够促进合作至关重要。制度只有在国家拥有共同利益却因情境结构导致彼此利用的动机而无法实现时才能发挥作用。经典的囚徒困境就是一个例证：两个个体都希望合作，但却因为害怕对方占自己便宜而无法合作。相反，他们试图利用对方，结果反而使双方的处境都比合作时更糟。集体行动逻辑是另一个例子，在这种情况下，个体拥有共同利益却无法实现，因为他们有强大的动机去利用对方。有人认为，制度可以帮助处于这种情境下的个体实现他们的共同利益。

It is important to specify the particular circumstances in which institutions foster cooperation. They work only when states have mutual interests but cannot realize them because the structure of the situation gives them incentives to take advantage of each other. An example of this problem is the classic prisoner’s dilemma, where two individuals have a vested interest in cooperating but cannot because each fears the other might take advantage of him. Instead, they try to exploit each other, which leaves them both worse off than if they had made the deal. Collective action logic is another instance where individuals have common interests but do not realize them because there are powerful incentives for them to take advantage of each other. Institutions, the argument goes, can help individuals in these situations realize their common interests.

当国家间存在利益冲突，且双方都认为合作无益时，该理论的适用性就微乎其微了。在这种情况下，各国几乎必然会寻求利用对方，而这有时会演变为暴力冲突。换言之，如果分歧深刻且涉及重大问题，各国就会以输赢为导向进行思考，这必然会导致激烈的安全竞争，有时甚至会引发战争。国际机构在这种情况下对国家行为的影响甚微，这主要是因为该理论并未探讨机构如何解决甚至缓解大国间的深刻冲突。因此，自由制度主义者对战争与和平的成因鲜有论述也就不足为奇了。

The theory has little relevance when states have conflicting interests and neither side thinks it has much to gain from cooperation. In these circumstances, states will almost certainly aim to take advantage of each other, and that will sometimes involve violence. In other words, if the differences are profound and involve important issues, countries will think in terms of winning and losing, which will invariably lead to intense security competition and sometimes war. International institutions have little influence on state behavior in such conditions, mainly because the theory does not address how institutions can resolve or even ameliorate deep conflicts between great powers.71 It is thus not surprising that liberal institutionalists have little to say about the causes of war and peace.

还有另一种方式可以展现制度的局限性。一些自由制度主义者认为，国际政治可以分为两部分。政治经济和安全领域存在显著差异，而他们的理论主要适用于前者。例如，查尔斯·利普森写道：“国际经济问题和安全问题相关的制度安排截然不同。” 72此外，在这些领域开展合作的可能性也明显不同。当经济关系受到威胁时，“几个自身利益攸关的国家之间可以维持合作”，而合作前景“在安全事务中则更为黯淡”。 73

There is another way to show the limits of institutions. Some liberal institutionalists argue that international politics can be divided into two realms—political economy and security—and that their theory applies mainly to the former. Charles Lipson, for instance, writes that “significantly different institutional arrangements are associated with international economic and security issues.”72 Moreover, the likelihood of cooperation in these realms is markedly different. When economic relations are at stake, “cooperation can be sustained among several self-interested states,” whereas the prospects for cooperation are “more impoverished . . . in security affairs.”73

基欧汉在《后霸权时代》一书中也体现了同样的思路，他强调自己关注的是“发达市场经济体国家之间的关系……这是共同利益最大、国际合作效益最容易实现的领域。” 74这一重要区别的一个例子是：联合国在解决大国间政治争端方面效率低下，而国际货币基金组织和世界银行在促进大国间经济合作方面却卓有成效。这在实践中意味着，自由制度主义者主要关注促进经济和环境领域的合作，因为在这些领域，各国最有可能需要借助制度的力量来实现其共同利益。自由制度主义者对安全机制的关注则少得多。

The same thinking is reflected in Keohane’s After Hegemony, where he emphasizes that he is concentrating “on relations among the advanced market-economy countries . . . the area where common interests are greatest and where the benefits of international cooperation may be easiest to realize.”74 One example of this important distinction is the contrast between the United Nations’ ineffectiveness at resolving political disputes between the great powers and the effectiveness of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank at facilitating economic cooperation among the major powers. What this means in practice is that liberal institutionalists focus mainly on fostering cooperation in the economic and environmental realms, because those are the domains where states are most likely to need the help of institutions to realize their common interests. Liberal institutionalists devote much less attention to security regimes.

有人可能会认为，军事联盟是安全机构，它们对国际政治无疑有着重要影响。毫无疑问，联盟有助于协调成员国在和平时期和战争时期的行动，从而提高其集体行动的效率和效力。北约就是一个典型的例子。在冷战期间，北约在帮助西方遏制苏联在欧洲的野心方面发挥了极其重要的作用。但该联盟的成员是那些在面对共同威胁时有着强大合作动机的国家，而不是那些存在根本分歧的国家。因此，总的来说，自由制度主义者很少关注战争与和平的问题。

One might argue that military alliances are security institutions, and they certainly have an important effect on international politics. There is no question that alliances are useful for coordinating the actions of the member states in both peace and war, which makes their collective efforts more efficient and effective. NATO is a case in point. It was hugely important during the Cold War in helping the West deter Soviet ambitions in Europe. But the alliance was among states with powerful incentives to cooperate in the face of a common threat, not states that had fundamental disagreements. Thus the general point stands: liberal institutionalists pay little attention to questions about war and peace.

有人可能会说，约翰·伊肯伯里（John Ikenberry）是个例外，他可能是除基欧汉（Keohane）之外最杰出的自由制度主义者。他发展出一套真正具有国际视野的理论，能够解释如何在经济和安全领域实现合作。在他开创性的……在《胜利之后：制度、战略克制与重大战争后秩序的重建》一书中，他阐述了国家构建国际秩序的条件，这似乎暗示着一种覆盖全球的秩序。艾肯伯里尤其关注二战后形成的国际秩序，而美国是这一秩序的主要缔造者。当然，这一秩序高度制度化。

Some might say that John Ikenberry, probably the most prominent liberal institutionalist besides Keohane, is an exception. He has developed a theory that is truly international in scope and can explain how to achieve cooperation in both the economic and security realms. In his seminal book After Victory: Institutions, Strategic Restraint, and the Rebuilding of Order after Major Wars, he explains the circumstances under which states can build international orders, which seems to imply an order that covers the entire globe.75 Ikenberry is particularly interested in the international order that came into being after World War II, for which the United States was principally responsible. That order, of course, was heavily institutionalized.

然而，仔细审视之下，我们发现艾肯伯里的论述主要围绕冷战时期西方内部的秩序展开，在这个秩序中，主要国家之间鲜有深刻的冲突。他对美苏之间的安全竞争着墨甚少，也鲜少提及联合国——一个名副其实的国际机构，但在管控超级大国关系方面却几乎毫无作用。归根结底，艾肯伯里探讨的并非国际秩序，而是西方发达工业国家之间的经济和军事关系。他的关注点与基欧汉在《后霸权时代》中的论述相似，尽管他们提出的理论略有不同，但都未能解释安全竞争和战争的根源，也未能阐明各种制度如何阻止敌对大国之间的战争。

On close inspection, however, we see that Ikenberry’s story is all about the Cold War order within the West, where the major countries had few profound disputes. He pays little attention to the security competition between the United States and the Soviet Union. Nor does he say much about the United Nations—a truly international institution, but almost useless for managing superpower relations. In the end, Ikenberry is not dealing with international order; he is dealing with economic and military relations among the advanced industrial countries of the West. His focus is similar to Keohane’s in After Hegemony, and although they offer somewhat different theories, neither explains what causes security competition and war or how institutions prevent rival great powers from fighting each other.

无政府状态问题

The Anarchy Problem

或许令人惊讶，但主要的自由制度主义思想家们并不声称（至少在大多数情况下）他们提出的理论能够清晰地替代现实主义。他们似乎希望在论证中保留现实政治的重要元素，同时又超越现实政治。例如，艾肯伯里写道，他的理论“借鉴了现实主义和自由主义的理论传统”，而基欧汉则写道，“我们需要超越现实主义，而不是抛弃它。” 76赫尔加·哈夫滕多恩、基欧汉和塞莱斯特·瓦兰德是直接探讨安全机构的一本书的编辑，他们写道：“我们认为，目前仍以现实主义思想为主导的安全研究，若能融入制度主义方法，将大有裨益。” 77很难理解，任何很大程度上基于现实主义逻辑的理论，如何能够摆脱权力平衡政治的束缚。但我们暂且搁置这个问题，转而集中解释，为什么国际机构即便能够促进合作，却几乎不可能显著提升和平前景。

It might seem surprising, but the major liberal institutionalist thinkers do not claim, at least most of the time, to be offering a clear alternative to realism. They seem to want to retain significant elements of realpolitik in their arguments while yet going beyond it. Ikenberry, for example, writes that his theory “draws upon both realist and liberal theoretical traditions,” while Keohane writes that “we need to go beyond Realism, not discard it.”76 Helga Haftendorn, Keohane, and Celeste Wallander, the editors of a book dealing directly with security institutions, write: “As we see it, security studies, still dominated by realist thinking, will greatly benefit by incorporating institutionalist approaches.”77 It is hard to understand how any theory that is based in good part on realist logic can possibly leave balance-of-power politics behind. But let us put that matter aside and instead concentrate on explaining why international institutions hold out little hope of significantly enhancing the prospects for peace, even if they enhance the prospects for cooperation.

自由制度主义基于这样一种信念：国际合作的主要障碍是欺骗的威胁，而欺骗很大程度上是难以解决的不确定性造成的。一个国家永远无法预知其他国家未来的想法和行动。该理论认为，制度可以通过四种方式缓解这一问题。

Liberal institutionalism is predicated on the belief that the main inhibitor of international cooperation is the threat of cheating, which is largely a consequence of intractable uncertainty. A state can never know what other states will think and do in the future. Institutions, so the argument goes, can ameliorate that problem in four ways.

首先，随着时间的推移，各国之间的交易数量可能会增加。这种迭代机制通过创造未来合作收益的前景，提高了作弊的成本。“未来的阴影”能够有效阻止当下的作弊行为，因为一旦被发现作弊，该国未来从合作中获益的可能性就会受到威胁。这种迭代机制也为受害者提供了反击作弊者的机会：它促进了以牙还牙的策略，从而有效防止作弊者逍遥法外。除了惩罚那些因作弊而声名狼藉的国家之外，它还能奖励那些因遵守协议而赢得声誉的国家。

First, they can increase the number of transactions among countries over time. This iteration raises the cost of cheating by creating the prospect of future gains through cooperation. The “shadow of the future” deters cheating today, since a state caught cheating jeopardizes its prospects of benefiting from future cooperation. Iteration gives the victim the opportunity to retaliate against the cheater: it facilitates a tit-for-tat strategy, which works to prevent cheaters from getting away with their transgression. In addition to punishing states that gain a reputation for cheating, it also rewards those that develop a reputation for adherence to agreements.

其次，规则可以将不同议题领域的国家间互动联系起来。议题关联的目的是增强国家间的相互依存，使它们更不愿在某一议题领域作弊，因为担心受害者乃至其他国家会在其他领域进行报复。与迭代机制类似，关联提高了双重交易的成本，并为受害者提供了反击作弊者的途径。

Second, rules can tie together interactions between states in different issue areas. The aim of issue linkage is to create greater interdependence between states, which will make them more reluctant to cheat in one issue area for fear that the victim, and perhaps other states, will retaliate in another area. Like iteration, linkage raises the costs of double-dealing and provides ways for victims to retaliate against the cheater.

第三，规则体系可以增加合作协议参与者可获取的信息量，从而实现密切监督。信息量的增加会提高作弊者被发现的可能性，进而起到遏制作弊的作用。此外，它还能让受害者及早发现可能的作弊行为，使他们能够在遭受严重伤害之前采取保护措施。

Third, a system of rules can increase the amount of information available to the participants in cooperative agreements, which permits close monitoring. Raising the level of information discourages cheating by increasing the likelihood cheaters will be caught. It also provides victims with early warning of possible cheating, enabling them to take protective measures before they are badly hurt.

最后，规则可以降低各项协议的交易成本。当制度履行上述职责时，各国就能减少在谈判和监督协议以及防范可能出现的违约行为方面所投入的精力。通过提高国际合作的效率，制度使其更具盈利性，从而更具吸引力。

Finally, rules can reduce the transaction costs of individual agreements. When institutions perform the tasks described above, states are able to devote less effort to negotiating and monitoring agreements, and to hedging against possible defections. By increasing the efficiency of international cooperation, institutions make it more profitable and thus more attractive.

毫无疑问，对竞争对手国家暗中或公开违反规则的担忧，是现实主义叙事的核心要素，也是安全竞争和战争背后的驱动力之一。78个国家都对权力平衡深感担忧，因为它们永远无法……他们确信自己不会成为其他国家作弊的受害者。但如果真的发生了，他们也无处求助。对我们而言，关键问题在于国际机构能否以任何方式解决作弊问题，从而挑战基本的现实主义逻辑。几乎可以肯定的是，它们做不到。

There is no question that the fear of a rival state breaking the rules, either covertly or openly, is a central element in the realist story, and one of the driving forces behind security competition and war.78 States are deeply concerned about the balance of power because they can never be certain they will not fall victim to another state cheating. If they do, there is no night watchman they can turn to for help. The key question for our purposes is whether international institutions solve the cheating problem in any way that challenges basic realist logic. Almost certainly, they do not.

当然，核心问题在于缺乏一个更高权威机构，能够以可信的方式威胁惩罚那些违反规则的国家。国际机构并非自主行动者，无法在认为遵守规则不符合国家利益时强迫其遵守规则。没有任何证据表明任何机构能够强迫大国违背现实主义的指导原则行事。相反，这些机构依赖于其成员国遵守规则，因为成员国认为这符合自身的长远利益。在制度主义的叙事中，成员国必须自我约束。79

The central problem, of course, is the absence of a higher authority that can credibly threaten to punish states if they disobey the rules. International institutions are not autonomous actors that can force a state to obey the rules when it thinks that doing so is not in its national interest. There is no evidence of any institution coercing a great power into acting against realist dictates. Instead, institutions depend on their member states to stick to the rules, because they think it serves their long-term interests. In the institutionalist story, member states have to police themselves.79

但历史记录表明，当国家认为遵守规则不符合自身利益时，它们就会作弊或违抗国际法。例如，美国——这个典型的自由民主国家——就曾违反国际法，分别于1999年和2003年发动了对塞尔维亚和伊拉克的战争。 80在这两起事件中，华盛顿都未能获得联合国安理会批准这些战争所需的决议。尽管如此，美国仍然选择无视国际法，因为它认为这样做有强烈的道德和战略必要性。自然，它从未受到惩罚。我们还可以指出，法国和德国也曾违反欧盟既定规则，因为它们认为这样做符合自身利益。 81它们同样没有受到惩罚。很难找到国际机构因大国违反规则而对其进行严厉惩罚的案例。

But we know from the historical record that states will cheat or disobey when they think that adhering to the rules is not in their interest. Consider, for example, that the United States—the quintessential liberal democratic state—violated international law to initiate wars against Serbia in 1999 and Iraq in 2003.80 In both cases, Washington failed to secure the required United Nations Security Council resolution sanctioning those wars. Still, the United States opted to ignore international law in both cases because it felt there were strong moral and strategic imperatives for doing so. Naturally, it was never punished. One could also point to instances when France and Germany violated well-established EU rules because they believed doing so was in their interest.81 They were not punished either. It is hard to find a case where an international institution punished a great power in any serious way for breaking the rules.

鉴于各国之间有时存在根本分歧，而国际机构又无法有效地约束它们，这些国家意识到，它们身处一个自助的世界，在这个世界里，尽可能地掌控全球权力至关重要，无论它们是否遵守规则。毕竟，如果一个国家遵守法律却牺牲了自身安全，那么一旦遭到敌对国家的攻击，谁会出手相助？恐怕无人问津。正是这种逻辑解释了为什么自由制度主义对战争与和平问题鲜有论述，以及为什么它无法对现实主义构成真正的挑战。

Given that states sometimes have fundamental differences and international institutions cannot meaningfully constrain them, those states recognize that they are operating in a self-help world where it makes eminently good sense to control as large a share of global power as possible, regardless of whether they gain that control by following the rules. After all, if a state obeys the law but sacrifices its security, who will come to its rescue if it is attacked by a rival state? Probably nobody. This logic explains why liberal institutionalism has so little to say about matters of war and peace, and why it does not offer a serious challenge to realism.

最后，我想补充一点关于作弊的问题。在安全问题上，对作弊的恐惧通常被认为是合作中更为巨大的障碍：在这种情况下，背叛可能导致毁灭性的军事失败。正如查尔斯·利普森所写，这种“迅速而果断的背叛”的威胁在国际经济领域根本不存在。鉴于“背叛的代价”在军事领域可能更为严重，自由制度主义对安全事务鲜有论述，而对经济和环境合作却颇有建树，也就不足为奇了。正如我们所见，自由制度主义在经济领域具有相关性的另一个原因是，各国往往拥有共同利益，而制度可以帮助实现这些利益。在安全领域，敌对国家之间往往存在根本分歧，除了联盟之外，制度在很大程度上无关紧要。

I would add a final word about cheating. Fear of cheating is generally considered a more formidable obstacle to cooperation when security issues are at stake:82 betrayal in such circumstances could bring a devastating military defeat. This threat of “swift, decisive defection,” as Charles Lipson writes, is simply not present in international economics. Given that “the costs of betrayal” are potentially much graver in the military sphere, it is hardly surprising that liberal institutionalism has little to say about security affairs but much to say about economic and environmental cooperation. As we saw, the other reason liberal institutionalism is relevant in the economic realm is that states often have common interests that institutions can help realize. In the security realm, where rival states often have fundamental differences, institutions are largely irrelevant, save for alliances.

总之，当各国拥有共同利益且需要帮助实现这些利益时，国际机构是有效的治国工具。它们可以促进国家间的合作，尽管这种合作并非总是为了和平目的。然而，更重要的是，没有理由认为国际机构能够使国家远离战争。

In sum, international institutions are useful tools of statecraft when states have common interests and need help realizing them. They can facilitate cooperation among states, although that cooperation is not always for peaceful ends. The more important point, however, is that there is no reason to think institutions can push states away from war.

我为什么是现实主义者

Why I Am a Realist

对国际政治主要自由主义理论的探讨，引出了我为何是现实主义者，以及为何我认为各国，尤其是大国，极倾向于遵循权力平衡逻辑行事。简而言之，任何国家都无法确定潜在的对手会在重大争端中恪守自由主义准则，尤其是在民族主义影响深远的情况下。如果对手选择发动战争，没有任何最高权威能够拯救目标国于战败之中。各国身处一个自力更生的世界，生存之道在于尽可能地强大，即便这意味着采取残酷的政策。这并非一个美好的故事，但如果生存是某个国家的首要目标，那么别无他法。

This discussion of the main liberal theories of international politics brings me to the reason I am a realist and why I think states, especially great powers, are strongly inclined to act according to balance-of-power logic. Simply put, no country can ever be certain that a potential rival will hew to liberal dictates during a serious dispute, especially given the powerful influence of nationalism. If that rival opts to start a war, there is no supreme authority to rescue the target country from defeat. States operate in a self-help world in which the best way to survive is to be as powerful as possible, even if that requires pursuing ruthless policies. This is not a pretty story, but there is no better alternative if survival is a country’s paramount goal.

8

8

克制的理由

The Case for Restraint

本书的核心任务是探讨当一个强权国家追求自由主义霸权时会发生什么。当然，这一任务的动机源于冷战后美国的对外政策。但要理解自由主义在国际政治中的运作方式，就必须理解它与民族主义和现实主义之间的关系，因为民族主义和现实主义都深刻影响着国家间的互动。因此，本书的核心在于探讨这三种主义之间的关系。

MY CENTRAL MISSION IN THIS BOOK has been to examine what happens when a powerful state pursues liberal hegemony. That mission was motivated, of course, by U.S. foreign policy in the post–Cold War era. But to understand how liberalism works in international politics, it is necessary to understand how it relates to nationalism and realism, both of which profoundly affect the interactions among states. At its core, therefore, this book is about the relationship among those three isms.

前几章的分析为美国未来的外交政策提出了若干建议。首先，美国应该放弃其自由霸权的宏大野心。这种政策不仅容易失败，而且往往会使美国军队卷入代价高昂且最终战败的战争。其次，华盛顿应该采取更加克制的外交政策，以现实主义为基础，并清楚地认识到民族主义如何限制大国的行动空间。虽然现实主义并非永久和平的灵丹妙药，但与自由主义指导下的外交政策相比，以现实主义为指导的外交政策将意味着美国发动的战争更少，外交上的成功更多。民族主义使得雄心勃勃的外交政策更加没有必要。简而言之，美国应该学习克制的美德。

The analysis in the preceding chapters implies a number of recommendations for the future conduct of American foreign policy. First, the United States should jettison its grand ambitions of liberal hegemony. Not only is this policy prone to failure, it tends to embroil the American military in costly wars that it ultimately loses. Second, Washington should adopt a more restrained foreign policy based on realism and a clear understanding of how nationalism limits a great power’s room to maneuver. Although realism is not a formula for perpetual peace, a foreign policy informed by realism will mean fewer American wars and more diplomatic successes than will a policy guided by liberalism. Nationalism works to make an ambitious policy abroad even less necessary. In brief, the United States should learn the virtue of restraint.

美国放弃自由主义霸权并采取现实主义外交政策的可能性有多大？这个问题的答案取决于两个密切相关的因素：未来的结构……国际体系——或者更具体地说，全球权力分配——以及自由国家在选择外交政策方面所拥有的自主权或自由度。

What is the likelihood that the United States will move away from liberal hegemony and adopt a realist foreign policy? The answer to this question depends on two closely related considerations: the future structure of the international system—or to put it in more concrete terms, the global distribution of power—and the degree of agency or freedom liberal states have in choosing a foreign policy.

一个强大的国家只有在单极体系中才能追求自由霸权，因为在这种体系下，它无需担心其他大国的威胁。然而，当世界处于两极或多极格局时，由于存在其他大国的竞争，大国别无选择，只能按照现实主义的规则行事。有充分的理由认为单极格局即将终结，这主要是由于中国的崛起。如果真是如此，美国决策者将不得不放弃自由霸权。但这也会带来一个严重的弊端：美国将不得不与一个潜在的竞争对手展开较量。

A powerful state can pursue liberal hegemony only in a unipolar system in which it need not worry about threats from other great powers. When the world is bipolar or multipolar, on the other hand, great powers have little choice but to act according to realist dictates, because of the presence of rival great powers. There is good reason to think unipolarity is coming to an end, mainly because of China’s impressive rise. If so, American policymakers will have to abandon liberal hegemony. But there is a serious downside: the United States will have to compete with a potential peer.

或许中国会遭遇严重的经济问题，经济增长急剧放缓，在这种情况下，世界格局仍将保持单极状态。如果这种情况发生，美国将很难放弃自由主义霸权。自由民主国家，尤其是其精英阶层，根深蒂固地带有某种“十字军东征”的冲动，他们很难不试图按照自己的意愿重塑世界。换句话说，自由主义政权在有机会拥抱自由主义霸权时，几乎没有自主权。然而，一旦自由主义霸权导致政策屡屡失败的局面变得明朗起来，我们或许可以合理地期待，自由主义单极国家能够幡然醒悟，放弃这种有缺陷的战略，转而采取一种基于现实主义和对民族主义的合理理解的更为克制的战略。毕竟，国家有时确实会从错误中吸取教训。

Perhaps China will run into significant economic problems and suffer a precipitous slowdown in its growth, in which case the system will remain unipolar. If that happens, it will be difficult for the United States to abandon liberal hegemony. A crusader impulse is deeply wired into liberal democracies, especially their elites, and it is difficult for them not to try to remake the world in their own image. Liberal regimes, in other words, have little agency when presented with the chance to embrace liberal hegemony. Nevertheless, once it becomes clear that liberal hegemony leads to one policy failure after another, we may reasonably hope that the liberal unipole will wise up and abandon that flawed strategy in favor of a more restrained strategy based on realism and a sound appreciation of nationalism. Countries do sometimes learn from their mistakes.

自由主义在海外的愚蠢之处

The Folly of Liberalism Abroad

正如我在本书开篇所强调的，我认为自由民主是最佳的政治秩序。它并非完美无缺，但远胜其他竞争制度。然而，在国际政治领域，自由主义却是一个麻烦的根源。奉行自由主义霸权的强国，往往在国内和国际上都陷入严重的困境。此外，它们最终通常会损害其他国家，包括那些它们原本想要帮助的国家。与西方普遍的观点相反，自由主义并非国家间和平的力量。尽管它作为一种政治制度拥有诸多优点，但它却并非外交政策的良方。

As I emphasized at the start of this book, I believe liberal democracy is the best political order. It is not perfect, but it beats the competition by a long shot. Yet in the realm of international politics, liberalism is a source of endless trouble. Powerful states that embrace liberal hegemony invariably get themselves into serious trouble both at home and abroad. Moreover, they usually end up harming other countries, including the ones they sought to help. Contrary to the conventional wisdom in the West, liberalism is not a force for peace among states. Despite its numerous virtues as a political system, it is a poor guide for foreign policy.

问题的根源在于自由主义的核心蕴含着一种行动主义心态。自由主义认为，所有人都拥有不可剥夺的权利，保护这些权利应凌驾于其他一切之上。这种信念促使自由主义国家在其他国家侵犯其公民权利时（这种情况屡见不鲜）进行干预。一些自由主义者甚至认为，非自由主义国家本质上就是在与其人民交战。这种逻辑驱使自由主义国家倾向于使用武力将专制政体转变为自由民主政体，这不仅是因为这样做可以确保这些国家的个人权利不再遭受践踏，还因为他们相信自由民主政体之间不会发生战争。因此，维护人权和实现世界和平的关键在于建立一个完全由自由民主政体组成的国际体系。自由主义还呼吁建立国际机构，培育开放的国际经济，这些措施也被认为有利于和平。

The principal source of the problem is that liberalism has an activist mentality woven into its core. The belief that all humans have a set of inalienable rights, and that protecting these rights should override other concerns, creates a powerful incentive for liberal states to intervene when other countries—as they do on a regular basis—violate their citizens’ rights. Some liberals believe that illiberal states are by definition at war with their people. This logic pushes liberal states to favor using force to turn autocracies into liberal democracies, not only because doing so would ensure that individual rights are never again trampled in those countries, but also because they believe liberal democracies do not fight wars with each other. Thus the key to safeguarding human rights and bringing about world peace is to build an international system consisting solely of liberal democracies. Liberalism calls as well for building international institutions and cultivating an open international economy, measures also thought to be conducive to peace.

但自由主义还有另一条重要的原则，它应该阻止自由民主国家干涉他国内政，更不应入侵他国。大多数自由主义者认为，就基本原则达成普遍共识是不可能的，因此个人应该尽可能自由地决定何为美好生活，并依此生活。正是基于这种基本信念，自由主义才如此强调宽容，宽容的核心在于尊重他人以自己认为错误的方式思考和行动的权利。

But liberalism has another important strand that should discourage liberal democracies from interfering in other states’ politics, and certainly from invading them. Most liberals maintain that it is impossible to reach a universal consensus on first principles, and thus individuals should be as free as possible to decide for themselves what constitutes the good life and to live their lives accordingly. This fundamental belief is the reason for liberalism’s great emphasis on tolerance, which is all about respecting the rights of others to think and act in ways that one considers wrongheaded.

人们或许会认为，这种基本逻辑也适用于国际政治，因此自由主义国家应该倾向于不干涉他国内政。按照这种逻辑，自由主义国家甚至应该尊重非自由主义国家的主权。但事实并非如此，这主要是因为自由主义者实际上认为他们对美好生活的构成要素有着深刻的理解，尽管他们并不承认，甚至可能根本不承认这一点。自由主义实际上要求在全球范围内建立和维护自由主义国家，因为在非自由主义国家中，个人权利无法享有自由主义赋予它们的地位和应有的保护。实际上，自由主义者认为他们对美好生活的构成要素有着普遍有效且持久的洞见：拥有一个能够保障所有公民不可剥夺权利的自由主义国家。鉴于这种信念，强大的自由主义国家在海外采取高度干预主义政策，这并不令人意外。

One might think this basic logic would also apply to international politics and so would incline liberal states to stay out of other states’ internal affairs. Liberal powers, in this telling, should even respect the sovereignty of illiberal states. But they do not, mainly because liberals actually believe they know a great deal about what constitutes the good life, although they do not acknowledge or maybe even recognize that fact. Liberalism effectively mandates the creation and maintenance of liberal states across the globe, because there is no way under an illiberal state that individual rights can enjoy the prominence liberalism assigns them and the protection they warrant. In effect, liberals are saying they have a universally valid and enduring insight about what constitutes the good life: having a liberal state that guarantees the inalienable rights of all its citizens. Given this conviction, it is not surprising that powerful liberal states adopt highly interventionist policies abroad.1

然而，追求自由主义霸权的国家却会遇到严重的麻烦。原因之一是，大多数国家对个人权利的支持并不深厚，这意味着将一个专制政体转变为自由民主政体通常是一项艰巨的任务。自由主义外交政策最终也会与民族主义和权力平衡政治发生冲突。当自由主义与这两种“主义”发生冲突时，它往往处于劣势，这很大程度上是因为它们比自由主义更符合人性。民族主义是一种极具影响力的政治意识形态，其影响力远超自由主义。国际体系由民族国家而非自由民主政体构成绝非偶然。此外，主导该体系的大国通常奉行现实主义原则，这给输出自由主义价值观的国家带来了重大问题。

States pursuing liberal hegemony, however, run into serious trouble. One reason is that support for individual rights does not run deep in most countries, which means that turning an autocracy into a liberal democracy is usually a colossal task. Liberal foreign policies also end up clashing with nationalism and balance-of-power politics. Liberalism is no match for either of those other isms when they clash, in large part because they are more in line with human nature than liberalism is. Nationalism is an exceptionally influential political ideology that holds much greater sway than liberalism. It is no accident that the international system is populated by nation-states, not liberal democracies. Moreover, the great powers that dominate the system typically follow realist principles, causing major problems for countries exporting liberal values.

简而言之，自由主义对于在世界舞台上运作的大国而言是一份愚蠢的指南。美国放弃对其极为不利的自由主义霸权，转而奉行更为克制的外交政策，这才是明智之举。在实践中，这意味着美国决策者应该拥抱现实主义。

In short, liberalism is a fool’s guide for powerful states operating on the world stage. It would make eminently good sense for the United States to abandon liberal hegemony, which has served it so poorly, and pursue a more restrained policy abroad. In practice that means American policymakers should embrace realism.

现实主义与克制

Realism and Restraint

大多数国际政治专业的学生会将现实主义与竞争和冲突联系起来。当然，这也是现实主义在自由社会中不受欢迎的原因之一。 2 现实主义者不喜现实主义的另一个原因是，他们认为战争是国家治理的合法工具，可以用来维持权力平衡或以有利的方式改变权力平衡。此外，现实政治的拥护者低估了国家间合作的可能性，因为他们认为，鉴于世界缺乏更高权威的保护，各国必须保障自身安全。为了最大限度地提高生存几率，这些国家别无选择，只能争夺权力，而这可能是一场残酷血腥的战争。现实主义无法激发人们对未来的希望。

Most students of international politics associate realism with rivalry and conflict. This, of course, is one reason realism is so unpopular in liberal societies.2 It is also disliked because realists consider war a legitimate tool of statecraft that can be employed to either maintain the balance of power or shift it in an advantageous way. Advocates of realpolitik downplay the prospects for cooperation among states, moreover, because they think countries have to provide for their own security, given that they operate in a world with no higher authority to protect them. To maximize their survival prospects, those states have little choice but to compete for power, which can be a ruthless and bloody business. Realism does not inspire a hopeful outlook for the future.

然而，现实主义者通常比自由主义者不那么好战，自由主义者强烈倾向于使用武力来促进国际和平，即使他们驳斥了战争是合法治国手段的论点。瓦莱丽·莫克维丘斯在比较这两种理论体系时观察到，大多数现实主义者反对美国在2003年入侵伊拉克，而美国三位最著名的正义战争理论家（让·埃尔什泰因、詹姆斯·特纳·约翰逊和迈克尔·沃尔泽）“对这场战争持更为积极的态度”，这便印证了这一点。她总结道：“传统观点认为，现实主义者比正义战争理论家更支持诉诸战争。但我认为事实恰恰相反：正义战争理论比现实主义更倾向于好战。” ³

Nevertheless, realists are generally less warlike than liberals, who have a strong inclination to use force to promote international peace, even while they dismiss the argument that war is a legitimate instrument of statecraft. This point is illustrated by Valerie Morkevičius’s observation, in her comparison of the two bodies of theory, that most realists opposed the U.S. invasion of Iraq in 2003, while America’s three most prominent just war theorists (Jean Elshtain, James Turner Johnson, and Michael Walzer) “viewed the war more positively.” She concludes that “conventional wisdom holds that realists support the recourse to war more than just war theorists. I argue that the opposite is true: just war theory produces a more bellicose orientation than realism.”3

许多现实主义者实际上认为，如果各国按照权力平衡逻辑行事，大国之间几乎不会发生战争。这些“防御型现实主义者”坚持认为，国际体系的结构通常会惩罚侵略者，而战争的推动力通常来自国内政治力量。换句话说，大国发动战争的原因大多并非出于现实主义。查尔斯·格拉泽的重要文章《现实主义者是乐观主义者》的标题很好地概括了这种观点。其他著名的防御型现实主义者包括杰克·斯奈德、斯蒂芬·范·埃弗拉，甚至还有肯尼斯·沃尔兹，后者有时被误认为认为国际无政府状态导致各国采取侵略行动以获取权力。另外两位现实主义者，塞巴斯蒂安·罗萨托和约翰·舒斯勒，主张美国奉行现实主义外交政策，他们将其描述为“不战而胜的保障”。

Many realists actually believe that if states acted according to balance-of-power logic, there would be hardly any wars between the great powers. These “defensive realists” maintain that the structure of the international system usually punishes aggressors and that the push toward war usually comes from domestic political forces. Great powers, in other words, most often go to war for non-realist reasons. This perspective is nicely captured in the title of Charles Glaser’s important article “Realists as Optimists.”4 Other prominent defensive realists include Jack Snyder, Stephen Van Evera, and even Kenneth Waltz, who is sometimes mistakenly said to argue that international anarchy causes states to act aggressively to gain power.5 Two other realists, Sebastian Rosato and John Schuessler, advocate a realist foreign policy for the United States that they describe as a “recipe for security without war.”6

历史学家马克·特拉赫滕贝格（Marc Trachtenberg）以防御现实主义的视角看待世界，他明确指出，遵循现实主义的指导方针会带来相对和平的世界，而按照他所谓的“不切实际的理想主义”行事则会导致无休止的麻烦。他对历史的解读告诉他，“只有当国家未能以符合权力政治逻辑的方式行事时，才会出现严重的麻烦。”冲突发生在国家“将权力浪费在道德主义、帝国主义或意识形态事业上”时。他认为，现实主义“本质上是一种和平理论，这一点必须得到认可。”简而言之，“权力并非不稳定。” 7

The historian Marc Trachtenberg, who looks at the world from the perspective of a defensive realist, explicitly argues that following the dictates of realism leads to a relatively peaceful world, while acting according to what he calls “impractical idealism” leads to endless trouble. His reading of history tells him that “serious trouble developed only when states failed to act in a way that made sense in power-political terms.” Conflict occurs when states “squander [power] on moralistic, imperialistic, or ideological enterprises.” Realism, he maintains, is “at heart a theory of peace, and it is important that it be recognized as such.” In brief, “power is not unstable.”7

我并不认同这种对现实主义的乐观理解。国际体系的结构常常迫使大国陷入激烈的安全竞争，有时甚至引发战争。国际政治是一项肮脏而残酷的生意，这不仅仅是因为错误的自由主义思想或……其他恶意的国内政治势力也会影响国家的外交政策。大国有时出于合理的现实原因发动战争。

I do not share this sanguine understanding of realism. The structure of the international system often forces great powers to engage in intense security competition and sometimes initiate wars. International politics is a nasty and brutish business, and not just because misguided liberal ideas or other malevolent domestic political forces influence states’ foreign policies. Great powers occasionally start wars for sound realist reasons.

即便各国按照我这种更为严苛的现实主义理论行事，它们发动的国际战争也可能比遵循自由主义原则的要少。即便像我这样强硬的进攻性现实主义者，也比自由主义者更不愿意鼓吹战争，原因有三。首先，由于遵循现实主义原则的大国主要关注的是最大化其全球影响力，因此它们愿意冒战争风险的地区数量有限。这些地区包括大国的周边地区，以及那些要么是其他大国所在地，要么蕴藏着至关重要资源的遥远地区。对美国而言，如今西半球以外的三个地区具有至关重要的战略意义：欧洲和东亚，因为其他大国都位于这些地区；以及波斯湾，因为它是极其重要的资源——石油——的主要产地。

Still, even if states act according to my harsher version of realism, they are likely to fight fewer international wars than if they follow liberal principles. There are three reasons why even hard-nosed offensive realists like me are less likely to advocate war than liberals. First, because great powers operating under realist dictates are principally concerned with maximizing their share of global power, there are only a limited number of regions where they should be willing to risk a war. Those places include the great power’s own neighborhood and distant areas that are either home to another great power or the site of a critically important resource. For the United States, three regions outside the Western Hemisphere are of vital strategic importance today: Europe and East Asia, because that is where the other great powers are located; and the Persian Gulf, because it is the main source of an exceptionally important resource, oil.

这意味着美国不应在非洲、中亚或波斯湾以外的中东地区发动战争。例如，冷战期间，现实主义者坚持认为，美国决策者应避免在“第三世界”或“发展中国家”发动战争，因为这些地区充斥着战略意义不大的小国。几乎所有现实主义者都反对越南战争，因为越南的命运对全球力量平衡几乎没有战略意义。

This means the United States should not fight wars in Africa, Central Asia, or areas of the Middle East that lie outside the Persian Gulf. During the Cold War, for example, realists maintained that American policymakers should avoid wars in the “Third World” or “Developing World” because it was populated with minor powers that were of little strategic significance.8 Almost every realist opposed the Vietnam War, because Vietnam’s fate held little strategic consequence for the global balance of power.9

另一方面，自由主义者往往将世界每个角落都视为潜在的战场，因为他们致力于在世界各地保护人权，并将自由民主传播到世界各地。他们自然更倾向于以和平方式实现这些目标，但通常也愿意在必要时考虑使用武力。简而言之，现实主义者对动用武力的地点有着严格的限制，而自由主义者则没有这样的限制。对他们而言，至关重要的利益无处不在。

Liberals, on the other hand, tend to think of every area of the world as a potential battlefield, because they are committed to protecting human rights everywhere and spreading liberal democracy far and wide. They would naturally prefer to achieve these goals peacefully, but they are usually willing to countenance using military force if necessary. In short, while realists place strict limits on where they are willing to employ force, liberals have no such limits. For them, vital interests are everywhere.

其次，现实主义者倾向于谨慎使用武力，甚至谨慎使用武力威胁，因为他们认识到，权力平衡逻辑会迫使其他国家遏制侵略者，即便这些国家是自由民主国家。当然，权力平衡并非总是奏效，这也是战争有时发生的原因。大国尤其关注自身安全，而且当……他们感到受到威胁，必然会采取措施保护自己。这种警惕性解释了为什么俄罗斯领导人自20世纪90年代中期以来一直顽固地反对北约扩张，以及为什么大多数美国现实主义者也反对北约扩张。然而，自由主义者往往认为权力平衡逻辑在21世纪已经过时。这种思维方式使得自由主义者在使用武力方面比现实主义者更加肆无忌惮。

Second, realists are inclined to be cautious about using force or even the threat of force because they recognize that balance-of-power logic will compel other states to contain aggressors, even if they are liberal democracies. Of course, balancing does not always work, which is why wars sometimes occur. Great powers are especially vigilant about their security, and when they feel threatened, they invariably take measures to protect themselves. This wariness explains why Russian leaders have stubbornly opposed NATO enlargement since the mid-1990s and why most American realists opposed it as well. Liberals, however, tend to dismiss balance-of-power logic as irrelevant in the twenty-first century. This kind of thinking helps to make liberals less restrained than realists about using military force.

第三，现实主义者在某种程度上是克劳塞维茨主义者，因为他们明白发动战争会将一个国家带入充满意想不到的后果的领域。 10 有时，这些后果是灾难性的。几乎所有现实主义者都理解这一基本事实，因为他们深入研究战争，并了解到，发动战争的领导人有时会对战争的结果感到意外。 11战争结果难以预料这一事实，使得现实主义者在发动战争时格外谨慎，但这并不意味着战争永远没有意义。有时，形势需要我们拔剑相向。另一方面，自由主义者通常不会在理性层面认真研究战争，这可能是因为他们不倾向于将战争视为一种正常的治国手段。克劳塞维茨的《战争论》不太可能出现在他们的阅读清单上。因此，他们往往对战争的复杂性及其可能带来的不良后果缺乏认识。

Third, realists are Clausewitzians in the sense they understand that going to war takes a country into a realm of unintended consequences.10 Occasionally those consequences are disastrous. Virtually all realists appreciate this basic fact of life because they study war closely and learn that leaders who take their countries to war are sometimes surprised by the results.11 The mere fact that it is hard to be certain about how a war will turn out makes realists cautious about starting them, which is not to say war never makes sense. Circumstances sometimes call for unsheathing the sword. Liberals, on the other hand, are usually not serious students of war at an intellectual level, probably because they are not inclined to treat war as a normal instrument of statecraft. Clausewitz’s On War is unlikely to be on their reading lists. Thus they tend to have little appreciation of war’s complexities and its potential for unwelcome outcomes.

需要明确的是，现实主义并非和平的灵丹妙药。这一理论描绘了一个战争可能性渗透到日常生活方方面面的世界。此外，现实主义认为美国应当力求保持其全球最强国的地位，维护其在西半球的霸权，并确保没有其他大国在其所在区域占据主导地位，从而成为其势均力敌的竞争对手。尽管如此，基于现实主义的外交政策可能比基于自由主义的外交政策更少好战倾向。

To be clear, realism is not a recipe for peace. The theory portrays a world where the possibility of war is part of the warp and woof of daily life. Moreover, realism dictates that the United States should seek to remain the most powerful state on the planet. It should maintain hegemony in the Western Hemisphere and make sure that no other great power dominates its region of the world, thus becoming a peer competitor. Still, a foreign policy based on realism is likely to be less warlike than one based on liberalism.

最后，正确理解民族主义如何制约大国，尤其是在其与小国的关系中，为美国采取克制政策提供了进一步的理由。简要分析美国决策者在冷战期间如何看待与小国的互动，可以发现他们不仅未能认识到民族主义如何限制华盛顿干预他国事务的能力，而且也未能理解这种主义如何为美国带来优势。如果美国不得不重蹈冷战覆辙，或者未来不得不参与类似的全球安全竞争，那么采取截然不同的遏制策略就显得合情合理。12

Finally, a proper understanding of how nationalism constrains great powers, especially in their relations with minor powers, provides further reason for the United States to adopt a policy of restraint. A brief analysis of how American policymakers thought about interacting with smaller powers during the Cold War shows that they not only failed to appreciate how nationalism limits Washington’s ability to intervene in other states, but also did not understand how that ism works to America’s advantage. If the United States had to run the Cold War all over again, or had to engage in a similar security competition in the future, it would make good sense to pursue containment in a markedly different way.12

民族主义与克制

Nationalism and Restraint

在冷战的大部分时期，美国领导人都在担忧世界各地小国的统治者是谁。他们最大的担忧是，任何一个由共产党统治的国家都会帮助邻国推广共产主义，而这反过来又会导致更多国家效仿。苏联当然在这一过程中扮演了核心角色。作为一个致力于通过共产国际等机构在全球传播共产主义的大国，人们认为它的任务相对容易。共产主义是一种具有广泛吸引力的普世意识形态。在苏联的支持下，越来越多的国家会加入共产主义阵营，直到莫斯科最终主导国际体系。这种现象被称为多米诺骨牌理论。 13

For much of the Cold War, American leaders worried about who ruled the minor powers in every region of the world. The great fear was that any country governed by communists would help promote communism in neighboring states, which, in turn, would cause additional states to follow suit. The Soviet Union, of course, played a central role in this story. As a great power committed to spreading communism across the globe via institutions like the Comintern, it was thought to have a relatively easy task. Communism was a universalist ideology with broad appeal. With Soviet sponsorship, more and more states would jump on that bandwagon until, at some point, Moscow would dominate the international system. This phenomenon was known as the domino theory.13

美国对这种潜在威胁的回应是竭尽所能阻止小国“走向共产主义”。华盛顿几乎干预了所有政治倾向左倾的国家，这导致美国在全球范围内推行强硬的社会工程。在实践中，这种做法包括：(1) 向友好政府提供资金、武器和其他资源以维持其政权；(2) 煽动政变推翻被视为敌人的国家，包括民选领导人；(3) 直接派遣美军进行干预。

The American response to this perceived threat was to do everything possible to prevent minor powers from “going communist.” Washington intervened in the politics of virtually every country whose politics showed signs of moving leftward, which led the United States into hard-nosed social engineering on a global scale. In practice, this approach meant (1) giving money, weapons, and other resources to friendly governments to keep them in power; (2) fostering coups against perceived foes, including democratically elected rulers; and (3) intervening directly with American troops.

这种策略注定失败。在任何国家，即使是自己的国家，进行社会工程都是困难的。问题错综复杂，阻力不可避免，而且总会有意想不到的后果，其中一些是负面的。当社会工程由外部强加时，这项任务就更加艰巨，因为无处不在的民族主义使得当地民众希望在不受外国人干涉的情况下决定自己的命运。这些干预之所以失败，还因为干预方几乎不了解目标国家的文化和政治。在许多情况下，外国人甚至不会说当地语言。当一个国家试图用武力改变另一个国家的社会和政治格局时，问题会更加严重，正如美国在阿富汗和伊拉克再次遭遇的那样，而此前美国在冷战期间的越南战争中也曾经历过类似的情况。随之而来的暴力冲突会让入侵国看起来像个压迫者，进一步阻碍其推动积极变革的努力。

This strategy was doomed to fail. Social engineering in any country, even one’s own, is difficult. The problems are multifaceted and complex, resistance is inevitable, and there are always unintended consequences, some of them bad. The task is even more demanding when social engineering is imposed from outside because nationalism, which is ever present, makes the local population want to determine its own fate without foreigners interfering in its politics. These interventions also fail because the intervening power hardly ever understands the target country’s culture and politics. In many cases, the foreigners do not even speak the local language. The problems are even worse when a country tries to use military force to alter another country’s social and political landscape, as the United States has rediscovered in Afghanistan and Iraq after previously discovering it in Vietnam during the Cold War. The ensuing violence will make the invading country look like an oppressor, further complicating its efforts to promote positive change.

这并非否认冷战期间美国有时成功干预了小国的政治。但即便如此，其中一些成功最终也给美国领导人带来了麻烦。例如，1953年伊朗政变使沙阿重新掌权，为美国赢得了约25年的重要盟友。但1979年沙阿被推翻、霍梅尼掌权后，德黑兰和华盛顿之间的关系却因此恶化。事实上，60多年后的今天，1953年政变的记忆仍然在损害着两国关系。而这竟然还算得上是一次成功！正如林赛·奥鲁克所指出的，美国的大多数政变企图甚至连短期目标都没能实现。 14美国的干预行动也可能给目标国带来极其惨重的代价。冷战期间，美国及其盟友杀害的其他国家公民人数令人震惊。 15

This is not to deny that during the Cold War the United States sometimes successfully interfered in the politics of minor countries. But even some of those successes came back to haunt American leaders. For example, the 1953 coup in Iran that put the shah back in power gave the United States an important ally for about twenty-five years. But it poisoned relations between Tehran and Washington after the shah was toppled in 1979 and Ayatollah Khomeini came to power. Indeed, memories of the 1953 coup continue to mar relations today, more than sixty years later. And that was a success! As Lindsey O’Rourke shows, most U.S. coup attempts did not even achieve their short-term goals.14 American interventions could also prove remarkably costly for the target states. The number of citizens of other countries killed by the United States and its allies during the Cold War is stunning.15

最糟糕的是，这些干预完全没有必要。“多米诺骨牌理论”并未描述任何严重的威胁：它假定马克思主义等普世主义意识形态会主导地方认同和自决愿望。事实并非如此。“多米诺骨牌理论”的支持者未能理解，民族主义比共产主义强大得多，正如它比自由主义强大得多一样。民族主义的核心在于自决。各国人民都渴望掌控自己的命运，在主权问题上，他们的政治领袖如同嫉妒的神明。他们希望做他们认为符合本国利益的事情，而不是被其他国家摆布，即使是那些与他们拥有共同意识形态的国家。因此，东欧各地的共产主义国家在冷战期间对接受莫斯科的命令深感不满也就不足为奇了。中国也是如此。苏联解体很大程度上也是因为乌克兰人、阿塞拜疆人、亚美尼亚人、格鲁吉亚人、爱沙尼亚人以及其他许多国家的人民渴望独立，这绝非偶然。小国往往会奉行独立的外交政策，并抵制大国的影响，除非这样做符合它们的利益。它有时会出于自身利益行事，但大多数时候并非如此。“傀儡国家”往往徒有虚名。

Worst of all, these interventions were unnecessary. The domino theory did not describe any serious threat: it assumed that universalist ideologies like Marxism would dominate local identities and desire for self-determination. They do not. Proponents of the domino theory failed to understand that nationalism is a far more powerful ideology than communism, just as it is far more powerful than liberalism. Nationalism is all about self-determination. Nations want to control their own fates, and where sovereignty is concerned their political leaders are jealous gods. They want to do what they think is in their country’s interest and not be pushed around by other states, even those with which they share an ideology. It is not surprising that communist countries across Eastern Europe deeply resented taking orders from Moscow during the Cold War. So did China. Nor is it an accident that the Soviet Union disintegrated in good part because Ukrainians, Azeris, Armenians, Georgians, Estonians, and many others wanted independence. Minor powers are likely to pursue independent foreign policies and resist the influence of the great powers unless it suits their interests, which it sometimes does but mostly does not. “Puppet states” exist more often in name than in reality.

美国在冷战时期过度干预小国事务的政策完全是错误的。华盛顿不应试图控制这些国家的政治倾向，而应采取不干涉政策。一个国家领导人的意识形态倾向对于与其合作或对抗都无关紧要。关键在于双方的利益是否一致。在冷战时期，美国与小国进行实质性接触的几乎所有案例中，明智的策略都应该是尽量不去干预谁上台执政，而是集中精力与执政者合作，以促进美国的利益。面对控制严密的共产主义意识形态，这种策略或许能够实现数十年武装干预都未能达成的目标：扭转民意，使其倾向于美国。

America’s Cold War policy of hyper involvement in the affairs of minor powers was exactly the wrong strategy. Instead of trying to control their political orientation, Washington should have adopted a hands-off policy. The ideological orientation of a country’s leaders matters little for working with or against them. What matters is whether both sides’ interests are aligned. In almost all of the Cold War cases where the United States had serious dealings with minor powers, the smart strategy would have been to do little to influence who came to power and concentrate instead on working with whoever was in charge to promote America’s interests. In the face of a rigidly controlling communist ideology, this strategy might have accomplished what decades of armed interventions could not: move popular sentiment to favor America.

简而言之，在冷战期间，美国本应更加开放地寻求与共产主义国家建立友好关系，正如有时与民主国家保持不友好关系也是合理的一样。事实上，华盛顿在冷战期间确实与一些共产主义国家保持了良好的关系，因为双方友好相处对彼此都具有战略意义。中美关系就是一个例证。在冷战最初的二十多年里，美国和共产主义中国关系十分敌对，但这种情况在20世纪70年代初发生了改变，这主要是由于中苏分裂，这意味着北京和华盛顿都对苏联抱有敌意，因此双方更有可能结盟。最终，美国与一个它之前视为“倒下的多米诺骨牌”的共产主义国家建立了良好的合作关系。

During the Cold War, in short, the United States should have been much more open to seeking friendly relations with communist states, just as it occasionally made sense to have unfriendly relations with democracies. In fact, Washington did have good relations with a few communist countries during the Cold War, because it made good strategic sense for both sides to get along. Chinese-American relations are a case in point. The United States and communist China were deeply antagonistic for the first twenty-plus years of the Cold War, but that changed in the early 1970s, largely as a consequence of the Sino-Soviet split, which meant that both Beijing and Washington were hostile to the Soviet Union and thus well positioned to join forces. The United States ended up working well with a communist state that it had earlier identified as a fallen domino.

越南的例子进一步证明了共产主义等普世意识形态的局限性以及国家利益的力量，而国家利益当然与民族主义紧密相连。越南领导人胡志明既是共产主义者，也是狂热的民族主义者。二战后，他曾认真考虑与美国建立友好关系，但杜鲁门政府愚蠢地拒绝了他的提议，仅仅因为他是共产主义者。美国最终发动了一场漫长而残酷的越战，这主要是由于基于多米诺骨牌理论的错误恐惧。16在那场不必要的战争中，美国遭受了决定性的失败。共产主义越南曾与共产主义柬埔寨和共产主义中国交战。此外，冷战结束后，河内与华盛顿的关系显著改善，如今比以往任何时候都更加密切，这主要是因为双方都对中国的崛起感到担忧。

The case of Vietnam provides more evidence of the limits of universal ideologies like communism and the power of national interests, which, of course, are tightly bound up with nationalism. Ho Chi Minh, the Vietnamese leader, was both a communist and a fervent nationalist. He was seriously interested in befriending the United States after World War II, but the Truman administration foolishly rejected his overtures because he was a communist. America ended up fighting a long and brutal war against Vietnam mainly because of misguided fears based on the domino theory.16 After the United States suffered a decisive defeat in that unnecessary war, communist Vietnam fought wars against communist Cambodia and communist China. Moreover, once the Cold War ended, relations between Hanoi and Washington improved significantly and today are better than ever, mainly because both fear a rising China.

如果美国没有深度介入发展中国家，苏联是否会入侵众多小国并将它们变成傀儡政权？或许苏联会攻击一些小国，但结果绝不会是共产主义的连胜。相反，苏联最终会陷入一个又一个泥潭。看看1979年苏联军队入侵阿富汗的后果就知道了。他们被困了十年，最终惨败。如果苏联拥有更多像阿富汗那样的势力，美国的利益将得到极大维护，正如如果美国拥有更多像越南那样的势力，莫斯科的利益也将得到极大维护一样。对这两个超级大国来说，引诱和消耗对方都是明智的策略。17

If the United States had not been deeply involved in the developing world, might the Soviet Union have invaded a host of minor powers and turned them into puppet states? Perhaps the Soviets might have attacked a few smaller countries, but the result would not have been a steady string of communist victories. On the contrary, the Soviets would have ended up in one quagmire after another. Just look at what happened when the Soviet military moved into Afghanistan in 1979. They were stuck for ten years and ultimately suffered a humiliating defeat. U.S. interests would have been well served if the Soviets had had more Afghanistans, just as Moscow would have been well served if the United States had had more Vietnams. Baiting and bleeding the other side was a smart strategy for both superpowers.17

然而，美国决策者仍然难以从这个角度思考问题。他们中的大多数人未能充分认识到民族主义的力量，反而高估了共产主义和自由主义等普世意识形态。尽管如此，历史经验表明，大国对待小国的最佳策略是避免干涉其内政——当然，除非绝对必要，否则更不应入侵和占领。大国应该努力诱使对手采取激进的干预行动。如果中美安全竞争持续升温，美国决策者应该牢记这一教训。

Yet it is still difficult for American policymakers to think along these lines. Most of them fail to appreciate the power of nationalism and instead overestimate universal ideologies like communism and liberalism. Nevertheless, the historical record shows that the best strategy for a great power dealing with minor powers is to avoid getting involved in their domestic politics—and certainly not to invade and occupy them unless it is absolutely necessary. Aggressive intervention is what great powers should try to draw their rivals into doing. U.S. policymakers should keep this lesson in mind if the Sino-American security competition continues to heat up.

对自由主义、民族主义和现实主义之间关系的正确理解表明，即使是地球上最强大的国家——包括美国——也应该奉行克制的外交政策。任何未能理解这一基本信息，反而试图按照自身意愿塑造世界的国家，都可能面临无休止的麻烦。

A proper understanding of the relationship between liberalism, nationalism, and realism suggests that even the mightiest powers on the planet—including the United States—should pursue a foreign policy of restraint. Any country that fails to understand that basic message and tries instead to shape the world in its own image is likely to face unending trouble.

美国将走向何方？

Where Is the United States Headed?

美国外交政策机构肯定会抵制任何放弃追求自由霸权、转而采取基于……的外交政策的举动。关于现实主义。民主党和共和党都坚定地致力于在海外推行自由主义，尽管这项政策几乎处处以失败告终。 18虽然美国公众倾向于克制，但执政精英在​​制定外交政策时很少关注民意——除非迫不得已。

The American foreign policy establishment would surely resist any move to abandon the pursuit of liberal hegemony and adopt a foreign policy based on realism. Both the Democratic and Republican parties are deeply wedded to promoting liberalism abroad, even though that policy has been a failure at almost every turn.18 Although the American public tends to favor restraint, the governing elites pay little attention to public opinion—until they have to—when formulating foreign policy.

然而，有充分理由认为，这种情况即将改变，而这并非外交政策机构所能控制的。由于中国的崛起和俄罗斯实力的复苏，国际体系的结构似乎正在朝着多极化方向发展。这一发展很可能使现实主义重新成为华盛顿的首要考量，因为当国际体系中存在其他大国时，奉行自由主义霸权已不可能。自冷战结束和苏联解体以来，美国决策者无需再为全球权力平衡而担忧，但单极体系似乎只是昙花一现，这意味着美国将再次面临其他大国的挑战。事实上，正如国防部长詹姆斯·马蒂斯所言，特朗普政府已明确表示，“大国之间的竞争再次成为现实”，并且“大国竞争而非恐怖主义，如今才是美国国家安全战略的首要关注点”。 19

Nevertheless, there is good reason to think this situation is about to change, for reasons beyond the control of the foreign policy establishment. It appears that the structure of the international system is moving toward multipolarity, because of China’s striking rise and the resurrection of Russian power. This development is likely to bring realism back to the fore in Washington, since it is impossible to pursue liberal hegemony when there are other great powers in the international system. American policymakers have not had to concern themselves with the global balance of power since the Cold War ended and the Soviet Union collapsed, but the unipolar system seems to have been short-lived, which means that the United States will once again have to worry about other great powers. Indeed, the Trump administration has made it clear, to quote Secretary of Defense James Mattis, that “great power competition between nations is a reality once again,” and “great power competition, not terrorism, is now the primary focus of U.S. national security strategy.”19

在三大强国并存的世界格局下，尤其当其中一个拥有中国这样潜在的军事实力时，安全竞争乃至战争在所难免。美国别无选择，只能采取现实主义外交政策，因为它必须阻止中国成为亚洲的地区霸主。如果中国继续保持经济和军事增长，这项任务将异常艰巨。尽管如此，自由主义很可能仍会以某种方式继续影响美国的对外政策，因为传播民主的理念如今已深深根植于美国外交政策机构的基因之中。虽然大国竞争会阻碍华盛顿全面拥抱自由主义霸权，但奉行自由主义对外政策的诱惑将始终存在。

In a world of three great powers, especially when one of them has China’s potential military might, there is sure to be security competition and maybe even war.20 The United States will have little choice but to adopt a realist foreign policy, simply because it must prevent China from becoming a regional hegemon in Asia. That task will not be easy if China continues to grow economically and militarily. Still, liberalism will most likely continue to influence U.S. policy abroad in small ways, as the impulse to spread democracy is by now hardwired into the foreign policy establishment’s DNA. Although great-power competition will prevent Washington from fully embracing liberal hegemony, the temptation to pursue liberal policies abroad will be ever present.

除了这种在以现实主义为主的外交政策边缘采取自由主义策略的顽固倾向之外，美国决策者还可能未能充分认识到，民族主义限制了他们干预他国的能力，正如它限制了其对手干预他国的能力一样。为了征服其他国家。他们在冷战时期和后冷战时代都未能理解民族主义的影响，而且也无法保证他们将来会明白这一点。即便现实主义回归，自由主义霸权瓦解，我们仍然必须警醒世人，自由主义外交政策的危险性以及理解民族主义如何限制大国行动能力的重要性不容忽视。

In addition to this lingering tendency to adopt liberal strategies on the margins of a largely realist foreign policy, there is also the danger that U.S. policymakers will not fully grasp that nationalism limits their ability to intervene in other countries just as much as it limits their adversaries’ ability to conquer other states. They failed to understand the effects of nationalism both during the Cold War and in the post–Cold War world, and there is no assurance they will get it in the future. Even with the return of realism and the demise of liberal hegemony, it will still be imperative to sound the tocsins about the dangers of a liberal foreign policy and the importance of understanding how nationalism limits great powers’ ability to act.

还有另一种可能。中国经济可能会遭遇严重问题，导致其长期增长显著放缓，而美国经济则保持稳健增长。 21在这种情况下，目前明显有利于美国的实力差距将进一步扩大，使中国根本无法挑战美国的实力。人们不禁要问，即便中国不构成挑战，俄罗斯未来是否有可能对美国构成挑战？美国在20世纪的三大主要竞争对手——德国、日本和俄罗斯——都在经历人口减少，未来几十年，美国相对于它们各自的实力可能会日益增强。 22中国是地球上唯一一个有潜力对美国实力构成实质性挑战的国家，但如果中国未能发挥这种潜力，美国仍将是国际体系中最强大的国家。换言之，国际体系的多极格局不会持续太久，最终将回归单极格局。

There is also an alternative scenario. The Chinese economy could encounter serious problems that markedly slow its growth over the long term, while the American economy grows at a solid pace.21 In that situation, the present power gap, which clearly favors the United States, would widen even further and make it impossible for China to challenge American power. One might wonder whether Russia is likely to pose a future challenge to the United States, even if China does not. America’s three principal great-power rivals from the twentieth century—Germany, Japan, and Russia—are all depopulating and the United States is likely to become increasingly powerful relative to each of them over the next few decades.22 China is the only country on the planet with the potential to challenge U.S. power in a meaningful way, but if it does not realize that potential, the United States will remain by far the most powerful state in the international system. In other words, the system will not remain multipolar for long before reverting back to unipolarity.

如此一来，美国决策者便可继续奉行自由主义霸权，因为他们几乎无需担忧美国在全球力量平衡中的地位。即便随之而来的外交政策灾难也必将危及美国的安全，因为没有其他大国能够对其构成威胁。如果这种情况真的发生，华盛顿是否有可能放弃自由主义霸权，转而采取强调克制而非永久战争的外交政策？

In that event, American policymakers would be free to continue pursuing liberal hegemony, since they would again have little reason to worry about the U.S. position in the global balance of power. Even the further foreign policy disasters that would surely follow would not endanger the security of the United States because no other great power could threaten it. Should this scenario pan out, is there any hope that Washington might abandon liberal hegemony and adopt a foreign policy that emphasizes restraint rather than permanent war?

毫无疑问，要让美国停止在海外推行自由主义是件难事，原因很简单：自由民主国家本能地希望创建一个完全由自由主义国家组成的世界。巴拉克·奥巴马的经历就很有启发意义。在2008年总统竞选期间，他强调将结束美国在阿富汗和伊拉克的战争，避免美国卷入新的冲突。他主张将精力集中在国内而非国外的冲突建设上。但他未能从根本上改变美国的外交政策方向。在他卸任时，美军仍在阿富汗作战，他还主导了美国在埃及、利比亚和叙利亚的政权更迭。2011年，他从伊拉克撤军，但2014年又将美军派回伊拉克，打击占领伊拉克和叙利亚大片地区的“伊斯兰国”。从他在2017年1月卸任前接受《大西洋月刊》的一系列充满感伤的采访中可以明显看出，他明白“华盛顿的剧本”存在严重缺陷，但他却一直按照其规则和策略行事。最终，他还是无法与既有的外交政策体制抗衡。

There is no question that it would be difficult to get the United States to stop pursuing liberalism abroad, simply because liberal democracies reflexively want to create a world populated solely with liberal states. Barack Obama’s experience is instructive here. During the 2008 presidential campaign, he emphasized that he would end America’s involvement in the Afghanistan and Iraq wars, avoid getting the United States tangled in new conflicts, and concentrate on nation-building at home instead of abroad. But he failed to change the direction of U.S. foreign policy in any meaningful way. American troops were still fighting in Afghanistan when he left office, and he oversaw American involvement in regime change in Egypt, Libya, and Syria. He removed U.S. troops from Iraq in 2011 but sent them back in 2014 to wage war against ISIS, which had overrun large parts of Iraq and Syria. It is clear from a series of wistful interviews he gave the Atlantic before leaving office in January 2017 that he understood “the Washington playbook” was deeply flawed, yet he had operated according to its rules and strategies.23 He was ultimately no match for the foreign policy establishment.

尽管如此，仍有一线希望，即单极化的美国或许可以被说服放弃自由主义霸权。强大的自由主义国家拥有自主权，并非注定要遵循错误的战略，即便它们面临着巨大的压力。24认为美国能够超越自由主义霸权的主要原因在于，当机会初现时选择采纳该战略与在看到长期后果后选择放弃该战略之间存在着区别。当一个自由主义国家首次获得单极地位时，几乎不可能阻止它接受这项雄心勃勃的政策。它承诺带来巨大的好处，而其代价尚未显现。但是，一旦该战略付诸实践，其缺陷显露无疑，那么使其偏离轨道就成为可能。

Still, there is a glimmer of hope that a unipolar United States could be persuaded to move away from liberal hegemony. Powerful liberal states do have agency and are not doomed to follow a misguided strategy, even though the pressure to do so is enormous.24 The main reason to think the United States can move beyond liberal hegemony revolves around the distinction between the decision to adopt that strategy when the opportunity first presents itself and the decision to forsake it after seeing the long-term results. It is almost impossible to stop a liberal state, when it first gains unipolar status, from embracing that extraordinarily ambitious policy. It promises great benefits and its costs are not yet apparent. But once the strategy has been tried and its flaws become clear, derailing it becomes possible.

2016年总统大选表明，自由主义霸权并非无懈可击。唐纳德·特朗普几乎挑战了这一战略的方方面面，反复提醒选民，这种战略对美国有害。最重要的是，他承诺，如果他当选总统，美国将不再致力于在全球传播民主。他强调，他的政府将与包括弗拉基米尔·普京在内的威权领导人保持友好关系，而普京正是自由主义外交政策建制派眼中的眼中钉。他还批评国际机构，甚至称北约已经过时。他倡导的保护主义政策与美国自二战结束以来一直引领的开放国际秩序背道而驰。与此同时，希拉里·克林顿则大力捍卫自由主义霸权，并毫不掩饰地表明了她对自由主义霸权的坚定立场。他倾向于维持现状。尽管外交政策并非此次选举的核心议题，但特朗普反对自由主义霸权的立场无疑帮助他赢得了许多选民的支持。

The 2016 presidential election shows that liberal hegemony is vulnerable. Donald Trump challenged almost every aspect of the strategy, reminding voters time after time that it had been bad for America. Most importantly, he promised that if he were elected president, the United States would get out of the business of spreading democracy around the world. He emphasized that his administration would have friendly relations with authoritarian leaders, including Vladimir Putin, the current bête noire of the liberal foreign policy establishment. He was also critical of international institutions, going so far as to call NATO obsolete. And he advocated protectionist policies that were at odds with the open international order the United States had spearheaded since the end of World War II. Hillary Clinton, meanwhile, vigorously defended liberal hegemony and left no doubt she favored the status quo. Although foreign policy was not the central issue in the election, Trump’s opposition to liberal hegemony undoubtedly helped him with many voters.

有人可能会认为，特朗普的竞选言论无关紧要，因为外交政策精英们会像驯服他的前任一样驯服他。毕竟，奥巴马在竞选时挑战了自由主义霸权，但作为总统，他却被迫遵循华盛顿的既定策略。特朗普也会面临同样的命运。事实上，已有证据表明，外交政策建制派驯服特朗普的努力至少在一定程度上取得了成功，而且他最初的政策与前任的政策有着相当大的延续性。25

One might argue that Trump’s campaign rhetoric is irrelevant because the foreign policy elites will tame him just as they tamed his predecessor. After all, Obama challenged liberal hegemony when he was a candidate, yet as president he was forced to stick to the Washington playbook. The same will happen to Trump. Indeed, there is already some evidence that efforts by the foreign policy establishment to tame Trump have at least partly succeeded and that his initial policies show considerable continuity with his predecessors’ policies.25

为了确保美国不会重蹈自由主义霸权的覆辙，即便中国和俄罗斯都未能构成足够的竞争对手，制定一套独立于唐纳德·特朗普或任何特定继任者的战略至关重要。首先，削弱自由主义霸权的最佳途径是建立一个能够倡导现实主义外交政策的反精英群体。26好消息是，目前已经存在一小群敢于发声的制衡者，他们可以作为这个精英群体的基础。27然而，争取外交政策建制派其他成员的支持仍然至关重要。这项任务应该是可行的，因为大多数人都能学习，而且现在应该已经清楚地认识到，在全球范围内进行社会工程是行不通的。我们已经做过实验，结果失败了。有学习能力的人至少应该愿意考虑另一种外交政策。尽管许多精英成员无疑会坚持自由主义霸权并试图更成功地实施它，但其根本缺陷是无法克服的。

To help ensure that the United States does not go back to liberal hegemony, should neither China nor Russia prove a sufficient rival, it is essential to come up with a game plan that is independent of Donald Trump or any particular successor. For starters, the best way to undermine liberal hegemony is to build a counter-elite that can make the case for a realist-based foreign policy.26 The good news is that there is already a small and vocal core of restrainers that can serve as the foundation for that select group.27 Still it is essential to win over others in the foreign policy establishment. That task should be feasible because most people do learn, and it should be manifestly clear by now that doing social engineering on a global scale does not work. We have run the experiment and it failed. People with the capacity to learn should be open to at least considering an alternative foreign policy. Although many members of the elite will no doubt want to stick with liberal hegemony and try to implement it more successfully, its fundamental flaws cannot be overcome.

历史记录表明，外交政策机构中的许多人都能被说服，认同现实主义和克制的理念。毕竟，美国有着精英阶层克制主义的悠久传统，正如记者斯蒂芬·金泽在《新旗帜》一书中阐述的那样。他在书中描述了十九世纪末美国帝国主义者和反帝国主义者之间那场激烈的辩论。 28尽管扩张主义者最终取得了胜利，但他们赢得并不轻松，而克制主义者在整个二十世纪的美国外交政策辩论中始终保持着强大的影响力。因此，正如金泽所指出的：“我们这些……”他们试图推动美国采取更加审慎和克制的对外政策，他们是站在巨人的肩膀上——这些巨人是美国历史上的伟大人物，他们率先阐述了这一观点，而继续阐述他们的论点正是典型的美国精神。” 29
